title: Tourism Information Officer
description:
Cariboo Chilcotin Coast Tourism Association (CCCTA) is seeking a talented individual to join our team on a Summer Student project to help grow the tourism industry in the Cariboo Chilcotin Coast region of British Columbia. Are you passionate about our region? Are you passionate about Emergency Preparedness? Interested in contributing to the development of the tourism industry and building a diversified economy? Would you like to work for a forward-thinking innovative organization?

We might have the position you have been looking for.


Responsibilities:

  • Learn about the Emergency Management framework in BC
  • Support implementation of the regional tourism emergency preparedness plans
  • Generate awareness and participation in emergency preparedness with tourism operators and communities
  • Assist with tourism emergency mapping project and data entry
  • Assist operators in the completion of business emergency preparedness and business continuity plans
  • Support training and ongoing tourism emergency education
  • Complete funding reporting requirements

This position will support the Regional Tourism Emergency Manager and work with the Provincial Tourism Emergency Management Committee to ensure that tourism information is up-to-date and accessible to the tourism emergency program staff. Duties may include database management, research, client contact via email and phone, attending minutes, preparing minutes and reports, and updating emergency plans. The summer student will have the opportunity to attend tourism emergency training and sit with our management on any emergency related events for workplace experience.


Job Requirements/Qualifications:

  • This summer student position will operate with the CCCTA team based in Williams Lake, BC
  • Travel within our region will be required
  • Current and returning students are strongly encouraged to apply
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to build quality relationships are essential in this position
  • The right candidate for this position will be passionate about emergency preparedness, tourism in rural settings and travel
  • Salary/Wage: $16.00


Job Application Process:

Please forward your resume to Amber Stratton:

Amber Stratton, Finance Manager

Cariboo Chilcotin Coast Tourism Region

finance@Landwithoutlimits.com

We thank all candidates for their application, we will respond directly to selected interviewees.


Who we are:

A Regional Destination Management Organization representing Destination British Columbia, Cariboo Chilcotin Coast Tourism Region promotes the development of tourism, marketing the tourism products of the region with its industry partners, and promotes the regional film and motion picture industry. Cariboo Chilcotin Coast is officially the second region in North America to earn the internationally registered Biosphere Certified Destination from the Responsible Tourism Institute based in Spain. Through innovative approaches and leading-edge marketing initiatives, Cariboo Chilcotin Coast is responsible for ensuring the long-term growth and prosperity of the regions multimillion dollar tourism industry. Considered an industry leader, Cariboo Chilcotin Coast Tourism is adding to its team of talented and motivated employees. All applicants should be excellent communicators and high achievers who are dedicated to business excellence and customer service. Products and services include access to an extensive image bank, travel guide and DVD, Fam tour assistance, itinerary planning assistance, property inspections and recommendations, along with our expert regional knowledge.

title: Child Minding/Reception
description:
Love your job!


Mama Massage is looking for a Child Minding Specialist to work at our family-friendly spa in Country. In your position as a Child Minding Specialist, you will be responsible for creating a fun atmosphere for kids to learn and play for our “smaller clients” as well as answering phones, greeting guests and keeping our spa prepared for our guests.


The Role

  • Provide high quality care for children by providing and taking part in play based activities or arts & crafts that stimulate and support children’s intellectual, physical, social, emotional and development
  • Listening to, encouraging, enabling and ensuring the safe keeping of the children
  • Develop creative ways and programs keep kids engaged on an hourly basis
  • Build and maintain positive and professional relationships with clients and other staff
  • Wash, dry, and fold laundry
  • Answer phones a greet guests at the front door
  • Book appointments on a computer
  • Provide all necessary customer service
  • Maintain the space: organizing and light cleaning


Qualifications

  • Experience in early learning and childhood education, child development preferred, but not required.
  • Mature, high energy, enthusiastic, creative, positive, hardworking, willing to learn, out-going, team player,
  • Able to work collaboratively with a team as well as independently
  • Basic computer skills
  • Leadership skills and especially the ability to follow

title: Camping Tour Guide
description:
Join a growing team in the adventure travel sector and get paid to do what you love!


Fresh Adventures is looking for a part-time guide to help run our Vancouver Island Camping Tours this summer!


This is perfect for you if you love working with people and spending your days outside in the wilderness!


Our camping tour guides run high quality trips from Victoria all around Vancouver Island with 12 intrepid guests from around the world.


A typical days looks like:

  • Driving a 15 passenger van and trailer
  • Cooking for a group of 14 people in a camp setting
  • Guiding people on daily hikes to remote beaches and rainforest groves
  • Arranging excursions like whale watching etc
  • Working with a co-guide to ensure a fun and professional environment
  • Teaching travelers about the local history and ecology
  • Camping at front-country campgrounds around Vancouver Island and helping guests feel comfortable


Skills and certifications we are looking for:

  • Class 4 unrestricted Drivers License
  • 40+ hour wilderness first aid
  • Relevant experience + other guiding credentials
  • Personal experience in outdoor recreation


We have 4-5 8 day tours available for summer 2022 and potentially more work in the Rockies.


This position could grow into winter ski guiding employment, and opportunity to guide in future seasons.


Expect between $160 and $200 daily pay rate, plus tips and bonuses for excellent performance.


If you don't mind hard work, love being outside and think you have what it takes, we want to hear from you!


Please email us and include details on past experience and current certifications.

title: Receptionist / Office Assistant
description:
Job description

We are looking for a Retail Sales Representative/Office Assistant to work at our office in Coquitlam.

Candidates with strong communication skills who can make customers feel welcome in our store will stand out. You will help identify client needs, present and answer questions about our products and services and recommend solutions. A positive attitude and a desire to promptly resolve potential customer issues or complaints will make you successful in this role.3


Requirements

  • Work experience as a Retail Sales Representative, Sales Associate, or Office Assistant
  • Familiarity with consumer behavior principles and customer service
  • Knowledge of computers and office
  • Reliable, trustworthy, and willing to grow in a position
  • Excellent communication skills in English, capable of building trusting relationships
  • Ability to multi-task if needed
  • Flexibility to work various hours including Saturdays


Responsibilities:

  • Greet and direct clients
  • Answer phone calls and emails
  • Provide accurate information about product features, pricing, and after-sales
  • Answer customers’ questions about specific products/services
  • Prepare quotes and invoices for our clients
  • Booking appointments and entering orders in the system
  • Manage deliveries and installations of products
  • Provide customer feedback to the management
  • Stay up-to-date with new products/services

Job Types: Full-time

Salary: $21.00- $28.00 per hour + Commission and Bonus.

title: Italian Speaking Administrative Clerk
description:
We are currently seeking individuals who are fluent in the Italian language to assist with administrative duties for the Italian Consulate for their upcoming Referendum.


Individual must be able to speak and write Italian fluently.


This is a part time position - Monday to Friday - 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

Contract position - approximately 3 to 6 months


Duties include:


Data entry of voter profiles into computer system

Assist with inquiries from the public regarding upcoming election details

Preparation of documents and packages to be mailed out to voters

General administrative support


Requirements:

Fluency in the Italian Language (oral and written)

Accurate with attention to detail

Professional approach to work with ability to handle sensitive and confidential materials

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
Therapy Now Therapeutics is looking for a part-time administrative assistant to join our team that is friendly, polite, has excellent communication skills and knows how to take initiative!

Our clinic is very commute friendly, located across Newton Exchange. The team consists of very supportive and fun group of RMTs, chiropractor, kinesiologist, counselor and acupuncturists!

We pride ourselves on having a culture that promotes work-life balance and provides convenience to our Team Members. We have a friendly, non-competitive, open communication between all our team and we have passion to be the best for our patients by educating each other and sharing knowledge to our patients so that they can help themselves when we are not around.


If this sounds good to you, please reply with a copy of your CV and availability.


Who we are looking for:

  • Exceptional interpersonal, customer service and communication skills
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple demands
  • Strong problem-solving and decision making skills with high attention to detail
  • Knowledge about JaneApp and experience working in a similar setting is an asset
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and excellent computer skills

    • Duties:

    • Greet all patients and make them feel welcome
    • Assist patients book appointments and confirm them
    • Keeping patient information up to date
    • Communicating with insurance companies regarding payments
    • Billing patient invoices and collecting payments as needed
    • Keeping the front desk clean

title: (Canada) Data Entry Part Time (Remote)
description:
Remote work from home administrative assistant, data entry clerk, typing, customer service representative, get started now.

Thanks for checking us out! Work From Home Data Entry Jobs - Part Time, Full-time

We are seeking individuals who are trying to find part-time or full time work or side jobs to be connected with companies that are hiring employees directly to work from their homes. You will certainly find both permanent and also part-time remote opportunities in a variety of career fields.

Reputable Work From Home Data Entry Jobs are going to require that you have skills relevant to the position you are looking for. Training is supplied based upon the position.

Job Requirements
  • Computer with web access
  • Silent work area away from interruptions
  • Should be able as well as comfortable to operating in an environment without immediate supervision
  • Capacity to read, comprehend, as well as follow oral as well as written directions.
  • Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not needed but can be a bonus
  • We are recruiting those that have a history in healthcare, storage facility worker, delivery chauffeurs, customer support, etc - we invite all backgrounds as long as you're ready to learn
You must apply on our website only.

Job Needs
  • Typing 25+ words per min
  • You enjoy data entry work as well as can perform the work from your home or location of choosing (remote work at home job)
  • Computer with web access
  • It is vital that you be self-motivated and also able to follow explicit instructions to start working from home
  • Self Motivated - you must be 100% able to commit to working with little supervision
  • Work from home jobs of this nature call for Web and one of the following: Laptop or COMPUTER, MAC, or Smart Device - Android or IOS
Ready to get started? Start today and earn money next week.

Thanks for checking us out and also we look forward to helping you achieve your goals!

title: front desk clerk, hotel - Urgent Hiring
description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic front desk clerk, hotel to join our vibrant team at Daigle's Motel Ltd in Sainte-anne-de-madawaska, NB.

Growing your career as a Full Time front desk clerk, hotel is a terrific opportunity to develop relevant skills.

If you are strong in adaptability, problem-solving and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of front desk clerk, hotel at Daigle's Motel Ltd today!

Business Equipment and Computer Applications
  • Word processing software
  • Spreadsheet
  • Internet
  • Computerized bookkeeping system
Specific Skills
  • Take, cancel and change room reservations
  • Register arriving guests and assign rooms
  • Provide information on hotel facilities and services
  • Process group arrivals and departures
  • Process guests' departures, calculate charges and receive payments
  • Perform light housekeeping and cleaning duties
  • Investigate and resolve complaints and claims
  • Exchange foreign currency
  • Balance cash and complete balance sheets, cash reports and related forms
  • Answer telephone and relay telephone calls and messages
  • Clerical duties (i.e. faxing, filing, photocopying)
  • Provide general information about points of interest in the area
  • Follow emergency and safety procedures
  • Handle wake-up calls
  • Provide customer service
  • Assist clients/guests with special needs
  • Maintain an inventory of vacancies, reservations and room assignments
Work Conditions And Physical Capabilities
  • Fast-paced environment
  • Work under pressure
  • Attention to detail
  • Standing for extended periods
  • Overtime required
Personal Suitability
  • Effective interpersonal skills
  • Flexibility
  • Team player
  • Excellent oral communication
  • Excellent written communication
  • Client focus
  • Dependability
  • Judgement
  • Reliability
  • Organized
Company Benefits
  • Excellent benefits
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Attractive package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are looking for an Office Administrative/ Operations Assistant (Part-time or Full-time)

  • If you are an entrepreneurial person who is passionate about fashion and always wanted to start your own clothing line, this position will allow you to learn and understand how a clothing brand operates on a daily basis, including learning to use Shopify to fulfill daily orders.


This role focuses on:

  • Email/ Phone Order Processing:
  • Process orders received from Email or Phone using Shopify
  • Edit orders based on customers’ requests
  • Customer Service:
  • Answer telephone and solve customers’ requests/ problems.
  • Relay telephone calls and messages to appropriate staff
  • Reply to customers’ emails
  • Providing administrative support
  • Set up and maintain manual and computerized information filing systems
  • Maintain contact list
  • Help other team members with other duties as needed


Qualifications and Skills Requirement:

  • Smart-working and fast learning attitude and desire to grow professionally
  • High-level attention to detail
  • Comfortable learning new technologies and skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where it requires changes based on customers' needs
  • Good organizational and time management skills
  • Able to prioritize and multi-task in a busy workplace
  • Ability to solve problems in an efficient and effective manner
  • Strong MS and Google Docs Editor Suite
  • Strong written and verbal in English
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work in a team environment


Nice to have:

  • Previous work experience in administration or retail is an asset
  • Second language: Mandarin / French
  • Valid driver’s license

title: Spa Receptionist
description:
Midtown est à la recherche d'un réceptionniste pour le spa pour aider notre équipe de spa à dorloter nos clients.

Le poste

Nos réceptionnistes de spa créent des impressions positives durables en offrant des salutations enthousiastes, une assistance chaleureuse et des adieux sincères. Qu'il s'agisse de prendre des réservations ou d'aider un client à se sentir à l'aise en attendant un traitement, ils jouent un rôle important en dépassant les attentes de service et en procurant un sentiment d'appartenance.

Les Principales Responsabilités Sont
  • Saluez les membres par leur nom et avec le sourire
  • Maintenir la propreté de la réception et de la boutique du spa
  • Répondre aux appels entrants
  • Répondre aux questions et aux préoccupations des membres au besoin
  • Fournir un soutien supplémentaire à l'équipe du spa si nécessaire
Exigences De La Réceptionniste Du Spa
  • La passion du service et de l'assistance de qualité
  • Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois, à faire preuve d'initiative et à avoir une solide éthique de travail
  • Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication
  • Une expérience antérieure en spa est fortement préférée
Midtown is looking for a Spa Receptionist to help our Spa team pamper our clients.

The Position

Our Spa Receptionists create positive lasting impressions by providing enthusiastic greetings, warm assistance and genuine farewells. Whether taking reservations or helping a guest feel comfortable while waiting for a treatment, they play an important role by exceeding service expectations and providing a sense of belonging.

The Primary Responsibilities Are
  • Greet members by name and with a smile
  • Maintain cleanliness of the spa’s front desk and shop
  • Answer incoming calls
  • Respond to members’ questions and concerns as needed
  • Provide additional support to the Spa team as needed
Spa Receptionist Requirements
  • A passion for quality service and assistance
  • Ability to multi-task, demonstrate initiative and strong work ethic
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Previous spa experience is strongly preferred
This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

MIDTOWN is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Personal Assistant
description:
The role of Personal Assistant position requires organized, friendly, detail-oriented professional who can work with confidentiality. We require someone proactive and driven who can handle balancing various responsibilities.


Responsibilities of the Personal Assistant:


  • Handling paperwork including filing, faxing, and copying
  • Answer phone calls and emails in a timely and professional manner
  • Take initiative when necessary
  • Schedule and maintain an organized calendar for our client
  • Experience with handling and exercising discretion over sensitive material



Qualifications of the Personal Assistant:


  • Ability to multitask and prioritize
  • Excellent organizational and communicative skills
  • Ability to work under deadlines while maintaining attention to detail
  • Friendly, professional, and polished etiquette
  • Can maintain utmost confidentiality

title: Receptionist - Toronto
description:
Entertainment One Ltd. (eOne) is a talent-driven independent studio that specializes in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. As part of global play and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS), eOne's expertise spans across film and television production and sales; production, distribution and brand management of kids and family properties; digital content; and immersive and live entertainment. Through its extensive reach and scale, and a deep commitment to high-quality entertainment, eOne unlocks the power and value of creativity.

eOne brings to market both original and existing content, sourcing IP from Hasbro’s portfolio of 1500+ brands, and through a diversified network of creative partners and eOne companies including: international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; unscripted television production companies Renegade 83, Daisybeck and Blackfin; live entertainment leaders Round Room Live; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.

The Receptionist, as the first point of contact, will respond with a high level of professionalism, with an emphasis on great customer service. This position facilitates and ensures smooth and efficient operations of the front office. The incumbent will need to greet all visitors respectfully and in a professional manner. In addition to these duties, various administrative functions fall into the scope of responsibility of the role.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Handles queries and requests from visitors, staff, vendors, and the public.
  • Greets visitors and accommodates them, re-directing when necessary.
  • Provide timely, efficient, accurate and professional administrative support
  • Handles incoming calls and directs to the correct department.
  • Coordinates the booking and setting up of meeting rooms
  • Maintain cleanliness and general organization of meeting and boardrooms
  • Logging and maintaining security card access system for employee entry
  • Schedule deliveries, create waybills, and provide tracking for local couriers and expedited parcel shipments through Quick Messenger Service & FedEx.
  • Receive package deliveries and notify individuals
  • Receive mail and distribute to various departments
  • Tracking and logging invoices for the Facilities department
  • Ordering/Maintaining office supplies.
  • Maintain executive kitchen and supplies
  • Verify vaccination status of visitors using the Verify Ontario app
  • Involvement in Health & Safety committee and fire warden duties

Key Competencies:
  • Good working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)
  • Administrative experience working in a fast-paced environment
  • Positive, enthusiastic, and professional attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, written, verbal and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills, independent judgment, confidentiality, time management, attention to detail, and flexibility to work with changing priorities under pressure
  • Love for entertainment!

What You’ll Be a Part Of…
  • Taking care: competitive health and dental coverage
  • Investing in your future: local defined contribution pension plans
  • Break time: free snacks and reduced hours in summer
  • Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
  • Be inspired: regular film screenings and opportunity to get involved in industry events
  • The office: modern facilities and in-house screening rooms
  • Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
  • Grow: develop your career and shape your future

We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Entertainment One is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to supporting diversity and inclusion within our work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Through its extensive reach and scale, and a deep commitment to high-quality entertainment, eOne unlocks the power and value of creativity.

eOne brings to market both original and existing content, sourcing IP from Hasbro’s portfolio of 1500+ brands, and through a diversified network of creative partners and eOne companies including: international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; unscripted television production companies Renegade 83, Daisybeck and Blackfin; live entertainment leaders Round Room Live; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.

The Receptionist, as the first point of contact, will respond with a high level of professionalism, with an emphasis on great customer service. This position facilitates and ensures smooth and efficient operations of the front office. The incumbent will need to greet all visitors respectfully and in a professional manner. In addition to these duties, various administrative functions fall into the scope of responsibility of the role.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Handles queries and requests from visitors, staff, vendors, and the public.
  • Greets visitors and accommodates them, re-directing when necessary.
  • Provide timely, efficient, accurate and professional administrative support
  • Handles incoming calls and directs to the correct department.
  • Coordinates the booking and setting up of meeting rooms
  • Maintain cleanliness and general organization of meeting and boardrooms
  • Logging and maintaining security card access system for employee entry
  • Schedule deliveries, create waybills, and provide tracking for local couriers and expedited parcel shipments through Quick Messenger Service & FedEx.
  • Receive package deliveries and notify individuals
  • Receive mail and distribute to various departments
  • Tracking and logging invoices for the Facilities department
  • Ordering/Maintaining office supplies.
  • Maintain executive kitchen and supplies
  • Verify vaccination status of visitors using the Verify Ontario app
  • Involvement in Health & Safety committee and fire warden duties

Key Competencies:
  • Good working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)
  • Administrative experience working in a fast-paced environment
  • Positive, enthusiastic, and professional attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, written, verbal and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills, independent judgment, confidentiality, time management, attention to detail, and flexibility to work with changing priorities under pressure
  • Love for entertainment!

What You’ll Be a Part Of…
  • Taking care: competitive health and dental coverage
  • Investing in your future: local defined contribution pension plans
  • Break time: free snacks and reduced hours in summer
  • Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
  • Be inspired: regular film screenings and opportunity to get involved in industry events
  • The office: modern facilities and in-house screening rooms
  • Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
  • Grow: develop your career and shape your future

We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Entertainment One is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to supporting diversity and inclusion within our work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Front Desk Clerk
company: The Wilson Hotel at Big Sky
description:
We are looking for a Hotel Front Desk Agent to serve as our guests’ first point of contact and manage all aspects of their accommodation. Hotel Front Desk Agent responsibilities include registering guests, managing reservations and providing information about rooms, rates and amenities. If you have a knack for customer service and work experience in the hotel industry, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will help create a pleasant and memorable stay for our guests.

Responsibilities

Perform all check-in and check-out tasks

Manage online and phone reservations

Inform customers about payment methods and verify their credit card data

Register guests collecting necessary information (like contact details and exact dates of their stay)

Welcome guests upon their arrival and assign rooms

Provide information about our hotel, available rooms, rates and amenities

Respond to clients’ complaints in a timely and professional manner

Liaise with our housekeeping staff to ensure all rooms are clean, tidy and fully-furnished to accommodate guests’ needs

Confirm group reservations and arrange personalized services for VIP customers and event attendees, like wedding guests

Upsell additional facilities and services, when appropriate

Maintain updated records of bookings and payments

Skills

Work experience as a Hotel Front Desk Agent, Receptionist or similar role

Experience with hotel reservations software, like Cloudbeds and RoomKeyPMS

Understanding of how travel planning websites operate, like Booking and TripAdvisor

Customer service attitude

Excellent communication and organizational skills

Degree in hotel management is a plus

title: Licensed Office Assistant
description:
Licensed Office Assistant 

Sterling Mutuals is looking for a Licensed Office Assistant. 

As a Licensed office assistant, your responsibilities may include but are not limited to: 

  • General reception duties (answering phones, greeting clients, etc.) 
  • Promptly responding to clients via phone and/email 
  • General office duties (mail sorting, filing, etc.) 
  • Processing Mutual fund orders 
  • Checking for completion and accuracy of Mutual fund orders 
  • Preparation of Representative paperwork for trades 
  • Preparing Deposits and making deposits to bank. 
  • Managing invoices 
  • Managing office supplies and ordering them as needed 

The successful candidate will have the following: 

  • Completion of the Canadian Mutual Investment Funds course 
  • Previous experience in the financial industry an asset 
  • Extensive knowledge of the financial services industry 
  • Strong written and oral communication skills 
  • Attention to detail and ability to multitask 
  • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite 
  • Excellent time management skills  

Daytime work, 20- 25 hours per week. 

Compensation to be discussed at interview. Wage commensurate with experience. 

Please send resume and cover letter to slevesque@sterlingmutuals.com

description:
We are currently seeking a permanent part-time Office Services Assistant to join our team. The position requires an in-office presence 5 days a week for 6 hours a day (5 hours work+ unpaid lunch hour). We offer a friendly workplace environment along with a benefits package which includes extended health and dental, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and a Health Spending Account.


Duties:


  • Process incoming mail, including scanning and distribution
  • Assist remote staff with on-site tasks, including some data input
  • Backup coverage for reception desk
  • Oversee maintenance and troubleshoot issues with equipment; place service calls as required and liaise with technicians when they report for on-site repairs; order device supplies when necessary
  • Oversee office supply inventory
  • Purchase sundry items outside office as required
  • Update the library
  • Safety Committee duties – first aid; emergency evacuation


We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Receptionist
description:
JOB SUMMARY:

This position is responsible for providing Administrative support to SOTCS and to various Programs within Spirit of the Children Society. The Office Receptionist is responsible for administrative duties including reception, social media updates, and other administrative support for all locations.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Reception:

  • Promote and support traditional cultural teachings and practices for our families, agency, and community
  • Create and maintain a welcoming, culturally supportive reception area
  • Answer calls, greet families and guests, respond to email inquiries
  • Follow emergency procedures/guide staff and clients in emergencies

Office Administration and Support:

  • Track and administer vehicle and transit ticket usage
  • Schedule and maintain room bookings
  • Maintain and distribute staff lists, program calendars, office supplies and manage postage and printers
  • Coordinate mail, and courier
  • Ordering office and janitorial supplies.

Program Support:

  • Administrative support and preparing for program start (printing documents, labels, brochures)
  • Program inventory and control
  • Support the agency's client file system, including receiving, documenting, and filing intakes and referrals
  • Assist in organizing agency events such as annual powwow, family nights, and family Christmas gathering
  • Develop and update Social media (strong computer skills are required)

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience office administration, reception, and social media, preferably in the non-profit or public sector.
  • Excellent computer skills in word processing, spreadsheets, internet, and email on Windows platform.
  • Strong understanding of social media tools and website development
  • First Aid an asset or must be willing to certify.

Skills and Attributes

  • Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to multi-task and prioritize in a dynamic fast paced work environment, excellent problem-solving abilities, ability to work independently and as a team player.
  • High degree of professionalism and comfort in setting boundaries.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment, sensitivity, and confidentiality.
  • Knowledge of Indigenous communities, organizations and service providers within the Circle 6 area an asset.
  • Criminal Records Check vulnerable sector

TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT:

Full Time position, dependent on negotiated funding for the contract year. 9:30 am – 5:00 pm

Please send resume and COVER LETTER state salary expectations in your cover letter.

Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.

Peoples of Indigenous Ancestry are strongly encouraged to apply. Please self-identify.

Position open until filled.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $39,000.00-$41,000.00 per year

title: Recording Secretary
description:
Looking for recording secretaries to attend condominium Board and general meetings, both in person and virtual. In this position, you will:


- Earn a competitive per-meeting wage as an independent contractor

- Have the ability to work as many or as few meetings as your schedule permits

- Benefit from a flexible meeting schedule

- Receive training, feedback and support


The record of the minutes is not a transcript, but a summary of the meeting discussion items, decisions made and actions to be taken. We will provide minute-taking training and clearly communicate our expectations to successful candidates.


Meeting locations are varied across the GTA. Most meetings are held in the evening hours, Monday to Thursday, with typical duration of up to 2 hours per meeting.


Candidates must own a laptop and have the ability to attend meetings on location or virtual. We offer a comprehensive program starting at $20/hour up to $50/hour dependent on experience.


Experience Required:

- Administration or Management experience in a Corporate environment

- Advanced Microsoft Office skills

- Strong typing, business writing , proofreading and grammar skills


Qualifications:

- Absolute reliability and punctuality

- Ability to summarize key discussions and document decisions

- Experience in minutes/notes/transcription taking and preparation is an asset

- Vehicle ownership is preferred but not required


If you are interested in joining our team, please provide a cover letter and resume to minutes_plus@outlook.com.


We thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive, we may only respond to those candidates being selected for an interview.

title: Survey Caller - COVID 19
description:
Are you passionate about customer service? Are you passionate about helping others? Are you passionate about educating others? Do you speak another language? Then we have the job for YOU!

Randstad is looking for Survey Callers to assist with the COVID-19 Vaccine rollout in Ontario. This is a temporary position, roughly 2-3 months, with full-time hours. To find out more, read below.

Type: Temporary; 7-8 Weeks

Pay: $15.61 + $2 bonus per hour on the phone

Start Date: Monday, February 28th

Hours of Operation: Mon - Fri 12:30pm - 9pm OR 5pm-9pm. Sat-Sun 12pm-5pm

Location: Work from Home

Some equipment will be provided by the client

Must be able to connect the computer to the modem

Create your own schedule!

Advantages
  • Full-time hours
  • 7-8 week contract
  • Create your own schedule on a week to week basis
  • Paid weekly
  • $2 bonus per hour on the phone
  • Be a part of the Vaccine rollout
  • Get good working experience

Responsibilities
  • Making outbound calls
  • Assisting people to book their second COVID-19 Vaccine
  • Walking people through the booking process
  • Providing basic information about the Vaccine
  • Answering any concerns they may have
  • Sending off confirmation emails
  • Providing top-notch service

Qualifications
  • Customer service or Call Center experience is a must
  • Clear communication
  • Positive thoughts about the COVID-19 Vaccine
  • Customer-focused and tech-savvy

Summary

If you are interested and you like to learn more, apply now!
  • Apply online
  • Send a copy of your resume to anastasia.kourniotis@randstad.ca OR andrea.francis@randstad.ca and mention "Survey Caller - COVID19"

Looking forward to hearing from you

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Data Entry Clerk Part Time (Remote)
description:
Remote work from home administrative assistant, data entry clerk, typing, customer service representative, get started now.

Thanks for checking us out! Work From Home Data Entry Jobs - Part Time, Full Time

We are looking for individuals who are trying to find part-time or full-time work or side gigs to be connected with companies who are hiring workers directly to work from their homes. You will find both permanent and also part-time remote opportunities in a variety of career fields.

Legitimate Work From Home Data Entry Jobs are going to require that you have skills appropriate to the position you are requesting. Training is supplied based on the position.

Job Requirements
  • Computer with web access
  • Silent work area away from interruptions
  • Must be able as well as comfortable to operating in an environment without immediate supervision
  • Capacity to read, recognize, and also follow oral and written instructions.
  • Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not needed however can be a bonus
  • We are recruiting those that have a background in healthcare, storage facility worker, delivery drivers, customer support, etc - we welcome all backgrounds so long as you're ready to learn
You should apply on our web site only.

Job Needs
  • Typing 25+ words per minute
  • You enjoy data entry work and can carry out the work from your home or location of choosing (remote work at home job)
  • Computer with net access
  • It is vital that you be self-motivated and able to follow explicit directions to begin working from home
  • Self Motivated - you must be 100% able to commit to collaborating with little supervision
  • Work from home jobs of this nature need Internet and one of the following: Laptop computer or COMPUTER, MAC, or Smart Device - Android or IPHONE
Ready to get going? Start today and make money next week.

Thanks for checking us out and we look forward to helping you achieve your goals!

title: Admin Assistant- EN
description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The legendary customer experience is paramount to everything we do at TD and to achieve the same, our executives seek out and rely on exceptional administrative and executive assistance support. Our administrative and executive assistants provide a broad range of administrative and general office support to executives at senior levels in the organization. Join our team if you can contribute to maintaining the smooth operations of the business through your strong administration skills.

Job Description

As Administrative Assistant, you will provide dedicated administrative support to executives at the TD Bank Group. You will provide a broad range of administrative or general office support for the broader team as assigned. In addition, your work will involve a range of complexity and may include but is not limited to the following accountabilities:
  • Provide a high level of administrative support ensuring quality service and professionalism at every customer interaction
  • Manage efficiently in a multi-tasked environment and ensure deadlines are met
  • Apply appropriate due diligence ensuring accuracy in preparing and promptly completing all required supporting documentation (reports, presentations, invoices, communications, tables, charts, files, etc.)
  • Ensure the optimal level of customer service and integrity is provided
  • Provide accurate, organized and efficient administrative support
  • Collect and track data, research information, sort and distribute mail, balance and process expense reports, schedule and organize meetings, and perform other administrative assignments as required
  • Consistently exercise discretion in handling correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; raise issues w here appropriate
  • Be an effective teammate and flexible in adjusting to changing work priorities
  • Participate fully as a member of the team and contribute to a positive work environment
  • Keep others in the immediate team informed and up-to-date about the status/progress of projects, and all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
  • Provide dedicated administrative support to multiple Vice Presidents and Assistant Vice Presidents and their respective team
  • Offer fully qualified, experienced administrative and clerical support and perform multiple tasks and work on dynamic assignments with limited complexity
Job Requirements
  • High school diploma with over 2 years of relevant experience
  • Hands on knowledge of MS Office Suite and Internet applications
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team with flexibility for effectively coordinating processes and information across related teams
  • A dynamic professional with willingness to learn and take initiative on upcoming tasks and projects
  • Strong communication skills to interpret policies and apply standards to complete assignments in a fast-changing environment
Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
ResQ Youth International

Job Posting

Executive Assistant

 

ResQ Youth International is a registered charity providing services to racialized and marginalized youth through counselling, student mediation/advocacy, restorative justice, life skills/character building training and career coaching/job search programs for over 20 years.

 

Type of Position: Contract position. 35 hours per week

 

Position Summary:

We are seeking an assistant to support the work of the Executive Director. The executive assistant will participate in the supervision of a small staff team. Will assist the team in providing excellent presentations and programs for the youth participants. The executive assistant will connect with our network of community-serving organizations and sometimes attend meetings, workshops and training events on behalf of the Executive Director. Will need excellent computer skills to keep abreast and participate in social media and to monitor and update the website. The executive assistant will be detail oriented and keep accurate records. The executive assistant will maintain confidentiality. The executive assistant may have the flexibility of partially working remotely as dictated by the pandemic.

 

Skills/Knowledge Required:

The successful applicant:

·        Should have the ability to communicate effectively and to facilitate video conferencing, as needed.

·        Should be outgoing, articulate and creative with the ability to effectively forge professional ties with the Executive Director, other staff and our community network.

·        Should have strong specialized understanding of the unique needs, culture and possible life experiences of Black youth.

·        Should have the ability to represent the Executive Director at meetings, events, etc. gathering and sharing information accurately with the Executive Director.

·        Should have the skills to effectively supervise a small staff.

·        Should have the willingness to work and consult with the Black community.

·        Should be able to work independently as well as with a team.

·        Should have high digital literacy and a strong command of digital tools (g-suite, zoom, canva, basic back-end web experience, data input etc.)

·        Should have knowledge, and familiarity with patois, Caribbean dialects and Creole.

title: Executive Personal Assistant (fully remote)
description:
Love being an Executive Personal Assistant? Have tech and startup experience? Are always one step ahead of everyone? Then you want to join the Take It Easy Group team. We are a fast-growing Fractional EA and PA team that supports North American Tech Startups. We are a remote first company and are disrupting the way people think of the VA and EA worlds. Our ambition is to redefine how CEOs / Founders think of working with Executive Assistants, and in doing so become more than just a part time assistant for hire. We strive to be strategic partners in business. We love building relationships with our clients and our Fractional EAs and PAs never work with more than 4 clients at a time. We are hiring for multiple full-time positions.


Job Responsibilities:

· Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external parities on all matters

· Calendar management & meeting coordination for multiple CEOs / Founders

· Inbox management for multiple CEOs / Founders as well as agenda coordination & note-taking

· When necessary, represent the CEO / Founder by attending meetings in their absence and speaking on their behalf

· Manage event planning and travel / accommodations / arrangements

· The "go-to" person for your clients overall life

· Personal Assistant duties such as gifting, reservations, confirming appointments, personal travel, etc.

· Record and submit expense reports

· Some personal assistant duties such as gifting, reservations, confirming appointments, personal travel, personal research, etc.

· Other ad hoc EA + PA duties


Qualifications / Skills:

· Thrives in a collaborative yet fast-paced environment

· Can exhibit extremely high attention to detail, especially in operational responsibilities

· Readily adapts personal, interpersonal, and leadership behaviour, understanding that different situations may call for different approaches

· (We shouldn’t have to say this .. but putting it out there anyway) … Extensive knowledge with GSuite, Office, Zoom, Teams, Slack, Asana + Trello

· Is a creative problem-solver, adapts well to change, and can independently resolve any challenges through proposing and executing solutions

· Deliberate and forward thinking in approaching challenges

· Comfortable operating with ambiguity, navigate uncertain situations, and drive for clarity

· Outside the box thinking, someone who is not afraid to ask questions and look for new / different solutions

· Loves to create order

· Resilient, highly motivated

· Exceptional at proactive thinking

· Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

· Passionate about being an Executive Assistant and helping others succeed


Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:

· 10+ years as an Executive Personal Assistant supporting a variety of Executives and teams, preferably C-level support experience

· Experience working with startups is a must!

· Extremely comfortable with new technology

· Located in North America


The Fine Print:

· Working hours: Monday – Friday office hours, with additional time as needed (we are EAs after all!) Looking at hiring all time zones

· 3 weeks PTO

· Unlimited Sick Days

· Medical and Dental Benefits

  • · Being part of an amazing group of EAs who are supportive, fun, and passionate about helping others

title: Guide touristique
description:
OFFRE D’EMPLOI – GUIDES-ANIMATEURS/ANIMATRICES

NATURE DU TRAVAIL -accueillir les visiteurs, - s’occuper de la billetterie et de la boutique - accompagner et guider les visiteurs au cours de leur visite - répondre aux questions et aux besoins des visiteurs - vérifier et préparer le matériel et l’équipement nécessaires - assurer l’entretien et la propreté du site - décrire et commenter l’environnement et les points d’intérêt - veiller à la sécurité des visiteurs CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL • 14,50 $ / h; • Horaire 32 heures par semaine (horaire variable en semaine et fin de semaine); • Date d’embauche : 13 juin • Durée de l’emploi : 12 semaines (important : les candidat-e-s doivent être disponibles pour toute la durée de l’emploi). QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES • Aimer travailler en équipe et avec les publics; • Être autonome, débrouillard-e, dynamique et fiable; • avoir sens de l’organisation; • avoir une souplesse quant à l’horaire de travail; • être honnête et intègre.

CONDITIONS D’ADMISSIBILITÉ (emploi d’été canada) : • Être citoyen canadien ou résident permanent • Être âgé entre 15 et 30 ans • Avoir étudié un semestre à temps plein (tel que défini par son établissement d’enseignement) au cégep ou à l’université au cours du trimestre précédent • Prévoir un retour à temps plein aux études à la fin de l’emploi obtenu à l’aide du programme JCT Informations complémentaires : Avoir accès à une voiture et posséder le permis de conduire s’avère nécessaire pour se déplacer jusqu’au Phare de Pointe-des-Monts. Nombre de postes 2 Si tu as des questions sur le poste, n’hésite pas à nous contacter. Fais parvenir ton curriculum vitae avant le 22 mai 2022 : France Caron, directrice générale baie.trinite.phare@gmail.com 418 939 2400

title: Server
description:
Posting Date May 05, 2022

Job Number 22073056

Job Category Food and Beverage & Culinary

Location Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver, 645 Howe Street, Vancouver, BC, Canada VIEW ON MAP

Brand Renaissance Hotels

Schedule Full-Time

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Located Remotely? N

You were always one of those curious kids who opened every cabinet, peeked behind every door, and never ceased to ask "why" when given an explanation. Today, you bring your personal style to every experience. You live life to discover. You are passionate about your neighborhood, always looking to explore the places one wouldn’t find in a travel guide. If this sounds like you, you’re in the right place. You’ve got authentic style, natural curiosity and a warm way with people. Renaissance is not just a place to spend the night, it's a place to discover, a place in the world with style like yours. That’s why we’re not just looking for anyone. We’re looking for someone like you.

Job Summary
  • FT (Evenings & Weekends)
Explore our very big world

We welcome you to join our global and diverse family. Whether you’re new to hospitality or a seasoned professional, you can come to us knowing that you will always be appreciated for your natural talents. Your positive energy and people-pleasing mindset are an important part of why our guests stay with us again and again.

Rewards For Work, Benefits For Life

You’ll be supported in and out of the workplace through:
  • Discounts on hotel rooms, gift shop items, food and beverage
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Recognition programs
  • Wellbeing programs
  • Encouraging management
  • Team-spirited colleagues
The impact you’ll make

You know the finest details of our menu and can’t wait to share your expertise with our guests. When they dine with us, your warm greeting, flawless table settings, and your friendly demeanor do not go unnoticed. No matter the day, you set out to provide each guest with a dining experience that will be remembered long after their stay.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Welcome guests and promptly attend to tables
  • Serve food and beverages to guests making recommendations if needed
  • Share your menu knowledge to assist guests with questions and special requests
  • Record transactions in the MICROS system correctly and timely
  • Check-in with guests to assure satisfaction with each course and beverage
  • Clean tables, complete closing duties and re-stock tableware and other supplies
What We’re Looking For
  • Great conversational skills and teamwork-oriented
  • Positive outlook and outgoing personality
  • Previous serving experience is a big plus
This role requires the ability to move and lift up to 25 lbs. Standing, sitting or walking for extended periods of time and ensuring a professional appearance in a clean uniform are also required. Prior to employment, we’ll ask you to complete safety training and certification.

Connect your passions with a rewarding opportunity

You’re a food and beverage enthusiast who really enjoys making others feel at home. When you work with us, you'll get to entertain and meet people from all over the world as you build your experience. Join us and grow through opportunities to explore the business, opening yourself to various career options. No matter your path, we’ll make sure you feel right at home.

At Marriott, we are committed to putting our associates first and their health and safety are our highest priorities. This position requires associates to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per current Public Health Agency of Canada standards or approved for a Human Rights accommodation.

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Notification to Applicants: Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver takes seriously its obligations under the applicable provincial legislation and will provide accommodations to job applicants needing assistance. If you require an accommodation in relation to this job posting, our online application or an interview, please call 905-366-5227 or email CanadaApplicationAccommodation@marriott.com and a member of our Human Resources team will respond to your request. Please note that this phone number and email are only for those individuals who would like to request an accessibility accommodation as part of the recruiting process.

title: Executive and Personal Assistant
description:
Overview

Our client is looking for an experienced Executive and Personal Assistant to join their ranks. In this role, you will report to the CEO and be responsible for enabling him to grow the business, by keeping him focused and organized. If you are a self-starting, hyper-organized, multi-tasker with the ability to work fast and bring results – we are looking for you!


Company overview

You will be working for the world’s only open, digital, customer-centric marketplace connecting individuals who want to complete Real Estate and related transactions with the best service providers for them. Our company’s revolutionary platform brings transparency, choice, accountability, and simplicity to the entire Real Estate process.


Particularly, you will need to:

-Prioritize what is important as you manage the CEO’s calendars and tasks.

  • recognize what must be done now, what can wait and what does not need the CEO’s attention at all
  • be comfortable with adjusting last minute
  • be mindful of the many, little, but important multidimension facets of his schedule – are Thursday evenings family nights? Keep that in mind!

-Act as a "gate-keeper", protecting the CEO's time, while managing positive relationships with all internal and external stakeholders.

-Be a self-starter and anticipate needs by:

  • building into the CEO’s schedules time to prepare, reflect, or travel.
  • being prepared with solutions and alternatives through researching and thinking to yourself “if I were the CEO, what would I ask next?”, then proceeding to prepare for the answer OR “what issues might arise?” then proceeding to mitigate these issues if possible.
  • following up on action items from meetings to ensure they are done.

-Manage ALL communications (email, phone, etc.) on behalf of the CEO – if the CEO never has to look at his emails because he knows you’ve either taken care of things or will connect with him to ensure you understand how to take care of things, that would be ideal.

-Act as a Personal Assistant on behalf of the CEO – you will act as the first point of contact for the CEO and provide full logistical support. Your attention to detail and professionalism will allow a streamlined process to manage scheduling, correspondence, arranging and managing travel schedules, personal appointments, household staff etc.

-Draft and send correspondence with internal and external stakeholders on behalf of the CEO – high professionalism, attention to detail and sound judgement are key here.

-Organize receipts, make claims and manage admin processes that relate to all of the CEO’s personal and professional expenses, thereby ensuring he spend as little time as possible worrying about administrative tasks, and as much time as possible growing the business.

-Prepare and book all travel and related appointments and manage all of the associated documentation.

-Be resourceful and humble – be comfortable saying “I don’t know”, but resourceful enough to say “and here is how I’ll find out”.

-Offer support to the other direct reports of the CEO as needed.

-Be ready to be very flexible regarding working hours and assignments – you truly enjoy helping executives run their businesses and understand that the personal and corporate often overlap; this will not be a 9-5, Monday-Friday job.


Job Requirements

-You have several years’ experience supporting C-suite leader(s) and/or busy senior executives.

-You have experience working within a fast-paced, high growth, chaotic environment.

-Extremely resourceful and proactive, with a strong sense of urgency and even stronger attention to detail.

-You are hardworking, with a positive, can-do attitude.

-You’re a team player – willing to help wherever and however necessary to support other departments.

-Your strong interpersonal skills shine on – you can work well with different personalities in the organization.

-Professional and approachable.

-You are trustworthy and have incredible discretion and judgment when it comes to sensitive or confidential matters.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills - able to edit documents for spelling and grammar; able to represent the CEO internally and externally both in meetings and in writing.

-Flexibility to match the CEO’s schedule.

-Strong project and time-management skills.

-Calm, organized, and responsive - you take pride in your ability to get things done not just quickly, but also well.

-You hold yourself and others around you accountable – you OWN your work and are proud to deliver high-quality outcomes.


Education and Technical Knowledge:

-Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university is a minimum educational requirement.

-Intermediate-to-advanced skill-level with PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, etc.

-Intermediate comfort with Excel.


Location:

-Anywhere in the GTA


Additional information

-Very competitive cash and equity compensation – all employees are part-owners!

-Excellent healthcare benefits plan 

-20 days off available per year + all Statutory Holidays

-Exposure to all aspects of a successful PropTech business, as well as great leaders and engaged colleagues.


Salary

-Salary is commensurate with experience and candidate qualities/capabilities

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Our client, a successful Boutique Commercial Real Estate Brokerage, is hiring a full-time Administrative Assistant. The ideal candidate has experience creating and editing documents, preparing presentations, managing calendars, performing research and light analysis, and providing project administration support.


Duties:

- Prepare documents, presentations, and reports

- Complete research and assist with special projects

- Answer phone calls and email inquiries.

- Communicate with Tenants, Landlords, Real Estate Sales Professionals.

- Assist with marketing support - update social media, website, and presentations.

- Manage office supplies

- Coordinate contractors

- Schedule meetings and manage calendar

- Assist with coordinating travel arrangements


Requirements:

- Post-secondary education is required.

- 1-3 years’ experience providing administrative support to multiple or team of professionals.

- Work experience in a Sales or Marketing environment preferred.

- Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions.

- Ability to write routine reports and correspondence, with exceptional attention to detail.

- Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to clients and team members.

- Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts and/or commissions.

- Ability to be proactive and problem solve.

- Excellent written/verbal communication skills in order to effectively and confidently communicate with clients in person, by phone or by email.

- Strong organizational and analytical skills.

- Ability to determine and respond to conflicting priorities, as well as multi-tasking various projects within the team.

- Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite, internet research and web publishing skills.

title: School Receptionist - Administrative assistants
description:
School Receptionist - Administrative assistants

TERMS

Vacancies: 1

Job start date

As soon as possible

Wage

$37,000 to $40,000/year + Annual Bonus

Hours

40 Hours / Week

Terms of employment

Permanent, Full time, Day

Work conditions and physical capabilities

Fast-paced environment, Work under pressure, Tight deadlines, Repetitive tasks, Attention to detail

Area of Specialization

Correspondence, Reports and records, Financial statements, Invoices, Charts, tables, graphs and diagrams

Business Equipment and Computer Applications

MS Office, Simply Accounting, MS Word, Quick Books, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Windows

Essential Functions

  • Answering telephone system for the purpose of screening calls, transferring calls, responding to inquiries and/or taking messages.
  • Greeting individuals entering the school (e.g. visitors, parents, students, vendors, etc.) for the purpose of responding to inquiries; and/or directing individuals to appropriate location in accordance with established procedures.
  • Performing general secretarial and clerical functions (e.g. scheduling, copying, faxing, data entry, filing, etc.) for the purpose of supporting office operations.
  • Assisting with all admissions-related tasks and various administrative tasks and duties, utilizing word, excel, Google Drive and maintaining the school database updated.
  • Processing a variety of records (e.g. student records, transcripts, attendance sheet, guardianship letters, etc.) for the purpose of conveying information within Ministry’s guidelines and regulations.
  • Assisting with the ordering of stationery, materials and resources and ensuring that stock levels are maintained.
  • Communicating with parents, agents and students regarding all aspects of school life, receiving and passing on information, between parents and teachers, including phoning parents or guardian to ascertain reasons for students’ absence.

Other Functions

  • Performs other related duties as assigned for the purpose of ensuring the efficient and effective functioning of the work unit.

Technical Terminology

Business

Education

Bachelor's degree

Experience

1 year to less than 2 years

HOW TO APPLY

By email only.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Toronto, ON

Required experience:

  • Administrative Support: 2 years

*Language Languages

English Preference: Japanese/Korean/Chinese/Thai/Vietnamese

title: Early Childhood Educator - Yoga Program
description:
Little Yogis is a mobile Yoga & Mindfulness program for kids in Ontario aged 2 - 13 years. Our tagline is “Positivity & Movement for Busy Minds” as we aim to improve physical, mental, and emotional health through our curriculum. We partner with schools, childcare centers, and offer private sessions to improve the health and wellness of communities.


As we grow, we are looking for more passionate teachers to join our team.


As a mobile program, we are looking for a teacher who can easily commute to different locations across the GTA and conduct various classes.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood Education or related field
  • Must have experience working with children in some capacity
  • Must be flexible with hours and willing to commute to different locations for classes
  • Have a fun and outgoing personality! We tell stories and use props to conduct our yoga sessions
  • Have an interest in yoga and or practice regularly
  • Yoga certification is considered an asset
  • CPR training


Skills:

  • Knowledge of early learning philosophies/frameworks
  • Patience
  • Great communication skills
  • Creativity
  • People skills
  • Passion for children & early learning
  • Flexibility
  • Dedication/loyalty


Job Behaviours:

Customer Service Focus·

  • Establish and sustain positive working relationships with daycare, school staff and parents
  • Build trust; value others; treat others with respect; demonstrate integrity
  • Make the needs of customers the primary focus of all actions
  • Take responsibility to promote and sustain productive customer relationships and loyalty


Accountability & Professionalism:

  • Show up early to shifts to ensure your classes are set up for success
  • Demonstrate decisiveness
  • Prepare lesson plans in advance


Student focused

  • Put the needs of your students first
  • Display empathy and compassion for your students
  • Understanding students needs and making quick decision


Self Starter

  • Takes the time to carefully prepare lesson plans in advance
  • Ensures all classes are instructed with a quality education experience in mind
  • Cares deeply about students and is passionate about the role


Please send your resume, we will be in touch for an interview shall you meet the requirements.


Namaste!

title: PART-TIME ESL INSTRUCTOR
description:
This position requires candidates to be comfortable with helping other instructors & adult students from multicultural backgrounds. This position is permanent part-time. The candidate must be comfortable with working in early mornings, late evenings as well as weekends. The work environment is fast-paced.

Professional Requirements:

  • High proficiency in English language (Reading/ Writing/Listening / Speaking).
  • Excellent communication skills, and ability to explain concepts clearly.
  • Computer skills and administrative skills.
  • Detail orientation and time management.
  • Ability to deal with clients professionally and effectively.
  • Able to work in a team as well as independently.
  • Clean and professional attire.
  • Ability to assist and coordinate with instructors without any issue.
  • Knowledge of English language exams such as IELTS/CELPIP is an asset, not a requirement.
  • Knowledge of other languages (French, Chinese, Spanish) is an asset.

Other Requirements:

  • Strong work ethic.
  • Commitment to work and learning new things.
  • Ability to perform under pressure.
  • Ability to think clearly and solve problems.
  • Ability to deal with conflicts.

title: Office Assistant
description:
The ideal candidate will provide top-level assistance for our Therapists. They should be well-organized and be comfortable scheduling clients and responding to any emails on request.. Lastly, this individual should be able to draft documents and help the Therapists with any necessary meeting or session preparations. 

**Please note, as this position will be primarily funded by a provincial grant, applicants will need to be 30 and under ***

 Responsibilities

  • Calendar management for therapists
  • Aid in preparing for sessions, i.e. photocopying worksheets
  • Responding to emails and document requests on behalf of therapists
  • Draft slides, meeting notes and documents for therapist
  • Complete a few janitorial tasks

Qualifications

  • We are willing to train
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite
  • Experience in managing multiple priorities, administrative coordination, and logistics
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented, ability to multi-task with great follow-up skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Willing to learn basic skills in inputting data in accounting program

title: Language Specialist
description:
I am a Cree writer, educator who teaches through storytelling, I teach from the spirit, to paper, you will understand your inner self. Then once you do, we grow from there...

I have a lot of things that will help learn... I love meeting new people, I think everyone should learn a new language; especially here in Canada, it would make life so much better for everyone knowing we all come from different backgrounds, so we can build a better future for our children, respecting our differences...

title: Office Administrator
description:
Are you extremely organized, have an insane eye for detail, excellent English skills and love to energize people? Do you thrive being the individual that glues teams together, changing priorities quickly, having a customer service attitude at all times and always looking for ways to improve processes and enhance company culture?


Come work with us! Be part of a team that has your back, enjoys working hard and having fun while helping you succeed in your career!


Reporting to the HR Business Partner, the Office Administrator provides administrative support and HR assistance to maintain the smooth running of our offices and to encourage employee engagement.


Duties & Responsibilities


  1. Provides administrative support to all departments by helping with clerical tasks to facilitate job performance and maintain productivity levels.
  2. Organizes employee onboarding and offboarding, as well as functions, events and services to support employee engagement and help with employee retention
  3. Organizes agendas, travel, and documentation as needed, while maintaining high levels of confidentiality in order to provide administrative and operational support to all departments
  4. Files, updates and organizes company records to support company compliance with federal, provincial and industry regulations.
  5. Executes data entry of purchase requisitions related to office supplies and /or services using the selected company’s software to support organizational controls and compliance and to provide a streamlined procurement workflow that allows for decision making.
  6. Supports the office’s IT demands by liaising with the IT provider to assist with troubleshooting and /or IT user requests and set-up.
  7. Coordinates building's vendors and suppliers by proactively anticipating the company's needs and arranging services that allow to maintain the facilities and the equipment in optimal condition thus enhancing the resources to facilitate employee productivity.


Experience, Skills and abilities


  • A minimum of high school diploma with at least 3-4 years of office administration and/or HR experience.
  • Or a bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or similar with at least 2 years of office administration or HR experience.
  • Exceptional knowledge of computer software applications and general disposition with IT processes and computer processes, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Teams, One Drive, MS Forms), and Adobe Pro.
  • Some knowledge of general bookkeeping or basic accounting related procedures will be an asset.
  • Excellent command of English, both written and spoken.
  • Must be legally allowed to work in Canada.
  • Having a reliable means of transportation
  • Ability to apply for a Port Pass


Why us


With the backing of a multinational corporation, SAAM's mission to drive the economic and social development of countries extend to the desire to impart our workforce with real growth opportunities and contribute to the regional economic sustainability by providing quality jobs within remote and local communities.


You will enjoy a comprehensive benefit's package, including excellent extended health, dental and vision services; group life, AD & D, Short & Long-term disability; great contribution to our pension plan, performance rewards; mentorship and a team ready to work with you!


Our operations are in a central location, with an easy commute from most places in Metro Vancouver.


SAAM Towage Canada’s vision is to stand out as ONE team, delivering towage services beyond expectations!


We guide ourselves from 5 pillars that create our competitiveness and success: Safety, Respect, Honesty, Responsibility, and Service.

If these values resonate with you, we encourage you to apply and let us know a bit more about your commitment to excellence and your passion for achieving high standards while being rewarded with a culture that encourages learning, development, camaraderie, and innovation.


SAAM Towage Canada is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals, including women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities.


We would like to thank you in advance for your interest in this position. Only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


SAAM Towage Canada acknowledges we operate in the Traditional, unceded territories of the Coast Salish people and in particular, the traditional territories of the xʷ*məθkwəy*̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓*ílwəta *ʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
