title: Survey Caller
description:
Are you passionate about customer service? Are you passionate about helping others? Are you passionate about educating others? Do you speak another language? Then we have the job for YOU!

Randstad is looking for Survey Callers to assist with an upcoming provincial election. This is a temporary position, roughly 1-2 months, with full-time hours. To find out more, read below.

Type: Temporary; 1-2 months

Pay: $16.50 + $2 bonus per hour on the phone

Start Date: Monday, April 25th

Hours of Operation: Mon - Fri 12:30pm - 9pm OR 5pm-9pm. Sat-Sun 12pm-5pm

Location: Work from Home

Must be able to connect the computer to the modem

Create your own schedule!

Advantages
  • Full-time hours
  • 7-8 week contract
  • Create your own schedule on a week to week basis
  • Paid weekly
  • $2 bonus per hour on the phone
  • Be a part of the Vaccine rollout
  • Get good working experience

Responsibilities
  • Making outbound calls
  • Following a survey and asking customers specific questions
  • Calling in regards to a political election
  • Updating customers answers into the system

Qualifications
  • Customer service or Call Center experience is a must
  • Clear communication
  • Positive thoughts about the COVID-19 Vaccine
  • Customer-focused and tech-savvy

Summary

If you are interested and you like to learn more, apply now!
  • Apply online
  • Send a copy of your resume to anastasia.kourniotis@randstad.ca OR andrea.francis@randstad.ca and mention "Survey Caller"

Looking forward to hearing from you

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Ideal Candidate:


1. Tech Savvy (Microsoft Office, Outlook, Adobe, Internet) ** AutoCAD and/or Photoshop are an Asset


2. Excellent oral and written communications, fluent in English (much of the work involves telephone and email communication); outstanding communication and negotiation abilities are a must


3. Flexible schedule – longer hours may be needed from time to time, as-is a change in hours, from time to time, including the occasional Saturday


4. Duties and responsibilities of this position fluctuate day-to-day, and the successful candidate will be able to adapt to changing requirements


5. Able to take direction and complete tasks Independently to meet critical deadlines


6. Works well under pressure, and is able to react efficiently and effectively to time-sensitive requests


7. Create and submit estimates, reports and proposals for review and submission to clients


8. Upon project award, coordinate procurement of materials


9. Constant Follow up with the Office Team – requires thoroughness and excellent organization skills


10. Have at least 3 - 5 years administrative experience. (Please tell us where)


11. Manage and maintain filing and storage systems (both on desktop and in paper)


12. General office duties – answering phone calls, monitoring stock of office supplies, etc.


13. Some warehouse work is required – organizing / cleaning , sweeping – Bonus to those willing to drive a forklift and can offload 1 or 2 deliveries a day) – Forklift training can be provided.


14. Bookkeeping experience would be considered an asset


15. Having Own Vehicle is Preferred – Live in close proximity


16. Organizes Showroom in Downtime and helps others.


17. HIGHLY ORGANIZED


EXTRA BONUS POINTS: Friendly and Sense of Humour!

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
The administrative assistant will be responsible for performing general office duties, maintaining an organized office environment and assistance with various clerical aspects of released projects, SAP data entry, and scheduling.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Answer all incoming phone calls and direct traffic

Handle and maintain all IT inquiries

Petty Cash Reconciliation

Maintain file system in the appropriate job folders

File management responsibilities include handling confidential and otherwise sensitive company documents

Create and maintain spreadsheets and templates

Provide clerical support documenting open issues on projects

Accurate Data Entry

Maintain and monitor Service Documents

Ability to multi-task and be organized

Assist General Manager & Office Manager as required

Minimum 2 years of experience in an office environment.


What you offer:

Excellent computer skills, including experience working with Microsoft and Google.

Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality, a professional demeanor and to represent the organization in a positive manner.

Problem solving: identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner and gathers and analyzes information skillfully.

Completes written progress notes and other formal communications skillfully and professionally

A collaborative attitude

Experience with SAP would be considered an asset.

A diploma in business administration or accounting would be considered valuable for this position.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Real Estate Administrative Assistant
description:
Looking for an Administrative Assistant to an Independent Real Estate Agent.The right person must be extremely detail-oriented, enthusiastic, self-starting and deeply committed to supporting the agent in achieving higher levels of success. Must also be reliable, dependable, punctual, Professiona, attention to detail, organized , fun and creative. This is a full-time position that offers a competitive salary & commission.


Responsibilities

  • Addressing client queries and scheduling appointments
  • Making follow-up calls
  • Scheduling meetings between the buyer and seller
  • Assisting in preparing real estate documents and forms
  • Coordinating showings and open houses
  • Maintaining electronic and print records of properties
  • Preparing, posting, and updating property listings
  • Maintaining and managing a database of clients
  • Performing clerical duties when required
  • Helping with the preparation of listing agreements and other legal documents
  • Collecting signed copy of the agreements from clients
  • Creating and distributing real estate brochures and other marketing materials
  • Handling online and offline property listings and advertisements
  • Taking photos of the properties under construction or repairs to determine the progress
  • Putting up signboards on the property
  • Gathering necessary information about properties for sale
  • Collecting mortgage payments
  • Assisting clients to look for properties based on their needs and financial standing
  • Acting as an intermediary during negotiations and property dealings


I have a Brand - StrataQueens


I specialize in Condo and Townhouses and help my clients to Downsize, or upsize depending on their needs.


As an Assistant , you will be responsible for my day to day activities and scheduling.

You will also be responsible for doing video recordings for me. No editing , simply recording.

No evening working hours required however you are expected to work some wekends in the field or even weekdays , to record videos of me or houses and to record my day to day activites.


I am very much about Social Media , you can check my Social Media to know my personality .


STRATAQUEENS on all social media platforms.

youtube

tiktok

instagram

facebook

twitter

Linkedin


Send your resume , only selected canditates will be contacted.

Must have valid drivers license and car


Must be able to work from home office location

Please include your salary expectations

title: Online Instructor K-12
description:
Knowledgehook is on a mission to empower the problem-solvers of tomorrow. We have a math education brand with a passionate fan-base and are assembling a purpose-driven team who loves to collaborate and solve problems with innovative solutions.


To help us build an even more compelling education experience, we are looking for online instructors and tutors for various subjects from K-12.


What you need to succeed

  • Bachelor of education or the equivalent in tutoring experience
  • Subject-matter expertise in the subjects that you are applying for
  • Working towards or have completed an undergraduate degree in the related field, or are currently enrolled in a teaching program
  • You are passionate about making a difference and have a desire to learn and grow
  • An engaging personality and the ability to inspire students


What’s in it for you

  • Competitive rates based on your professional experience
  • Use of our learning platform that includes teacher and student resources
  • Work from the comfort of you home, saving yourself time and money
  • Be a part of a fast-growing organization with advancement opportunities


About Us

Knowledgehook, a leading educational technology company, empowers over 450,000 teachers and parents to collaboratively support the mathematics learning journey of over 5 million students worldwide. Winner of Google’s Game Changer Award and named Top Disruptor by BNN, its platform analyzes student understanding through engaging assessments, providing real-time personalized solutions to close learning gaps between classroom teaching and at-home learning. Designed by leading numeracy and research experts, Knowledgehook’s Instructional Guidance System is known for reinventing how online technology supports education and educators, while inspiring the problem solvers of tomorrow.


How to apply

Send your resume to tutoringrecruitment@knowledgehook.com with the subject line “Tutor application” along with the subjects and grade levels you are interested in tutoring.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant hybrid remote position at Changemark

Please do not contact the company directly, all CV and resume to Janine@prontos.ca


About the company

Changemark Research and Evaluation offers contract services in mental health, Indigenous health and substance use to healthcare, not-for-profit, and select for profit sector organizations across Canada and the U.S. Changemark values and respects all members of the communities, each of whom individually and collaboratively contribute to transforming care, education, training, and research in this area. Changemark builds collaborative networks across regional health authorities, researchers, educators, and care providers, and other allied care professionals across the province to ensure that research and innovation efficiently reach the people they are intended to serve.

Changemark is a female founded and owned business in its 2nd year of operation. The company is on a growth trajectory and is growing and therefore we are looking to contract an executive assistant to help the founder and the business consultant with several duties. We have a very fun work environment that is casual in dress entire, we work hard and play hard.

We are looking for an Executive Assistant who will provide support to our CEO and team members. We are looking for an experienced EA who is highly organized, can think broadly and takes initiative. We are a company that values open communication and teamwork. Located in Vancouver, B.C., this is a crucial role as you will assist with the development and progress of our projects. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, organized, and be able to problem solve. This position will be a hybrid of in-office and remote work.

Decisions at Changemark are led by our values, it is important that we find a person who is aligned with the values of the company which are justice, equity dignity and inclusion.

Responsibilities

 Generate client invoices from tracking and invoicing platform or manually create when needed in the invoicing system. Month end task.

 Timely upload of contractor invoices and other bills in to DEXT. Month end task.

 Maintain correct and current information in invoicing system.

 Communicate with book keep when there are new vendors, clients, projects, contractors to be set up.

 Assist CEO in responding to client and contractor queries.

 Maintain client database (Excel)

 Maintain contractor database (Excel)

 Assist with managing CEO calendar

 Organize and maintain folder structure in MS Teams

 Assist in gathering onboarding documents from new clients and contractors and follow up for missing documents from current clients and contractors.

 Create contracts for clients and contracts from templates and work with CEO on any revisions.

 Work with the CEO to populate job costing sheet and keep them updated

 Team player



Requirements

 Participate in the company cultural safety and humility training if candidate has not taken equivalent training.

 EA experience (3-5 years’ experience)

 12 hours per week to start with possible increase after probation

 Ideally located in Vancouver (not required)

 Hybrid Remote position may require 1 day of the week at a home office in Kitsilano.

 Experience with calendar management in outlook, MS Teams, Intermediate Excel, invoicing, and customer service

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Business Name: Galewest Services Limited

Business Address: 22 St. Clair Ave. East, Suite 2001, Toronto, ON, Canada. M4T 2S7

 

Job Title: Executive Assistant


Job Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada


Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent


Job Responsibility

 

Summary

 

As Executive Assistant in the Private Family Office, you will be responsible for a wide variety of assignments and confidential tasks on behalf of the Private Family Office, providing support to the Director of Executive Services and other staff members, as required, to enable them to focus on their core activities.

 

Primarily based in the Toronto office, you will undertake the following tasks using exceptional verbal and written skills.

 


Scheduling & Communication


·       Book meetings – business, charitable, personal.

·       Book personal appointments – hair, makeup, spa, medical (attend if required).

·       Book restaurants – business, personal, celebrations.

·       Book activities – Museum visits, Art Galleries, Exhibitions, Cinema, Theatre (greeting / escorting Principals, family / friends on location when required).

·       Populate Outlook and produce daily schedules and monthly calendars. Issue once proofread by the Director of Executive Services.

·       Answer the phone, connect calls and take detailed telephone messages.

·       Send and track letters, parcels and packages for the Director of Executive Services and Principals.

·       Research and coordinate travel as directed.

·       Sort all relevant post and compose a daily Mail List.

·       Produce detailed travel itineraries and book hotel, cars, planes, helicopters, etc.

·       Source items for purchase as directed by the Principals – clothing / accessories, beauty products, books etc.

·       Organize Christmas activities and Gifts.

·       Source and administer gifts and cards as directed by the Principals and Director of Executive Services.

·       Maintain Canada / US friends’ lists and Christmas card lists and ensure CRM database is up to date.

·       Maintain accurate hard and soft copy files on behalf of the Director of Executive Services.

·       Daily printing of all reports and memos for the Principals.

·       Manage invitations & RSVPs (accepts and regrets), meeting requests and personal letters

·       Coordination of Events – assist with planning and execution of special events, event booklet compilation, event stationery (calligraphy – placement cards, menus etc.), and assistance with guest list management.

·       Liaising directly with the Principals including one to one meetings.

·       Some travel to worldwide residences to provide support / cover when required – the family have properties in Canada, Florida and the UK.

 


Administration & Reporting

·       Creation of cost authorization sheets – travel, purchases, charitable donations.

·       Research and creation of informative memos when required – products, locations, people and updates

·       Produce report summaries, submit for proofreading, print, bind, issue.

·       Collate photographic updates and produce booklets.

·       Book staff travel arrangements – flights, accommodation, and transfers.

·       Run errands where required e.g. collect clothing purchases, books, magazines, etc.

·       Setup the residence in advance of the Principals’ arrival with paperwork, magazines, stationery, etc. and tidy the paperwork after the Principals’ departure.

 


Job Requirement

 


Qualifications and Experience

·       The ideal candidate will have experience in working for a high-profile individual and operate comfortably within such an environment.

·       Proven success in a high volume work and shifting priority environment.

·       Advanced proficiency in MS Word, Excel, CRM, Adobe, Power Point, Outlook and the Internet.

·       Previous experience of working in an environment where written and numerical reports are expected on a daily and weekly basis.

·       University degree preferred but not required.

 


Personal Attributes

·       Used to working in a high-pressured environment with a high level of ambiguity.

·       Maintains confidentiality and uses utmost discretion with all matters.

·       Highly organized, focused and with outstanding attention to detail.

·       Remains open to others' ideas, and seeks to proactively build connections with internal and external partners and stakeholders.

·       Excellent time management; ability to establish and maintain superior filing and tracking systems.

·       Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.

·       Strong writing and editing skills.

·       Analytical thinking and strong research skills.

·       Well-presented and able to communicate with high net worth and high profile individuals as and when required.

·       Flexibility with a strong work ethic.

·       Exemplary attitude towards providing first-class customer service.

·       Exceptional ability to follow precise and detailed instructions.

·       Team player.

·       Must have a valid driver's license.

 


Job Salary:

Competitive, according to experience.


Job Details

  • Annual Compensation: $70k - 80k
  • Work Location: Toronto, ON, M4V 2L7
  • Number of Work Hours per Week: 40
  • Language of Work: English
  • Benefits package offered: Health Benefits Plan, Pension Plan, Group RRSP

 

Job Starting Date:

As soon as possible.


How to Apply

If you are interested, please submit your resume to hr@wittington.ca.

title: Executive Assistant I
description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com


Department Overview

The legendary customer experience is paramount to everything we do at TD and to achieve the same, our executives seek out and rely on exceptional administrative and executive assistance support. Our administrative and executive assistants provide a broad range of administrative and general office support to executives at senior levels in the organization. Join our team if you can contribute to maintaining the smooth operations of the business through your strong administration skills.


Job Description

Can you provide dedicated administrative support to executives at the TD Bank Group? As Executive Assistant I, you will provide administrative or general office support for the broader team. Besides that, you will:
  • Provide a high level of administrative support ensuring quality service and professionalism at every customer interaction
  • Manage efficiently in a multi-tasked environment and ensure deadlines are met
  • Apply appropriate due diligence ensuring accuracy in preparing and promptly completing all required supporting documentation (reports, presentations, invoices, communications, tables, charts, files, etc.)
  • Ensure the optimal level of customer service and integrity is provided
  • Provide accurate, organized and efficient administrative support
  • Collect and track data, research information, sort and distribute mail, balance and process expense reports, schedule and organize meetings, and perform other administrative assignments as required
  • Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; raise issues where appropriate
  • Be an effective teammate and flexible in adjusting to changing work priorities
  • Participate fully as a member of the team and contribute to a positive work environment
  • Keep others in the immediate team informed and up-to-date about the status/progress of projects, and all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
  • Report to a Senior Vice President (SVP) and provide senior level dedicated executive administrative support
  • Perform diverse range of tasks that involve a range of complexity with autonomy and some discretion to make decisions within well-defined parameters



Job Requirements
  • High school diploma with over 3 years of relevant experience
  • Hands on knowledge of MS Office Suite and Internet applications
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team with flexibility for effectively coordinating processes and information across related teams
  • A dynamic professional with ability to learn and take initiative on upcoming tasks and projects
  • Strong written and verbal communications to interpret policies and apply standards to complete assignments in a fast-changing environment



Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Corporate Administrator
description:
Full-time Position


Position Overview

Reporting to the Director Education, Design and Delivery, this position is responsible for providing general administrative and project related support for FP Canada Institute and FP Canada Standards Council initiatives and ongoing work. The position is also responsible for providing support for FP Canada Institute and Standards Council committee, contractor and volunteer related functions.


Key Responsibilities

In this role, you will:

  • Volunteer/contractor recruiting and support. Support Institute team in recruiting volunteers and contractors for specific projects, training and access to relevant folders, invoicing for payroll and follow up on deliverables. 
  • Panel Liaison-Reporting to the Executive Director and Head of the FP Canada Standards Council™: Act as a liaison for the Standards Panel and the Projection Assumptions Guideline Committee. As liaison you will be responsible for Panel/Committee recruitment efforts, coordinating Panel and Committee meetings and activities, scheduling meetings, preparing and delivering meeting materials, attending Panel/Committee meetings, taking minutes and conducting necessary follow-up.
  • Meetings. Work with Institute project team members and event manager, as appropriate, to set up, send invites and prepare facilities and materials for meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Research. Support Institute project work in fundamental research and data gathering both within and outside FP Canada.
  • Project Support. Prepare for project status meetings by following up with key members of Institute team for updates on work streams and any required materials for meetings; support project manager in tracking reviews, approvals and key deliverables and following up on issue resolution. Support project management in documenting project related issues and outcomes and disseminating to relevant stakeholders.
  • Continuing Education (CE) support. Support Continuing Education (CE) administration including facilitating the email of CE confirmation letters to certificants, uploading CE credits into Aptify and other administrative tasks as needed.
  • SharePoint. Implement and maintain a structure, directories, folders and naming conventions for Institute documents on SharePoint.
  • Learning Management System (LMS) administration. Provide ongoing support as required with LMS administration.
  • Invoice and expenses. Review and verify Institute invoices and direct them to appropriate staff for approval; verify that Institute staff expenses submitted to Concur are appropriate based on the Travel, Meeting & Other Business Expenses Policy and act as the “Delegate” in Concur for the Head, Institute.  
  • Quality Assurance. Review Institute documents prior to release, including reviews for AODA compliance, internal consistency, formatting, and branding. 


 

Required Qualifications 

The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Post-secondary education in general business discipline desired
  • Five (5) years of project administration/coordination experience, with at least one (1) year of experience with a professional-oversight, education or certification body
  • Experience dealing with the public, volunteers or in customer service
  • Knowledge of financial services industry is an asset
  • Experience with MS Office Suite software programs
  • Experience with LMS administration (asset)


Competencies

The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Team player with a professional demeanor and positive supportive nature
  • Experience working with management
  • Able to deal professionally and calmly with members of the public at all times
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with the organization
  • Strong teamwork and collaboration skills
  • Takes ownership and initiative to get things done
  • Ability to coordinate work on multiple ongoing large-scale projects


About FP Canada

A national professional body working in the public interest, FP Canada is dedicated to championing better financial wellness for all Canadians by leading the advancement of professional financial planning in Canada. FP Canada is the leading certification and enforcement body for professional financial planners in Canada. There are about 17,000 CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER® professionals and about 1,900 QUALIFIED ASSOCIATE FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professionals, who meet FP Canada’s rigorous professional and ethical standards. Learn more at FPCanada.ca.


At a time when society is facing unprecedented technological disruption in all walks of life, as well as the impact of COVID-19 on personal and business finances, Canadians have a greater need than ever for personalized financial planning advice with a human touch.


Working with FP Canada

We’re FP Canada, a team of passionate and progressive professionals. FP Canada employs over 55 people, and our office is located in downtown Toronto. This is a full-time permanent position working 5 days]per week, during core business hours, with some flexibility required.


We are committed to wellness and a healthy work environment for our employees. You will earn a highly competitive annual salary, generous paid vacation and personal time, and you will enjoy our comprehensive employee benefits, RRSP matching program, professional development opportunities, flexible work arrangements and regular social events. 


We are service-oriented, principled, and driven to make a societal impact, and we strive for and demand excellence, integrity, and respect from each other as well as our external stakeholders. We value collaboration and flexibility, and together have created a collegial and positive work environment. 


Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity

FP Canada values inclusion and diversity, and different perspectives and experiences; and we are committed to working towards an inclusive and diverse organization, reflective of Canada’s population. We encourage candidates who identify in traditionally underrepresented communities (women, racialized persons, indigenous persons, LGBTQ2S+ and persons with disabilities) to apply.


Our Commitment to Accessibility

FP Canada is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). FP Canada will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Human Resources Department at careers@fpcanada.ca.


How to apply

To apply, please submit your application to careers@fpcanada.ca and note the position title in the subject line. Applications will be accepted until May 20, 2022.


We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Receptionist

Full-time Position


Position Overview

Reporting to the Director Education, Design and Delivery, this position is responsible for providing general administrative and project related support for FP Canada Institute and FP Canada Standards Council initiatives and ongoing work. The position is also responsible for providing support for FP Canada Institute and Standards Council committee, contractor and volunteer related functions.

title: Adjoint administratif
description: Nous recherchons activement, un(e) adjoint(e) administratif(ive) pour coordonner l'agenda des installations à effectuer. Compléter la boucle à la fin de opérations. Travailler sur les soumissions des projets pancanadien sous ma direction et autres tâches connexes.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
Fifth Ave Spa & Nails is seeking a Spa Front Desk Receptionist. This position is responsible for the reception area of the spa. It includes greeting guests, answering phones, assisting with questions regarding spa services and products, booking all appointments, checking the guest into the computer system upon arrival and charging for services performed.

Job Duties Include
  • Warmly greets each member and ensures a polished experience.
  • Schedules spa treatments with spa software and communicates with members in person, over the phone and via e-mail.
  • Provides spa tours to members and their guests and reports any health information to the spa technicians.
  • Provides light locker room upkeep. Upkeep with guest lockers and restocking locker room linens
  • Follows spa facility opening and closing procedures.
  • Reports any incident or accident to the Spa Manager.
  • Becomes knowledgeable about the facility and its amenities to effectively communicate with members and guests.
  • Goes the extra mile for members and anticipates member needs.
  • Informs Spa Manager of any member, guest, or facility issues.
  • Additional duties as assigned.
Qualifications
  • High School diploma minimum.
  • Spa and/or luxury hospitality experience preferred but not required.
  • Excellent communication, customer service skills, and work ethic.
  • Efficient, organized, and able to handle a variety of duties simultaneously.
  • Professional manner and appearance.
  • Excellent verbal and written skills.
  • Energetic, enthusiastic, and motivational.
  • Strong team player.
  • Ability to lift 25 lbs.
Fifth Ave Spa & Nails is a team of enthusiastically-empowered and loyal hospitality experts with the combined passion of flawlessly executing the creation of family time and world class conventions. Many of our associates have been given the tools to be a success and have built careers. Sixty-one percent of our leadership team has been promoted into their roles. As an employer-of-choice, we’ve held on to A-players that seek responsibility and want to learn.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Job duties and responsibilities will include:

  • supply management
  • purchase order tracking and filing
  • tracking budget expenses
  • tracking company data and contacts
  • providing general administrative support, such as by organizing meetings and schedules
  • managing process documentation
  • tracking inventory of office and shop supplies
  • creating work orders

Experience:

  • 2+ years of relevant experience is preferred
  • related post secondary education is required


Qualifications

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

title: Office Administrator
description:
Review, evaluate and implement new administrative procedures, Establish work priorities and ensure procedures are followed and deadlines are met, Carry out administrative activities of establishment, Administer policies and procedures related to the release of records in processing requests under government access to information and privacy legislation, Co-ordinate and plan for office services such as accommodation, relocation, equipment, supplies, forms, disposal of assets, parking, maintenance and security services, Assist in the preparation of operating budget and maintain inventory and budgetary controls, Assemble data and prepare periodic and special reports, manuals and correspondence, Oversee and co-ordinate office administrative procedures

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$25.50 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • administrative assistant: 1 year (preferred)

title: Personal Assistant
description:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for a range of activities which will assist this organization's leadership. In this position, you should feel comfortable coordinating calendar appointments, managing communications, and planning events, as necessary. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Managing work and personal diaries/schedules.
  • Organizing meetings and appointments
  • Schedule travel
  • Book and arrange travel, transportation, and accommodation for both private and work trips.
  • Organize events/conferences.
  • Remind the manager of important tasks, deadlines, and events both at work and personal matters.
  • Typing, compiling, and preparing reports, presentations, and correspondence.
  • Managing databases and filing systems.
  • Liaising with staff, suppliers, clients as well as family members.
  •  Collating and filing expenses.
  • Conducting research on behalf of the manager.
  • Organizing the manager’s personal commitments including travel, events, and other personal-related tasks. 
  • Accompanying the manager on work and family trips (where necessary).
  • Book family holidays, restaurants,s or social activities.
  • Personal shopping on behalf of the manager.


Qualifications

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.
  • A calm and professional manner
  • Excellent administration and computer skills.
  • Flexible and adaptable approach to work.
  • The ability to use your own initiative
  • Tact and discretion for dealing with confidential information.
  • The ability not to flap in a stressful situation.
  • Knowledge of Microsofts office software.
  • Ability to research and find information for your company.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Ucluelet Harbour Seafoods, a division of Pacific Seafood, one of the leading seafood Processing Companies in North America, with operations in Western Canada as well as the United States, has an opening for the Full Time permanent position of Administrative Assistant for its operation in Ucluelet, BC.

Reporting to the Personnel Coordinator, the Administrative Assistant will be part of a progressive and dynamic Admin team responsible for providing support to the various admin functions associated with the daily activities of the Plant Operation.

title: Front Desk Clerk
company: Sheraton Gateway Hotel In Toronto International Airport
description:
Posting Date Apr 14, 2022

Job Number 22060529

Job Category Rooms & Guest Services Operations

Location Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Toronto International Airport, Terminal 3, Toronto AMF, P.O. Box 3000, Toronto, ONT, Canada VIEW ON MAP

Brand Sheraton Hotels & Resorts

Schedule Full-Time

Relocation? N

Position Type Non-Management

Located Remotely? N

When you join the Sheraton family, you become a member of its global community. We’ve been a place to gather and connect since 1937. At Sheraton, associates create a sense of belonging in more than 400 communities around the world. We welcome guests through engaging experiences and thoughtful service. If you’re a team player who is excited to deliver a meaningful guest experiences, we encourage you to explore your next career opportunity with Sheraton.

Job Summary

Process all guest check-ins by confirming reservations, assigning room, and issuing and activating room key. Process all payment types such as room charges, cash, checks, debit, or credit. Process all check-outs including resolving any late and disputed charges. Answer, record, and process all guest calls, messages, requests, questions, or concerns. Coordinate with Housekeeping to track readiness of rooms for check-in. Communicate parking procedures to guests/visitors and dispatch bell staff or valet staff as needed. Supply guests with directions and information regarding property and local areas of interest. Run daily reports (number of arrivals, departures), identify any special requests, and check reports for accuracy. Complete designated cashier and closing reports in the computer system. Cash guests' personal checks and traveler's checks. Count bank at the beginning and end of shift. Balance and drop receipts according to Accounting specifications.

Follow all company safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; assist individuals with disabilities; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

At Marriott, we are committed to putting our associates first and their health and safety are our highest priorities. This position requires associates to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per current Public Health Agency of Canada standards or approved for a Human Rights accommodation.

Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.

Notification to Applicants: Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Toronto International Airport takes seriously its obligations under provincial human rights and accessibility legislation (such as the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, the Accessibility for Manitobans Act, and Nova Scotia Accessibility Act). We are happy to provide accommodations to job applicants needing assistance. If you require an accommodation in relation to this job posting, our online application or an interview, please call 905-366-5227 or email CanadaApplicationAccommodation@marriott.com and a member of our Human Resources team will respond to your request. Please note that this phone number and email are only for those individuals who would like to request an accessibility accommodation as part of the recruiting process.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Receptionist
description:
Mosaic is a leading North American Integrated Agency, specializing in Experiential Marketing, Sales and Merchandising, and Interactive. At Mosaic, we are never satisfied with the status quo and are in constant search for new ideas and new ways to help our clients build their brands, amidst the evolving dynamic of empowered consumers leveraging new technologies.

What are we looking for?

Mosaic is currently looking for a Full-Time Receptionist to join our team based out of our Head Office location.

What will you do?

As a receptionist, you will ensure smooth, secure operation of the Head Office as it relates to working environment, equipment and office practices. To deliver a positive first impression which reflects Mosaic’s values/culture to all visitors as well as new employees. Provide a primary point of contact and expertise for arriving visitors and residents of our facility.

Responsibilities:

Reception
  • Greet and manage all arrivals & departures from the office with a high degree of professionalism and awareness
  • Receipt and distribution of Canada Post mail and faxes

Other
  • Maintain Boardroom Calendars
  • Maintain Storage room to standard
  • Health and Safety awareness
  • Follow Facility Process Checklist
  • Manage building Access Cards and Parking Badges
  • Place bi-weekly office supplies order and process monthly invoice reconciliation
  • Maintain AV / Projector bookings
  • Support with meeting/training catering requests
  • Support Shipping & Receiving as needed
  • Support in maintenance of office equipment, including repair requests with supplier
  • Participate in identifying and setting up process improvements
  • Participate in researching and documenting policy and process changes
  • Maintain standards for overall reception practices
  • Maintain facility supplies replenishment
  • Maintain cleanliness standards and order for all office facilities
  • Other duties assigned by Office Manager from time to time
  • Post-secondary education or 1-2 years of related experience
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills
  • Proficient user of Microsoft Office & interest in other software tools
  • Significant strength in the area of organization and time management
  • Self-motivated to perform a broad variety of organizational and administrative tasks within a day and exhibit initiative to do what is necessary to produce quality results

To Apply: Please send resumes to Logan.Abroms@mosaic.com

Why Mosaic?

Consistently voted one of the best places to work, Mosaic North America gives you the opportunity to work with the world’s most beloved brands that you know and use every day. Every employee is given the keys to charter new ground as they collectively live in the moment of building experiences together. We are a cast of diverse, yet like-minded individuals and we believe in taking risks, creating shared experiences not just for our clients, but for each other to guarantee we’re making the next chapter of everyone’s story the most memorable one yet.

DISCLAIMER: Acosta/ Mosaic North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Mosaic reserves the right to modify all or part of any job descriptions at its discretion in order to meet and or exceed the needs of the business.

We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs, to the extent required by law

By submitting your application you agree with and accept the Acosta Privacy Statement and Terms of Conditions.

US: http://acosta.jobs/privacy-policy-us/

Canada: http://acosta.jobs/privacy-policy-ca/

Company

Corporate - Mosaic Canada

Primary Location

CA-ON-Toronto

Work Locations

Toronto Corporate Office

Job

Administrative

Schedule

Full-time

Job Type

Standard

Shift

Day Job

title: Executive Assistant I- EN
description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

The legendary customer experience is paramount to everything we do at TD and to achieve the same, our executives seek out and rely on exceptional administrative and executive assistance support. Our administrative and executive assistants provide a broad range of administrative and general office support to executives at senior levels in the organization. Join our team if you can contribute to maintaining the smooth operations of the business through your strong administration skills.

Job Description

Can you provide dedicated administrative support to executives at the TD Bank Group? As Executive Assistant I, you will provide administrative or general office support for the broader team. Besides that, you will:
  • Provide a high level of administrative support ensuring quality service and professionalism at every customer interaction
  • Manage efficiently in a multi-tasked environment and ensure deadlines are met
  • Apply appropriate due diligence ensuring accuracy in preparing and promptly completing all required supporting documentation (reports, presentations, invoices, communications, tables, charts, files, etc.)
  • Ensure the optimal level of customer service and integrity is provided
  • Provide accurate, organized and efficient administrative support
  • Collect and track data, research information, sort and distribute mail, balance and process expense reports, schedule and organize meetings, and perform other administrative assignments as required
  • Consistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; raise issues where appropriate
  • Be an effective teammate and flexible in adjusting to changing work priorities
  • Participate fully as a member of the team and contribute to a positive work environment
  • Keep others in the immediate team informed and up-to-date about the status/progress of projects, and all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
  • Report to a Senior Vice President (SVP) and provide senior level dedicated executive administrative support
  • Perform diverse range of tasks that involve a range of complexity with autonomy and some discretion to make decisions within well-defined parameters
Job Requirements
  • High school diploma with over 3 years of relevant experience
  • Hands on knowledge of MS Office Suite and Internet applications
  • Able to work independently as well as part of a team with flexibility for effectively coordinating processes and information across related teams
  • A dynamic professional with ability to learn and take initiative on upcoming tasks and projects
  • Strong written and verbal communications to interpret policies and apply standards to complete assignments in a fast-changing environment
Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Recepcionista
description:
¡Las primeras impresiones son todo! Como Recepcionista, cuidará de los huéspedes desde el momento en que llegan hasta su partida, asegurándose de que tengan una experiencia memorable con nosotros.

Lo Que Hay Para Usted
  • En 3-4 puntos, muestre los beneficios y ventajas de trabajar en el hotel
  • Tarjeta de Beneficios para colaboradores que ofrece tarifas con descuento en Accor en todo el mundo
  • Programas de aprendizaje a través de nuestras Academias
  • Oportunidad para desarrollar su talento y crecer dentro de su hotel y en todo el mundo!
  • Capacidad para hacer diferencia en la comunidad local a través de nuestras actividades de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa, como Planet 21
Lo Que Hará
  • Saludar, registrarse, responder a solicitudes y liquidar cuentas mientras brinda un servicio excepcional
  • Tome la iniciativa de agregar una experiencia personalizada
  • Promueva con orgullo las instalaciones del hotel, buscando oportunidades para mejorar la estadía de un huésped a través de la venta
Su Experiencia y Habilidades Incluyen
  • La personalidad enfocada en el servicio es esencial; la experiencia es un diferencial
  • Experiencia previa con Opera o un sistema relacionado
  • Fluidez en inglés; los idiomas adicionales son una ventaja
Su Equipo y Ambiente De Trabajo
  • En 1-2 oraciones, comente el ambiente del equipo, del hotel o de la oficina de una manera que refleje la cultura

Nota: esta descripción podrá sufrir alteraciones incluyendo situaciones locales, de legislación y documentaciones oficiales de trabajo

Nuestro Compromiso Con La Diversidad & Inclusión

Somos una empresa inclusiva y nuestra ambición es atraer, reclutar y promover talentos diversos.

¿Por qué trabajar para Accor?

Somos mucho más que un líder mundial. Te damos la bienvenida tal como eres y puedes encontrar un trabajo una marca que coincida con tu personalidad.

Te apoyamos para que crezcas y aprendas cada día, asegurándonos de que el trabajo le dé propósito a tu vida, para que durante tu viaje con nosotros, puedas seguir exporando las posibilidades ilimitadas de Accor.

Al unirte a Accor, cada capítulo de tu historia es suyo para escribir y juntos podemos imaginar la hospitallidad del mañana. Descubre la vida que te espera en Accor, visita https://careers.accor.com/

¡Haz lo que amas, cuida el mundo, atrévete a desafiar el status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: Administrative Assistant Intern
description:
￼

Administrative Assistant Guide - Official Document

Updated: October-2021

PART A. General Description

The administrative assistant at Avolta is responsible for the creation and maintenance of a smooth office workflow environment. This includes making sure that all files are organized, all emails and inquiries are responded to promptly, and that all tasks assigned by the executive assistant(s) are completed accurately and on-time.

PART B. Main Responsibilities

Schedule and confirm appointments/meetings.

Fulfill tasks assigned by the executive assistant and management.

Respond to telephone, in-person, and email inquiries.

Provide senior management with prompt assistance.

Keep all Google Drive files neat and organized.

Type letters, reports, and other documents.

Oversee and review office procedures.

Supervise office support staff.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are now hiring a self-motivated, energetic individual to fill our multi-functional Administrative Assistant position! We are one of the leading full-service marketing & client acquisition firms in the Calgary area, and we specialize in marketing & sales for a variety of clients through targeted campaigns. We have recently expanded our firm, adding several different divisions, and suddenly have an opening for an Administrative Assistant that must be filled right away!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Recruiting & Onboarding:
  • High-volume recruiting to fill customer service, community outreach, and sales positions
  • Scheduling Training in the Calendar System
  • Creating Offer Letters per Company
  • Attaching Offer Letter PDF to Orientation Email per Company
  • Creating New Employee Digital Folder per Company
  • Bringing New Start on Board via Calendar System
  • Sending Digital Documents per Company
  • Administering New Start Paperwork and Scanning IDs
    • Cross checking paperwork
    • Administering Coffee Card Perk Ticket
  • Download Background Check PDF & Upload to Digital File
  • Taking and Uploading a Badge Photo
  • Submitting Direct Deposits
  • Filing Physical Paperwork
  • Printing Badges
  • Off-boarding
  • Wednesday Payroll Management - Providing i9 documentation per first payroll week
  • Ad Hoc Tasks as requested by Management (via Worksheet)
    • Social Media Photos
    • Leadership Library Stock
    • Daily Reports Stock
    • Weekly Leadership Tracker
    • Weekly Tablet Audits
    • Reporting
    • Personal Development Roster
Reception:
  • Health and Safety Management
    • In Person Temperature Checks and Sign in Sheet
    • Proof of Vaccination Register Management
  • In Person Appointment Confirmations
  • In Person Appointment Check Ins
  • Zoom Appointment Check-Ins
  • Zoom Appointment Troubleshooting (SMS and Phone Assistance)
  • Communicating all Appointment Check Ins via Slack
  • Stocking Forms

title: Reception and Client Services Attendant for Rodeo BLVD
description:
Under the supervision of the Audio Executive Producer, the role of the reception and customer service attendant is to establish professional contact with customers and to ensure that customer service meets the standards of quality of BLVD and contribute positively to customer loyalty. Also, the person must ensure that common areas are kept clean and tidy and that customers feel good.

Main Responsibilities

  • Opening of the studios in the morning (alarm system, doors, rooms, coffee machines, etc.);

  • Design a menu and prepare lunches;

  • Serve lunch and drinks: managing orders, picking them up and serving them;

  • Make sure to keep the place clean and suitable;

  • Collaborate with the management committee to establish standards relating to customer service and services that could be offered to customers;

  • Collaborate with the management committee to plan and manage client and employee events;

  • Advise team members as needed regarding services that could be offered to clients;

  • Collaborate with the management committee to establish the department's operations budget, including the food budget;

  • Make an inventory of the items needed for future needs;

  • Be available as needed to assist with customer service for VFX Advertising teams;

  • Perform any other related tasks to support the receptionist: answer the phone and relay messages, perform certain administrative tasks (orders, food inventory and budget, management of credit card bills, etc.).



Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position and/or in customer service is an important asset;  
  • Have a strong interest in cooking;
  • Proficiency in spoken and written French and functional English;
  • Great sense of autonomy, initiative and resourcefulness;
  • Professionalism: be able to establish and maintain a good relationship with clients;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate easily with various partners and stakeholders;
  • Great sense of organization and excellent priority management;
  • Attention to detail and great operational rigor;
  • Great ability to work under pressure in a fast past environment

Additional Information

  • Permanent full-time position (40 hours per week);
  • Hours: Daytime - Monday to Friday - 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.;
  • Offices located in Old Montreal (308 Place d'Youville, Montreal, QC, H2Y 2B6);
  • Additional holidays during the holiday season;
  • Comprehensive group insurance;
  • Dialogue platform: access to a virtual health care program.
  • EAP: employee assistance program.
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution;
  • And much more!

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: COVID Administrator
description:
Altis Recruitment is looking for a candidate to work on-site throughout the Woodstock area as Covid Administrator. This role includes interacting with employees on client work sites, answering questions about testing, some data entry, and other administrative support. Candidates must have a valid G drivers license, reliable access to a car, and be able to start right away.


This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to gain administrative experience, assist with COVID preventative initiatives.


Roles and Responsibilities

  • Work with a team to answer questions about the self-testing for employees, data entry for each shift, and other administrative requirements

Qualifications and Experience

  • Good communication and customer service skills
  • Must be comfortable working on-site at various client locations
  • Day shifts start BETWEEN 5:30AM AND 11:30AM, and are for 8 hours each
  • Afternoon shifts start BETWEEN 3:45PM AND 5:45PM, and are for 8 hours each
  • Need to have availability to work five shifts a week, Monday - Friday, with some weekends if required

Must have:

  • Must have valid G drivers license and reliable access to a car


Apply today!

title: Réceptionniste
description:
Nous sommes une étude de notaires dynamique, définitivement pas “beige”, d’envergure humaine, avec une clientèle sympathique !


Nous œuvrons principalement en droit de la personne, en droit successoral, ainsi qu’en droit familial.


Nous sommes à la recherche de la perle rare pour combler un poste de réceptionniste.


Tâches

  • Répondre aux appels téléphoniques ;
  • Informer les clients sur les différents services ;
  • Accueillir les clients à l’étude ;
  • Préparer la correspondance aux clients et faire les copies d’actes notariés ;
  • Réceptionner le courrier ;
  • Préparer les envois par messager ;
  • Commander les fournitures du bureau ;
  • Assister l’adjointe juridique.


Compétences requises

  • 1 an d’expérience en service à la clientèle ;
  • Solides habiletés interpersonnelles et grand sens du service client ;
  • Français impeccable et anglais courant.


Notre candidat(e) idéal(e)

  • Est champion(ne) du monde en service à la clientèle ;
  • Est spécialiste du multitâche ;
  • Est double médaillé(e) de la débrouillardise ;
  • Est curieux(se) et apprend vite (et bien).


Rémunération

A discuter selon expérience


Nous offrons

  • Un environnement de travail humain ;
  • Les vendredis de congé ;
  • Un congé pendant la période des fêtes (environ 2 semaines), en plus des congés usuels ;
  • Beaucoup de café et de bonne humeur ;
  • Un bureau fraichement construit et aménagé ;
  • Une possibilité d’avancement au sein de l’étude.


L’horaire de travail est du lundi au jeudi, de 9h à 17h.


www.alineanotaires.com

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Van-Con Enterprises is hiring!

The Administrative Assistant will be tasked with providing a wide range of administrative and office support services, as well as be responsible for assisting operations staff to fulfill their responsibilities and company goals. Applicant must have strong organizational, communication, and time management skills. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite and Saga preferred but not required.

Please send resume and cover letter to: admin@van-con.ca

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Clerk - Proficient
description:
Position Title: Office Clerk - Proficient

Position Duration: 3+ Months

Position Location: Toronto, ON 


Position Purpose:

Perform clerical duties that are assigned in accordance with the office procedures of the work site and may include a combination of answering phone calls, bookkeeping, word processing, office machine operation, and filing, etc.

Areas of work might be accounting, collection, filing, general office, inventory, mail, payroll, statistical or word processing.

Key Accountabilities:

- Communicate with customers, employees, and other individuals to answer questions, disseminate or explain information, and address complaints

- Answer telephones, direct calls and take messages

- Compile, copy, sort, and file records of office activities, business transactions and other activities

- Compute, record and proofread data and other information, such as records or reports

- Maintain and update filing, inventory, mailing, and database systems

Knowledge & Experience:

Must-have

- 1-4 years administrative/customer service related experience

Nice-to-have:

- Industry experience and business function knowledge

Skills & Competencies:

- Verbal and written communication, multi-tasking, customer service and interpersonal skills

- Ability to work independently and manage ones time

- Ability to keep information organized and confidential

- Advanced user of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Attributes:

- Information seeking

- Listening, understanding and responding

- Customer service/Service Partner Orientation

title: Customer Services Assistant Summer Student (2 positions) - Urgent Hiring
description:
We are hiring a remarkable Customer Services Assistant Summer Student (2 positions) to join our stellar team at City of Markham in Markham, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Customer Services Assistant Summer Student (2 positions) is an amazing opportunity to develop relevant skills.

If you are strong in problem-solving, leadership and have the right mindset for the job, then apply for the position of Customer Services Assistant Summer Student (2 positions) at City of Markham today!

The City of Markham, an award-winning municipality with more than 355,000 residents, is Canada’s high-tech capital and most diverse community, enjoying a rich heritage, outstanding community planning and services, and a vibrant local economy. Committed to being a model of public service excellence, with a workforce that is representative of the population we serve, we are looking for people who share our values and are champions of innovative practices. Diversity is one of Markham’s strategic priorities, and we strive to develop and maintain an environment that is inclusive and creates a sense of belonging for all.

We are pleased to be named one of Canada's Best Employers for 2022 and the best City employer by Forbes for the second consecutive year. The City of Markham is ranked in the top two for Government Services and 15th among the 300 employers on the list, advancing from 18th place in 2021.

Applications are being accepted for the above temporary full time Summer Student position in the Legislative Services Department, Corporate Services Commission. Please apply on-line at www.markham.ca/careers by May 15, 2022.

Job Summary

Enthusiastic and team-oriented, the Summer Customer Services Assistant provides back-up to regular full-time staff in efficient customer service and administrative support to the Clerk’s Office, Legislative Services Department. Responsibilities include: providing customer service at the Clerk’s Office counter; responding to internal and external telephone inquires and emails; booking the wedding chapel and wedding room (once it is open); processing marriage licences; processing filming permit requests; assisting with print/mail services; assisting with administrative support for elections, claims and secretariat services; and performing general office duties as assigned.

Responsibilities
  • Respond to customer inquiries at the counter, by telephone, and e-mail;
  • Review and process marriage licence applications for signature by Clerk’s Department Staff;
  • Review process and issue wedding photo permits in accordance with established procedures;
  • Provide re-direction to the public as to the department responsible for their queries/concerns;
  • Assist in coordination the booking of Civic Centre meeting rooms (once open) for the internal and the Wedding Chapel in accordance with established procedures;
  • Assist with booking appointments for Commissioner of Oath
  • Assisting with print/mail services, including internal and external mail delivery, assistance with production of print materials;
  • Assisting with administrative support for elections, claims, and secretariat services including the preparation of documents and files; and
  • Other administrative tasks, as assigned.
Skills & Abilities
  • Previous customer service experience and interest in civil services preferred
  • Good verbal and written communications skills
  • Proficiency with MS Office (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, MS PowerPoint)
  • Valid Ontario G Driver's Licence required with a satisfactory drivers abstract (0 demerit points, no more than 1 moving violation and no more than 1 non-moving violation)
  • College or University Student Preferred
NOTE: This position is an on-site position (101 Town Centre Blvd) and is not available for remote work.

The City of Markham is committed to inclusive, accessible, and barrier free employment practices and to creating a workplace that reflects and supports the diversity of the community we serve. Please let us know if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to ensure a barrier free hiring process.

The City of Markham has established a mandatory vaccination requirement for staff related to the COVID-19 pandemic. As a result, should you be a successful candidate for a position with the City of Markham you will be required to provide proof of full vaccination upon a conditional offer of employment. Should you require accommodation in accordance with the Human Rights policy with respect to your vaccine status, you will be required to disclose that at the time of conditional offer so that an accommodation can be developed prior to your start date.

We thank all applicants who have applied. However, only those applications selected for an interview will be contacted.

Company Benefits
  • Excellent benefits
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Competitive salary
  • Remote Work opportunity
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Receptionist
description:
Who We Are

 Description & Requirements

lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations across North America, Australia and New Zealand, Europe, and Asia. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.

Core Responsibilities
  • Welcome and assist both guests, employees and vendors to the building
  • Maintain the cleanliness and order of the front desk and guest lounge area
  • Screen and direct incoming calls and emails as required
  • Order stationery supplies and maintain organization in all supply rooms
  • Manage security access passes for employees, vendors and guests
  • Update and publish all public building information and signage (internal comms site, vendor contacts, meeting room index, etc.)
  • Administer bookings for the yoga studio, meditation room and other office spaces when needed
  • Manage all office services requests, to be allocated to facilities team when needed; including but not limited to parking, security access, booking resources, supply inquiries and office feedback
  • Provide Facilities Workplace Specialist support when needed
  • Maintain building emergency and health & safety processes and procedures
The Finer Print
  • Excellent team player and ability to work independently
  • Upbeat, optimistic, passionate, friendly and authentic
  • Responsible and dependable
  • Proactive and solution-oriented
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal and written
  • Extraordinary guest service, organizational and time management skills
  • Computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite
Our Must Haves
  • Proven work ethic with utmost integrity
  • Passionate, empathetic, approachable and fun!
  • Desire to excel and spread the lululemon culture - locally and globally
  • Actively live and breathe the lululemon culture and lifestyle
  • Self-awareness, with desire for constant self-improvement (goal-oriented)
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and an egoless nature
