title: Réceptionniste et préposé(e) aux installations/Receptionist & Facilities Assistant
description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.

Qui sommes-nous?

En tant qu’experts des technologies de paiement, nous enrichissons le Commerce de notre expertise et de notre perspective mondiale. Axés sur l’innovation, nous répondons aux besoins de nos clients. De plus, nous nous engageons à offrir un Service exemplaire à nos employés, à nos clients et à nos communautés.

Grâce à notre équipe mondiale d’environ 11 000 employés, nos clients obtiennent des résultats exceptionnels. Notre passion pour la réussite fait que nous nous démarquons de la concurrence depuis des années. Joignez-vous à nous afin de laisser votre trace dans le monde des technologies de paiement de demain.

Nos valeurs:

Nos gens sont notre priorité - Partenaire de choix - Approche simplifiée en affaires - Responsabilité personnelle - Exécution cohérente et en temps opportun.

Pourquoi travailler chez Global Payments?

Nous offrons de réelles opportunités de grandir professionnellement et croyons à un environnement de travail collaboratif, harmonieux et amical avec un code vestimentaire décontracté.

Notre programme d'avantages sociaux compétitifs disponible après 30 jours à l’emploi comprend des éléments tels que: assurance santé, assurance invalidité de courte et longue durée, assurance vie, programmes d'épargne retraite, programme d'achat d’actions des employés, programme d'aide aux employés, travail flexible, programme de remboursement des frais de scolarité, tarifs corporatifs pour centre de conditionnement physique, possibilités de bénévolat ... et plus encore!

Rôle:

Le titulaire du poste de réceptionniste et préposé aux installations offre une assistance administrative à travers un large éventail de missions à l'appui du département des installations et de l'entreprise tout en planifiant et en hiérarchisant les horaires et les calendriers. Il crée également des outils de déménagement pour les nouvelles embauches et les transferts. Il peut générer des bons de commande, des bons de travail, des tickets de changement, des factures, des notes de frais et suivre les dépenses. Il vérifie l'équipement pour les dommages ou les réparations nécessaires et fait de le suivi de la complétion des réparations. Il assiste les chefs de projet ayant des besoins particuliers ou organise des réunions, des formations, etc. Il peut être demandé à assister ou diriger divers projets de recherche et fournir des résultats à la direction.

Responsabilités Principales:
  • Accueillir les visiteurs et leur demander de s'inscrire au journal des visiteurs.
  • Contacter les employés pour leur faire savoir que leurs visiteurs sont arrivés sur place.
  • Rappeler au personnel d'utiliser correctement ses cartes d'accès.
  • Créer des laissez-passer de visiteur
  • Fournir aux employés des laissez-passer temporaires et les enregistrer dans le journal de bord. Gardez une trace de ceux qui ont été distribués et récupérez-les des employés à la fin de la journée ou à la première heure le lendemain matin.
  • Faire le suivi des fournitures de bureau pour la salle du courrier.
  • Accepter et expédier les colis des coursiers locaux.
  • Coordonner avec le propriétaire concernant les permis d'accès des fournisseurs, les cartes d'accès au bâtiment et l' accès au stationnement, les nettoyants et autres articles liés aux installations
  • Coordonner avec les fournisseurs liés aux installations, y compris les nettoyeurs, les distributeurs automatiques et autres, en s'assurant que les locaux sont entretenus, équipés et entretenus selon les normes de l'entreprise
  • Être le point de contact pour la sécurité physique de l'espace.
  • Effectuer des audits de sécurité physique pour s'assurer que les portes et l'équipement d'enregistrement sont opérationnels.
  • Responsable de l' exploitation du standard téléphonique
  • Responsable de la préparation des postaux et de messagerie colis pour la livraison et la réception
  • Recevoir, trier et distribuer tous les colis du transporteur selon la destination et le destinataire.
  • Superviser tous les copieurs et fournitures pour le bureau.

Qualifications Requises:
  • Expérience de 2+ années en service la clientèle ou poste de soutien administratif dans un environnement de bureau professionnel
  • Bilinguisme (Français/Anglais) - Capacité à communiquer efficacement verbalement et par correspondance écrite
  • Bonnes connaissances de la sécurité des installations, du fonctionnement du courrier et des centres de fonctions et opérations standards
  • Connaissance de Windows, Word, Office et Outlook pour venir en aide à la réalisation de projets divers
  • Expérience dans un environnement de sécurité d'entreprise
  • Être flexible, responsable, professionnel et organisé
  • Faire part d’Initiatives pour accomplir les tâches quotidiennes avec peu de supervision
  • Être autonome et bien savoir gérer ses priorités

L’utilisation du masculin a pour unique but d’alléger le texte. Nous remercions sincèrement tous les postulants. Nous contacterons seulement ceux qui seront choisis pour une entrevue.

Global Payments est un employeur qui favorise l’égalité des chances. Nous valorisons la diversité et l’inclusion et assurons des opportunités égales à tous nos employés et postulants sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l’origine, l’état civil, l’orientation sexuelle, l’identité ou l’expression de genre, le handicap physique ou mental ou tout autre principe de base protégé par la loi et nous sommes heureux de fournir aux membres de notre équipe un environnement de travail sain et agréable.

Who are we?

Global Payments Inc. is a leading worldwide provider of payment technology services that delivers innovative solutions driven by customer needs globally. Our technologies, partnerships and employee expertise enable us to provide a broad range of products and services that allow our customers to accept all payment types across a variety of distribution channels in many markets around the world.

Our worldwide team of approximately 11,000 is helping customers achieve amazing results. It’s our passion for success that has led to years of out-performing the competition. Join us and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.

Our Values:

Our people come first - Being the partner of choice - Making it easy to do business with us - Being personally accountable - Ensuring a timely and consistent execution.

Why work for Global Payments?

Corporate citizenship is fundamental to our values. We offer real opportunities to grow professionally and believe in a collaborative, friendly work environment with a relaxed, casual dress code.

We offer competitive benefits such as health insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term disability coverage, life insurance plans, retirement savings programs, employee stock purchase program, employee assistance program, flexible working, tuition reimbursement program, gym membership corporate rates , volunteering opportunities ... and more!

Role:

The Receptionist and facilities assistant provides skilled administrative assistance through a broad range of assignments in support of the facilities department and the company while planning and prioritizing schedules and calendars. They also create move tools for new hires and transfers. They may generate purchase orders, work orders, change tickets, invoices, expense reports, and track expenses. They check equipment for damages or needed repairs and tracks repair completion. They assist project managers with special needs or set ups for meetings, trainings, etc. They serve as primary contact or back up contact to primary contacts for specifically assigned tasks within facilities. They may assist or head various research projects and provide results to management.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Greet visitors and have them sign into the visitor log book. Contact employees to let them know their visitors have arrived onsite.
  • Remind staff to use their access cards correctly.
  • Create visitor passes
  • Provide employees with temporary passes and log them into the log book. Keep track of those handed out and get them back from employees at the end of the day or first thing the next morning.
  • Keep track of office supplies for the mailroom..
  • Accept and ship packages from local couriers.
  • Coordinate with landlord regarding vendor access permits, building access cards and parking access, cleaners and other facility related items
  • Coordinate with facility related vendors including cleaners, vending machine and others ensuring the premises is serviced, equipped and maintained to Corporate standards
  • Be the onsite point of contact for physical security of the space.
  • Conduct physical security audits to ensure doors and recording equipment are operational.
  • Responsible for phone switchboard operation
  • Responsible for preparation of mail and courier packages for delivery and receipt
  • Receive, sort and distribute all carrier packages according to destination and recipient.
  • Oversee all copiers and supplies for the office.

Required Qualifications:
  • 2+ years experience in customer service or administrative support position in a professional office environment
  • Bilingual (fluent in English and French) is required - Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and with written correspondence
  • Strong knowledge of facility security, mail and copy center functions and switchboard operations
  • Knowledge of Windows, Word, Office and Outlook to provide support for various projects.
  • Experience in a corporate security setting (an asset)
  • Being flexible, professional, and organized
  • Being able to take initiative to complete daily tasks with little supervision
  • Being a self-starter with the ability to prioritize effectively
  • Being highly accountable

You do not have all of the required qualifications? No problem. Let us know in your presentation letter why you would be a great fit for this role.

We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest. We will only contact those selected for an interview.

Global Payments is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusiveness and provide equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, physical or mental disability, or any other basis protected by law and we are happy to provide our team members with a healthy work environment.

Global Payments Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

Global Payments provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis protected by law. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.

Applicants to roles based in the United States Only:

Except where prohibited by state law, Global Payments will give preference to candidates fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Team members are considered fully vaccinated after completing both primary vaccinations, if applicable, and after the requisite amount of time set by health authorities. Global Payments provides reasonable accommodations for medical or religious reasons or any other legally required reasons.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you organized, energetic and thrive in a fast-paced creative work environment? Do you have a strong administrative background and love providing support to a President / Executive Producer? If this sounds like you – let’s chat!

You will be an integral part of SPINVFX, reporting to the Development Executive.


You will spend your days:

  • Maintaining and coordinating a complex and constantly changing calendar, including scheduling meetings and conference calls, preparation of meeting materials and related tasks
  • Communicating directly, and on behalf of the President, with internal and external stakeholders and provide reliable and timely resolution to inquiries
  • Arranging travel schedules and associated arrangements, generally assisting on all matters related to outside business meetings
  • Composing and preparing material for the President and the Executive Management Team
  • Reviewing corporate contracts for a variety of productions, meetings and conferences
  • Ad hoc projects as assigned


You must have:

  • A university degree (ideally with a focus in Corporate Communication)
  • Experience supporting a senior business executive
  • The ability to operate with confidentiality and professionalism
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build effective working relationships with all levels of an organization and with external stakeholders
  • Proficiency in Microsoft applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook)
  • Experience working with Shotgun
  • A proven ability to work effectively in a fast paced organization that is constantly changing and has multiple competing priorities
  • Strong organizational skills and an energetic demeanor
  • Strong attention to detail and sharp focus on keeping track of commitments and responsibilities
  • A sense of urgency and work well under pressure and time constraints


Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • Dental care
  • Vacation & paid time off
  • Casual dress
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Discounted/free food
  • Work from home opportunities
  • Profit sharing/share options
  • Company events & social hours


If this sounds like you, please submit your cover letter and resume to careers@spinvfx.com. Be sure to include “Executive Assistant” in the subject line

title: Receptionist
description:
Receptionist in Vancouver, BC

Pathfinder Asset Management Limited is a full-service Investment Counsel operating across Canada with offices in Vancouver and Edmonton.

 

Since the beginning, our focus has been on stewardship of investment portfolios for motivated investors, seeking strong performance and risk-managed results.

 

Pathfinder holds true to its Equally Invested™ culture, where employees pay same fees and invest in same mandates as clients. We develop trusting relationships with our clients by aligning our interests with investors, utilizing consistent approach to investment management, and providing high level of service and transparency.

 

Overall Role

Pathfinder’s Receptionist will provide a welcoming, professional environment for Pathfinder Asset Management clients and business colleagues. The Receptionist is responsible for creating a superior client experience through friendly greetings, and polite communication (face to face, telephone, and email). The Receptionist is also responsible for administrative and accounting tasks.

 

Job Description

Phone, reception, general administration and meeting support:

•           Answer and manage phone system

•           Greet clients, guests, and support meetings

•           Retrieve, open, distribute incoming/outgoing mail

•           Manage courier accounts and packages

•           Manage all meeting room bookings and do pre-meeting prep

•           Keep office, reception, meeting rooms and kitchen clean and presentable

•           Conduct monthly inventory count, order and purchase office, kitchen, and printer supplies

•           Perform general office duties such as filing, typing, photocopying, scanning and printing

•           File trade tickets, slips and statements

 

Marketing support:

•           Prepare Annual Review Package and Intro Package for clients

•           Assist with business card requests for all employees

•           Upload Pathfinder Investment Outlook newsletter for distribution

•           Assist with preparation and mailing of marketing letters

•           Post website updates

 

Accounting support:

•           Account Payables, including invoices posting, invoice enquiry and cheque printing

•           Visa Statement reconciliation

•           Expense Reports

•           Deliver checks to banks for deposits

•           Prepare and deliver documents to custodians

 

Executive Assistant support:

•           Assist President and CCO with ad hoc tasks

•           Arrange travel schedules and make reservations

•           Arrange travel, hotel, and car reservations

 

Requirements

•           Friendly and cheerful personality

•           Honest and trustworthy

•           Diligent and disciplined

•           Experience with accounting and/or accounting software is an asset

•           Previous experience in financial industry an asset

The Receptionist is responsible for creating a superior client experience through friendly greetings, and polite communication (face to face, telephone, and email). Gain cash at Home by Participating in Paid Surveys - Data Entry agent - Customer Service Agent - Part-time

We are trying to find individuals across the country to join paid surveys - Apply ASAP!

We provide you the chance to gain extra income from home (remotely) and also to choose your own engagement schedule. At this job, you will be executing various jobs such as data entry, performing email feedback, evaluations, surveys as well as various other online tasks.

This work from home opportunity is really rewarding and will help shape the industry as well as influence new products coming to market. In some cases you will also get to see items prior to the public and take part in testing them. You'll be helping companies accumulate information to help forecast trends and also influence future organisation choices based upon the information provided.
  • Earn cash taking surveys. Up to $35 per completed survey!
  • Different payment methods, including Paypal, direct check, or online digital gift card codes
  • Part Time
  • Work remotely and gain additional income from home.
Apply

If you are the kind of person that is self-motivated and also comfortable working on your very own in the house, delight in such work as email customer support, data entry as well as review products, then you are the person we are seeking.

Data entry agent come from all various backgrounds including, data entry, outbound telemarketing, customer support, sales, clerical, assistant, administrative assistant, assistant, telephone call center, part-time.

title: Product Manager
description:
Would you like to shape the product development of a strongly growing international travel company with a passionate team and an entrepreneurial environment where industry boundaries are challenged and new ideas and out-of-the-box thinking are welcomed and encouraged? Do you enjoy interacting with people from different cultural backgrounds? Do you feel passionate about searching for and creating truly life changing travel experiences?


About the Company

Our client is a passionate, vibrant and innovative company that specializes in creating exceptional tailor-made journeys for discerning travellers to more than 70 destinations in all continents. Founded in 2004, they have made the travel dreams of thousands of guests from around the world come true. They rely on outstanding team members who are passionate about what they do and committed to providing excellent service. They are a multicultural team with 180 individuals from 20 nationalities working from their offices in the US, UK, Germany, Denmark, Sweden, India and Kenya.


What’s the position?

They are currently searching for a Product Manager North America to join their team, based in Toronto. The Product Manager independently creates, manages and continuously refines the travel experiences they offer to their guests in North America to support business growth and achieve high guest satisfaction. He/she continuously develops a suitable and competitive product offering, by understanding the existing and emerging needs of their target guest segments and analysing their competition. The product manager owns the product and price setup in their systems, selects suitable partners, drives negotiations of rates and specials and manages partner relationships to help their company and partners work effectively with each other. As part of this, the product manager sets expectations, systematically measures the partners' performance and intervenes in a timely and effective manner to course correct as needed. Furthermore, the product manager supports their sales team with successfully selling North America to their guests and their trip execution team with any challenges related to the execution of their guest trips in North America.


Why would you want this job?

Who doesn’t love traveling? And for you this is an opportunity to do it as a career! This is a really unique opportunity for many reasons - here are a couple!


  • Having an impact. You create memories of a lifetime for their guests through the joy and wonder of personalized travel which often have a deep impact on their lives. Beyond their guests, you have an impact on many people and organizations, through shaping their Responsible Travel initiatives, through helping their partners grow as well as through consistently demonstrating ethical business practices.
  • Support for your growth. Their team of managers and coaches will guide and support you to help you succeed and grow. They invest considerable time and resources in the growth and development of their team. They listen to their team members’ ideas and suggestions, irrespective of their seniority which gives you an opportunity to shape your own and their company’s path.
  • The people you work with. They are a very dynamic international and multicultural team where you will be challenged and have countless opportunities to broaden your horizons.
  • Attractive compensation. They offer a solid base salary with a variable incentive.


In summary, this is a fantastic opportunity if you are driven by having a positive impact and love partner interactions, driving destination growth and making travel dreams come true!


What do they expect from you?

  • You have 5+ years of Product Management experience in tourism, ideally for an international tour operator
  • You have a deep understanding of discerning travellers from Europe and North America as well as in-depth knowledge of travel destinations in North America
  • You feel passionate about creating amazing travel experiences
  • You have strong analytical skills and business sense and are able to multitask effectively
  • You have strong people and relationship building skills, enjoy communicating with people and have outstanding verbal and written communication skills. This entails empathy, assertiveness, listening, negotiation, presentation and ideally content writing skills.

title: Spa Receptionist (PT)
description:
J'adore Nails Salon & Spa is looking for a friendly and welcoming receptionist to join our team. This is a Part-Time position with work hours varying between 9-22 hours per week.

Primary Duties Include But Are Not Limited To
  • General Reception and clerical work
  • Completing daily opening and closing duties
  • Greeting, welcoming, and directing clients
  • Interact with clients and salon staff in a professional manner
  • Assisting staff with setup when needed
  • Resolve client's concerns or complaints professionally
  • Answering phones, responding to daily emails, inquiries, and voice messages
  • Booking appointments and reservations via phone, in person, or email
  • Processing sales via debit/credit card payments
  • Calculating daily sales receipts/transactions
  • Updating and organizing inventory
  • Be knowledgeable of all services and treatments offered by J’adore Nails Salon & Spa
  • Assist in spa cleaning and organization of all areas of the salon
  • Assist with social media postings
  • Able to work shifts from Mondays – to Saturdays
  • Access to reliable transportation
Essential Skills
  • Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills.
  • Exemplary customer service skills and a demonstrated willingness to exceed guest expectations.
  • Strong organizational and multitasking skills
  • Proficient in Excel, Microsoft Word, Point of Sale, and Online Booking applications.
How To Apply

Resumes can be submitted to Thuy at thuy.nguyen@jadorenails.ca.

Website: http://www.jadorenails.ca

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Sales Administrative Assistant
description:
Niagara Falls-based Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Companies is one of Canada’s largest and most successful diversified entertainment businesses, with more than 2500 talented professionals spread across its various Hotels, Spas, Conference Centres, Restaurants, Craft Brewery and Distillery, Indoor Waterpark, City Touring, Entertainment and Specialty Retail businesses - with more to come! We are home to world-class brands including Marriott, Sheraton, IHG, Morton’s, Milestones, Hard Rock Café, Rainforest Café, Hershey and Starbucks - to name a few. Regardless of what business or role you start with, career development opportunities and rewards are endless for people delivering exceptional guest satisfaction and attaining business results.


Sales Administrative Assistant Responsibilities:

  • Accountability to business results, our customers/guests, the team, and internal practices
  • Offering engaging, prompt, accurate and professional service to both internal and external clients
  • Assisting Account Directors and Sales Managers
  • Follow efficient Sales Office procedures
  • Accurate preparation of reports, file maintenance, proposals, contracts and correspondence
  • Accurate preparation and distribution of client files to prepare for Group arrivals
  • Accommodate inquiries by checking availability including systemic and reporting methods
  • Maintain knowledge of Canadian Niagara Hotels’ products and services

· Other duties as assigned


What you’ll need as a Sales Administrative Assistant:

Experience: 1+ years’ experience in an administrative role preferred

Education: College/University Degree in Business Administration, Hotel or related program preferred

Other Qualifications:

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office specifically Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • Knowledge of any of the hotel systems (Light Speed, Opera, Marsha, PMS, CI/TY or Delphi) considered and asset.
  • Outstanding interpersonal, communication and listening skills
  • Professional presentation, telephone and written correspondence skills and manners
  • Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with Account Directors, Sales Managers and clients
  • Highly motivated, driven and self-starter
  • Outstanding attention to detail and accuracy
  • Proven ability to multitask, maintain professional composure, remain flexible and prioritize activities to meet deadlines including coordinating several activities simultaneously
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, high volume environment and respond quickly to changing needs


We also understand that diversity includes people with disabilities who might require reasonable accommodation in order to fully participate and contribute to their full capabilities or candidates for employment interested in reviewing or receiving information pertaining to careers at Canadian Niagara Hotels. This includes being able to fully participate in the Resort’s candidate selection process, including personal interviews in many circumstances, wherever possible and practical. If you would like to receive information in another format or other communications supports please phone 905-374-4446 extension 4850.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
BC Interior Community Foundation is currently seeking a part-time Administrative Assistant who will work collaboratively, as part of our team, to ensure the efficient running of our daily office operations.

Knowledge and skills required

  • Exceptional administrative organizational skills and attention to detail (Office Administration Certificate and two years of experience is preferred)
  • Strong computer literacy with experience using MS Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat
  • Familiar with day-to-day office routine and capable of working with minimal supervision
  • Effective interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written, to deal with volunteers and the community
  • Aptitude to learn and utilize industry-standard donor management software program
  • Knowledge of non-profit operations
  • Website maintenance and social media savvy

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manage donor management software program – input donor data, generate receipts, prepare correspondence, forms and reports
  • Digital and paper filing and record keeping
  • Assist with preparation of presentation materials, as required
  • Assist with fundraising and community outreach events
  • Prepare bank deposits
  • Assist in preparing resources/board package for board meetings
  • Administration support for committee meetings, as required
  • Other day-to-day activities as required for administrative support for the Foundation

ABOUT US

The BC Interior Community Foundation is a registered charity that administers 198 endowment funds and dozens of scholarship funds supporting the philanthropic intentions of donors throughout the Thompson Nicola and South Cariboo regions. Since 1984, we have partnered with a broad array of not-for-profit and charitable agencies in their programming and project needs (www.bcicf.ca).

JOB DETAILS

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00 per hour

Hours: 20/week

TO APPLY

We are looking at filling this position as soon as possible. Please email your cover letter and resume to Wenda Noonan, executivedirector@bcicf.ca

title: Customer Service Consultant
description:
This is a remote role which means you get to work from home!

We ask our teams to rally one day a month at a Rogers location for a special culture day once we return.

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Wondering what it takes to join our team? Click here to try our interactive experience. We recommend that you use Chrome, Safari, Firefox or Internet Explorer 11.37 or above. You can also try it on your mobile device!

Rogers is a proud Canadian company with a rich family history. That’s why it’s always been important to us to give back to our communities and make a positive impact where we live and work. Our team is dedicated to making more possible every day for our customers and for our communities across Canada.Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and we know what makes you different makes us great. That’s why we believe in challenging work, rewarding opportunities and building an inclusive future for everyone. Because when our team learns, grows and reaches their true potential – we can make more possible. At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities, build the future you want with us.  Let’s make your possible at Rogers.

At Consumer Care, we believe our people are the heart of our success. We take pride in connecting Canadians to a world of possibilities and the moments that matter most in their lives by providing the very best wireless, residential and media to Canadians. We are leading the way in 5G for both coverage and reliability. Consumer Care is an opportunity for you to build something amazing, while accelerating your career. Together we can make more possible.

Life At Consumer Care – What We Offer

<@ Rogers or follow us on LinkedIn>>

We invest in our people to unleash their potential so we can win as a team! As part of the team, you will have access to a ton of amazing resources, discounts and perks. To name a few
  • Unlimited access to Headspace Premium for mindfulness training
  • Access to a virtual walk in clinic to connect with Healthcare Professionals from home
  • LIVX – Fitness Membership to attend classes virtually
  • Company matching contributions to charities you support
  • Paid time off for volunteering
  • Great benefits, pension plan, RRSP, TFSA and Wealth Accumulation Plan
  • Employee discounts to our products and services
  • Leadership development, Mentorship and Coaching programs
We genuinely care about each other and we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace at Rogers so all of our team members can bring their whole selves to work. We have employee resource groups that build awareness and a culture of allyship for equity-seeking groups, including groups representing People of Colour, LGBTQ2S+, Indigenous Peoples, Persons with Disabilities and Women. We all bring something different, and we know what makes you different makes us great.

https//youtu.be/i8Cp-R42LtI

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone who will bring enthusiasm and a positive attitude to the work they do. Someone who has a deep passion to listen and genuinely want to help each person they connect with. This role is fast-paced, and the environment is ever changing. You will be challenged to ask the right questions to unlock the appropriate solutions while recommending our products and services to our customers. You will foster collaboration within your team and other departments in efforts to help us work efficiently and provide world class customer service.

What You’ll Do

Our customers come first, and they inspire everything we do.  As part of our team, you will be providing world class customer service by connecting with our customers, analyzing their needs and offering customized solutions.  You will receive ongoing training and development to ensure you have all the necessary skills to navigate through our systems to find the solutions and/or the products that best suit our customers. We are there when our customers need us so you will have the ability to work a flexible schedule.  You will be speaking to different people from across Canada. 

Who You Are
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • 1+ years of customer interaction in a professional role, either face to face or over the phone
  • Expert in communication and listening
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills & ability to work a flexible schedule
  • Navigate multiple computer systems & multitasking
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Full time

Shift Variable

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location Remote

Travel Requirements None

Posting Category/Function Call Centre Operations & Customer Service / Sales

Requisition ID 267946

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes Customer Experience || Canada (CA) || ON || Kitchener

title: Summer Tour Guide - Full & Part Time - Summer Seasonal - Whistler Blackcomb
description:
We’re looking for team members whose legendary attention to detail and commitment to phenomenal service comes naturally. Pursue a lifestyle that will elevate your expectation of what work can look like. Nothing is too big or too small for the staff to bravely pursue and elevate the expectations of the guest. Do you possess a calling for delivering world-class events and amenities? Explore Employment Opportunities with Whistler Blackcomb! www.vailresortscareers.com/whistlerblackcomb

As of Nov. 15, 2021, Vail Resorts will be requiring all employees across North America to be vaccinated for COVID-19.

Whistler Blackcomb’s Mission Statement is “To create memories as the best mountain experience again and again.”

Love what you do! Because that’s what we’re all about. The Whistler Blackcomb staff is comprised of individuals who thrive in the outdoors, love the mountains, and are passionate about what they do. We look for applicants who share in this passion, whether you are looking for a seasonal job or wanting to build an exciting career, don’t miss the chance to work and play in BC’s winter wonderland. If you sound like our ideal applicant please apply online and show us what you’ve got. #wbworklove

Job Summary

The Summer Tour Guide (Wildlife, Ecology and Hiking) is responsible for providing a safe and enjoyable experience to guests on terrain on both Whistler and Blackcomb Mountains. Guides will provide in-vehicle and walking tours around both mountains, while educating guests in the diverse ecology and geology of the Whistler Area Coast Mountains.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • To continually strive to exceed our guest’s expectations and to provide them with the finest mountain recreational experience.
  • To deliver specific educational information to our guests, while at the same time touring them around our alpine environment, either in a vehicle or hiking.
  • To provide (in – vehicle) Bear and Wildlife Tours on both Whistler and Blackcomb mountain.

The Summer Tour Guide (Wildlife, Ecology and Hiking) is responsible for providing a safe and enjoyable experience to guests on terrain on both Whistler and Blackcomb Mountains. Guides will provide in-vehicle and walking tours around both mountains, while educating guests in the diverse ecology and geology of the Whistler Area Coast Mountains.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • To continually strive to exceed our guest’s expectations and to provide them with the finest mountain recreational experience.
  • To deliver specific educational information to our guests, while at the same time touring them around our alpine environment, either in a vehicle or hiking.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

Are you data entry clerk, administrative assistant or customer service Rep seeking a legit way to supplement your revenue from home?

Our company is seeking inspired people to participate in nationwide & regional paid studies.

With most of our paid researches, you have the alternative to take part online or in-person. This is a wonderful way to gain extra income from the comfort of your house.

If the thought of taking part in group discussions and also voicing your point of view about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited ... we 'd love to have you apply while places are still available.

  • Earn by taking surveys
  • Various payment methods, including Paypal, direct check, or online virtual gift card codes
  • Possibility to win rewards

Responsibilities

Get involved by completing written and oral guidelines.

Complete written study provided for each panel.

MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. After that prepare to discuss BEFORE meeting day.

Needs

Must have either a smart phone with functioning camera or cam on desktop/laptop.

Have to have accessibility to a reliable internet connection

Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given subjects

Capacity to read, understand, and follow oral and written guidelines.

Data entry or administrative assistant experience is not necessary but helpful

Job Advantages

Flexibility to participate in discussions on the internet or in-person.

No commute needed if you choose to work from home.

No minimum hrs. You can do this part-time or full-time

Enjoy cost-free samples from our sponsors and partners for your sincere comments of their products.

This position is opened to anybody searching for short-term, work at home, part-time or full time work. The hours are flexible and also no previous experience is required.

Our paid market survey members come from all backgrounds and markets including data entry clerk, administrative assistant, receptionist, sales assistant, customer service agent, warehouse or factory workers, chauffeur, medical assistant, nurse, call center agent, etc. If you are seeking a flexible part-time remote work from home work, this is a fantastic position for making a good side revenue.

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
Our client, a leader in the banking industry is seeking a Data Entry Clerk to join their Payments Processing team until the end of December with the possibility to extend. This will be a hybrid role in their Mississauga office. In this position, you will receive and process incoming payments from other entities worldwide electronically and repair incoming payments when they error out. You will be responsible for ensuring payments can process through their queue to the correct entity.

Role Responsibilities
  • Repairing wire payments
  • Ensuring wire payments are processed with no process errors
  • Receiving payments in differing currencies and manually keying the funds into the correct currency in alignment with the customer’s bank account
  • Working through their request queue with both speed and accuracy
Qualifications
  • Excellent typing skills- a speed of 50 words/minute at minimum with accuracy
  • Strong communication skills- a bilingual candidate is an asset, but the work the team completes day to day is with English speaking customers
  • Ability to effectively manage and deliver on high priority and time sensitive deadlines
  • A strong willingness to learn
  • Previous financial teller experience considered an asset
  • Previous service rep experience for a banking client considered an asset
  • Solid knowledge of general geography- this team handles transfers worldwide, and it can be helpful for candidates to have a good understanding of where countries are located and the currencies they leverage
  • Post-secondary degree highly preferred
At Prime Hires our mandate is simple - provide top-tier talent to our clients and unsurpassed career opportunities to our candidates while ensuring the best fit for both. We are perfectionists who excel at working to ensure we have a perfect match. With experience spanning almost 3 decades and offices across North America, we have built our reputation on the strong relationships and trust of our clients and candidates. Our expertise is in Temporary, Contract and Permanent placements in Finance, Accounting, Administrative & Clerical, Office Operations, Contact Centre, and Technology.

title: Customer Care Representative
description:
Today's Shopping Choice (TSC) is a leading interactive, multi-channel retailer, offering a vast assortment of exclusive products and top brand names to its customers. As Canada's only live broadcast retailer, Today's Shopping Choice incorporates entertainment, inspiration, personalities, and industry leaders to provide a unique shopping experience. Customers can find exceptional selections in Health & Beauty, Jewellery, Home/Lifestyle, Fashion/Accessories, and Electronics through our ecommerce platform and Customer Contact Centre.

We're looking for passionate Customer Care Associates to join our Customer Contact Centre who are eager to grow their career with Canada's only live broadcast retailer. This is a full-time position that provides a superior customer experience by supporting and resolving customer inquiries related to their purchases. We are currently recruiting for our Mississauga location that will begin on May 24th, 2022. Please note, this position will be temporarily working remotely.

You Are
  • Empathetic: You are someone who is able to show understanding and relate to the customer
  • Outgoing: You are someone who is friendly and approachable
  • Patient: You are someone who regardless of the situation can support the customer in a tactful, meaningful and effective manner
  • Passionate: You are someone who loves providing the best customer experience.
  • Customer Champion: You are passionate about providing world class customer service and sales solutions
You Get To
  • Promote and recommend the latest TSC products to customers
  • Receive inbound and outbound calls and provide the best experience to our customers
  • Take ownership to resolve customer issues from the beginning to end
  • Work with a supportive and dynamic leadership team that will encourage your growth and development
You Must Have
  • Availability to work on a flexible schedule including days, evenings, weekends, and statutory holidays to meet customer demand
  • Expert communication and listening skills
  • A willingness to be open to feedback and coaching
  • An ability to remain calm and polite when working under pressure
  • An ability to navigate multiple software application
In order to set you up for success, there will be a mandatory training starting on May 24th, 2022.

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule: Full time

Shift: Variable

Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location: 59 Ambassador Dr (096), Mississauga, ON

Travel Requirements: None

Posting Category/Function: Call Centre Operations & Customer Service / Sales

Requisition ID: 266407

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what's right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Location:

Mississauga, ON, CA

Being a Rogers team member comes with some great perks & benefits including:
  • Health & well-being benefits
  • Donation matching
  • Paid time off for volunteering
  • Wealth Accumulation including: Pension plan & Employee stock options
  • Generous employee discounts
  • Leadership development, Mentorship, and Coaching programs
Looking for career guidance and inspiration?

Catch up on the latest episodes of For the Love of Work podcast with Dr. Sonia Kang.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are a growing Downtown Vancouver real-estate brokerage and property management firm looking for a competent and diligent addition to our team.

The hired candidate will be responsible for various clerical tasks, most notably in maintaining our social media platforms, updating advertisements for furnished and unfurnished rentals and some light bookkeeping duties. As the company grows, there will be opportunity for growth and advancement.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Slack, Monday or similar softwares is a must.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Being a Travel agent or in the rental industry - Advantage.

*Keeping all rental ads up to date (Airbnb, Canada Stays, Rentboard, Craigslist, Kijiji, etc) by making sure the ad calendars, photos, and price points are always current according to availability and season

*Creating copy for new units (posting to the above platforms)

*Remain alert, courteous, and helpful to all staff members of the office

*Light reception duties

*Light duties in document processing

*Light bookkeeping duties (accounts payable and receivable etc)

*Always maintain a professional demeanor, attitude, and professional appearance

*Responsible, resourceful, and accountable for all duties assigned


JOB REQUIREMENTS:

*Has excellent to near-perfect English language skills, oral and written communication is central to this position

*Has intermediate to expert computer skills

*Familiar with programs and websites such as Microsoft office, Craigslist, Airbnb, Canada Stays, Rentboard, Dropbox, Slack, Monday.com etc

*Some experience with Quickbooks or similar accounting software is preferred.

*Effective time management skills

*Some experience in property management, real-estate, travel or the guest service industry preferred, but not required

*Authorized to work in Canada

*Completely fluent in the English language

*Ability to perform well under pressure

*Ability to problem solve with little or no supervision in a diplomatic and tactful manner

*Ability to accurately follow instructions, both verbal and written

*Highly detail orientated and organized

*Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

*Ability to work courteously as a team in a professional, public, and private environment

*Ability to work a flexible varying schedule that includes evenings, weekends, nights and holidays


This is a full time position at $24 an hour. Hours will generally be from 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.


If you think you could be an asset to our team, please tell us why in your cover letter and include your resume.


Experience:

  • administrative assistant: 2 year (Preferred)


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent


Salary: $23.00-$24.00 per hour


COVID-19 considerations:

We are a very small office (3-5 people max are in the office at one time). We can easily accommodate a socially distant environment and we are not open to the public. Hand sanitizers are available in office.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT


Duties and responsibilities:

• Keeping the executive’s calendar up-to-date, including adding events, booking and rescheduling appointments

• Filing important documents and keeping important information and documents organized physically, and electronically

• Performing all tasks of a personal nature for executives as it relates to banking, appointments, donations, medical, investments, gifts, cars, properties, and personal appointments.

• When necessary, acting as the gatekeeper for internal and external contacts, including vendors, colleagues, clients, and customers

• Planning and organizing office and personal events such as holiday parties, summer parties, and birthdays. etc.

• Maintaining a high degree of discretion and confidentiality


You are the ideal candidate if you possess:

• Exceptional attention to detail

• Excellent organizational skills

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

• Time management

• Ability to learn quickly

• Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion

• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and managing a varied and often challenging, quickly changing workload

• Ability to recognize task demands and deadlines and prioritize accordingly

• Basic computer and office equipment skills

• Fluency in French and English both written and spoken

• 1 to 3 years of experience.

The candidate must be energetic, discreet, flexible, accommodating; have a positive attitude and show good judgment.

This is a full-time position. The candidate must be prepared to answer texts and calls off hours if necessary. Please send your cv to amandab@hsprop.com if interested.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000-$60,000

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant

Location: 100% on-site, downtown Toronto

Type: Permanent, Full-time


This leader in the investment industry is adding an Administrative Assistant to support multiple teams across different business units in the downtown Toronto office. The ideal Administrative Assistant will be a self-starter who is detailed oriented, proactive and professional. The ability to interact with staff (at all levels) in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure while remaining positive, flexible, resourceful and efficient, is key for this role. The demonstration of a high level of professionalism and confidentiality is crucial.


Job Responsibilities include:


- Handle calendar management and scheduling

- Handle expense report receipt tracking and report submission

- Manage and process invoices

- Work effectively without constant supervision

- Promptly respond to requests with accuracy and a courteous demeanor

- Manage document preparation for internal and external meetings, training, etc.

- Handle mailing, scanning, copying and binding

- Provide administrative support to other groups when time warrants, during absences, holidays, etc.

- Assist other members of the administration staff with work overflow

- Modify PowerPoint presentations including the incorporation and formatting of charts, graphs and images


Candidate Profile:


- 2 to 3 years of Administrative Assistant experience

- Demonstrated the ability to handle confidential information appropriately

- Proficient in MS Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

- Extremely organized with the ability to anticipate requests and to be proactive

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

- Ability to stay focused, efficient and effective in managing multiple priorities

- Strong interpersonal skills and good judgment

- Team spirit, ability to provide support to other groups when time warrants, during absences, holidays, etc.

- Bachelor's degree required


Please send your resume in Word format to Maggie Colorado at maggie.colorado@quantum.ca.

description:

title: Executive Assistant
description:
The Company


Darren Voros is a Toronto based real estate investor. He is respected as an industry expert with his work having been featured on CBC, City TV. HGTV, and the W Network. Darren is actively involved in his real estate coaching business, development company and real estate mastermind.


Darren's preference is to work in a collaborative and synergistic way. Working together in person is where him and his team achieve their best results. Across his businesses, things move quickly. Projects and tasks continuously shift and require reprioritization to meet deadlines and targets. All things are done in pursuit of creating exceptional client and partner experiences. Maintaining posture as a sought after partner and service provider is of critical importance.


The Role


To enable the ongoing growth of his business and to streamline operations, Darren is in search of high-level administrative support. This versatile position will be accountable for:


  • Client Relations - communications and support, overseeing all email, phone and internal communications
  • Calendar Management - ensuring executive's calendar is current, managing appointments/meetings, providing daily briefings
  • Report & Document Prep - conducting research, producing reports, developing SOPs and presentations
  • Travel & Event Coordination - planning of networking events and courses, coordinating with external vendors
  • Bookkeeping - preparing expense reports, managing invoices and other documents
  • Marketing - managing social media accounts, sourcing opportunities to strategically market company offerings


Qualifications


  • 2+ years experience in an Administrative or Executive Assistant role
  • Knowledge of the real estate industry, ideally real estate investment and/or development
  • Confident communicating with diverse audiences
  • Effectively leverages technology including Google Suite, social media platforms, Quickbooks and project management softwares
  • Experience working autonomously and managing a wide breadth of priorities
  • Ability to occasionally work evenings


Is this the role for you?


  • Having fun at work is important to you and engaging with others gives you energy
  • You consistently demonstrate a high degree of professionalism and convey a polished presence
  • Operating in the unknown is your niche. You naturally systematize and create order in all that you do
  • You are enthusiastic about real estate and are keen to expand your knowledge of the industry
  • You understand and appreciate the importance of confidentiality and operating with integrity


We are happy to provide accommodations to support candidates throughout the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions or suggestions regarding accessibility in a different format, please do not hesitate to contact us.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Post Office Assistant - Term
description:
Job Requisition Id: 156131

Business Function: Retail

Primary City: Gleichen

Province: Alberta

Employment Type: On Call

Employment Status: Term

Language Requirement: English Essential

Employee Class and Level: RVSGD11 - Level 1

Working Hours: On-call

Number of Vacancies: 1

Salary: $18.08/hr

Job Closing Date (MM/DD/YYYY): 05/15/2022

All qualified candidates will be considered however preference will be given to Indigenous people (First Nations, Metis or Inuit) or persons with a disability. This is a special measure employment equity initiative and candidates from this group who wish to qualify for preferential consideration must self-identify.

Health and safety is our highest priority. With vaccination shown to be the most effective tool to reduce the risk of transmission of COVID-19 and protecting individuals from severe consequences of this virus, Canada Post has implemented a Vaccination Practice. Accordingly, you will be required to attest to being fully vaccinated. If you are unable to be vaccinated, you may request an accommodation due to a medical, religious, or other prohibited ground of discrimination as described in the Canadian Human Rights Act.

Job Description

If you have ambition, talent and drive, consider a fast-moving career with Canada Post. We are currently seeking an on-call Post Office Assistant who will use a customer-focused approach when providing counter services to customers.

Note: The ideal candidate should reside in the community. Applicants outside the community in which the Post Office is located may be considered as needed.

Job Responsibilities
  • Sell postal products and service to the business community and public
  • Sort, distribute and process mail into appropriate classifications
  • Provide customers with information and forms
  • Address delivery and service difficulties to resolve problems thoroughly and quickly
Qualifications

Job Responsibilities (continued)
  • High school or provincial equivalency and/or experience in business administration
  • Training and/or experience interacting with the public in a retail and/or service environment, including sales and cash transactions
  • Understanding of general or post office accounting systems.
  • Physically fit to lift mail containers of up to 50 lb, push or pull boxes, sort mail and stand for extended periods of time
  • Flexibility to be available for temporary, on-call work
Other Information

CANDIDATES WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE:
  • A character reference letter
Note: The ideal candidate should reside in the community. Applicants within a 50 km radius of the Post Office may be considered as needed.

As part of the selection process selected candidates will be required to complete a security screening process.

Safety Sensitive Positions

This position may be considered a Safety Sensitive position.

Employment Equity

Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous People, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.

Disability is defined as a persistent or episodic physical, sensory, or mental health condition and/or functional limitation. Disability includes both visible and hidden conditions and/or limitations that may impact vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, mental/psychological, and memory.

Conflict of Interest

The Conflict of Interest Policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.

Accommodation

Canada Post is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you are contacted by Canada Post regarding a job opportunity, please advise if you have any restrictions that need to be accommodated. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Important Message

Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as Canada Post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Leadership Behaviours

Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner, that aligns with the corporation's best interests.

Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds themselves and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.

Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.

Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.

Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.

Our Values

We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.

Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.

Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion.

Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect.

Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity.

Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.

title: Administrative Assistant, Operations
description:
The Administrative Assistant is responsible for a wide variety of administrative duties in support of the CEO, Director of Operations, and other members of senior management. The Administrative Assistant has virtual receptionist duties in addition to more complex functions and services, such as arranging travel plans, minute-taking during confidential meetings, and scheduling appointments concerning the processes and procedures of Wellington Advocacy. He/she is expected to assist Wellington Advocacy with any administrative duties such as managing the scheduling for the CEO, record keeping for attendance at meetings and meeting minutes, booking travel when required for members of the staff. Keeping the Executive Team’s calendars up-to-date, including all events, rescheduling appointments and providing a daily high-level briefing on the morning calls. Keeping important information and documents organized electronically. 



Core Competencies

• Exceptional attention to detail

• Communication and interpersonal skills

• Time Management

• Ability to learn quickly

• Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion

• Ability to work in a face-paced environment

• Ability to adapt to changes

• Team Work

• Quality Orientation

• Problem Solving

• Accountability and Dependability

• A high standard in ethics and integrity

• Operating equipment and multiple levels of online platforms.


Job Duties

• Provide direct administrative and office management support to all members of the Wellington

Advocacy team, as directed by verbal or written instruction.

• Prepare travel schedules, book travel arrangements, and make reservations for senior management

or executive staff when required.

• Coordinate the logistical aspects of executive team programs, such as meetings, seminars,

workshops, special projects, and events.

• Review all documents, reports, and correspondence prepared for signature of the executive team for

format, content, grammar, and spelling, and make edits as necessary.

• Prepare draft reports, background documentation, and research.

• Receive and screen all inbound telephone calls, e-mails, and visitors to the executive office; refer

and/or redirect calls, e-mails, or visitors as applicable.

• Maintain daily appointment calendars of members of executive team.

• Take and transcribe dictation and notes of highly confidential subjects, including minutes of morning

meetings

• Assist with the preparation of presentations.

• Assist with any planning or implementation documentation and organization.

• Other Duties as required.


Requirements

• An acceptable combination of education and progressively responsible experience.

• 5 years of direct work experience in an Administrative Assistant capacity.

• Strong knowledge of general office procedures involving procurement, travel arrangements, reports,

etc.

• Able to write and format moderately complex correspondence, including memos, letters, etc.

• Hands-on experience with productivity applications, including word processing, spreadsheets, e-mail

clients, and presentation software.

• Excellent writing skills, including proper spelling, grammar, and punctuation.

• Superior time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal

supervision.

• High level of sound and independent judgment, reasoning, and discretion.

• Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures.

• Professional, responsive, and positive work attitude is essential.

• Resourcefulness and flexibility.

• Previous experience in handling confidential or sensitive information.

• Knowledge of supplies, equipment, and/or services ordering, as well as inventory control of these

items.

• Able to maintain filing systems and basic databases.

• Meticulous records maintenance skills.

• Strong verbal skills to communicate with all levels of the executive team.

title: Receptionist
description:
Looking to get back into the office and joining a very reputable company?

Our client, is seeking a Receptionist to join their dynamic team on a temporary basis! As the first point of contact for incoming calls, visitors and

clients, the successful candidate will be responsible for promoting a friendly and courteous environment and always maintaining a professional appearance.

If you have great communication skills, a client service-oriented attitude and strong attention to detail then we want to hear from you!

Receptionist Responsibilities

  • Welcome guests and employees by greeting them in person or on the telephone;

answer or refer inquiries

  • Direct guests by utilizing employee and department directories; give instructions
  • Review all room booking to stay current and informed of all meetings taking place on the floor
  • Main point of contact for building security, employees and for receiving guests and visitors
  • Maintain safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and

regulations

  • Handle any administrative tasks/requests for the floor as needed
  • Respond promptly to incoming calls in a professional and enthusiastic manner, directing them to the proper individual/ department/ or responding to inquiries
  • Ensure the fax, photocopier and printers are in good working condition
  • Assist with large mail outs as required
  • Other administrative support as required

Receptionist Qualifications

  • Very strong organizational skills, along with the ability to prioritize tasks and

Responsibilities

  • Strong analytical and communication (both verbal and written) skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and pleasant telephone manner
  • Ability to organize tasks and prioritize responsibilities
  • Ability to function well independently and as a member of a team
  • MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills
  • Attention to detail and a ‘can do’ attitude

Other Details

  • Schedule: Monday to Friday
  • Wage: Up to 22/hour
  • Location: Toronto
  • schedule 1-3 Month Contract
  • Perks: Build a rapport with Talentworld to open up many opportunities!

About Talentworld

Accommodations are available upon request to support your participation during all stages of the recruitment process.
