title: Administrative Assistant
company: XMC - CANADA's OFFICIAL SPONSORSHIP AND EXPERIENTIAL MARKETING™ AGENCY
description:
General Description of the Role

The Receptionist/Administrative Assistant provides general assistance to staff while supporting other departments performing routine clerical and administrative duties. They are the front-line contact for visitors and callers, answering inquiries and providing information to the public, customers, visitors, and other interested parties regarding Campari Canada.


Key Responsibilities and Activities

Departmental:

  • Creating, tracking, and reconciling purchase orders using Coupa
  • Creating GRs for the PO’s
  • Submitting invoices to accounts payable for payment processing as needed
  • Manage invoices through SNOW system
  • Purchase Card (P-card) report submission 
  • Coordinating with new vendors and setting them up in Coupa


Office/Reception 

  • Greeting visitors/call-ins, handling inquiries, or directing them to the appropriate persons according 
  • Keeping track of office visitors and managing sign-in logbook
  • Operating telephone system (VOIP) taking messages, or scheduling appointments as required 
  • Opening and distributing incoming mail or other materials and answering routine letters
  • Preparing to ship, and tracking packages according to requirements, ensuring timely and accurate delivery (including international shipping linked to Supply Chain team)
  • Scheduling in-person meetings and virtual team meetings 
  • Booking flight tickets and hotels on Concur and occasionally negotiate special rates.
  • Arranging catering for specific functions and office activities
  • Ordering and dispensing office supplies
  • Coordinate office maintenance needs such as cleaning and sanitary services as well as scheduled services such as electrician, HVAC check, etc.
  • Ensuring common areas are kept clean, including sink, dishwasher, and storage areas
  • Scheduling deliveries of products and services to the office 
  • Arranging for employees’ gifts such as flower delivery, gift card purchases, baskets, etc.
  • Purchasing bottles from LCBO for sampling needs for different departments
  • Collecting and distributing internal data or feedback, organizing it in reports/spreadsheets
  • Assisting IT in purchasing, distributing, and collecting equipment (onboarding, offboarding)
  • Keeping receipts, files, and deck organized on the shared folder by month/function (ex. Camparista awards by month, Toronto credit card monthly reports)
  • Assisting different departments with seasonal projects.
  • Coordinating with Social Committee on delivering all staff emails and recognition.
  • Managing monthly office expenses, such as creating credit card reports (AMEX), keeping receipts in order on file/shared drive. Submitting information on Service Now (deadline- 28th of every month).
  • LCBO Receipts: Creating Trade sampling report end of every month and sending it Via Courier to the LCBO.
  • Manage Access Cards for different office across the country.
  • Work on business cards for all staff.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Key Relationships

Internal: 

  • All Canadian employees
  • Internal Department 
  • Senior Level Management Team

External:  

  • Vendors and agents, including Promotional Vendors, Shipping Agencies, Hospitality Companies, Travel Agents, Event Planners, Social Media Agencies


Experience Required

  • 2+ years of experience in office administration 
  • Customer service experience is an asset


Education / Professional Qualifications

  • Diploma in Business Administration is an asset


Skills 

Soft/Functional 

  • Ability to exercise tact and discretion in dealing with sensitive and confidential information
  • Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology
  • Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction

Other

  • Team oriented
  • Proactive, well organized, and be able to demonstrate attention to detail
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to prioritize and balance required tasks with sensitivity to time, resources, and budget
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong decision-making skills and sound judgment
  • Must be a person of high integrity and commitment, with a strong work ethic
  • Motivated to complete tasks independently and ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Prioritizes company goals and lives the Campari values
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate positively and work effectively with others
  • Strong achievement orientation with a commitment to delivering business results
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Photoshop and Illustrator knowledge is an asset
  • Working knowledge of enterprise-class systems experience (SAP)

title: Agent(e) à la réception / Guest Service Agent (TEMPS-PLEIN, FULL-TIME) Agent(e) à la réception TEMPS-PLEIN
description:
L'agent(e) à la réception est responsable de fournir un service hors pair à nos invités, en effectuant les arrivées et les départs, et en offrant des renseignements sur l'hôtel et la ville. L'agent(e) à la réception est appelé(e) à écouter et résoudre des problèmes, tout en maintenant un haut niveau de professionnalisme auprès de nos invités. RESPONSABILITÉS PRINCIPALES
  • Fournir un excellent service à nos invités, en les accueillant chaleureusement, en anticipant leurs besoins et en les remerciant sincèrement ;
  • Exécuter chaleureusement les arrivées et départs des invités, les réservations, les modifications ou les annulations;
  • Sécuriser la méthode de paiement ; vérifier et ajuster la facturation ;
  • Compter la caisse au début et à la fin du quart de travail et la sécuriser en tout temps;
  • Compléter les rapports de caisse et de fermeture dans le système informatique;
  • Traiter tous les types de paiement, les bons d'ajustement, les versements, les bons de correction et les frais divers ; fournir de la monnaie aux invités sur demande ;
  • Activer et classer les clés de chambre;
  • Produire et réviser les rapports et journaux quotidiens;
  • Traiter toutes les demandes des invités et communiquer les messages;
  • Fournir aux clients des explications et des informations concernant les fonctionnalités et fournitures de la chambre, les équipements, les services et les heures d'opérations de l'hôtel ;
  • Offrir des informations sur la ville et pouvoir suggérer des activités d'intérêt;
  • S'assurer que toutes les demandes ou problèmes mis en suspens la veille soient prioritaires et résolus;
  • Communiquer dans un langage clair, professionnel et courtois ;
  • Répondre au téléphone en utilisant l'étiquette appropriée;
  • Développer et maintenir des relations de travail positives avec les autres ; supporter son équipe pour atteindre des objectifs communs ;
  • Informer la direction de tout vol rapporté par un invité ;
  • Suivre toutes les politiques et procédures de l'entreprise ;
  • Maintenir la confidentialité des informations privées et confidentielles ;
  • Protéger les actifs de l'entreprise ;
  • Signaler les accidents, les blessures et les conditions de travail dangereuses au superviseur en devoir ;
  • Imprimez les listes de contingence pour avoir un registre de tous les invités en cas d'urgence ;
  • Refléter une apparence propre et professionnelle; porter l'uniforme selon les standards de la compagnie ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe lorsque demandé. ÉDUCATION ET EXPÉRIENCE
  • Formation professionnelle ou collégiale en hôtellerie, en tourisme ou dans un domaine connexe;
  • Expérience dans un poste de service à la clientèle depuis au moins un (1) an;
  • Expérience à titre de réceptionniste en hôtellerie, un atout ;
  • Connaissance du logiciel de réception OnQ, un atout. COMPÉTENCES, HABILETÉS ET APTITUDES
  • Communiquer efficacement à l'écrit et verbalement, en anglais et en français ;
  • Maintenir un haut niveau de professionnalisme en tout temps ;
  • Posséder un sens de l'organisation et le souci du détail ;
  • Posséder d'excellentes qualités interpersonnelles et une forte habileté au service à la clientèle ;
  • Démontrer une attitude positive et une capacité à écouter avec empathie les besoins ou les plaintes des invités;
  • Capable de prendre des décisions et de résoudre des problèmes par soi-même ;
  • Flexibilité concernant les horaires : les fins de semaine, les matins, les soirées, les jours fériés et les nuits ; des quarts de travail la nuit à des fins de remplacement de l'auditeur de nuit peuvent être nécessaires. Une formation supplémentaire est fournie à cet effet;
  • Être en mesure de travailler debout la plupart du temps ;
  • Déplacer, soulever, transporter, pousser, tirer et placer des objets pesant moins de 15 livres sans assistance. * Notre organisation est un employeur sensibilisé envers l'équité professionnelle et qui s'engage à recruter une main-d'oeuvre diversifiée et à maintenir une culture inclusive. L'usage du masculin n'est utilisé qu'aux fins d'alléger le texte. Nous ne discriminons pas en fonction du genre, de l'appartenance ethnique, de la religion, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge, du handicap ou de toute autre base protégée par les lois provinciales ou fédérales.

title: Corporate Receptionist
description:
Our client, a leading real estate organization is seeking a full-time Corporate Receptionist to work onsite at their Toronto office. The Corporate Receptionist will act as the first point of contact to all guests, as well as assist with office operations. The ideal candidate delivers strong customer service, has a great attention to detail and is able to act independently.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Act as first point of contact for the office
  • Answer incoming calls in a professional manner and efficiently transferring them as appropriate to head office employees
  • Respond to all email and phone correspondence in a timely manner and escalate when required
  • Assist in overseeing and maintaining office systems and procedures
  • Keep office supply inventory well-stocked and maintain kitchen and office areas
  • Manage boardroom bookings and meeting preparation
  • Coordinate and distribute all mail, deliveries, and couriers
  • Manage all ad hoc projects as assigned
  • Manage all office service requests
  • Provide additional administrative support to the team as needed
Qualifications
  • 2-3 years of previous corporate reception experience required
  • Must be able to adapt and prioritize, meet deadlines, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Must have a positive, professional attitude and always demonstrate professionalism
  • Highly organized with excellent attention to detail and quality of work
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
At Prime Hires our mandate is simple - provide top-tier talent to our clients and unsurpassed career opportunities to our candidates while ensuring the best fit for both. We are perfectionists who excel at working to ensure we have a perfect match. With experience spanning almost 3 decades and offices across North America, we have built our reputation on the strong relationships and trust of our clients and candidates. Our expertise is in Temporary, Contract and Permanent placements in Finance, Accounting, Administrative & Clerical, Office Operations, Contact Centre, and Technology.

title: Receptionist
description:
Become part of the first new Nordic Spa in Nova Scotia: SENSEA NORDIC SPA.


Our Nordic Spa is located in the beautiful South Shore region in Chester. The site is nested in a deep forest by a lake. Our Spa offers guests an all season outdoor Nordic experience including Massages and saunas, hammams, outdoor Baths and other relaxation area.


We are looking for receptionists to perform the following:

- front desk reception: check in / out, answering the phone

- with ability to take part in other site duties to keep our site unique for our guests.

- Some week-ends and evening shifts expected

- Job Type: full time and part-time, possible work from home on some days

- you are the front person for our spa, so you must pay attention to your presentation, show empathy, have an engaging and smiling attitude.


The successful candidate is a committed worker, reliable (very rarely absent and come on time, whatever the weather is: rain, wind, snow, sun) and share our company value: CARE.


Our focus is more on who you are rather than the number of diplomas you have.

This is not a seasonal job, we need a permanent commitment.

Lots of opportunities and possibilities of evolution as we are a fast growing start up company.


Benefits:

  • Benefits: $15-$17 / hour
  • On-site parking
  • Work from home opportunities
  • Tips sharing

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
The position of Assistant to the President is of critical operational importance to ensure the smooth functioning of the Company. The assistant functions as the “face” of the President through interactions with staff, clients and external contacts on behalf of the President.

Responsibilities include:

Executive Support – scheduling, preparing and co-ordinating the President’s meetings.
Team Support – to be a resource for the Veloso team and assist where needed
Consultant Support – participating in company meetings and assisting with editing and proofing of documentation.
External Communications – helping prepare and distribute external communications.
Office Co-ordination – working to ensure that the office runs smoothly and is properly supplied.
Work Productivity – coordinating the project management system– answering the phone for the President, sending emails and invoices. Part-time position, with working hours upon schedule.

Salary: ranges from $30,000-$35,000 plus bonus, depending on experience and skills.

Experience: The position requires superior organizational skills and a very professional personal attitude since this individual is effectively a key representative of the President. The successful Assistant to the President will have good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team. Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail and computer skills (proficiency in Windows, Outlook, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint) are necessary. The Assistant to the President must have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Prior administrative experience (preferably executive assistant experience), including experience with recruitment, expenses and scheduling would be considered an asset but not necessary.



Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: fast-paced environment, work under pressure, tight deadlines, multitasking

Other Information: Fluency in English is necessary (Portuguese an asset). All employees are expected to follow Ottawa Public Health best practices and recommendations.

Availability/Openings: June 2022

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $35,000 Plus bonus

title: Educator
company: Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies
description:
THE ORGANIZATION

Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies (FSWC) is a non-profit human rights organization committed to countering racism and antisemitism and to promoting the principles of tolerance, social justice and Canadian democratic values through advocacy and education.

 

THE OPPORTUNITY

FSWC seeks an experienced Educator to join the education department. As an FSWC Educator, you will be responsible for leading innovative and inspiring programming in both in-person and virtual formats for elementary and high school students across Canada.

 

You will:

  • Learn and lead students in both in-person and virtual formats through ourEquity & Diversity student workshops,
  • Learn and lead students through ourTour for Humanity workshops,

·      Contribute to the development of new educational programs and experiences that align with the goals of FSWC,

·      Build and maintain educational networks with teachers and community educators to ensure repeat and frequent re-booking, as well as participation in other educational programs,

·      Build and maintain relationships with survivor communities

·      Assist with the planning, promotion, and successful execution of all educational events,

·      Support other FSWC team members as needed leading up to and during annual organizational events (i.e., Spirit of Hope, State of the Union, etc.)

 

 

YOU ARE SOMEONE WITH:

  • A knowledge and understanding of Holocaust and genocide education along with the fight against hate, discrimination and antisemitism and the protection and advancement of human rights nationally and globally (minimum BA degree in an associated field).
  • Strong and engaging presentation skills and creative approaches to generating interactivity with students in both virtual and in-person formats.
  • Ontario College of Teachers certification or equivalent experience along with a comprehensive knowledge of curriculum expectations an asset.
  • A valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle that allows you to travel to schools (required).

·      Superior relationship-building and communication skills ensuring the ability to liaise with a variety of stakeholders at all levels.

  • Excellent attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
  • Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation and excellence.
  • Self-motivated and decisive with the ability to adapt to change and competing demands.
  • A solid understanding of technology and how to navigate a variety of platforms (including zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Classroom, etc.).

 

 

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • A knowledge (minimum BA degree in an associated field) and passion about the Holocaust, genocide, and more general human rights issues from both an historical and contemporary perspective.
  • Experience working with elementary and/or high school-aged students.
  • Flexible schedule that is open to early mornings and a willingness to travel across Canada to present programs to students from 8 to 18 years of age.
  • Ability to teach in French an asset.

 

Applicants should send a cover letter and resumé to Melissa Mikel at mmikel@fswc.ca.  Please reference “FSWC Educator” in the subject line. This role will remain open until the post is filled.

 

FSWC welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. We encourage applications from individuals within the employment equity categories. FSWC is committed to equity and diversity, and to a positive, supportive working environment. Please let us know should you require accommodation during any part of this recruitment process.

title: Post Office Assistant - Term
description:
Job Requisition Id: 155880

Business Function: Retail

Primary City: Forteau

Other Location(s):

Province: Newfoundland and Labrador

Employment Type: On Call

Employment Status: Term

Language Requirement: English Essential

Employee Class and Level: RVSGA10 - Level 1

Working Hours: On-Call

Number of Vacancies: 2

Salary: $18.08/hr

Job Closing Date (MM/DD/YYYY): 05/18/2022

All qualified candidates will be considered however preference will be given to Indigenous people (First Nations, Metis or Inuit) or persons with a disability. This is a special measure employment equity initiative and candidates from this group who wish to qualify for preferential consideration must self-identify.

Health and safety is our highest priority. With vaccination shown to be the most effective tool to reduce the risk of transmission of COVID-19 and protecting individuals from severe consequences of this virus, Canada Post has implemented a Vaccination Practice. Accordingly, you will be required to attest to being fully vaccinated. If you are unable to be vaccinated, you may request an accommodation due to a medical, religious, or other prohibited ground of discrimination as described in the Canadian Human Rights Act.

Job Description

If you have ambition, talent and drive, consider a fast-moving career with Canada Post. We are currently seeking an on-call Post Office Assistant who will use a customer-focused approach when providing counter services to customers.

Note: The ideal candidate should reside in the community. Applicants outside the community in which the Post Office is located may be considered as needed.

Job Responsibilities
  • Sell postal products and service to the business community and public
  • Sort, distribute and process mail into appropriate classifications
  • Provide customers with information and forms
  • Address delivery and service difficulties to resolve problems thoroughly and quickly
Qualifications

Job Responsibilities (continued)
  • High school or provincial equivalency and/or experience in business administration
  • Training and/or experience interacting with the public in a retail and/or service environment, including sales and cash transactions
  • Understanding of general or post office accounting systems.
  • Physically fit to lift mail containers of up to 50 lb, push or pull boxes, sort mail and stand for extended periods of time
  • Flexibility to be available for temporary, on-call work
Other Information

CANDIDATES WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE:
  • A character reference letter
Note: The ideal candidate should reside in the community. Applicants within a 50 km radius of the Post Office may be considered as needed.

As part of the selection process selected candidates will be required to complete a security screening process.

Safety Sensitive Positions

This position may be considered a Safety Sensitive position.

Employment Equity

Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous People, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.

Disability is defined as a persistent or episodic physical, sensory, or mental health condition and/or functional limitation. Disability includes both visible and hidden conditions and/or limitations that may impact vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, mental/psychological, and memory.

Conflict of Interest

The Conflict of Interest Policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.

Accommodation

Canada Post is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you are contacted by Canada Post regarding a job opportunity, please advise if you have any restrictions that need to be accommodated. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Important Message

Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as Canada Post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Leadership Behaviours

Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner, that aligns with the corporation's best interests.

Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds themselves and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.

Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.

Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.

Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.

Our Values

We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.

Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.

Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.

Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion.

Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect.

Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity.

Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.

title: Office Administrator - Fast Hire
description:
We are looking to hire an energetic Office Administrator to join our amazing team at Simply Foods in Delta, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time Office Administrator is a terrific opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in presentation, project management and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Office Administrator at Simply Foods today!

Looking for a friendly, eager Office Administrator for a busy production kitchen

Full Time: Sunday to Thursday 8:00 am - 4:30 pm

Location: Tilbury Industrial Park, Delta

Responsibilities
  • Send client information such as menus, quotes, and booking confirmations
  • Compile and print labels, BEO's, and production reports for the kitchen
  • Phone and email communications
  • Manage client concerns, questions, and complaints
Requirements:
  • Comfortable with various programs: excel, word, software
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Friendly, organized, and efficient
Please Submit Your Resume

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Competitive salary

description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Aide
description:
WINNIPEG LOCALS ONLY

We are looking for an entry-level digital administrative aide. A strong understanding of Apple computers and social media is a must.

Skills you will develop:

- Website design
- Content strategy
- Digital customer service
- SEO assistance
- Client relations

& much more. FT hours with the eventual opportunity to tap into the company revenue share program.

Misc hours, but preference will be given to someone available weekends and 3 days per week 6am - 2pm.

Must be outgoing, able to work with a team, and willing to have fun at work. We have a basketball hoop, VR, weird competitions, and all kinds of interesting activities.

title: Receptionist, Kleinfeld (Hudson's Bay)
description:
What This Position Is All About

The receptionist is a critical position within Kleinfeld as this role is often the first encounter of the Kleinfeld experience for the customer. They need to be an Ambassador of the brand while providing exceptional service and administrative support for the team.

Who You Are:Constantly looking for opportunity to improve the way things are done. Can be depended on for a unique perspective.
  • Constantly looking for opportunity to improve the way things are done. Can be depended on for a unique perspective.
  • Is a good listener, and can get cooperation with little disruption.
  • Generates a variety of approaches to problem solving including new and novel ideas.
You Also Have
  • Minimum of two years relevant experience, working with in the hospitality or bridal industry is an asset
  • Intermediate to expert level competence with MS Office and database applications.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
  • Ensures confidentiality, diplomacy and tact at all times
  • Full flexibility with schedule (including evenings and weekends)
As The Receptionist, You Will
  • Welcome customers into the shop in a demeanor reflective of the Kleinfeld brand
  • Assist with scheduling of appointments for customers if required
  • Respond to phone, email and in-person enquiries providing general information and referring enquiries to appropriate sources based on a broad knowledge of Kleinfeld and Hudson's Bay's, procedures, protocols and personnel
  • Maintain, sort and distribute all communications coming into shop for the team
  • Maintain entry of key information into Kleinfeld system as well as pulling of reports on a regular basis
  • Support Sales Manager in the performance of a wide variety of administrative and support functions, ranging from complex to routine, all of which contribute to the efficient and professional operation of the salon
How Often You May Travel
  • NA
Your Life And Career At HBC
  • Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!
  • Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
  • A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
  • Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
  • An amazing employee discount
Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

title: Evening Receptionist
description:
Summary:

Reporting to the Facilities Manager, perform receptionist and clerical duties at ISSofBC Welcome Centre location.

Responsibilities:

  • Responds to all incoming phone calls. Provides general information about various ISSofBC programs, training and other activities. Receives and transmits messages. Transfers calls to appropriate department or staff member as required.
  • Greets walk-in clients, students, volunteers, visitors, and the public. Responds to general enquiries about services and programs provided. Refers individuals to appropriate contacts within the organization. If clients are requesting services which are not provided at Welcome Centre, refers individuals to appropriate external agencies.
  • Monitors flow of clients, students, volunteers, visitors, and the public to prevent unauthorized entry. Maintains order in the reception area i.e. no cell phone use, no loud noise, talking etc. Responds to security/emergency incidents in accordance with established policies and procedures. Reports any incidents promptly to the Facilities Manager or designate.
  • Maintains and updates Reception Resource Manual. Ensures flyers/brochures displays are tidy and adequately stocked with current materials. Post information on designated bulletin boards and ensures boards are tidy and up-to-date.
  • Assists administrative staff with clerical functions such as photocopying, faxing, etc. Assembles information kits.
  • Assists in special events and activities such as AGM.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Completion of a certificate or diploma in office administration, business or related discipline supplemented by a minimum of one (1) year of related experience preferably in a related social service field, OR an equivalent combination of education, training and experience acceptable to the employer. Fluency in a second language is an asset.

Skills and Abilities:

  • Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written English.
  • Ability to deal effectively and courteously with culturally diverse clientele, staff, and the public.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in MS Word and Internet.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage time and resources effectively.
  • Ability to carry out the duties of the position.

ISSofBC’s mission and values emphasize inclusivity and recognition of individuals’ unique talents. In recruiting and developing our staff, we see strength in diversity of backgrounds, lived experiences, and identities. We welcome and encourage applicants who bring new perspectives and experiences to our team.


Role Salary Range: $19.38 – $25.33 per hour

Expected Starting Range: $19.38 – $20.57. Dependent on education, training, experience, and internal equity. Wage grids are reviewed annually.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
WP Osborne Executive Search is partnered with Starlight Investments in a search for an Administrative Assistant.


Starlight Investments is a privately held Toronto-based, full service, multi-family and commercial real estate investment and asset management company driven by an experienced team of 350 professionals. The company currently manages over $25 billion of direct real estate as well as real estate investment securities. Investment vehicles include institutional joint ventures, True North Commercial REIT, Starlight U.S. Multi-Family Funds, Starlight Western Canada Multi-Family Funds, Northview Fund and Starlight Capital Funds. Starlight Investment’s portfolio consists of approximately 73,000 multi-residential units across Canada and the U.S. and over 9.0 million square feet of commercial properties. For more information, visit www.starlightinvest.com


Administrative Assistant


Reporting to the Manager, Administration, and on behalf of the Canadian Multi-Family, the Administrative Assistant will be responsible for the management of all administrative duties, travel, calendar scheduling, internal/external communication and special projects as required.


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide direct administrative and office support to various departments;
  • Prepare travel schedules, book travel arrangements, and make reservations for team members;
  • Maintain electronic corporate files;
  • Create and track Purchase Orders & coordinate with third party venders;
  • Complete expenses for Executive Directors/VP’s;
  • Invoicing – track, receive and submit invoices for payment;
  • Assist with weekly market rent changes;
  • Oversee new vendor onboarding, facilitate and track vendor approvals;
  • Handle all incoming and outgoing mail and couriers;
  • Arrange property tours for financing/new properties;
  • Consolidate information for Property Manager Transition files;
  • Liaise with different departments to obtain and consolidate information required for property transition and set up (acquisition, disposition, etc.);
  • Assist with tenant meetings where required;
  • Maintain capex project schedule – one source for all AMs, directors, VP to access;
  • Coordinate with IT, Marketing, Finance and third-party property managers to ensure newly acquired properties are setup in a timely manner across all systems;
  • Manage third party reports, weekly, monthly and quarterly for all teams;
  • Handle all incoming and outgoing mail and couriers;
  • Prepare and review presentations as required;
  • Treat all responsibilities with confidentiality and discretion;
  • Assist with special projects and any additional duties as necessary;
  • Provide reception coverage (approximately 2hrs/wk) and additional coverage as requested.


Qualifications

The Administrative Assistant must possess a post-secondary Diploma in Office Administration or relevant discipline; a minimum of 3 years of experience in an administrative role; strong knowledge of office procedures and practices; superior proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite; experience in booking complex air & ground travel; is resourceful, flexible and detail oriented; has strong writing skills with the ability to draft memos, letters and press release documents. This candidate will have excellent time management and organizational skills, and interacts with employees, various management levels and the public at large.


Application

Qualified candidates can submit their resume. In accordance with the company’s mandatory vaccination policy, only applicants who have been fully vaccinated, or who are unable to vaccinate due to valid medical or religious reasons will be considered for an interview.

title: Early Childhood Educator
description:
West Moberly First Nations is located 35 minutes/40 kms northwest of Chetwynd, BC at the west end of Moberly Lake. The area is surrounded by the lake, rivers, trees, and mountains. Our community values its mission which is to positively enhance the procession of West Moberly First Nations ethics with respect, honesty, fairness, integrity, and self motivation by promoting open communication with members, Chief & Council and staff.  

Our early childcare program focuses on holistic child development. Our philosophy is to support healthy child development in the areas of physical, social, emotional, intellectual, language and spiritual growth. 


About the position

The successful applicant will work alongside an Early Years childcare team supporting the development and implementation of the West Moberly First Nations (WMFN) Dakii Yadze Centre, a licensed Multi Age Care Program, primarily serving ages 12 months to 5 years. This program operates in accordance with the Community Care Facility Act. This is a full time position with an average of 35 hours/week from Monday to Thursday & alternating Fridays.


The Successful Candidate

You will preferably have experience working in a First Nations community with knowledge of cultural practices or a keen interest in the culture, however not mandatory. You have a zest for play-based learning, outdoor education and working knowledge of the BC Early Learning Framework.

Your toolkit will bring:

  • Self motivation with strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • An engaging style who works well as part of a team and is also able to work independently.
  • Certificate required, or willingness to enroll in the ECE/ECEA online/local courses
  • Courses, training or education in a relevant field (child development, child guidance, health, safety & nutrition)
  • Childcare First Aid (or willingness to obtain) as specified by Community Care Facility Act
  • Relevant work experience in an educational setting (i.e. teacher, teacher assistant, volunteer, daycare)
  • Experience working with both children and their families/guardians
  • Knowledge of child development and the various stages of development
  • Knowledge of Aboriginal culture and experience working in First Nations community
  • Must be 19 years of age
  • Clean Vulnerable Sector Criminal Records Check.

title: Administrative Clerk
description:
49 Bespoke Inc.

 

49 Bespoke Inc. is hiring an administrative Clerk. Some of the duties include answering telephone calls, customer service, administrative work with the General Manager.

 

                                                                    JOB DESCRIPTION

 

LOCATION:                                                137 Buttermill Avenue, Concord, ON L4K 3X5

 

HOURS OF OPERATIION:                        10:00 AM to 6:00 PM (Negotiable)

 

POSITION:                                                 Administrative Clerk

 

COMPENSATION:                                     Depending on Qualifications

 

The Administrative Clerk reports to the General Manager.

 

Duties and responsibilities include providing administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the office, supporting the General Manager and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication.

 

He or she is responsible for confidential and time sensitive material and is familiar with all aspects of the company’s products, procedures, practices, and operations.

 

He or she will have the ability to effectively communicate in person, by phone, facsimile, email, or other correspondence by ensuring that all Administrative Clerk duties are completed accurately and delivered with high quality in a timely manner.

 

He or she may direct and lead the work of others and be able to be relied upon for his or her experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and objectives.

 

He or she will be comfortable working with a computer and have the aptitude to quickly understand the operations of the company and assist in a multi-faceted manner.

 

A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

 

REQUIREMENTS:                        1-3+ years experience as administrative Clerk with Microsoft Office experience.

 

BENEFITS:                                     Employee’s have some food and beverages provided in a comfortable work environment with payroll and WSIB. Salary to commensurate with experience, business casual dressing, and otherwise flexibility in the operations of the company.

 

 

APPLY VIA EMAIL:                                    4@49Bespoke.com

 

 

April 15, 2022

title: Executive Assistant
description:
About Us:

Betstamp is the future of sports betting. We were founded in 2020 with the mission to make sports betting easy and accessible with everyone, while improving your odds of winning your bets. Our team is dedicated to creating the best user experience possible, while educating the public about sports betting.

How We Work:

Betstamp aggregates sports betting odds from every sportsbook so you can easily compare and get the best price before you bet. You can track, manage, and analyze your sports bets for consistent improvement, in addition to being able to follow some of your favourite betting personalities and your friends’ performances in the app to see how they do. Save time, save money, and have more fun betting on sports.

The Opportunity:

Betstamp is launching in Ontario for the first time in January 2022, and our team is planning on ramping up Brand Awareness across the province.

As a new employee, you’ll join on the ground level of the best Sports Betting aggregator on the market, growing faster than ever. As we continue to grow, it is imperative that we have resources in place to support the infrastructure and processes in place to allow our team to continue to grow.

This role is perfect for someone with past experience in an Executive Assistant role, looking for exposure to a new industry, with potential for career growth and development. This is a full-time position.

What makes a great Executive Assistant?
  • A great communicator (written & verbal)
  • Strong organizational & time management skills
  • Experience managing sensitive/confidential information
  • Excellent MS Office/G Suite Knowledge
  • Past experience in a similar Executive Assistant role is an asset

Responsibilities
  • Providing administrative assistance, such as writing and editing e-mails, drafting memos, and preparing communications on others behalf
  • Maintaining comprehensive and accurate records
  • Performing minor accounting duties
  • Organizing meetings, including scheduling, sending reminders, and organizing catering when necessary
  • Answering/making phone calls in a polite and professional manner
  • Managing the executive’s calendar, including making appointments and prioritizing the most sensitive matters

Compensation & Start Date
  • Competitive compensation
  • This is a full-time position
  • Start Date: May 2022

The Basics
  • Must have laptop/access to internet
  • 1-2 years of experience in a corporate environment
  • Experience with Microsoft Suite – Powerpoint/Excel/Word
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Interest in sports and/or sports betting - is an asset

title: Travel Consultant
description:
Are you looking to be a part of a dynamic team and provide excellent travel service to our top leading clients? If you are looking to utilize your skills at the right company, we have the opportunity for you!

Travel Consultant

Full-time, (Virtual) Homebased in Canada

We’re BCD Travel, one of the world’s leading corporate travel management companies with offices around the globe. We help our clients travel smart and achieve more. People join our company because we provide a dynamic work environment, where no two days are the same. And our people stay with us because we care about their work-life balance. But don’t just take our word for it we've been voted top place to work and recognized by Investors In People, Flexjobs and Forbes.

This position performs at an expert level and demonstrates an extensive understanding and applicability of all areas in the travel industry. You work independently on requests and thrive in a fast paced environment. The Travel Consultant will take the initiative to provide assistance to team members and management as requested.

A snapshot of this opportunity
  • Search and confirm travel reservations for the customer
  • Provide travel offers and general travel advice to travelers
  • Strong understanding of a client travel policy to guide and consistently provide consultation to the customer
  • Excellent knowledge and application of travel supplier rules
  • Provide the customer with the required industry information, such as low fares, exchange costs and penalties
  • Fulfill all requests regarding necessary regulations (DOT, TSA, passports, visas, etc.)
  • Supports BCD Travel and client driven initiatives
How Can You Set Yourself Apart
  • Experience in the travel management industry
  • Strong experience with Sabre
  • Proven ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Demonstrate excellent professional customer service and problem resolution skills
What We Offer You

At BCD Travel, we work with highly motivated and passionate people. We value open communication, collaboration, and a flexible work-life balance. We offer unique, often global, experiences that empower you to develop and grow within the organization. Sustainability and helping others is also high on our list. We make a difference through charitable activities in our communities across the globe.

About Us

BCD Travel helps companies make the most of what they spend on travel. We give travelers innovative tools that keep them safe and productive and help them make good choices on the road. We partner with travel and procurement leaders to simplify the complexities of business travel, drive savings and satisfaction, and move whole companies toward their goals. In short, we help our clients travel smart and achieve more. We make this happen in 109 countries with a global client retention rate of 98%, the highest in the industry. For more information, visit www.bcdtravel.com.

Interested?

Create your profile and upload your resume/cover letter via our website. Feel free to reach out to us with any questions via americas.recruiting@bcdtravel.com. Note send your application via the website only.

Stay Informed About New Career Opportunities At BCD Travel

Use the 'notify me' button in our careers center to be one of the first to hear about interesting opportunities in the future. On the left-hand side of the screen, you can select filters to see updates on all vacancies that match your interest.
  • Note We’ll give preference to internal and/or furloughed employees.
and *CAJM

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Are you looking for a career in team operations and client support? 

 

Location: Ottawa, ON

Hours: 35 - 44 hours/week

Type of employment: full time, permanent

 

Languages

  • Bilingual with working proficiency in English and French.

 

Education and Experience

  • Either have relevant education or experience (at least one is required);
  • Be knowledgeable Microsoft Office, project management software, and accounting software (Quick Books).


Administrative Skills and Responsibilities

  • Liaise with clients either in person, phone, written communication, etc.;
  • Oversee the good function of the daily activities of the firm;
  • Receive all in-bound calls, emails and visitors;
  • Prepare, review, and edit correspondence, forms, and other documents;
  • Send and receive messages;
  • Provide administrative support to all team members;
  • Sort, file, and retrieve documents according to established filing systems;
  • Sort, process, and verify applications, receipts and other documents;
  • Maintain records of filed and removed materials;
  • Perform basic bookkeeping tasks such as preparing invoices and bank deposits;
  • Provide information to clients and public;
  • Photocopy and collate documents for distribution, mailing and filing;
  • Review, evaluate and implement new administrative procedures;
  • Establish work priorities and ensure procedures are followed and deadlines are met;
  • Invoicing clients and following up on payment,
  • Assemble data and prepare periodic and special reports, manuals and correspondence;
  • Other duties will be assigned as required


Personal Skills

At Boyer & Boyer, CPA, we are looking for the right fit, candidates who have more than just the hard skills listed above. If you are looking to acquire accounting skills, we can provide you with on the job training. This is why who you are when you walk into the office is just as if not more important.

 

We are looking for a candidate who:

  • Has strong communication and customer service skills (personable, service oriented, friendly);
  • Has strong organization and time management skills (can work under pressure in a fast pace environment);
  • Has strong analytical and strategic thinking skills;
  • Is motivated and ambitious (strong work ethic and always looking to learn and take on new responsibilities);
  • Excels at both working with a team and working individually;
  • Wants to make a positive impact on clients;
  • Wants to grow and develop their skills;
  • Wants part of the growth and development of the firm.

 

Boyer & Boyer, CPA (BBCPA) is a dynamic and fun work environment that offers tremendous growth to each member and an unparalleled wealth of knowledge and experience. Team members are welcomed into a community of like-minded and ambitious professionals where they participate directly in the growth and advancement of the firm.


If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career, a place to belong and thrive and a great team of colleagues who want to be part of your development, send your resume to : pascale@boyer-boyer.com

title: Receptionist
description:
Duties include, but are not limited to;
• Serve visitors by greeting, welcoming, directing and announcing them appropriately
• Answer, screen and forward any incoming phone calls while providing basic information when needed
• Receive and sort daily mail/deliveries/couriers
• Update appointment calendars and schedule meetings/appointments
• Perform other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, faxing etc.
• Data Entry of supplier invoices for various companies
Start date at earliest convenience with compensation to commensurate with experience. Students are welcome to apply.

All resume information is received in confidence. While we appreciate all applications received, we can only contact directly those candidates selected for an interview.

To learn more about Dalron Group Limited please visit our website at https://dalron.com .

Hourly Rate Range: $18.00-$22.00/hourly compensation dependant on experience.

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow all current municipal and provincial mandated precautions.

Submit all resumes to; ssanti@dalron.com

title: Early Childhood Educator
description:
We have just opened another centre and we need more passionate educators to join our amazing team!


We know and appreciate the important work you do in preparing the next generation. The events of the past few years have only served to highlight how critical ECEs are. We, at Atelier Kids, have known this for some time.


Atelier Kids is a Reggio-inspired child care centre in High Park. We pride ourselves in providing a homelike environment but still delivering on educational excellence for our community. We have a Forest School and Urban Gardening Curriculum in addition to our world-class curriculum. We just opened our second location, located steps away from our current location! Good things are happening.

  • Are you hoping to find a place where you can be appreciated for the important work you do?
  • Do you picture yourself working in a calm and natural space, working alongside children and learning with them, and allowing children’s learning to unfold in its own time?
  • Do you want to see great things happen in early learning & education?

If this is your dream, Atelier Kids is the place for you.

We have opportunities for both Part Time and Full Time Professional RECE and ECAs for our Toddler, Prekindergarten and Kindergarten program. For more info visit: www.atelierkids.com/careers

Ideally, we are looking for individuals with the following:

  • You are a registered ECE and possess the training and documents required by the Ministry of Education to work within a child care setting. ● Enjoy being a team player and possess a passion for working with children ● Passionate about spending time outdoors whenever possible
  • Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues to create programs and healthy learning environments
  • Desire to continue to learn and grow in the early childhood profession through professional development opportunities

Why join us?

  • Competitive Salary: $20 to $25 per hour depending on years of experience and/or academic credentials; our centre qualifies for the PWE funding so you will be eligible to make $2 an hour as a bonus. In addition, you may qualify for the additional $1 hour wage grant proposed.
  • Paid, dedicated design time for programming and documentation
  • New and modern facility with close proximity to TTC Subway and High Park, the 400-acre natural park across the street, for frequent and lengthy visits to emphasize our extended outdoor curriculum
  • Daily support from on-site Pedagogista (Educational Ambassador) and Atelierista (Artist in Residence) and permanent part-time staff
  • On-going professional development in the Reggio Emilia philosophy along with others through a custom program created by some of the top minds in Ontario. 3 dedicated professional development days throughout the year.

Please apply by visiting: https://www.atelierkids.com/careers/

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
• Description:* Looking for an enthusiastic professional to fill the position of a data entry associate. This position requires finding prospects and inputting data into our database in a timely manner. Should have the ability to quickly find errors and update inaccurate information. It is key to compile and sort large data sets. Will also be responsible of knowing the ins & outs of the database to support other department requests. Prospects online, day-to-day tasks, web browsing, repetitive tasks. A cleansing task, contact info is up to date. Manufacturing and R&D companies.

Data entry skills – pivot tables and v-look ups. Attention to detail, extension numbers, correcting spellings.

More on the cleanup side

Team of 6 – working individually
  • Skills:* data entry accuracy, data entry alphanumeric, data entry excel
  • Top Skills Details:* data entry accuracy, data entry alphanumeric
  • Additional Skills & Qualifications:*
  • 6month-1 year experience as a data entry associate
  • Experience using Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP)
  • Resourceful, detail orientated and strong communication skills
  • Can work as an individual and in a team
  • Experience Level:* Entry Level

À propos d'Aston Carter:

Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.

About Aston Carter:

Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Parts Data Entry Clerk - Urgent
description:
We are hiring a remarkable Parts Data Entry Clerk to join our vibrant team at Villeneuve Construction in Hearst, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Parts Data Entry Clerk is an amazing opportunity to develop competitive skills.

If you are strong in creativity, critical thinking and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Parts Data Entry Clerk at Villeneuve Construction today!

Job Description

The Parts Data Entry Clerk will be responsible for updating and maintaining information on our company parts purchasing and work orders system. The incumbent will also be responsible for collecting and entering data in databases and maintaining accurate records of company information.

Key Responsibilities
  • Enter data by inputting text based and numerical information from source documents within time limits;
  • Receive purchase orders and enter work orders;
  • Assist in different parts room activities;
  • Research and obtain further information for incomplete documents;
  • Scan documents and print files, when needed;
  • Verify accuracy and completeness of documents;
  • Perform routine data entry and other office support activities including creating, sorting and filing documents;
  • Any other responsibilities/duties as required and/or as assigned
Qualifications/Skills
  • Minimum 1 year of proven data entry work experience, as a Data Entry Operator or Office Clerk;
  • High school diploma, additional computer training or certification will be an asset;
  • Experience with MS Office and data programs;
  • Knowledge of techniques for document control, tracking, distribution and follow-ups
  • Familiarity with administrative duties;
  • Excellent typing speed and accuracy;
  • Excellent knowledge of correct spelling, grammar and punctuation;
  • Great attention to details and strong organization skills;
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality;
  • Mature personality and sound judgement skills;
  • Act in a professional and ethical manner at all times
Apply

Job Info

Location

Villeneuve Construction (Hearst Division)

Opening

Immediately

Terms of Employment

Permanent - Full-Time

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Advantageous package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Company description

Shoplazza is an online e-Commerce platform designed for people worldwide who wish to start or continue their business ideas of all shapes and sizes. Merchants are empowered with a powerful set of leading global tools to learn to create their online presence, sell, promote, and run their dream business online. With our global expansion based on rapid growth, Shoplazza welcomes new talents to build North American business units.


Brief description

The Executive Assistant will support the Chief Operating Officer from Shoplazza and influence day-to-day efficiency by providing professional and high-quality administrative support in a dynamic and collaborative environment. The successful individual must have the ability to multi-task and meet time-sensitive deadlines and strong analytical skills.

A successful candidate will be highly organized, extremely detail-oriented, self-motivated, able to handle confidential information and demonstrate the ability to respond effectively to changing workloads and priorities. The Executive Assistant must communicate well, manage and coordinate multiple assignments and people simultaneously.


Tasks

· Prepares notices, mailings, agendas, minutes and other materials for the Board of Directors, and Committee meetings.

· Attends meetings with the Board of Directors, Executive and Committees, and coordinates Director & other staff meetings as required.

· Prepare records and files minutes of each meeting.

· Maintains general correspondence for the COO.

· Organizes annual Committee process.

· Oversees calendar, directories etc. for the COO.

· Coordinates scheduling the COO’s appointments and conferences.

· Takes and relays messages for the COO and other Management staff as required.

· Photocopying, faxing, typing meeting notes, making travel arrangements.


Qualifications and requirements

· 4 to 5 years of assistant experience

· Computer Knowledge (MS Excel, MS Word - google docs would be an asset)

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Strong interpersonal and problem-solving abilities

· Will be required to maintain a flexible work schedule, including evenings, weekends and holidays.

· Ability to handle administrative details independently while exercising good judgment in keeping team members informed.

· High levels of integrity and discretion.

· Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

· Experience in Coordination.

· Mandarin is an asset.


Working conditions

· This is a permanent full-time position, working remotely, and you may be required to come to the office occasionally.

· Travel may be required

· Attend presentations

· Flexible working schedules: weekends, nights and holidays as the business requires


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Tour Guide Lead (Part-time, Permanent)
description:
To apply, visit our online application portal: https://torontobicycletours.campbrainstaff.com/

This is a permanent part-time position with a guaranteed minimum of 20 hours/week year-round.

We are looking for two Tour Guide Leads to join us. Reporting to the Founder, a Tour Guide Lead delivers tours and assists with the day-to-day running of the business, ensuring a smooth, safe operation that delivers excellent service and memorable experiences to our guests and clients.

Our business runs seven days a week in peak tourist season. A typical work week for a Tour Guide Lead is 20 hours, but the weekly schedule will vary depending on client demand and time of year – there will be weekend and evening work.

We are looking for a person who is looking for a unique opportunity to apply & grow their skills as people leader, problem solver, skilled cyclist and Toronto ambassador.

Our guides come from a variety of backgrounds, but they all live in (and love) Toronto, enjoy the outdoors, and are comfortable leading and entertaining groups. Maybe you’re a grad student who loves to talk about urban affairs, an actor who relishes the opportunity to tell a great story, a hospitality worker who loves taking care of customers, or just an avid cyclist who believes that the best way to get to know a city is on two wheels.

Are YOU ready to roll?

Responsibilities
  • Lead Bicycle Tours and perform Guest Services duties as required
  • Assist with managing day-to-day operations, resolving any operational issues and/or customer service escalations
  • Provide leadership, training, direct supervision and coaching to our teams: Tour Guides, Guest Services (Customer Service)
  • Help to assuring that all shifts and positions are properly staffedto deliver our services
  • Coordinate execution of special events for clients (e.g. private group tours, rentals and on-sites)
  • Help to foster & maintain a safe, fun, & smooth working environment
  • Ensure proper maintenance & upkeep of our bicycles, equipment, software, office and supplies
  • Develop, improve and document processes, procedures
  • Represent the company externally – maintaining good relationships with partners, clients, suppliers and the general public
  • Support Recruiting Activities
  • Support Sales & Marketing Activities (e.g. Third Party relationships, Social Media)
  • Support Program Development: new tour & event offerings
  • Support Bookkeeping and Accounting activities
Minimum Requirements
  • Is a strong City Cyclist – has lots of experience and comfort with safe riding in an urban environment
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and people management skills, with an ability to lead, organize, and engage groups of people of all ages and diverse backgrounds
  • Has a deep familiarity with Toronto, and a love for the city
  • Can read maps
  • Experience/Education in Tourism, Hospitality, Performing Arts, and/or Customer Service would be considered an asset
  • Experience in leadership/managerial roles is an asset
  • Experience & comfort leading & working in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong problem-solving ability with an eye for detail
  • Strong computer/internet skills. Familiarity with MS Office (Word, Excel), instant messaging applications, and social media platforms
  • Great phone & email manner
  • Dependable, trustworthy, honest, and self-motivated
  • Professional, proactive, organized, and efficient
  • Interest in history and current affairs, and in getting to know people from all over the world
Working @ Toronto Bicycle Tours & Events

Our business runs seven days a week in peak tourist season. A typical work week for a Tour Guide Lead is minimum 20 hours, but the weekly schedule will vary depending on client demand and time of year – there will be weekend and evening work.

How To Apply

To apply, visit our online application portal: https://torontobicycletours.campbrainstaff.com/

Our online application should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. You’ll need to upload a copy of your resume after you’ve completed the application.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us – jobs@torontobicycletours.com

We will review applications as they are received and look forward to hearing from you.

About Toronto Bicycle Tours

Toronto Bicycle Tours & Events is an award-winning company providing sightseeing tours, rentals and events in the Greater Toronto Area for guests of all ages and abilities (from ages 1 to 80+) from around the world. Our guests have a fantastic, fun time while connecting to our city and gaining a deeper appreciation for Toronto, its people, culture, history and food. We are celebrating our 10th year in business.
