title: Survey Caller
description:
Are you passionate about customer service? Are you passionate about helping others? Are you passionate about educating others? Do you speak another language? Then we have the job for YOU!

Randstad is looking for Survey Callers to assist with an upcoming provincial election. This is a temporary position, roughly 1-2 months, with full-time hours. To find out more, read below.

Type: Temporary; 1-2 months

Pay: $15.61 + $2 bonus per hour on the phone

Start Date: Monday, March 21st

Hours of Operation: Mon - Fri 12:30pm - 9pm OR 5pm-9pm. Sat-Sun 12pm-5pm

Location: Work from Home

Must be able to connect the computer to the modem

Create your own schedule!

Advantages
  • Full-time hours
  • 7-8 week contract
  • Create your own schedule on a week to week basis
  • Paid weekly
  • $2 bonus per hour on the phone
  • Be a part of the Vaccine rollout
  • Get good working experience

Responsibilities
  • Making outbound calls
  • Following a survey and asking customers specific questions
  • Calling in regards to a political election
  • Updating customers answers into the system

Qualifications
  • Customer service or Call Center experience is a must
  • Clear communication
  • Positive thoughts about the COVID-19 Vaccine
  • Customer-focused and tech-savvy

Summary

If you are interested and you like to learn more, apply now!
  • Apply online
  • Send a copy of your resume to anastasia.kourniotis@randstad.ca OR andrea.francis@randstad.ca and mention "Survey Caller"

Looking forward to hearing from you

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Executive Asistant
description:
About Bunch

We're building the home for gamers in the Metaverse. Bunch is a digital world that allows players to meet up, hang out, and jump into any of their favorite games across the App Store. Our mission is to bring people together through the games that they love when they are physically apart!

Our team comes from companies like Meta, Google, and Kik Messenger and combines the experience of building large-scale social applications, developer platforms, and games. We've raised over $28M from top investors like General Catalyst and London Venture Partners, and many of the largest game companies including Electronic Arts, Krafton (PUBG), Take-Two Interactive, Ubisoft, Supercell, Riot Games, Miniclip, and Tencent.

Our current app Bunch 1.0 is one of the most popular group video chat apps for gaming that brought millions together through the pandemic. Bunch 2.0 is an evolution of it that turns it from a video chat application into a digital world that's more fun, and easier to meet new people. Bunch 2.0 is currently invite only, in the meantime you can download Bunch 1.0 here: https://bunch.app.link/BKlS8V2hImb

Check out our tech stack here: https://stackshare.io/bunchlive/bunch

Meet our team: https://web.bunch.live/team

Learn about our culture: https://web.bunch.live/join

Recent Press: https://cheddar.com/media/gaming-platform-bunch-joins-the-metaverse

🤩 About the Role

The Executive Assistant will be responsible for providing exceptional administrative support and managing the day-to-day operations of Bunch's CEO, arranging travels and company events. We are looking for someone who is tech-savvy, proactive, hyper-organized, adaptable, and capable of quickly developing an EA role in a fast-growing environment - a high level of professional integrity and confidentiality is crucial. To be successful in this role, you must be a forward thinker who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions.

This is a unique opportunity for someone looking to join a small team working on a fast-growing social gaming product, and make an impact.

💪 What you will do
  • Manage calendars of the CEO and the executive team priorities with prompt and sound decision-making skills
  • Manage attendees, agenda, and logistics of all executive-level meetings and departmental events while anticipating needs, conflicts and solving scheduling issues
  • Manage all logistics for internal and external meetings; including Executive Team meetings, conferences, partner meetings, and Board of Directors obligations
  • Planning and organizing company-wide events
  • Arranging domestic and international travels and accommodations for the Executive Leadership Team
  • Ability to work autonomously and implement processes with minimal direction
  • Gathering and organizing operational document
  • Maintain confidentiality and professionalism for all communications and documentation

We're excited about you because you have:
  • Previous experience as an Executive Assistant, or position with relevant and comparable skills, preferably in the tech sector
  • Strong proficiency with G-Suite, Notion, Zoom
  • Tech-savvy and can quickly adapt to new tooling
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills
  • Multitasking; being able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Exceptionally resourceful, self-sufficient, punctual, and reliable
  • Being able to learn and adapt quickly, while facing continuously changing demands
  • Great attention to detail and high levels of thoroughness
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
  • High levels of honesty, discretion, and integrity

🚀 Working at Bunch comes with:
  • Competitive salary and stock options 💰
  • Comprehensive health, dental and vision plans 💪
  • Outfit your home office with the gear you need to work effectively 🎧
  • Regular team retreats (...to be continued post-covid) 🚤
  • Regular game nights and other fun activities (... in the mean time) 🎮

🌎 Location
  • We're an entirely remote company with development hubs in Kitchener/Waterloo, Toronto, New York, and San Francisco. We can help you to outfit your home office with all the gear and tools you need.

We believe excellence is impossible without diversity, and would love to hear from women, men, non-binary, trans, parents, non-parents, and people of all ages, ethnicities and sexual orientations — especially you. ✨🌈🦄

title: Office Administrator
description:
Description

Who we are:

Founded in 2001, Vivid Seats (NASDAQ: SEAT) is a leading online ticket marketplace committed to becoming the ultimate partner for connecting fans to the live events, artists, and teams they love. We believe in the power of experiences and are fiercely dedicated to building products that inspire human connections. Named as one of Built In Chicago’s top 10 places to work in 2021, we believe that our People are our greatest competitive advantage. To support our People, we have built a company culture that empowers our employees to embrace challenges, encourages unity through collaboration, and seeks to constantly evolve by leveraging data and inspiring innovation.

The Opportunity

As the Toronto Office Receptionist you are the face and voice of the organization. You’ll be responsible for greeting all guests and callers, including answering phone calls, welcoming and directing visitors, and assisting with overall office maintenance. This position will also work with a variety of vendors for tasks such as shipping, deliveries, and building maintenance. To succeed in this position, you must be able to provide general administrative services support, maintain professional communication, have the ability to multitask, work independently, and stay organized. As the point person for all day-to-day facilities operations for our Toronto office space, you will guarantee that everything runs smoothly, identifying inefficiencies before they become a problem and creating processes that are built to scale.

How your role contributes to the success of Vivid Seats:
  • Provide organizational and administrative support for a growing office of 40+ employees.
  • Procure and manage facilities services and vendors.
  • Maintain all office supplies, equipment, and food and beverage offerings.
  • Play a meaningful role in our employee experience journey, creating and maintaining a welcoming, amenity rich, and innovative environment.
  • Oversee Toronto operational needs—including kitchen and office inventory, space planning, security, maintenance, and deliveries—with an eye toward automation and predictability.
  • Distribute company-wide announcements and plan company events and outings, both small and large scale.
  • Ensure all visitors and callers are greeted and routed efficiently and professionally.
  • Manage direct communications with building management regarding items specific to our suite as well as updates regarding the building and local events.
How your role expectations will progress as a Receptionist in the first 30, 90, and 180 days:

30 days in
  • Complete new hire orientation, gaining the resources you need to be successful.
  • Learn how ticket marketplaces operate and how you’ll contribute to providing great experiences for our customers.
  • Acclimate to team and company norms, business objectives, and Vivid Seats values.
  • Meet with Toronto employees to begin understanding their office needs and regular office functions.
  • 90 days in
  • Contribute to our approaches, methods, or technologies to support overall office goals and drive team efficiencies.
  • Maintain, harvest and aid internal and external vendor relationships to improve the office working environment.
  • Champion Vivid Seats values for the Toronto office location and contribute to employee experience and engagement initiatives.
180 days in
  • Apply methods to execute individual tasks that positively impacts the team. Play an active role in continued learnings to advance skill sets necessary for team goals.
  • Evaluate and consolidate vendors to save on office costs and realize efficiencies.
  • Play a leading role in delivering a People Program that impacts the full company of 300+ employees across multiple locations.
What You’ll Bring:
  • Experience in an office receptionist, administration, or related position.
  • Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures.
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks at the same time.
  • Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills and the desire to provide the highest level of customer service.
  • Experience or interest in leveraging physical office space to create meaningful employee experiences.
Our Commitment

We are an equal opportunity employer that values the critical importance of a diverse workforce and sense of belonging. Many of our roles have flexible requirements and we encourage you to apply regardless of whether you meet every qualification.

Vivid Seats provides competitive compensation; bonus incentives; FLEX PTO; mental health days; medical, dental, and vision insurance; 401K matching; monthly credits and discounts for attending live events; remote work and snack allowances; and a variety of additional workplace perks.

Location: Toronto

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering your assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo.


Charger logistics invests time and support into its employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. We are entrepreneurial-minded organization that welcomes and support individual idea and strategies. We are looking for an organized and motivated individual to join our dynamic team as an Administrative Assistant for our Brampton, ON office. Your primary role will be to assist us with maintaining files and paperwork and responding to customer inquiries in a professional and timely manner. The position is based out of our maintenance department in Brampton.

Responsibilities:


  • Respond to customer requests & queries via phone and email in a professional and timely manner.
  • Coordinating with other departments to make sure all paper work is thoroughly managed.
  • Assist accounting with invoices, accounts receivable and accounts payable.
  • Maintaining driver files and fleet documents to ensure proper documentation.
  • Assisting drivers with documents (ensuring that drivers obtain necessary signatures on Bills of Lading, complete their manifests).
  • Compile and review require customs documentation, such as customs invoices, and certificates of origin (not limited to)
  • Enter new orders into the system and maintain the customer portals with up to date information.
  • Provide administrative support including generation of reports, presentations, policies and general correspondence documents.
  • Prepare and submit weekly reports for internal review as well as per client requests.
  • Other ad-hoc duties

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's' Degree in commerce, finance or accounting or related discipline is required
  • Previous administrative logistics and service experience is an asset
  • Knowledge of equipment financing (in particular transportation equipment), would be considered an asset
  • Strong computer skills, particularly with Microsoft Office, with the ability to learn new software quickly.
  • Good time-management with an ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Healthcare Benefit Package
  • Career Growth

title: Executive Personal Assistant
description:
• Are you passionate about being a person’s right hand and ensuring their success by taking care of details and logistics, allowing them to focus on critical tasks and projects?
  • No task is too small for you because you are a natural enabler who is detail-oriented and feels comfortable with all sorts of tasks, from selecting the color of the napkins for a social event, handling correspondence, making copies, answering phones, to participating in high-level strategy meetings?
  • Nothing ever escapes your keen sight, and you are nimble to react immediately, planning and executing plan b, c or d on the spot, resolving unexpected and complex situations?
  • You are flexible and resilient since you adapt quickly to different working styles, and enjoy learning new technologies?


If this sounds like you, apply now!


Job requirements:

  • Has 3-5 years of experience as a personal executive assistant.
  • Superior organization and time management skills.
  • Ability to multitask, organize, and maintain composure under pressure.
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google suite.
  • Strong rapport-building and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong command of written and verbal communication.

title: Contracts Administrator
description:
Job Summary:

Contracts Administrator – Western Canada

Vancouver, BC

Who are we?

Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company, comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, and Live Nation Media & Sponsorship. Ticketmaster is the global leader in event ticketing with over 500 million tickets sold annually and more than 12,000 clients worldwide. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 30,000 shows and 95+ festivals annually for nearly 4,000 artists in over 40 countries. These businesses allow Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to create strategic music marketing programs that connect over 900 brands with the 86 million fans that attend Live Nation Entertainment events each year. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com

Who are you?

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!

The Role: The key responsibility of this role is to review and coordinate execution of all contracts for Western Canada. This includes ensuring insurance and deposit requirements are completed as needed to support each contract. A support function of this role is reception/front desk coverage.

Responsibilities:
  • Review and perform markups to artist and venue contracts
  • Prepare and coordinate artist and venue deposits
  • Prepare and coordinate insurance requests
  • Work with legal department regarding contracts as required
  • Support completion of vendor contracts as needed
  • Set up electronic show files
  • Maintain contract filing systems
  • Provide daily reception/front desk coverage
  • Provide administrative support as required

Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma, or related working experience
  • Previous experience in an office environment or administrative background is preferred
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Exceptional organizational skills, meticulous and detail oriented
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel, and a general level of computer fluency
  • Customer service focused and team player approach
  • Able to work comfortably with all levels of the organization, as well as external partners
  • Quick learner coupled with ability to follow instruction and established processes
  • Curious in nature, able to respond to changing priorities and work independently
  • COVID-19 vaccination will be required for this position subject to legally valid exemptions.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Live Nation Entertainment strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by provincial or federal law.

HIRING PRACTICES

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Live Nation Entertainment recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation Entertainment may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.

Thank you for your interest in working with Live Nation Canada! While we thank all candidates for their applications, only qualified candidates who are selected for further consideration will be contacted directly.

title: Executive Director
description:
Title: Executive Director

Organization: Vancouver Thunderbird Minor Hockey Association

 

Vancouver Thunderbird Minor Hockey Association is one of the largest minor hockey associations in British Columbia with approximately 1000 annual player registrations. Vancouver Thunderbirds Hockey strives to create a player centered environment that provides a rewarding hockey experience for our community of players that is founded on character, teamwork, and the pursuit of excellence on and off the ice.

 

We have an exciting opportunity for an Executive Director to join our organization. The role is responsible for successfully leading, managing, and administering the day-to-day operations and initiatives of Vancouver Thunderbirds Hockey according to the policies, plans and budget set by the Association’s Board of Directors. 

 

The Executive Director will be the face of the organization within the hockey community and the key liaison with Vancouver Thunderbirds Hockey stakeholders including members, athletes, coaches, volunteers and external partners.  

 

This is a full time position with non-traditional hours, weekend work, and travel within BC as necessitated by the hockey season.

 

The key responsibilities of the role include:

 

o  Participating with the Board in developing a vision and strategic plan to guide the organization, acting as a professional advisor to the Board on all aspects of the organization's activities and fostering effective team work between the Board and staff, contractors and volunteers.

o  Working with staff and the Board to develop a comprehensive Annual Business Operating Plan and budget, and securing adequate funding for the operation of the organization. Administering the funds of the organization according to the approved budget and applicable funding agreements and managing the financial reporting of the organization.

o  Managing the day to day operation of the organization, including financial and data management, and procedure and policy development.

o  Working in collaboration with the Board and staff to ensure that the programs and services offered by the organization contribute to the organization's vision and mission, including monitoring the delivery of the programs and services to maintain and/or improve quality.

o  Representing the organization at community, local, regional, provincial and national activities as appropriate.

o  Being a key liaison with Vancouver Thunderbirds Hockey stakeholders including members, athletes and coaches, both in person and using the organization’s social media tools.

o  Managing the risk, health and welfare of organization's members, property, data, finances, image and implement measures to control risks.

o  Determining and managing staffing requirements for organizational management and program delivery, with responsibility for recruitment, management and mentoring of numerous staff, contractors and volunteers.

 

The successful candidate shall possess the following:

 

o  Passion for providing superior customer service by understanding and responding to membership needs.

o  Demonstrated ability to think strategically, problem solve, and implement and evaluate action plans.

o  Excellent and effective interpersonal and relationship building skills.

o  Demonstrated ability in public speaking, clear and effective written and oral communication, and effective team management skills.

o  Demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize tasks, assess situations, and make timely and clear decisions.

o  Understanding of a sport organization, preferably hockey.

o  Personal stability, maturity, and optimism.

 

Qualifications

·      Education or experience in the field preferred:

 

o  University degree or equivalent in not-for-profit management, sport management, recreation, business, or a related discipline.

o  Minimum five years of experience in not-for-profit management (preferably sport focused), including supervising paid staff and volunteers and experience working with a Board of Directors.

o  Minimum five years of leadership experience.

o  Advanced education and/or combination of formal education, training and professional development and work experience in a related field.

o  Experience with not-for-profit fiscal management, including accounting and budgeting, fundraising, and sponsorship.

 

Successful candidates must complete Respect in Sport and provide a clear Criminal Record Check including a vulnerable sector search.

 

Resumes and cover letters may be submitted in confidence to ccotton@vancouvertbirds.ca by May 15, 2022. Compensation will be based upon experience and qualifications.

 

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Executive Assistant (1-year Contract)
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Executive Assistant (1-year Contract)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Executive Assistant provides direct support to the Vice President, Contact Center Technology. You will be responsible for organizing schedules and correspondence to ensure operational effectiveness. You will prepare and support key meetings, events, communities and forums, including minute taking, action tracking and following up with relevant parties where necessary. The incumbent maintains calendars, maintains files and department expense reports, prepares and compiles correspondence, agendas, briefs, reports and analysis where required.

What will you do?
  • Manage and maintain executive calendars, coordinate meetings/conferences, ensure all materials/packages, and catering requirements are provided; track actions items
  • Act as the VP’s delegate for email and phone during absences, handle/forward issues, prioritizing for VP’s action upon return
  • For multi-channels develop communications, meeting/conference materials, forms, documents, presentations and spreadsheets
  • Coordinate all requirements, maintain appropriate records in managing the team; including preparing and verifying monthly expense claims and invoices, travel and other expenses, supplies, and updating vacation and absence for the executive team
  • Organize communication sessions, employee recognition celebrations, and other team events
  • Maintain global distribution list and distributes group-wide communications
  • Raise awareness among the team, extend invitations to key business partners, maintain effective knowledge of all relevant resources and services available within organization

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication (written and verbal) skills with the ability to work with all levels of management and staff
  • Ability to take initiative, prioritize tasks, function independently, and work as part of a team
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion
  • Superior attention to detail, calm under pressure and confidence with strong reporting and analysis skills
  • Innate ability to develop and maintain constructive and cooperative working relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization
  • MS Office skills including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and RBC systems and tools

Nice-to-have
  • Ability to anticipate needs, be resilient in challenging situations and persevere to get the job done
  • Professionalism, initiative, enthusiasm, energy, and a sense of urgency

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d'emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d'entrée en fonction. title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Receptionist
description:
Do you come from office administration and Reception experience? Are you open to a short term contract Receptionist position? Then we would love to chat with you about an opportunity in Toronto! We are currently hiring for a two week contract position as a Receptionist from April 25th -May 6th. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years working in a receptionist position or in a general administrative role. This position will require someone who can welcome and greet guests, handle filing, and answering all incoming calls.

If you are interested in this position, please send your resume directly to brittany.v.thomas@randstad.ca or apply online to Randstad

Advantages
  • Receptionist contract opportunity that is scheduled for 2 weeks from April 25th- May 6th
  • Great office environment with a helpful team!
  • Hourly rate of $18-19
  • Monday to Friday 7:30 am - 4:00 pm
  • Work in office role

Responsibilities
  • Greeting and screening all visitors in a prompt and professional manner
  • Escorting visitors and clients to the appropriate boardroom or waiting area
  • Ensuring all incoming calls are answered promptly and professionally and are directed to the appropriate individual
  • Monitoring boardroom bookings using a custom system according to established procedures:
  • Reviewing and approving bookings
  • Scheduling any necessary additional resources such as audio- visual equipment or

catering
  • Responding to end user inquiries
  • Ensuring all policies for catering and meetings are adhered to
  • Covering Reception desk, Concierge, and Switchboard as required
  • Ensuring that Reception and Lobby areas are always maintained and presentable
  • Assisting with activities associated with event and meeting setups as required
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
  • A minimum of two years experience in Reception or Office Administration
  • Strong attention to detail with good organizational skills
  • Ability to work effectively within a variety of changes
  • Ability to communicate effectively and coordinate meetings
  • A welcoming and warm personality
  • Ability to work well in a team environment
  • Commitment to setting, achieving, and/ or exceeding individual, team, or firm goals

Summary

If you are interested in this position, please send your resume directly to brittany.v.thomas@randstad.ca or apply online to Randstad

Thank you,

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Spraggs Law, one of Coquitlam's premier law firms, currently has an opening for an Administrative Assistant! For 50 years, we have served the people of the Tri-Cities, delivering results that meet their needs. We balance legal skill, efficiency, and client satisfaction to help our clients get access to justice and exceptional results. We work in teams comprised of legal assistants, a claims manager/paralegal, and a lawyer. A claim team helps a client through the entire process – from choosing Spraggs Law to reaching a final settlement or judgment.


At Spraggs Law, we work as a team. We collaborate on every case to capitalize on each team member’s diverse strengths. This allows us to outwork and outfight the competition while simultaneously respecting the needs of our clients, colleagues, and the courts.


Our Values

At Spraggs Law, we’re committed to doing the best and being our best selves by walking out our Core Values:

  1. Honesty & Integrity
  2. Accountability & Discipline
  3. Relational Awareness
  4. Team Players & Collaborative
  5. Continuous Improvement & Renewal
  6. Grit & Perseverance
  7. Intentional & Deliberate


Position Summary

Within this collaborative model, you are responsible for carrying out the administrative tasks required to effectively manage a claim. Through regular meetings and check-ins with your team, you are provided with direction on tasks that need to be accomplished.


As an administrative assistant you will spend most of your time:

  • Completing File Room tasks including:
  • Preparing incoming and outgoing mail for distribution
  • Sorting and scanning incoming and outgoing mail
  • Accurately and appropriately filing correspondence, invoices, receipts, etc.
  • Locating filed materials upon request, ensuring materials are only given to authorized users
  • Using standardized filing methods and procedures
  • Keeping accurate and complete records and forms for filed items
  • Answering questions about records and files
  • Adding new material to files and records
  • Creating new files and records as necessary
  • Closing files and transferring them to inactive storage according to file maintenance/legal guidelines
  • Opening files (documentation management)
  • Reception/phone assistance and coverage
  • Communicating with claim-related vendors
  • Assisting in trial preparation
  • Simple overflow Legal Assistant tasks such as Records follow-up, client reminders, etc.
  • Other responsibilities and directives as assigned


Qualifications

We think you are probably a student or administrative assistant with aspirations of an exciting career. You have a strong attention to detail and you are able to effectively prioritize tasks. If that sounds like you, and you can meet the list of qualifications and competencies below, we want to hear from you:

  • One year of experience with administrative tasks and duties,
  • A pragmatic and solutions-oriented approach to problem solving,
  • Effective organization and time-management skills,
  • An aptitude for using various software packages such as Microsoft Suite and other technological applications,
  • Experience in a law firm is not a requirement, but it is an asset.


As you’d expect, you need effective interpersonal and communication skills to be successful in our team-based collaborative model. We work hard and we like to get stuff done, but we have fun while we work so a positive attitude is a strong requirement.


Working Environment

Together we work hard to help clients get access to justice and satisfying results. We challenge our employees to work to the best of their abilities and provide them with support, training and development along the way. We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package including an extended health and benefits plan, sick time, and free parking as well as many opportunities for mentorship and continuous learning. Success in this role presents opportunities for more responsibilities, complex work and advancement.


This position can be a part-time or full-time position and requires all hours to be worked in the office.


We welcome applications from all qualified candidates and thank you for your interest in Spraggs Law. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.

  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics

Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Receptionist
description:
The role of the Front Office at Rodeo FX is to help ensure the smooth running of our studio, including client service, relief reception and other miscellaneous functions.

It’s the perfect position for someone who likes a large variety of tasks, providing great service to clients and colleagues, and who likes to be active and on the go (a.k.a. not stuck behind a desk all day! and being part of the life at the office and make positive impact on the work climat) 

  • Greet clients, visitors and redirect them to the desired person (in person and on the phone); 
  • Coordinate any out of town travel for employees with RodeoFX’s travel agency; 
  • Provide administrative support to the operations and executive team; 
  • Manage the cell phone plan, including reviewing invoices and communicating with the vendor for any changes;
  • Administer access cards and security codes, including preparing cards and codes for new employees and making changes (departures, access changes, etc.);
  • Plan and coordinate all employee office moves;
  • Prepare meetings with clients or for the production team (food, drinks, necessary documents, etc.); 
  • Follow-up with cleaning staff to ensure quality service;
  • Review and dispatch requests from the facilities team; 
  • Order office supplies; 
  • Provide support for special events (5 @ 7, end of project, employee activities, etc.) ; 
  • Produce and update various reports;
  • Write, update, translate, scan and file various documents;
  • Participate in specific projects with the facilities team.

Qualifications

  • 3 to 5 years of experience as a receptionist or in a similar position;
  • DEP in Administration or related field;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Office and Google Suite;
  • Fluent spoken & written communication skills in English and French;
  • Professionalism, discretion, organization and courteousness.

Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays; - Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: 010 - Tour Guides
description:
Join the dynamic team of guides who make the Morrin Centre a fun and fascinating place to visit – and work!

Amaze visitors with your stellar tours of Quebec City’s best kept secret. Use your unique talents to enliven each program. This fun, summer job involves a lot of time within the spaces of this beautiful historical site – as well as our dark and sinister jail cells!

Reporting To The Guided Tours Coordinator, Responsibilities Include

We are currently seeking positive, enthusiastic individuals dedicated to providing exemplary customer service in presenting the site to our visitors.
  • Greeting and responding to visitor enquiries;
  • Interpreting the site and delivering tours & educational programs as a costumed guide from May until September 2022, with the possibility of extension;
  • Performing front desk duties including; admission, gift shop sales & inventory, collecting statistical data, visitor questions through phone & email, other related tasks.
  • Promoting the Centre’s tours to passersby.
  • Assist with special events and activities, as required.
  • Disinfecting and ensuring a clean work environment.
Intention Of Returning To Studies In The Fall In One Of The Following Fields (or Other Relevant Studies) Is a Must

We are looking for self-motivated people who are able to work within a team, have strong communication skills in both official languages and be punctual. Must have experience with customer service and cash systems. Experience with giving guided tours and theatre is an asset. Must have been a full-time student in Winter 2021 / 22, aged 30 years or younger & have completed at least a one-year post-secondary studies.
  • Archaeology
  • Communications
  • Education
  • Heritage Studies
  • History
  • Museology
  • Tourism
Number of hours: 35 per week. Includes evening and weekend work.

Start Date : Training begins the week of May 9th, 2022.

Salary: $16 / hour

Interested candidates are invited to send their curriculum vitae in French and a cover letter in English and French by email to jobs@morrin.org by May 2nd at 5:00 pm to the attention of Stefanie Johnston. Please indicate Tour Guide in the subject line. Selected candidates will be invited to an interview.

title: Receptionist
description:
Calling all new university graduates! Looking to kick start your career at a company that offers many perks and growth?

Our client, a leading investment counseling firm, is seeking a Receptionist to join their dynamic team long term! As the first point of contact for incoming calls, visitors and clients, the successful candidate will be responsible for promoting a friendly and courteous environment and maintaining a professional appearance at all times. If you have fantastic communication skills, a client service oriented attitude and strong attention to detail then we want to hear from you!

Receptionist Responsibilities

  • Welcome guests and employees by greeting them in person or on the telephone; answer or refer inquiries
  • Direct guests by utilizing employee and department directories; give instructions
  • Review all room booking to stay current and informed of all meetings taking place on the floor
  • Main point of contact for building security, employees and for receiving guests and visitors
  • Be familiar with all policies and guidelines as it pertains to the Floor/Reception Area
  • Maintain safe and clean reception area by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations
  • Facilities walkthrough to ensure space is ready for guest and all is working properly
  • Help maintain work space by notifying the appropriate Departments when service is needed, i.e. carpet cleaning, missing light bulbs, etc.
  • Handle any administrative tasks/requests for the floor as needed
  • Respond promptly to incoming calls in a professional and enthusiastic manner, directing them to the proper individual/ department/ or responding to inquiries
  • Distribute mail, interoffice mail and courier packages accordingly
  • Ensure office and kitchen supplies are stocked, ordering supplies as necessary
  • Ensure the fax, photocopier and printers are in good working condition
  • Set up and maintain boardrooms for client breakfasts/lunches
  • Assist with large mail outs as required
  • Other administrative support as required

Receptionist Qualifications

  • Post secondary education with summers work experience and/or 1-2 years previous reception experience
  • Very strong organizational skills, along with the ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities
  • Strong analytical and communication (both verbal and written) skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and pleasant telephone manner
  • Ability to organize tasks and prioritize responsibilities
  • Ability to function well independently and as a member of a team
  • Excellent MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills
  • Attention to detail and a ‘can do’ attitude
  • Corporate dress code – polished and conservative

Other Details

  • Full time: Monday to Friday
  • Salary: $40,000 - 43,000 plus a BONUS up to 50K
  • Hours: 7:30AM-4:00PM
  • Location: Downtown Toronto
  • Employment Type: Permanent position

Interested in the Receptionist role in Toronto?

If you have any questions, feel free to contact

TWTOPERM

Accommodations are available upon request to support your participation during all stages of the recruitment process.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Driving Instructor
description:
NEW CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Ottawa Valley Driving Academy is located in the heart of the Ottawa Valley, Pembroke, ON.

We are currently looking for licensed Driving Instructors. Some qualities that are required to be a great Driving Instructor include:

  • Patience
  • Sense of Humor
  • Great Organizational Skills
  • Enjoys meeting and helping people
  • Easy Going Personality
  • Above Average Communication Skills

Requirements:

  • Must have clean driver’s abstract – (no demerit points)
  • Criminal background check
  • Class G License for minimum 5 years
  • MTO Driver Instructor License (Signing Bonus for Licensed Driving Instructors)
  • Applicants without a Driving Instructor license must be willing to take a 4 week course. (We will offer some financial assistance for the course)
  •  Must have a clean reliable vehicle and a brake will need to be installed on the passenger side.

If this opportunity appeals to you, please email your resume to ovdapembroke@hotmail.com or call the office at 613-631-0600 to set up an interview.

Related keywords: driving instructor, driver

Job Types: Full-time, part-time                     Salary: to be negotiated                    Work remotely:   Yes

Benefits:

  • Perfect Second Career
  • Casual dress
  • Flexible hours

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place. Face masks required.       


Office is located at 381 Isabella Street, Unit B, Pembroke, ON

title: Sales Associate
description:
At Rogers, our retail team is the heart of our success. They don’t just embrace the latest technology and content—it's part of who they are. They're outgoing and approachable team members who want to share their knowledge and experience with others. They understand that our customers rely on technology to enhance and simplify their lives and they're excited to show customers how our latest products and services can help.

We’re growing our teams and are looking for retail representatives who are committed to innovating by sharing ideas that have real business impacts and creating a best-in-class customer experience for our communities and neighbours in our retail stores from coast-to-coast-to-coast.

Let’s help make your passion for the latest technology a career possible. Consider the following opportunity!

In Retail, we believe our people are the heart of our success. We don’t just embrace the latest technology and content - it’s part of who we are. We dive deep into how our products and services enhance our customer’s lives and we’re excited to show them how our technology can make more possible each and every day. We put our customers first in everything we do, and we’re committed to creating best-in-class customer experiences by connecting with our customers in our stores from coast-to-coast-to-coast. This is an opportunity for you to have a role that is both challenging and rewarding and helps build transferrable lifetime skills.

Life At Retail – What We Offer…

<>

We invest in our people to unleash their potential so we can win as a team! As part of the team, you will have access to a ton of amazing resources, discounts, and perks. To name a few
  • Competitive base pay plus commissions
  • Unlimited access to Headspace Premium for mindfulness training
  • Access to a virtual walk in clinic to connect with Healthcare Professionals from home
  • LIVX – Fitness Membership to attend classes virtually
  • Company matching contributions to charities you support
  • Paid time off for volunteering
  • Great benefits, pension plan, RRSP, TFSA and Wealth Accumulation Plan
  • Employee discounts that can offer up to 50% off our products and services
  • Leadership development, Mentorship and Coaching programs
We genuinely care about each other and we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace at Rogers so all of our team members can bring their whole selves to work. We have employee resource groups that build awareness and a culture of allyship for equity-seeking groups, including groups representing People of Colour, LGBTQ2S+, Indigenous Peoples, Persons with Disabilities and Women. We all bring something different, and we know what makes you different makes us great.

https//youtu.be/i8Cp-R42LtI

What We’re Looking For…

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about connecting with our customers and genuinely wants to help find the best product to meet their needs. Someone who has a deep passion to listen and genuinely want to help each person they connect with. This role is fast-paced, and the environment is ever changing. You will be challenged to ask the right questions to unlock the appropriate solutions. You will foster collaboration within your team and other departments in efforts to provide world class customer service.

What You’ll Do…

Our customers come first, and they inspire everything we do. As part of our team, your analytical expertise will be used showcase how our products and services can help make their possible everyday. You will have the opportunity to connect, develop relationships, and offer value-added solutions to customers in your local community. You will receive ongoing training and development to ensure you have all the necessary skills to navigate our systems and find the solutions and/or the products that best suit our customers. We are there when our customers need us so you will have the ability to work a flexible schedule.

Who You Are…
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Expert in communication and listening
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Skilled in delivering exceptional customer service and sales experience
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule (min 20 hours/week)
  • Navigate multiple computer systems and multitask
We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for our customers, we believe it starts with our retail team. At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your possible.

As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to complete an online assessment and provide consent for and successfully pass a criminal background check.

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Part time

Shift Variable

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 333 King St. E, UNIT 110 (5309), Toronto, ON

Travel Requirements Up to 10%

Posting Category/Function Retail (In Store / Hourly) & Sales and Service

Requisition ID 265853

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes Retail

title: Administration Assistant
description:
A busy office is looking for a admin person to look after day to day office tasks. Tasks include but not limited to invoicing, receiving, cleaning duties,
Contracts, bookings and greeting at the door
Must be proficient in English and enjoy working with people.
Hours are Monday-Friday 9-3
Wages can be discussed at interview based on experience.
Please email resumes to info.elevatecowork@gmail.com

title: Personal Assistant
description:
Reporting to the Chief of Staff, the Personal Assistant/EA will be supporting the CEO, Chief of Staff and the office leasing team. This is a dynamic role, perfect for a high-performing, detail oriented, motivated individual.


Location: Toronto - hybrid in-person and remote


Day-to-day responsibilities:

  • Working closely with the Chief of Staff to support and anticipate the day to day needs of the CEO.
  • Tasks will change from day to day, hour by hour and will include (but not limited to) - meeting/call scheduling, running personal errands, administration, gifting, purchasing, shipping, sending personal reminders, booking appointments/reservations, research, planning events, submitting expenses, coordinating/ordering catering and everything in between!
  • Provide support to our office leasing team with office admin, liaising between the landlord, contractors, subtenants and other stakeholders
  • Coordinate and book meetings for CEO
  • Travel arrangements for CEO
  • Given the nature of this role you must be comfortable working untraditional hours. This is a high-growth startup, this is not a 9-5. You will be available to respond to the CEO and Chief of Staff’s requests after-hours (evenings and weekends). Weekend requests will be ad hoc but still need to be actioned with urgency.


You will thrive if you:

  • Have 1-2 years of experience as an EA/PA, ideally supporting an executive and dealt with complex scheduling
  • Are proactive and love problem solving. You have a can-do, no ego attitude - you don’t think there is any task that is beneath you (no matter how small and unglamorous). And yes, picking up coffee is part of this role if that’s what is needed!
  • Have proven experience maintaining the highest level of confidentiality and maturity
  • Have experience troubleshooting technical problems while navigating ambiguous and time sensitive situations

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Company: TryCycle Data Systems

Recruiting Company: HRCovered Inc.

Job Title: Executive Assistant

Location:  Ottawa

Job type: Permanent, Full-Time, Flexible Working Hours, 90% Remote

Reports to: VP of Operations

Compensation: 65-70K + stock options, benefits and more


Would you like to accelerate your career at an innovative software company that is building solutions that enhance people's lives? Here’s your chance!


About TryCycle:


TryCycle Data Systems is in the business of turning data into dialogue. Its mission is to reduce treatment barriers, increase human compassion, and improve outcomes for people with addiction, mental illness, depression, trauma, and eating disorders. TryCycle is an  Ottawa-owned, Ottawa-founded digital health technology company on the verge of major growth! The company provides innovative health-focused solutions being used today with First Nations, Veterans, Clinics, Health Insurers, Researchers and many more.


Position Summary


TryCycle is seeking an exceptional and energetic Executive Assistant with an unwavering sense of purpose to join their mission. In this role, you will provide administrative support to the Senior Leadership Team and report to the VP of Operations. In addition, you will work closely with the leadership team to maintain a high-level understanding of priorities across the company and support quarterly board operations.


You will be working in a stimulating, and fast-paced environment with lots of concurrent projects and activities.


In this role, you have the opportunity to make a difference! 


What you’ll do at TryCycle


  • Provide high-level executive administrative support to the Senior Leadership Team including the VP Operations and the CEO
  • Lead administrative tasks, special projects, producing documents, reports, agendas, and presentations for internal and external stakeholders
  • Prepare meeting agendas, draft minutes, track, and report on status of action items, including supporting quarterly board meetings
  • Organise and manage time-sensitive and confidential information
  • Creates various written documents including presentations and memos 
  • Hit the ground running!


Who we need


  • Become the VP of Operations go to support person 
  • Strong organisational skills, and the ability to prioritise multiple tasks
  • Respond to changing priorities and needs in a flexible and efficient manner
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • High level of accountability and trustworthiness
  • Solid street smarts in dealing with internal and external stakeholders 
  • Able to anticipate problems and address them before they become issues
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Word, Excel, and PowerPoint


Must haves 


  • Must live in Greater Ottawa Area (National Capital Region)
  • Minimum three years of experience as an Executive Assistant. 
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills in English 
  • Strong technical aptitude and working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint tools
  • This position will require a background check and training in privacy regulations. 
  • Must have a valid drivers licence


Nice to haves


  • Being bilingual in French is a bonus but not required
  • Experience in the technology industry and/or start-up ecosystem is considered an asset


Why Join TryCycle


  • This is a rare opportunity to be one of the early employees at TryCycle
  • Be a part of something inspiring, impactful, and unique!
  • Work with a rapidly growing, creative, and agile company 
  • Experience a culture based on empathy, compassion and entrepreneurial spirit
  • 90% remote full-time (but you can work in the office if preferred) 
  • Flexible work hours to support work-life-balance
  • Health and Dental Benefits Plan
  • 3 weeks paid vacation (+ bonus “Flex” days)
  • Get your Birthday off!
  • Employee stock options 
  • Friday Afternoon Zoom Parties
  • Monthly Social Events (Virtual)
  • Pension program coming in the near future


What’s life @ TryCycle like


  • This position will be 90% remote and 10% in the office and/or meetings in Ottawa 
  • To succeed with TryCycle, you must be team-oriented, eager to learn, and reliable
  • Enthusiasm, passion, and the love of learning goes a long way at TryCycle. If you have trouble collaborating freely and maintaining friendly communication, even when you don’t want to – TryCycle isn’t the right place for you
  • Enjoy the challenges that come with working in a fast paced environment for a company that is rapidly growing
  • You will have a direct influence on people's health and wellness 


Are you ready to make a difference and chart an exciting new career path? 

Be one of the first to apply!  Please send your resume to recruitment@hrcovered.com before May 20th, 2022.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Assistant & Content Creator
description:
Role: Administrative Assistant & Content Creator

Compensation: $18-20.50/hour

Experience Level: Entry

Status: Full time, Permanent (37.5 hours/week)

Hours: Tuesdays - Saturdays with afternoon and evening shifts

Job locations: Improbable Escapes HQ (downtown Kingston) and Improbable Escapes Wonderland (Kingston west-end)

 

Position Summary:

Improbable Escapes is looking for a zealous Administrative Assistant & Content Creator to support the Marketing and Sales department of our company in its primary duties. 

 

Improbable Escapes is a tourism and hospitality business that specializes in interactive entertainment. With a heavy focus in escape rooms, theatre, and board games, we are looking for an individual with similar interests that would enjoy working with other creative team members.

 

Job responsibilities include: 

  • Receiving visitors at the front desk by greeting, welcoming, directing and announcing them appropriately
  • Answering incoming phone calls, emails, social media account messages
  • Receiving and sorting daily mail
  • Ordering inventory items as needed for board game cafe and escape rooms 
  • Updating company manuals and policies 
  • Completing any administrative work delegated by management 
  • Corresponding with corporate/B2B clients
  • Regularly create content and post on social media accounts, such as TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter
  • Assist customers with questions, process payments, and arrange merchandise on shelves and displays in the board game shop


Required skills: 

  • Strong and professional communication 
  • Comfortable being in front of a camera and creating content based on trends 
  • Understanding of relevant trends on various social media platforms 
  • The capacity to work independently 
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects
  • Comfortable working in fast-paced environments 


Assets: 

  • Lover of board games 
  • Has played escape rooms before 
  • Has examples of content created for personal or professional accounts 
  • Tourism and hospitality work experience 


How to apply:

Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@improbableescapes.com.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administration and Reception for an Engineering Firm in Downtown Vancouver


Your new company

This position acts as the first point of contact, providing excellent customer service for

visitors and incoming callers.


Your new role

o Courteously meet and welcome clients and general members of the public

o Answer, screen and direct all incoming calls

o Process outgoing mail and maintain postage machine. Open, date stamp and deliver all incoming mail.

o Responsible for meeting room schedules

o Perform administrative support tasks in periods of high volume and vacation coverage including the

preparation of letters, memos, minutes, reports, and formatting of specifications.

o Other general administrative duties including data entry, filing, copying, pdf’ing, etc.

o Order and maintain office supplies. Conducts research and makes recommendations for vendors of

office supplies when necessary.

o Review and update internal telephone directory

o Monitor and ensure the reception and boardroom areas are kept tidy and projects a business-like image

o Maintain organized electronic filing systems to ensure business and operational reports, forms, and

other business documentation are readily available

o Maintain a professional image and demeanour with all employees, management, executives and visitors

at all times

o Oversees the tidiness of the kitchen and responsible for scheduling kitchen duty rotation

o Overtime as required


What you'll need to succeed

Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly develop positive business relationships with

management, coworkers and external contacts

o Must possess strong technical skills with Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and

Outlook at an intermediate level

o Experience with specification writing is considered an asset

o Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality relating to activities involving duties of position

o Displays flexibility in order to respond to various administrative requests.

o Maintains good attendance and being able to meet deadlines

o Ability to adhere to task-related procedures and standards and demonstrate flexibility in handling heavy

workload

o Excellent communication and organizational skills

o A professional, enthusiastic attitude and pleasant demeanour with a can-do attitude is a must!


What you'll get in return

45,000 - 50,000, 3 weeks Vacation, Extended Health care and Dental, RRSP Matching


What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.
