title: Ontario Highschool Tutor
description:
This position’s primary focus is to educate elementary and secondary students in language arts, mathematics and science in a 1:1 online environment. The role is also to support our Founder, to help her stay organized and on task as she creates new materials and content to support students and their families. 


We empower students, families and educators. Our mission is to prepare students of today for the jobs of tomorrow. Our goal is to inspire students to become confident, independent learners through developing growth mindsets, grit, resiliency and solid foundations in core academics. We offer private online tutoring for elementary and secondary students in the Peel and Halton regions. 


In everything we do, we aim to inspire and empower educators and students. We lead a fun-loving, dedicated team that is committed to excellence, always sees the upside to any situation and maintains the strength and flexibility to grow as our business evolves. 


Early Learning Foundations welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.


This is a contract position that reports directly to our Founder, while also working closely with other key members of the team. This isn’t a 9-5 job. This position involves working some evenings and weekends, and at times, responding to team members outside of typical work hours.

title: Receptionist & Admin Office Assistant - Summer Position
description:
COMPANY PROFILE

The Luxus Group (“Luxus”) is a family-owned and operated, property management and real estate development firm based in Sherwood Park, Alberta.

 

With an initial vision of enhancing the way people invest in their lifestyle and experiences, Luxus launched its first division in 2007, Luxus Vacation Properties. Luxus Vacation Properties is an innovative business model which offers a unique investment opportunity by providing investors access to a portfolio of exceptional properties around the world. Now operating with a dedicated service team and operating three Partnerships with approximately 300 high-net-worth investors and more than 25 properties around the world, Luxus Vacation Properties remains the core of the company.

 

Over the past 15 years, Luxus has achieved growth by consistently pursuing innovative opportunities and building trusted relationships with its clients, vendors, and suppliers around the world. This evolution has led to the creation of additional divisions, such as our US-based operations which includes Luxus Developments, and Luxus Restorations. Projects launched by Luxus Developments and Luxus Restorations to date include Podere Paníco, a historical restoration in Tuscany, Italy; Vista Dunes Estates, a private gated community in Palm Springs; The Residences of Laule’a, a luxury community on the Big Island of Hawaii; and a Marriott branded boutique hotel in Playa Del Carmen. Other Luxus Canada projects include Ena Lake Lodge Fishing Club, a private fly-in fishing lodge in Northern Saskatchewan and Luxus Real Estate Advisory.

 

Looking ahead to the next 10 years and beyond, Luxus will continue to focus on its passion for helping its clients and employees live happier, healthier and more fulfilling lives. For further information on The Luxus Group, please visit luxusgroup.com.

 

LUXUS CULTURE


At Luxus, we pride ourselves on having a unique, high-performance culture that is fun, collaborative and supportive. The Luxus Culture is best described through its six core values, which are:


  • Excellence: we deliver our best, every day.
  • Positivity: we approach challenges with a positive attitude and an open mind.
  • Integrity: we always do the right thing.
  • Forward-thinking: we are innovative.
  • Humility: we are grateful.
  • Family: we embrace the family spirit.


Our talented team members are truly dedicated to helping clients see new places, try new experiences and build lasting memories with their families and friends.

 

The successful candidate will be confident that they can engage with, demonstrate and live the Luxus Core Values daily.

 

POSITION SNAPSHOT

Reports to:              Receptionist & Office Coordinator

Key Work Relationships: Luxus Team, Tenants, Clients, Vendors

Office Location:         Sherwood Park, Alberta

Hours (Part-time):       Approx. 18-24 hours per week. (Mon, Wed, Fri)

Start Date:             May 24, 2022 (preferred)


MANDATE

 

First impressions are key and as the first and last person to interact with potential customers, business partners, investors, and our team, either face-to-face or over the telephone, this position is instrumental in making sure the daily interactions with The Luxus Group are a positive one. 

 

The successful candidate will be highly motivated, self-starting and creative, with experience and passion for making those around them better people. The ability to leverage their team's time by creating efficiencies, maintaining the office and optimizing daily schedules will be instrumental in this candidate’s success.

 

The ability to be flexible to accommodate changing work demands along with being able to work both independently and in a team environment is crucial.

 

This position is accountable for providing essential support to the entire organization of The Luxus Group in the main areas of reception, administration, office management and office communication.

 

The ideal candidate would be university student looking for part-time summer work (Mon/Wed/Fri - 6-8 hours/day).

 

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

The position will include the following key accountabilities:

 

Reception Desk Responsibilities

  • Maintain a clean, organized and professional reception desk (personal workspace)
  • Welcome guests to the office, offer refreshments (water/coffee/tea) and direct them appropriately to their scheduled appointments.
  • Direct all incoming calls to the various departments or individuals, ensuring that general inquiries are appropriately screened (i.e. office gatekeeper).
  • Enforce a no-solicitation policy for office.
  • Ensure the confidentiality and security of all sensitive materials at all times at the reception desk, including locking the desktop when away from the desk.
  • Limit activities away from the reception desk and ensure basic reception responsibilities are covered when absence is necessary.
  • Assist with maintaining Phone System & Voicemail.


 Administration Responsibilities

  • Manage outgoing/incoming courier service, deliveries and faxes.
  • Prepare cover letters or memos required for any outgoing materials.
  • Assist with photocopying, faxing or scanning upon request.
  • Monitor calendars for meeting rooms and bookings to ensure the room is ready and no conflicts exist.
  • Assist in scheduling meetings for Team Members and Tenants as requested.
  • Coordinate details for conference call sessions when requested.
  • Requested office errands may include Canada Post Office, Save-On, Staples, etc.

 

 Office Management Responsibilities

 Working closely with the Office Coordinator, ensure the overall office environment is welcoming, clean & organized (includes guest & staff entrances, guest & staff washrooms, storage areas/room, server room, photocopy area, lunchroom, boardroom and hallways). Basic expectations include:


  • Coordinate & oversee weekly cleaning service of office and provide feedback to cleaners as required.
  • Coordinate & oversee the maintenance of the office as required (lights, carpets, repairs, etc.).
  • Entrances: cleaned and tidied.
  • Guest Washroom & Shower: ensure overall cleanliness; stocking of bathroom products.
  • Storage room & Server room: ensure secure, organized and access limited to authorized personnel only.
  • Photocopy area: free of clutter and “drop off” items; cupboards organized & labelled.
  • Lunchroom: clean & organized; tea, coffee, creamer stocked; fridge routinely inspected for removal of perishable/expired items; garbage/recycling removed from office as required.
  • Boardroom: ensure overall cleanliness; computer logged off when not in use.
  • Hallways & Office: light bulbs replaced when needed; carpets free of debris or boxes.
  • Arrange catering for in-house meetings or events upon request.
  • Maintain inventory of refreshments, basic office supplies and paper products stocked in the photocopier area.
  • Ensure Xerox Copier and colour printer are stocked adequately with supplies (toner, paper, etc.).
  • Maintain all office equipment – boardroom computer (logged off when not in use), postage machine, colour printer, Xerox Copier, shredding etc.
  • Ensure the Alarm System is in good working order and the emergency contact list is kept up to date.
  • Reorganize and maintain Office Keyholder Tracking. (Special project)
  • Administer Parking Schedule and maintain Parking Tracking.
  • Ensure the efficient and appropriate use of office resources (including copiers) by monitoring use and providing training and best practice tips to Team.

 

Office Communication

  • Assist with the setup and facilitation of Team Meetings.
  • Phones – messaging/daily, break & holiday.
  • Facilitate & monitor reminders to staff for holiday messaging emails.
  • Email & Address Change Tracking.

 

Office & Ena Coordinator Support

  • Provide documentation preparation & support as needed.
  • Assist with Ena related communications, tracking, errands as needed

 

Additional Growth & Development Opportunities

  • Special projects related to various areas of the business.

 

 CANDIDATE PROFILE

 

Education:

  • Diploma in Office Administration - Post-secondary Education (in progress)


Experience:

  • Customer Service
  • Office Administration experience


Competencies & Attributes:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is required.
  • Superior time management and ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and highly organized.
  • Comfortable with technology and coordinating projects within the office (i.e. new phone system).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be self-motivated and able to make decisions while handling numerous projects at one time.
  • Creativity, a sense of humour and a passion for excellence are essential to this position.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Is intuitive and has a proactive approach to serving others.
  • Professional demeanour.


Please apply via the following link to Kathryn Luedtke, Culture & Office Manager, The Luxus Group. A resume and Cover Letter must be included to be considered for this position.


https://theluxusgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=35

The ability to leverage their team's time by creating efficiencies, maintaining the office and optimizing daily schedules will be instrumental in this candidate’s success.", 'Assist with the setup and facilitation of Team Meetings.', 'Provide documentation preparation & support as needed.', 'Start Date:\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0May 24, 2022 (preferred)', 'Professional demeanour.', 'Ensure the efficient and appropriate use of office resources (including copiers) by monitoring use and providing training and best practice tips to Team.', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills.', 'Assist with maintaining Phone System & Voicemail.', 'Assist with photocopying, faxing or scanning upon request.', 'Office Administration experience', 'Superior time management and ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.', 'Working closely with the Office Coordinator, ensure the overall office environment is welcoming, clean & organized (includes guest & staff entrances, guest & staff washrooms, storage areas/room, server room, photocopy area, lunchroom, boardroom and hallways).\xa0Basic expectations include:']

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Recepcionista
description:
¡Las primeras impresiones son todo! Como Recepcionista, cuidará de los huéspedes desde el momento en que llegan hasta su partida, asegurándose de que tengan una experiencia memorable con nosotros.

Lo Que Hay Para Usted
  • En 3-4 puntos, muestre los beneficios y ventajas de trabajar en el hotel
  • Tarjeta de Beneficios para colaboradores que ofrece tarifas con descuento en Accor en todo el mundo
  • Programas de aprendizaje a través de nuestras Academias
  • Oportunidad para desarrollar su talento y crecer dentro de su hotel y en todo el mundo!
  • Capacidad para hacer diferencia en la comunidad local a través de nuestras actividades de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa, como Planet 21
Lo Que Hará
  • Saludar, registrarse, responder a solicitudes y liquidar cuentas mientras brinda un servicio excepcional
  • Tome la iniciativa de agregar una experiencia personalizada
  • Promueva con orgullo las instalaciones del hotel, buscando oportunidades para mejorar la estadía de un huésped a través de la venta
Su Experiencia y Habilidades Incluyen
  • La personalidad enfocada en el servicio es esencial; la experiencia es un diferencial
  • Experiencia previa con Opera o un sistema relacionado
  • Fluidez en inglés; los idiomas adicionales son una ventaja
Su Equipo y Ambiente De Trabajo
  • En 1-2 oraciones, comente el ambiente del equipo, del hotel o de la oficina de una manera que refleje la cultura

Nota: esta descripción podrá sufrir alteraciones incluyendo situaciones locales, de legislación y documentaciones oficiales de trabajo

Nuestro Compromiso Con La Diversidad & Inclusión

Somos una empresa inclusiva y nuestra ambición es atraer, reclutar y promover talentos diversos.

¿Por qué trabajar para Accor?

Somos mucho más que un líder mundial. Te damos la bienvenida tal como eres y puedes encontrar un trabajo una marca que coincida con tu personalidad.

Te apoyamos para que crezcas y aprendas cada día, asegurándonos de que el trabajo le dé propósito a tu vida, para que durante tu viaje con nosotros, puedas seguir exporando las posibilidades ilimitadas de Accor.

Al unirte a Accor, cada capítulo de tu historia es suyo para escribir y juntos podemos imaginar la hospitallidad del mañana. Descubre la vida que te espera en Accor, visita https://careers.accor.com/

¡Haz lo que amas, cuida el mundo, atrévete a desafiar el status quo! #BELIMITLESS

22010170

title: Réceptionniste
description:
Les Lofts Vieux-Québec se spécialisent dans les résidences de tourisme (appartements locatifs de courte durée). Avec plus d'une centaine de lofts et de chambres d’hôtel, notre mission est d'offrir des hébergements urbains chaleureux situés dans les quartiers touristiques de Québec les plus en attrayants.


Relevant du superviseur de la réception, l’agent à la réception s’assure de la gestion des réservations et d’offrir un service à la clientèle à la hauteur des standards des Lofts.


Le poste à combler est basé dans le quartier Saint-Roch, mais le candidat peut être amené à se déplacer dans l’un ou l’autre de nos 16 établissements du Centre-Ville de Québec. Nous recherchons une personne fiable, autonome et qui est capable de gérer plusieurs priorités en simultané.


Notre entreprise est en pleine croissance et nous aimons encourager nos employés à grandir avec nous et à travailler sur des projets qui les passionnent.


Liste des tâches:


· Répondre aux demandes d’informations par courriel, par téléphone et en personne ;


· Entrer des réservations dans le système de vente Hotello ;


· Vérifier les réservations, assigner les chambres, procéder aux paiements ;


· Communiquer avec les différents départements (maintenance, entretien ménager, direction, etc.) au besoin ;


· Répondre aux commentaires et aux plaintes des clients ;


· Préparer les rapports demandés ;


· Gérer la présence des Lofts sur les différentes plateformes (Booking, Expédia, Google, TripAdvisor, AIRBNB, etc.) ;


· Se déplacer dans nos différents établissements pour assister des clients au besoin (dans un rayon de 2km) ;


· Certains soirs, effectuer des tournées dans nos différents établissements pour s’assurer de la tranquillité des lieux et assister les clients au besoin;


· Autres tâches connexes proposées par l’employé et/ou par ses supérieurs.


Exigences

· Expérience en réception d’hôtel ;

· Bilinguisme (français/anglais) à l’oral et à l’écrit (une troisième langue serait un atout) ;

· Excellentes aptitudes en service à la clientèle ;

· Connaissance du logiciel Hotello, un atout.


Conditions

Il s’agit d’un poste à temps plein entre 35h et 40h pour l'été avec possibilité de réduire à temps partiel à l'automne.


Les horaires sont variables en fonction des besoins opérationnels.
skills: ['Relevant du superviseur de la réception, l’agent à la réception s’assure de la gestion des réservations et d’offrir un service à la clientèle à la hauteur des standards des Lofts.', '· Connaissance du logiciel Hotello, un atout.', '· Autres tâches connexes proposées par l’employé et/ou par ses supérieurs.', '· Gérer la présence des Lofts sur les différentes plateformes (Booking, Expédia, Google, TripAdvisor, AIRBNB, etc.) ;', '· Expérience en réception d’hôtel ;']

title: Receptionist
description:
The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented team player who will be the first point of contact for visitors at the office, greeting them in a polite and well-spoken manner. You will also be assigned duties as required (i.e. organization of inbound and outbound mail, administrative work, and general clerical support). 

 

Responsibilities


  • Greet customers at reception desk (When working in Office)(This will include welcoming guest, preparing coffee, initial greeting when people come into the office)
  • Perform some administrative tasks according to the needs of the team. (Meeting scheduling, mail management, clerical work)
  • Responsible for making sure we have all necessary office supplies
  • Being the first point of contact for walk-in clients and customers
  • Answer, screen and forward telephone calls as well as relay any messages to proper individuals
  • Perform other duties, such as filing, sorting and distributing mail, photocopying, faxing


    • Qualifications

    • High school diploma or relevant work experience
    • Ability to maintain a positive attitude
    • Excellent communication skills


    Perks and Benefits

    • Immediate employment
    • Health Benefits and insurance after 3 months
    • RRSP Contribution plan after 3 months

title: Office Administrator
description:
The Chilliwack Coliseum is seeking an outgoing and friendly Office Administrator to join our team. The Office Administrator ​​is responsible for the everyday function of the Coliseum and Chiefs’ joint front office and is the first face that greets customers in our office.


Duties include but are not limited to:

- Managing phones, answering inquiries, front office presence.

- Scheduling ice and facility rentals with customers and stakeholders.

- Daily and game night cashouts.

- Assist accounting staff with Bookkeeping (A/R & A/P).

- Box Office Staff Scheduling.

- Selling of tickets and merchandise in the front office.

- Season Tickets – Assisting in sales, processing, and input into our ticketing system.

- Available to work game nights and events.


Requirements:

- Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills.

- Excellent coordination, organizational, time-management, and work prioritization skills.

- Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel.

- Accounting and administrative experience is an asset but not required.

- Excellent customer service, and interpersonal skills.

- Enjoy working in a team environment.


Job Type: Full-time, Permanent.

Benefits: Extended Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted
skills: ['- Accounting and administrative experience is an asset but not required.', '- Available to work game nights and events.', '- Managing phones, answering inquiries, front office presence.', '- Season Tickets – Assisting in sales, processing, and input into our ticketing system.']

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Job Type: Permanent

Reference code: 102401

Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada

All Available Locations: Toronto

Our Purpose

Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.

Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.

Are you looking for a role where you will be continuously learning? Keep reading!

What will your typical day look like?

As an Executive Assistant, you will provide administrative support for 3-5 Partners and/or Directors. You will work alongside your partners to proactively support their day-to-day needs and management of their service area. You are a highly organized individual and are able to build effective relationships. As an Executive Assistant, you will support, represent, and actively participate in Partner matters.

About The Team

As a part of the Business Operations Team, we work to leverage appropriate firm resources to manage, own, and minimize administrative tasks for the Partners. In our team, we handle work-related matters on behalf of, and alongside the Partner. We work to grow our careers, connect, and learn through continuous on-the-job learning and collaboration with others.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone with:
  • Minimum 3 years of administrative experience in a professional, client-service driven and fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated aptitude to prioritize tasks based on comparative importance and urgency
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and direction
  • Advanced-level knowledge of common industry software such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Adobe Acrobat
  • Flexibility to work overtime, if required
Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
skills: ['Demonstrated aptitude to prioritize tasks based on comparative importance and urgency', 'Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.', 'Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.', 'Advanced-level knowledge of common industry software such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Adobe Acrobat', 'Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.', 'Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.', 'Minimum 3 years of administrative experience in a professional, client-service driven and fast-paced environment']

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual back-grounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.

Position Description Summary

This position is responsible for opening the files used by the departments and branches to track, control, bill and manage shipments from Asia to North America.

Principal Accountabilities
  • File Shipment creation- data entry.
  • Container/ shipment internet tracking and tracing
  • Container/ Shipment tracking and tracing via telephone
  • Follow-up on documents from Schenker’s overseas office.
  • Provide Shipment updates.
  • Providing customer service.
  • Clerical duties as assigned.

Knowledge And Skills
  • Keyboarding/typing speed- 60 -70 WPM
  • Accuracy is essential
  • Flexible
  • Team Player
  • Knowledge of Microsoft programs i.e. Excel, and Word at an intermediate level.
  • Able to work with minimal supervision
skills: ['Provide Shipment updates.', 'Flexible', 'Clerical duties as assigned.', 'Providing customer service.', 'Keyboarding/typing speed- 60 -70 WPM', 'Able to work with minimal supervision']

title: Executive Assistant/Office Coordinator
description:
The Executive Assistant/Office Coordinator is based in Stratcom’s Vancouver office. The position is in the Office of the CEO and has a role in the effective day-to-day administration of the Vancouver office, which is a flex time staffed office in a co-working space in Yaletown. The Executive Assistant/Office Coordinator provides pro-active support to the CEO and works in collaboration with all Stratcom departments. This position reports to the CEO.


The responsibilities for this position are listed below. However, specific duties and tasks assigned will reflect the workload of the CEO at different periods of time.


Executive Assistant/Office Coordinator


The following is a list of responsibilities for the position. However, specific duties and tasks assigned will reflect the workload of the company in coordination with the CEO.


Executive Assistant to CEO Responsibilities:

• Schedule appointments for busy calendar; assist in preparation and follow up for meetings

• Document preparation and dictation including writing, editing, formatting of letters, emails, memos and reports; research and data entry

• Management of filing system, contacts and paper flow. Organize and track receipts, purchases and expenses including: sorting receipts, tracking missing receipts, determining which expenses are work-related or personal (this often involves calling a hotel, digging into Amazon account) 

• Scheduling and attending Board of Directors meetings, assisting in preparation of Board materials package, taking minutes of Board meetings and other general assistance as required – prepare documentation, book hotels, travel, meals 

• Coordinate and book CEO’s travel arrangements, and liaise with Travel Agency

• Personal assistance including updates to personal calendar, organizing personal expenses and bookings, personal errands tech purchases/repairs 

• Other duties as required


Office Coordination Responsibilities:

• Purchase supplies, provide some administrative and other support to senior staff, clients and to the call centre

• Prepare memos, announcements; liaise with office landlord on building related issues including repairs, keys, and act as point person for these issues; overall responsibility for keeping office space organized, book and organize meeting space.

• Coordinate set up of events, attend and provide assistance

• Other duties as required


While the place of work is Stratcom’s Vancouver office, a hybrid home/in office arrangement has been approved for this position. This is evolving but current expectations of 3 days in the office and 2 days work from home. Working more or full time from the office is available should the candidate prefer.


Skills, knowledge and experience requirements include:

• Proven success working as an Executive Assistant required.

• Highly organized, and proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks effectively with strong attention to detail and minimal supervision.

• Extremely reliable and timely.

• Advanced MS Office knowledge, skills, ability, and experience particularly using: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, One Note and Internet applications.

• Excellent scheduling, prioritizing capability.

• Strong copywriting, editing and proofreading skills.

• Excellent verbal and written communications skills. 

• Pro-active problem solver - anticipate needs and resolve autonomously.

• Able to work effectively under pressure and to deadlines.

• Able to take direction from multiple sources.

• Excellent interpersonal skills. Tactful and able to remain calm in stressful environments including when dealing with staff, clients and public.

• Experience sourcing suppliers and purchasing.

• Good understanding of and experience working with office equipment (phone systems, photocopiers, printers, etc.). 

• Availability to work evenings and weekends, which may include working offsite to set up and attend events

• Ability and willingness to be available wirelessly for after-hours requests. 

• Bilingual French/English will be considered a strong asset.


This is a full-time position, requiring some weekends and evenings, and availability to respond to urgent requests afterhours.


We are committed to workforce diversity and actively recruit people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, which reflect the community in which we live and work. If this description of work excites and inspires you, we want you to apply today.


Stratcom has an accommodation process in place. Applicants requiring accommodation because of a disability or medical need are asked to make their needs known in advance.


Please submit covering letter and resume by, May 10, 2022, to: wwright.hr@gmail.com and include, Executive Assistant/Office Coordinator in the subject line.


We thank all applicants for their interest but only those shortlisted will be contacted.

title: Chargé de la réception
description:
Bienvenue à Muraflex
Muraflex est une entreprise pionnière dans le domaine de l'architecture. Nous fabriquons des cloisons de séparation en verre haut de gamme pour les espaces commerciaux, et le lauréat du prix de la société la mieux gérée au Canada!
Nos produits élégants et au design recherché sont créés et fabriqués à Montréal avec une touche européenne qui distingue notre style unique.
Les produits de Muraflex sont non seulement très solides, mais aussi toujours de sophistication et de raffinement emblématiques. Nous visons à créer pour chacun de nos clients des espaces élégants et fonctionnels qui apportent de la lumière dans leurs bureaux. Nous vendons nos produits du Canada aux États-Unis, et nous sommes heureux d'avoir parmi nos clients Google, NARS, Starbucks, Sidley Austin, et bien d'autres.

Culture du lieu de travail
Le travail est une partie tellement importante de la vie d'une personne que nous essayons de faire en sorte que vous vous sentiez chez vous lorsque vous travaillez avec nous.
Nous souhaitons la bienvenue à tous les membres de notre famille Muraflex depuis le premier jour, et nous pensons que le soutien, la communication et la collaboration sont les clés du succès !
Chez Muraflex, nous rassemblons les gens parce que les équipes qui s'unissent fonctionnent mieux!
Nous encourageons les employés à créer des liens en organisant de nombreuses activités avec un comité social convivial qui planifie des repas-partage, des dîners, des activités sportives, des fêtes et bien d'autres choses encore tout au long de l'année.
Nous montrons notre reconnaissance à nos employés en célébrant des événements marquants comme les anniversaires et les congés de maternité.
Chez Muraflex, nous sommes passionnés, nous nous développons rapidement et nos employés grandissent avec nous !
Notre équipe est dynamique et innovante.
Notre devise est OUI, NOUS POUVONS, et quand nous promettons, nous réalisons.
Nous avons des chefs d'équipe inspirants, qui croient en nous et rendent notre vie de bureau si agréable!
Vous êtes curieux d'en savoir plus sur nous et notre équipe extraordinaire ? Consultez notre page Instagram, FB, et notre site web en cliquant sur les icônes ci-dessous ou sur les liens !
Maintenant, assez parlé de nous, parlons de vous !

www.instagram.com/muraflex
www.facebook.com/muraflex
muraflex.com

Résumé des tâches
Nous sommes à la recherche d'une Réceptionniste expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe ! Vous serez responsable d'un éventail de tâches administratives, notamment répondre et transférer un volume élevé d'appels, prendre et transmettre des messages, accueillir et signer les visiteurs et effectuer d'autres tâches administratives et de bureau générales selon les besoins.
Si vous possédez d'excellentes aptitudes à la communication, une tenue professionnelle, un esprit d'équipe et une attitude positive et que vous êtes fiable et très organisé, ne manquez pas de postuler immédiatement ! Chez Muraflex, vous travaillerez dans un environnement convivial, rapide et respectueux qui favorise le travail d'équipe et la collaboration.

Ce que vous ferez?
Responsable d'une variété de tâches administratives, de bureau et de réception.
Répondre/transférer les appels pour les bureaux du Canada et des États-Unis.
Aider les RH et le comité social à planifier les événements avant et après leur tenue.
Accueillir et aider tous les invités et visiteurs avec une attitude chaleureuse et enthousiaste.
Traiter tout le courrier entrant et sortant, y compris les colis interbureaux nationaux et internationaux.
Tenir un inventaire régulier et commander en temps utile les fournitures de bureau, les boissons, les ustensiles, etc.
Effectuer d'autres tâches liées au travail, selon les besoins.

Avez-vous ce qu'il faut ?
2 à 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de réceptionniste de bureau ;
Exigence minimale : diplôme d'études secondaires, diplôme d'études collégiales de préférence.
Maîtrise totale de l'exploitation d'un système téléphonique multi-lignes
Compétences informatiques : Excellente maîtrise de MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook).
Personnalité énergique et ouverte, avec une attitude positive
Solides compétences administratives, y compris la connaissance du fonctionnement de l'équipement de bureau standard.
Compétences exceptionnelles en matière de service à la clientèle, au téléphone et en personne.
Sens aigu de l'urgence, aptitude à résoudre les problèmes et capacité à travailler sous pression.
Sens du contact et étiquette téléphonique
Familiarité avec les rapports financiers et la facturation
Expérience de l'expédition et de la réception avec Fedex, Purolator et d'autres entreprises du secteur des transports (un atout).
Suivi exceptionnel et souci du détail
Excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite en anglais et en français.
Ponctuel, fiable.

Ce que nous offrons?
Muraflex est une entreprise à croissance rapide qui offre un environnement de travail dynamique avec des possibilités de croissance et un programme de rémunération compétitif ainsi que des avantages tels que
Régime d'assurance collective : ensemble d'avantages médicaux et dentaires payés à 50 % par l'employeur
2 jours de maladie/ 2 personnel par an
Semaines de vacances
Stationnement gratuit
Espresso, café et thé gratuits
20% de réduction sur l'abonnement STM OPUS
Accès gratuit à la salle de sport sur place
Révision annuelle des performances et des salaires
Un comité social actif, des activités mensuelles et des surprises pour couvrir divers événements.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Administrative Assistant & Receptionist
description:
Kanset Services Inc. is seeking an energetic, self-starter professional to join our team as an Administrative Assistant & Receptionist.


Kanset Services Inc. is a full-service immigration firm with over 25 years of experience in helping clients immigrate, work, and live in Canada. Our business is built on our commitment to helping corporate, individual clients and their families achieve their immigration-related goals by surveying the ever-changing landscape of Canadian foreign and domestic policy and applying this professional expertise in a manner that is tailored to their needs.


We offer a valuable learning experience, diverse and interesting work with a high degree of autonomy, the ability to interact with a broad range of clients, and ample opportunities to grow within the company.


About The Role

As an Administrative Assistant & Receptionist, you will be responsible for providing support and professional courtesy to both clients and internal staff alike. You will also act as the first point of contact for clients and visitors hailing from many diverse backgrounds and walks of life throughout their time engaged with the firm.


This is a permanent, full-time position.


Responsibilities and Duties

  • Oversee front reception desk by greeting visitors in a pleasant and professional manner
  • Screening calls and inquiries for relevance and matter resolution
  • Drafting, filing, and managing e-mail and correspondence, opening files, printing and filing, archiving, and performing general administrative tasks
  • Handling incoming and outgoing mail, ordering office supplies, arrange couriers, prepare bank deposits
  • Scheduling both in-office and off-site meetings, including in-person and via zoom or phone and securing reservations
  • Supporting staff in various department with administrative tasks, resources and organization
  • Maintain office security by following safety, security and alarm procedures and limiting access to offices via the reception desk
  • Complete various tasks as asked by the higher management team


Qualifications, Experience and Skills

  • Post-secondary diploma in a relevant field – either to Immigration or Administration
  • 1-2 years of office administrative assistant and/or receptionist experience
  • Proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Multi-tasking and self-driven time management skills
  • Organized and detail-oriented
  • Comfortable working both autonomously and in a team in a fast-paced, demanding environment
  • Punctual and reliable
  • Experience in the immigration industry or at a consultancy/law firm an asset
  • Familiarity working with a CRM considered an asset
  • Multilingualism HIGHLY preferred, French Bilingualism an asset

 


Kanset Services Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other related factors. In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005, and the Integrated Accessibility Standards Regulation, disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.


How to apply

Qualified applicants are invited to submit their application in response to this ad or by an electronic resume and cover letter in a single PDF format, separated by page breaks to resume@kanset.com with the subject line: “Administrative Assistant – [your name]”


Deadline

Applications must be submitted by May 1, 2022. Note: Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted, please do not attempt contact after sending in your application.

title: Dental Receptionist
description:
ABOUT US


We make Toronto smile!


City Dental Toronto is a rapidly growing dental group with numerous dental practices in downtown Toronto.


Our amazing team of dentists, hygienists, administrators and auxiliary staff deliver the highest quality of care to thousands of patients in downtown Toronto. Our people provide our patients with the highest level of care through innovation, technology and a commitment to superior patient experience.


Position: Dental Receptionist / Administrator

We are looking for a full-time Dental Receptionist / Administrator to join our growing team! In this role, you will be responsible for administering the day-to-day activities of the practice, including: welcoming patients, answering inquiries about dental services, managing the daily schedule, processing insurance claims and other administrative duties to ensure the smooth running of the office. Our ideal candidate is an ambitious, self-starter who is organized and energetic with a patient-focused attitude.

This position requires an applicant with a flexible schedule and availability to work Monday through Saturday.


Responsibilities:

  • Welcome patients to the practice and assist with their needs
  • Answer incoming calls and assist with inquiries in a timely manner
  • Schedule and confirming initial/recurring patient appointments
  • Optimize the appointment schedule to ensure the day is full, with limited gaps, ensuring efficient use of both Dentist and Hygienist(s) time
  • Oversee patient relations and handle questions and complaints with professionalism
  • Ensuring patient acceptance of treatment plans by answering questions and creating value for the proposed dental treatment
  • Liaise with insurance providers for billing, breakdowns, predeterminations and payment reconciliations - being prepared to effectively educate patients on the insurance process
  • Assist in the resolution of issues with third-party payers
  • Manage and maintain patient records in compliance with practice policies
  • Monitor inventory and order dental office supplies as needed
  • Other ad hoc administrative duties as required

    • Qualifications:

    • 1+ years of experience in a customer service or receptionist role, dental administration or health care experience is highly preferred
    • Knowledge of dental practice management software is preferred, experience with Tracker is considered an asset
    • Knowledge of dental practice processes and workflows (scheduling, financial and treatment coordination) is preferred
    • Outstanding communication skills – you have an energetic and outgoing personality with a passion for helping those around you
    • Exceptional organizational skills and strong attention to detail
    • Comfortable working with computers and technology – we are paperless!
    • Strong problem-solving skills and comfortable working with autonomy
    • Effective interpersonal skills and a professional and positive demeanor under varying stress levels


    If this sounds like you, please submit your cover letter and resume outlining why you think you’d be a great fit for this role!


    We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who are selected to proceed in the hiring process will be contacted.


    City Dental Toronto is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, family status or on any legally protected grounds.

title: (Canada) Data Entry Clerk - Administrative Assistant (Remote Data Entry Job) (Remote)
description:
Earn money from Home by Participating in Paid Surveys - Data Entry agent - Customer Service Rep - Part-time

We are looking for individuals nationwide to join paid studies - Apply ASAP!

We offer you the possibility to gain extra income from home (remotely) and likewise to choose your own involvement schedule. At this task, you will be executing numerous tasks such as data entry, performing email response, reviews, studies as well as other on-line jobs.

This work from home possibility is very rewarding and also will help shape the industry as well as affect new products coming to market. Sometimes you will also get to see products before the public and also participate in testing them. You'll be helping companies accumulate information to help projection trends and influence future company choices based on the info given.
  • Earn cash taking surveys. Up to $35 per completed survey!
  • Various payment methods, including Paypal, direct check, or on-line virtual present card codes
  • Part Time
  • Work remotely and earn extra income at home.
Apply

If you are the type of person that is self-motivated and also comfy working on your own at home, delight in such work as email customer support, data entry as well as evaluate products, then you are the person we are trying to find.

Data entry agent originate from all different backgrounds including, data entry, outbound telemarketing, customer support, sales, clerical, secretary, management assistant, assistant, phone call facility, part-time.

title: executive assistant - Urgent Hiring
description:
We are hiring a remarkable executive assistant to join our diverse team at Bangkok Food Truck in Scoudouc, NB.

Growing your career as a Full Time executive assistant is a fantastic opportunity to develop exceptional skills.

If you are strong in people management, cooperation and have the right mindset for the job, then apply for the position of executive assistant at Bangkok Food Truck today!

Business Equipment and Computer Applications
  • MS Excel
  • MS Word
  • Accounting software
  • MS Office
  • MS Outlook
Specific Skills
  • Establish and co-ordinate administrative policies and procedures
  • Analyze incoming and outgoing memoranda, submissions and reports
  • Liaise with departmental and corporate officials and with other organizations and associations
  • Arrange travel, related itineraries and make reservations
  • Prepare and co-ordinate the production and submission of summary briefs and reports
  • Compile data and prepare papers for consideration and presentation by executive committees and boards of directors
  • Prepare agendas and make arrangements for committee, board and other meetings

  • Excellent oral communication
  • Excellent written communication
  • Dependability

  • Health care plan

  • Company offers great benefits

title: Adjoint administratif
description:
Nous sommes, chez Gamic Sports, une équipe dynamique de passionnés de

sport et de plein air. Notre agence met en relation les fabricants et les

détaillants en représentant un éventail diversifié de marques de plein air.

Créée en 2007, notre entreprise se démarque par son service à la clientèle

hors pair. Nous préconisons une approche personnalisée axée sur une réponse rapide et

efficace aux besoins de notre clientèle. Afin de compléter notre équipe, nous sommes

actuellement à la recherche d’une adjointe ou d’un adjoint administratif permanent à temps

plein, du lundi au vendredi, pour travailler directement à notre (tout nouveau très beau) bureau situé au 7960 14e avenue à Montréal, dans le quartier Saint-Michel.


Ces tâches feront partie du quotidien :


❖ Gérer les comptes payables et recevables

❖ Vérifier et saisir les factures dans le logiciel Quickbooks

❖ Effectuer de l’entrée de données

❖ Faire la réception et l’expédition de marchandises

❖ Offrir de l’assistance technique aux représentants (par exemple, aider à la préparation

d’évènements corporatifs)

❖ Assurer le service à la clientèle (téléphonique, courriels et présentiel)

❖ Être responsable de l’organisation du bureau (approvisionnement, rangement, etc.)

❖ Coordonner des projets de commandites/partenariat avec des fondations


Nous avons quelques exigences :


❖ Connaissances en comptabilité, facilité avec les chiffres

❖ Maîtriser Excel

❖ Expérience dans un poste similaire

❖ Être organisé et minutieux

❖ Bilinguisme (oral et écrit)

❖ Atout si

➢ intérêt pour le sport et le plein air

➢ connaissance du logiciel Quickbooks


De plus, afin de bien compléter notre équipe existante, nous recherchons une ou un future

collègue qui démontre de l’initiative, qui soit autonome et rigoureux et… sympathique! ☺


En contrepartie, nous offrons les avantages suivants :


❖ Un régime volontaire d’épargne-retraite avec une participation équivalente de

l’employeur jusqu’à concurrence de 3 %

❖ Des assurances collectives payées à 60 % par l’employeur

❖ Un salaire concurrentiel à discuter en fonction de l’expérience

❖ Et surtout, une opportunité de se réaliser avec une équipe de travail exceptionnelle!


Intéressant, n’est-ce pas?


Envoyez-nous votre C.V. par courriel avant le 15 mai 2022 à mbyette@gamicsports.com.


Nous avons déjà hâte de faire votre connaissance!

title: Driving Instructor
description:
About GoDribe:

We are a Waterloo-based driving school startup, simplifying the process for learners to find and book their ideal Driving Instructors. At the same time, we help instructors get a steady stream of students for their business.


We are looking for a knowledgeable instructor to join our team to transform the student training industry. Our instructors are provided with GoDribe’s licenced app to automate the working hours, appointments, student lists and other day-to-day tasks.


What we offer:

  • $30 - $35 / hour guaranteed on a full-time basis, whether you get lessons or not
  • We provide a dynamic workplace with promotion opportunities and a super flexible work schedule!


What you will do:

  • Provide in-car lessons and train students on how to drive using the GoDribe curriculum
  • Share feedback with our students and us to help them become better drivers
  • Create a safe learning environment for our students
  • Participate in frequent training / upskilling
  • Share your knowledge with our team to improve our app and training industry.


What we’d like to see in you:

  • Safe driving skills
  • Regular and Punctual
  • Patience and teaching ability
  • Excellent customer serviceability
  • Tech Savvy and curious to learn new tech - all of our instructors manage their schedules using our inbuilt GoDribe Software and apps


What we’d like to see on your resume:

  • MTO driving instructor license (required)
  • 3-5 years of driving experience
  • Existing driving school, Uber, Taxi, or Truck Driving experience is a big plus.
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • College / university diploma / degree is an asset


﻿Meet the ministry standards for driving instruction:

  • Have a clean driving record (0 demerit points)
  • Able to produce a Vulnerable Sector Check and a Police Information Check
  • A vehicle with a valid safety certificate


Thank you for considering a career with GoDribe’s Driving School arm.


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time Part-time hours: 10-40 per week

Salary: $30.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Schedule:

  • 8-hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Are you an MTO-certified driving instructor?

Experience:

  • Driving Instructor: 1 year (preferred)

title: 010 - Tour Guides
description:
Join the dynamic team of guides who make the Morrin Centre a fun and fascinating place to visit – and work!

Amaze visitors with your stellar tours of Quebec City’s best kept secret. Use your unique talents to enliven each program. This fun, summer job involves a lot of time within the spaces of this beautiful historical site – as well as our dark and sinister jail cells!

Reporting To The Guided Tours Coordinator, Responsibilities Include

We are currently seeking positive, enthusiastic individuals dedicated to providing exemplary customer service in presenting the site to our visitors.
  • Greeting and responding to visitor enquiries;
  • Interpreting the site and delivering tours & educational programs as a costumed guide from May until September 2022, with the possibility of extension;
  • Performing front desk duties including; admission, gift shop sales & inventory, collecting statistical data, visitor questions through phone & email, other related tasks.
  • Promoting the Centre’s tours to passersby.
  • Assist with special events and activities, as required.
  • Disinfecting and ensuring a clean work environment.
Intention Of Returning To Studies In The Fall In One Of The Following Fields (or Other Relevant Studies) Is a Must

We are looking for self-motivated people who are able to work within a team, have strong communication skills in both official languages and be punctual. Must have experience with customer service and cash systems. Experience with giving guided tours and theatre is an asset. Must have been a full-time student in Winter 2021 / 22, aged 30 years or younger & have completed at least a one-year post-secondary studies.
  • Archaeology
  • Communications
  • Education
  • Heritage Studies
  • History
  • Museology
  • Tourism
Number of hours: 35 per week. Includes evening and weekend work.

Start Date : Training begins the week of May 9th, 2022.

Salary: $16 / hour

Interested candidates are invited to send their curriculum vitae in French and a cover letter in English and French by email to jobs@morrin.org by May 2nd at 5:00 pm to the attention of Stefanie Johnston. Please indicate Tour Guide in the subject line. Selected candidates will be invited to an interview.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Overview

Are you a highly organized professional with a knack for systems and adding “method to the madness”? Do some of your strengths include “herding cats” and “coordinating chaos” ? If so, we may have the right role for you ! We have a newly created position for an Executive Assistant to work closely with our partnership team. Want to feel valued and part of a collaborative team? From day one, you will have an immediate impact on our organisation!!


Roles and Responsibilities

Now, the right person for this role is going to desire details. So, while this is a new role to the organization and things may evolve, here’s a detailed breakdown of what the role’s accountabilities and cadence looks like:

  • Administrative - Oversee daily operations through collaboration with senior management, performing an array of administrative tasks from managing calendars, generating correspondence, maintaining hard copy and electronic files, planning and coordinating corporate meetings, and scheduling facilities
  • Marketing and Communication - Ability to prepare and disseminate strong internal and external communications including emails, marketing literature, website content, and social media.
  • Office Management - Maintain efficiency within the office by establishing the best policies, standards, and procedures for the company


Qualifications & Experience


  • High School Diploma. Post Secondary education is preferred.
  • 2+ years in a business, marketing or executive management role
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Proficient use of technology and ability to learn new software programs rapidly
  • High level of organization with a client-oriented approach
  • Demonstrated ability to adhere to deadlines and multitask
  • Ability to be handling confidential information with high degree of integrity.
  • Extremely versatile, dedicated to efficient productivity
  • Nimble business mind with a focus on developing creative solutions
  • Ability to communicate directly with clients and encourage trusting relationships

If interested, please send your updated resume and salary expectations to info@lockhartinc.ca. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Personal Assistant
description:
Your Purpose at SHAiR.co!


We’re looking for go-getters who don’t mind being pushed out of their comfort zones. For perfectionists who are willing to put in extra hours to make sure their tasks are completed not just to their own satisfaction, but beyond others’ expectations. For confident self-starters who want to be part of something greater than themselves.


What We Are Looking For:

We are looking for a Personal Assistant to help our busy CEO with a variety of professional and personal tasks. You may be asked to attend meetings and help around the office, as well as help run the personal day to day tasks of the CEO’s household.

This role would often spend their time traveling (Need Passport), making phone calls, meet with vendors and speaking on behalf of the CEO, among numerous other tasks. The CEO would prefer for this position to be with him the majority of the day and travel with him when needed.


Skills Needed For Success In The Role

  • Strong Interpersonal Skills
  • Tech-savvy and experience with word processing and email programs
  • Active listening and good communication skills
  • Proactive approach to problem-solving
  • Ability to multitask
  • Strong time-management and organization
  • Clean driving record.
  • Cooking
  • Comfortable/Good with children


Duties and Responsibilities

  • Schedule meetings and manage personal calendars for CEO & Wife
  • Answer phone calls/emails and be able to take detailed messages.
  • Help with daily time management/Personal schedules outside of the office calendar.
  • Run errands as requested, including kid pickup/drop offs.
  • Some travel planning to and from B.C.
  • Cooking if requested.
  • May be asked to look after children and must be able to be around to help with dogs.

title: administrative assistant - Urgent Position
description:
We are on the lookout for a resourceful administrative assistant to join our exceptional team at BUSY BOYS ELECTRICAL LTD in Surrey, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time administrative assistant is an amazing opportunity to develop competitive skills.

If you are strong in persuasion, presentation and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of administrative assistant at BUSY BOYS ELECTRICAL LTD today!
  • or equivalent experience
Operating Systems and Software
  • Google Docs
Business Equipment and Computer Applications
  • MS Excel
  • MS PowerPoint
  • MS Windows
  • MS Word
  • Quick Books
  • MS Office
Area of Specialization
  • Reports and records
  • Invoices
  • Correspondence
Technical Terminology
  • Business
Specific Skills
  • Type and proofread correspondence, forms and other documents
  • Schedule and confirm appointments
  • Greet people and direct them to contacts or service areas
  • Answer telephone and relay telephone calls and messages
  • Answer electronic enquiries
  • Compile data, statistics and other information
  • Order office supplies and maintain inventory
  • Record and prepare minutes of meetings, seminars and conferences
  • Open and distribute regular and electronic incoming mail and other material and co-ordinate the flow of information

title: Office Assistant
description:
Description

You might be the highly-skilled and motivated Office Assistant Robert Half is looking for, if you're interested in providing support with various administrative duties. Are you a talented professional who loves handling multiple projects at once with a positive outlook? Then this Office Assistant role is the job for you. The Office Assistant is a short-term contract / temporary opportunity and is located in the West Vancouver, British Columbia area.

What you get to do every day
  • Submit data accurately
  • File, copy and faxing for multiple departments
  • Direct calls appropriately
  • Oversee office facility
Requirements
  • Thorough understanding of word processing and spreadsheets highly valued
  • Means to operate basic office equipment, complete general office work and route incoming materials
  • Finish tasks independently
  • Ability to multitask and communicate well with individuals of all backgrounds
  • Eagerness to take on anything from small internal administrative tasks to high profile requests
  • Capacity to assess process and internal control weaknesses and identify improvements
  • Administrative Assistance experience
  • Branch administration experience preferred
  • Proficiency in Organizational Changes
Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4154. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Bookkeeper / Administrative Assistant
description:
Are you ready to join a challenging, energetic and fast paced environment? We are a local family owned promotional company located in London, ON and are looking for an experienced Book Keeper / Administrative Assistant .


We have a very friendly, cooperative work environment with many long term employees. We are very accommodating with our staff and pride ourselves on good relationships.

 

Full Time - 8 hrs/day, Monday-Friday. paid 1/2 hour lunch

Location: In Office

Salary : to be negotiated

                                   Job Responsibilities:

Accurate and efficient maintenance of accounting records using industry specific accounting software.

                       Accounts Receivable

- creating customers invoices

- accepting and processing payments from walk-in customer as well as CC payments online

- collection of overdue accounts

 

                       Accounts Payable

- reconcile vendor invoices to statements

- managing payment of vendor invoices

- managing corporate credit card payments and statements

 

                       General

- problem-solving

- assistance to co-workers

- filing, scanning, office organization

- administration duties as required

 

Your Qualifications:

- minimum college diploma in Bookkeeping, Accounting or Business

- 3+ years of experience in a bookkeeping role

- Meticulous attention to detail - specifically balancing and double-checking entries

- excellent organizational, time management and prioritizing skills

title: Urgent Hiring - Full Time - Data Entry Associate / Clerk
description:
Data Entry Opportunity is back! Catch this great opportunity and level up your data entry skills. Are you a fast typist with great attention to detail and accuracy? We want to hire you! Calling all Data Entry job seekers in Mississauga, we have a great opportunity for you in the Data Entry Centre. Check this out!

Are you comfortable working in fast paced and in a warehouse environment? Do you have great multi-tasking skills and effective communication skills? Do you have experience with high volume and keen attention to accuracy and detail? If so, look no further we are looking for YOU! We are looking for eager, confident individuals to join our team in the Mississauga / Brampton area !

Job Title: Data Entry Clerk / Associate
  • Must be comfortable working in an office setting within a warehouse type of environment.
  • 90% Data Entry and 10% Production

Pay rate:

$17.70/hr - $18.70/hr,

Weekly pay by direct deposit

SHIFTS AVAILABLE:

Morning Shift: Monday - Thursday 5am - 3:05pm $17.70

Weekend Shift: Friday - Sun: 6:15am - 6:45pm $18.70

Job Location (choose one):

Mississauga: Airport Road and American Drive (close to the Pearson Airport)

Please send your updated resume to Mery at: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca with the Job Title "Data Entry Clerk" with the Shift of your choice in the subject line for immediate consideration.

Advantages

Weekly pay (every Thursday)

Opportunity for growth and permanent hire within the company

Team based environment

Positive and fun work atmosphere

Gain experience working for a leader in Retail Distribution

Medical and dental plans available through Randstad

(optional)

One-of-a-kind, inclusive culture

Self-serve beverage and snack station

Fun team-oriented environments

Responsibilities
  • Working in an office in a warehouse setting - assisting with the cutting, stapling, sorting of packaging labels - excellent attention to detail, organization skills.
  • Responsible for facilitating and supporting DC production flow by ensuring distros, tickets, store labels are sorted, cut, matched and distributed in an accurate and timely manner, in addition to also printing locator cards as necessary.
  • Responsible for accurately sorting, separating, cutting, matching, shipping and bundling tickets, distros, store labels, advertisement labels, locator cards and translations.
  • Maintains the timely scanning of ticket bundles into correct production/processing areas/departments.
  • Responsible for ensuring the accurate and timely release of tickets to the correct production areas.
  • Work with Cutter/Stacker machine for cutting and matching tickets
  • Other Duties as assigned

Qualifications

Education: OSSD Grade 12 or equivalent

1+ year experience in a fast paced production environment

A minimum of 6 months of professional data entry experience

Effective communication skills with internal partners

Attention to accuracy and detail

Requires sense of urgency to be able meet sensitive timelines

Basic math (ie counting, addition, multiplication)

Summary

Also, let us know if you have a friend or family member who would be interested in a warehouse associate or data entry job, you could earn cash if you refer someone who is hired! You can earn up to an extra $250 referral bonus for every person you refer. There’s no referral cap, so refer as many people as you like!

Please email your updated resume to LEENA at: aileen.mason@randstad.ca with the Job Title "Data Entry Clerk" with the Shift & Location of your choice in the subject line for immediate consideration.

Hope to hear from you soon.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Receptionist - Urgent
description:
We are on the lookout for a motivated Receptionist to join our productive team at CEP Forensic Engineering in Ottawa, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Receptionist is a fantastic opportunity to develop relevant skills.

If you are strong in communication, leadership and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of Receptionist at CEP Forensic Engineering today!

We are looking for a full-time receptionist (37.5 h/week) from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. This person will play an important role in everyday operations and the smooth functioning of the Ottawa office as the first line of contact between the clients and the business.

Under supervision of the regional director, this person will work hand in hand with different professional teams and offer timely administrative support for routine activities and special events, as needed.

Responsabilities

 Reception
  • Act as the first point of contact for clients and visitors.
  • Prepare and update employees and suppliers contact information.
  • Acknowledge receipt and adequately answer client emails and other correspondences, then follow-up as needed.
  • Complete general office tasks, such as photocopying, faxing, scanning documents, and filling in forms.
  • Coordinate sending and receiving emails, packages, and shipments.
  • Manage office supplies, including safety equipment and supplies used in the kitchen and the washrooms.
  • Oversee proper maintenance and cleaning.
  • Collaborate with service suppliers concerning building management and installation contracts (document shredding, garbage collection, office cleaning, etc.).
Administration
  • Open new mandates on the company’s systems, including Salesforce, and create both a physical and a virtual file on the server.
  • Manage the entirety of the files billing process.
  • Manage storage of exhibits for inactive files.
  • Contact clients to obtain missing information on a file and update said file as needed.
  • Buy, replace, and make technical supplies available in the laboratory and workshop when they break.
  • Manage the storage of samples and exhibits so that they are easily retrievable and update the inventory.
  • Label equipment and tools.
  • Book flights and accommodations as needed.
  • Perform any other related task entrusted by management.
Requirements
  • Administrative or secretarial studies.
  • Two years of relevant experience in a similar capacity.
  • Bilingualism – verbal and written mastery of both French and English.
  • Proven ability to work with sensitive information and use common sense in various situations.
  • Resourcefulness, teamwork as well as competency in interpersonal relations, communication, planning, organization, coordination, and time management.
  • Exceptional writing, transcription, and report revising skills.
  • Excellent customer service skills and attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of cross-functional workflows and processes.
  • Positive and upbeat attitude, resilience, and adaptability.
Benefits :
  • Be part of a collaborative team.
  • Group insurance plan and RRSP/DPSP.
  • A day off on your birthday.
  • Telemedicine.
  • And more…
Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Advantageous package
