title: Receptionist
description:
Mosaic is a leading North American Integrated Agency, specializing in Experiential Marketing, Sales and Merchandising, and Interactive. At Mosaic, we are never satisfied with the status quo and are in constant search for new ideas and new ways to help our clients build their brands, amidst the evolving dynamic of empowered consumers leveraging new technologies.

What are we looking for?

Mosaic is currently looking for a Full-Time Receptionist to join our team based out of our Head Office location.

What will you do?

As a receptionist, you will ensure smooth, secure operation of the Head Office as it relates to working environment, equipment and office practices. To deliver a positive first impression which reflects Mosaic’s values/culture to all visitors as well as new employees. Provide a primary point of contact and expertise for arriving visitors and residents of our facility.

Responsibilities:

Reception
  • Greet and manage all arrivals & departures from the office with a high degree of professionalism and awareness
  • Receipt and distribution of Canada Post mail and faxes

Other
  • Maintain Boardroom Calendars
  • Maintain Storage room to standard
  • Health and Safety awareness
  • Follow Facility Process Checklist
  • Manage building Access Cards and Parking Badges
  • Place bi-weekly office supplies order and process monthly invoice reconciliation
  • Maintain AV / Projector bookings
  • Support with meeting/training catering requests
  • Support Shipping & Receiving as needed
  • Support in maintenance of office equipment, including repair requests with supplier
  • Participate in identifying and setting up process improvements
  • Participate in researching and documenting policy and process changes
  • Maintain standards for overall reception practices
  • Maintain facility supplies replenishment
  • Maintain cleanliness standards and order for all office facilities
  • Other duties assigned by Office Manager from time to time
  • Post-secondary education or 1-2 years of related experience
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills
  • Proficient user of Microsoft Office & interest in other software tools
  • Significant strength in the area of organization and time management
  • Self-motivated to perform a broad variety of organizational and administrative tasks within a day and exhibit initiative to do what is necessary to produce quality results

To Apply: Please send resumes to Logan.Abroms@mosaic.com

Why Mosaic?

Consistently voted one of the best places to work, Mosaic North America gives you the opportunity to work with the world’s most beloved brands that you know and use every day. Every employee is given the keys to charter new ground as they collectively live in the moment of building experiences together. We are a cast of diverse, yet like-minded individuals and we believe in taking risks, creating shared experiences not just for our clients, but for each other to guarantee we’re making the next chapter of everyone’s story the most memorable one yet.

DISCLAIMER: Acosta/ Mosaic North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Mosaic reserves the right to modify all or part of any job descriptions at its discretion in order to meet and or exceed the needs of the business.

We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs, to the extent required by law

By submitting your application you agree with and accept the Acosta Privacy Statement and Terms of Conditions.

US: http://acosta.jobs/privacy-policy-us/

Canada: http://acosta.jobs/privacy-policy-ca/

Primary Location

CA-ON-Mississauga

Work Locations

Schedule

Job Type

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Our client located in Toronto in the higher education sector is seeking an EA to the President.


The Executive Assistant will provide administrative support to the President and help with various organizational needs. The Executive Assistant’s responsibilities include managing calendars, preparing various reports, monitoring projects, and ensuring that deadlines are met in a timely manner. To be successful in this role, you should be a proactive problem solver with exceptional communication skills and meticulous attention to detail, well-organized, have great time management skills and be able to act without guidance. The ideal candidate will have previous experience working in an office environment, performing administrative duties and providing support to management.


Responsibilities

  • Acting as the gatekeeper for internal and external contacts, including vendors, colleagues, clients, and customers
  • Conduct research and create reports on various topics based on the needs of the executive.
  • Keep the executive’s calendar up to date, including adding events, rescheduling appointments, and providing daily briefings.
  • Manage President’s inbox and flag all important emails to ensure they are addressed in a timely manner.
  • Keeping important information and documents organized physically, and electronically
  • Maintain a high degree of discretion and confidentiality.
  • Make travel arrangements.
  • Prepare expense report at the end of the month.
  • Attendance management – approve all absences on the Cezanne portal on behalf of the President.
  • Act as the liaison between external stakeholders and internal departments.
  • Prepare, review and submit various reports.
  • Assist with the preparation and implementation of projects and programs.
  • Manage all short-term projects and ensure consistency is the same.
  • Generating reports as required, including tracking/monitoring projects for completeness.
  • Generate process implementation plans and timelines for projects to be released.
  • Ensures all project documentation is accurate and uploaded into internal systems.
  • Responsible to track project changes and producing updated schedules and/or reports.
  • Review project information and compile schedules and/or reports in a timely manner.
  • Be aware of all aspects of the scopes of work so proper assistance can be provided.
  • Responsible for providing comprehensive and high-quality administrative support services.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
  • File essential documents, such as reports, meeting notes, emails, and letters.
  • Maintain a high degree of discretion and confidentiality.
  • Keep important information and documents organized physically and electronically.
  • Performs other duties as assigned or requested.

Position Requirements

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an Administrative Assistance or relevant support role.
  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills, specifically in Word and Excel.
  • Strong communication skills in all forms including written, oral, email, telephone, and presentation.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, including the ability to cope with competing demands and to prioritize tasks.
  • Ability to use own initiative and pay close attention to detail.
  • Ability to work within a team or independently as needed.
  • Proven ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Assistant
description: Office & Administrative Assistant; experience working with an Engineering Consulting Firm is a prerequisite.

title: Office Assistant
description:
London Kia

London, Ontario

London Kia is looking for an Office Assistant to join our Used Car Department. Reporting to the Used Vehicle Manager, you will be responsible for general office duties, and minimal customer facing for our Dealership. If you bring the winning attitude, we can provide the data and training you need to achieve!

What We Offer
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Competitive base pay
  • Benefits plan
  • An opportunity to be part of an exciting, growing business!
Your Key Responsibilities
  • Marketing our vehicles online.
  • Occasionally Shuttle vehicles on and off the property.
  • Provide visitors with an exceptional customer experience by greeting each customer personally.
  • Answering incoming calls regarding vehicle status, shuttles services, and pricing quotes.
  • Assist with a variety of administrative tasks, including copying and scanning documents.
Your Capabilities
  • Completion of a High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
  • Experience in a dealership is considered an asset.
  • Valid driver's license and a clean driving abstract.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate information accurately, clearly, and as intended.
  • Accurate and efficient typing skills.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Proven ability to multi-task in a high-volume, fast-paced working environment, frequently under urgent deadlines.
  • Excellent skills in Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Highly skilled in standard office software (MS Office, SharePoint, etc.) and able to quickly adapt to new technologies deployed by the department and across the company.
Apply Now!

As a two-time Kia Canada Platinum Prestige Award Winner and Top Overall National Dealer , culture at London Kia is everything! The greatest accomplishment of any dealership is having a productive culture.

At LONDON KIA , we don’t hire often, but when we do, we hire for fit and attitude as it’s our belief that promoting within and providing our team members with the necessary tools will make them successful!

Don’t know about us? Check us out on social media Instagram , Facebook , LinkedIn and London Kia .

To join our elite team please submit your resume and cover letter on the Careers Portal of our website www.autocan.ca/careers/ or email us at careers@autocan.ca

title: Administrative Assistant - with Growth Opportunities
description:
We are looking for a motivated Administrative Assistant to join our all-star team at Qcom in Markham, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Administrative Assistant is a terrific opportunity to develop productive skills.

If you are strong in leadership, adaptability and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Administrative Assistant at Qcom today!

Company

Qualcomm Canada ULC

Job Area

Administration Group, Administration Group > Administrative Support

General Summary

Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.

We require an energetic administrative assistant with a positive attitude and cheerful disposition to support for our creative engineering team.

Duties To Include
  • Manage/arrange calendars, coordinate meetings with internal staff & external visitors
  • Booking travel, paperwork for shipments, PO requests, building maintenance requests
  • Inventory/upkeep of breakrooms and meeting rooms
  • Catering, teambuilding events and office facility’s needs.
  • Compile and manage timely submission of expense reports.
  • Coordinate special projects and prepare presentation materials as needed.
Preferred Experience
  • 3+ years of experience using Microsoft Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Concur.
  • Frequently interacting with company personnel at all levels.
  • Building strong working relationships with other administrative staff.
  • Handling subjects of critical and confidential nature.
Physical Requirements
  • Frequently transports between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile.
  • Frequently transports and installs equipment up to 5 lbs.
  • Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting).
  • Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.
  • Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely.
Minimum Qualifications

Provides administrative assistance to one or more first or second-level level managers, a department, or office. Researches, learns, and applies knowledge of industry standards in various administrative areas, including policies, guidelines, and procedures. Leverages proficiency in various types of software including Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, & PowerPoint) and shared file services (SharePoint, MS Teams, OneDrive, etc.) to provide effective and efficient support. Assignments may be of a diverse scope and related to various functional areas.

The Responsibilities Of This Role Include
  • Working under supervision.
  • Taking responsibility for own work and making ethical decisions with some impact.
  • Using verbal and written communication skills to convey factual information about day-to-day activities.
  • Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.
  • Solving basic problems; most problems have defined processes; some limited analysis may be required.
The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include
  • Does not provide supervision to others.
Principal Duties And Responsibilities
  • Provides assistance and support to first or second level managers, a department or an off-site office.
  • Researches and learns departmental/company policies and procedures.
  • Manages basic calendar needs for one or more manager.
  • Prepares and proofs correspondences, reports, spreadsheets, and presentations with appropriate syntax and grammar.
  • Completes various office tasks (e.g., iProc creation, using a Pcard, maintaining office files, supplies, and equipment, submitting expense reports and checking requests, arranging for shipping, maintaining vendor database, etc.).
  • Coordinates basic, domestic travel (flights, hotel, rental cars, etc.) for a single traveler.
  • Answers internal (with exposure/requests from managers) and external phone calls.
  • Schedules and coordinates various types of meetings including luncheons, conferences, and team building events. These events may include external customers and vendors.
Applicants: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to

accommodationsupport

To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact

Qualcomm Careers

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Advantageous package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

description:

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.

  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.

This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
Glen Recruiters is looking for a Receptionist to join our team in our Richmond office. The Receptionist will greet and assist visitors and clients of the organization.

The ideal candidate will deliver a professional and qualified first impression to all visitors. This person has excellent communication and customer service skills. He/she has a basic understanding of administrative and clerical procedures/systems and the ability to multitask in a busy environment.

Responsibilities:
  • Guest services – Welcome guests, employees, and clients who arrive at the office and clarify the purpose of their visit and who they want to see. Answer all phone calls and emails sent to the main office and provide inter-office messages as requested.
  • Administration – Send out and receive mail, documents, supplies and packages. Distribute items to mailboxes and offices as requested. File and keep good records. Maintain office supplies and reorder as needed. Maintain an organized filing system. Manage a schedule for those needing support and schedule appointments on a daily basis.

Requirements:
  • Associates degree is preferred
  • A high school diploma is required
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Reliable, professional, courteous and patient
  • Excellent communication and writing skills

title: Administrative Support Assistant 6-8 month Contract
description:
We are looking for a Administrative Support Assistant

Administrative Support Assistant is a full time contract position that involves daily tasks and team initiative tasks. We are responsive to Customer needs. We listen, we anticipate, and we deliver. Actively engages the Customer to create a positive experience with our client that is aligned with their claims philosophies.

Advantages
  • work with one of the largest players in the Canadian insurance market
  • foot in the door with a company with unlimited potential
  • work from the comfort of your home for the duration of the project
  • IT/laptop will be provided by our client
  • flexibility around work hours after training completed
  • exposure to the insurance/finance industry
  • good possibility of contract extension

Responsibilities
  • Call skills- following up with claimants via phone
  • Sorting and scanning mail
  • Responding to emails sent to our office general mailbox
  • Photocopy requests
  • Paying invoices
  • General support for Internal and External partners on requests to complete tasks.

Qualifications
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Ability to work well independently and as part of a team
  • Well developed organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment with changing priorities
  • Proficient user in MS Office including Outlook, Word, Excel
  • Strong typing and data entry skills
  • Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
  • Well developed problem solving skills

Summary

If this sounds like you - click APPLY today!

Alternatively, you can send your resume directly to: manisha.patel@randstad.ca with "Administrative Support" in the subject line.

In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to leverage your personality and administrative expertise to join a company fighting for food security and equality?

Trendi is hiring an Executive Assistant and wants to hear from YOU!

Who Are You?
  • An exceptionally organized Executive Assistant with a keen eye for detail AND exceptional listening skills?
  • A rebellious, self-aware, and compassionate thinker ready to drive real change in technology?
  • An innovative contributor who manifests ideas into actionable strategies and procedures?
  • A great delegator and communicator that leads with kindness and humor?
  • A growth-seeker that thrives in a chaotic and tight-knit work environment?

A Day in the Life
  • As the right-hand to the Executive team, capture and embrace the craziest of ideas into actionable meeting minutes and strategies that spur your Trendi team into action.
  • Initiate daily touch point meetings with executives so that you’re always clear on daily priorities, assignments, timelines (and roadblocks!) and deliverables.
  • Champion communications with the executive team by capturing post-meeting action items, deliverables, and discussions to circulate relevant information to the wider team.
  • Grab the executive’s chaotic and fast-paced company life by the horns and own their email, calls, meetings, and travel with your task manager and vigor to get ish done.
  • Open your Pinterest and your colour-coding system to invent creative streamlining and filing processes that get the executive’s files, documents, and Google Drive into shape.
  • Embrace relationships with our clients and stakeholders to make them feel like they’re part of the family with your upbeat spirit!
  • Equip yourself and the team with the office supplies needed and the equipment required to tackle their workday at Trendi and crush all the obstacles that threaten our mission.

What You Bring To The Table
  • 3+ years of experience passionately embracing and owning your previous Executive Assistant roles in a fast-paced and growing company.
  • 3+ years of experience supporting internal team communications and delegating to execute projects.
  • You have exceptional listening skills that foster innovation through your unique ability to follow an Executive’s train of thought AND action, action, action!
  • You’re a pro at navigating Microsoft Office Suite, Calendly, Monday, and Todoist, and you have outstanding organizational and time management skills.
  • You’re enthusiastic about technology and addressing barriers to efficiency by connecting your team with solutions.

Bonus Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a field of study that you are passionate about!
  • Experience in a start-up environment.
  • Experience coordinating events.

Why Trendi?

Here, at Trendi, we value and actively work to ensure all employees are equipped with tools necessary to become the best, healthiest, and most passionate version of themselves. Here’s a bit about how you can expect us to support you:
  • Competitive Compensation & Generous Benefits – Your passion, drive, and contributions are the reason Trendi is successful. We offer a competitive base salary, a generous bonus program (that’s actually attainable), and comprehensive benefits to care for you and your family.
  • Vacations, Time Off & Remote Work – You’re human, which means you need to pursue your passions, enjoy time with people you love, and prioritize work-life balance.
  • Personal & Professional Development – When you learn, grow, and achieve your goals we all win. From articles and webinars to mentorship, events, and continued education, we’ve never found a growth opportunity we didn’t love! We’re small, and we recognize that means your growth may outpace ours. In fact, we consider that a win! We love and celebrate our alum!

About Trendi

We’ve all thrown out a bag of rotten fruit before. None of us are perfect. Especially on the Trendi team, where we each have a unique story, a quirky personality, and many flaws. Our focus is undoubtedly on eliminating the food waste crisis, particularly in Canada where we waste 58% of the food we produce. With that said, we’re not tree-hugging sustainability gurus; we’re just regular people like you.

But regular people can make a big difference. You can help us work towards rescuing the 1.3 billion tonnes of unused food before it’s wasted every year, upcycle it, and make it accessible to 800 million people that go hungry daily.

We do it all with robotics, AI, automation, delicious food, and most importantly our quirky team of misfits. Our team doesn’t work here because they just need a job. They do it because this mission propels them and gives them an opportunity to personally grow and become a kick-a$$ change maker.

If this is something you can get behind, we want to hear from you. Just like the misfit food we rescue, tell us how you’re a misfit.

Trendi is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know from experience that a diverse team that reflects our planet, partners and community stakeholders is central to ensuring varied perspectives and better ideas to solve the complex problem of food waste. Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion are unwavering and the core of how we build our team, cultivate leaders and create our impact. We do not discriminate, and we are open to anyone, whoever you are, wherever you’re from, however you identify and whatever your story. If you’re qualified for the job and can get on board with our mission and community, we’re ready to talk.

Does this sound like the opportunity you have been waiting for?

Apply today with your resume!

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to leverage your personality and administrative expertise to join a company fighting for food security and equality?

Trendi is hiring an Executive Assistant and wants to hear from YOU!

Who Are You?
  • An exceptionally organized Executive Assistant with a keen eye for detail AND exceptional listening skills?
  • A rebellious, self-aware, and compassionate thinker ready to drive real change in technology?
  • An innovative contributor who manifests ideas into actionable strategies and procedures?
  • A great delegator and communicator that leads with kindness and humor?
  • A growth-seeker that thrives in a chaotic and tight-knit work environment?

A Day in the Life
  • As the right-hand to the Executive team, capture and embrace the craziest of ideas into actionable meeting minutes and strategies that spur your Trendi team into action.
  • Initiate daily touch point meetings with executives so that you’re always clear on daily priorities, assignments, timelines (and roadblocks!) and deliverables.
  • Champion communications with the executive team by capturing post-meeting action items, deliverables, and discussions to circulate relevant information to the wider team.
  • Grab the executive’s chaotic and fast-paced company life by the horns and own their email, calls, meetings, and travel with your task manager and vigor to get ish done.
  • Open your Pinterest and your colour-coding system to invent creative streamlining and filing processes that get the executive’s files, documents, and Google Drive into shape.
  • Embrace relationships with our clients and stakeholders to make them feel like they’re part of the family with your upbeat spirit!
  • Equip yourself and the team with the office supplies needed and the equipment required to tackle their workday at Trendi and crush all the obstacles that threaten our mission.

What You Bring To The Table
  • 3+ years of experience passionately embracing and owning your previous Executive Assistant roles in a fast-paced and growing company.
  • 3+ years of experience supporting internal team communications and delegating to execute projects.
  • You have exceptional listening skills that foster innovation through your unique ability to follow an Executive’s train of thought AND action, action, action!
  • You’re a pro at navigating Microsoft Office Suite, Calendly, Monday, and Todoist, and you have outstanding organizational and time management skills.
  • You’re enthusiastic about technology and addressing barriers to efficiency by connecting your team with solutions.

  • Bachelor’s degree in a field of study that you are passionate about!

title: Receptionist - Start Now
description:
We are searching for an expert Receptionist to join our stellar team at Remax Solutions in Montréal, QC.

Growing your career as a Full Time Receptionist is an awesome opportunity to develop productive skills.

If you are strong in presentation, cooperation and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Receptionist at Remax Solutions today!

Compensation

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, professional receptionist to join our team. You’ll play a crucial role as the face and first point of contact for our organization. Other responsibilities include answering phone calls and emails, making travel arrangements, scheduling emails, managing mail and deliveries, and other assignments as needed to ensure efficient business operations. Job seekers should take pride in their work, be passionate about helping others, and have an interest in growing with our organization. If this sounds like you, apply now.

$12 - $18 hourly

Responsibilities
  • Respond to incoming phone calls and emails and make sure the right people receive all important information
  • Schedule appointments and ensure the business calendar is accurate and up-to-date
  • Welcome fellow employees, clients, and visitors when they enter the building and give them any pertinent information or directions
  • Assure incoming and outgoing mail is managed appropriately and handle deliveries
  • Ensure the security of the building by having visitors follow necessary sign-in protocol
  • Open and close the office
  • Welcome visitors and direct them to the appropriate person
  • Answer calls and transfer them to the appropriate person
  • Data entry for all calls and emails
  • Prepare documents for brokers
  • Order office supplies
  • Schedule broker/client appointments
  • Assist administration when needed
  • Any other tasks that may be required
  • Possibility of growth within the team, i.e. administrative work or broker
Qualifications
  • Well-versed in taking telephone calls and handling stressful situations
  • Displays impeccable interpersonal, time management, organizational, and customer service skills
  • 1 year of experience as a receptionist, administrative assistant, guest service specialist, or similar position preferred
  • Exhibits working knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic computer skills
  • High school graduate, G.E.D. recipient, or equivalent
  • Bilingual: French and English speaking and writing
  • Available full-time
  • Bilingual (English/French) written and spoken, Italian an asset
  • High school diploma, DEC an asset
  • Customer service experience, 1-2 years minimum
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Professional attire
  • Enthusiasm, team spirit and positive mindset
  • Coachable, eager to learn and grow
  • Strong communication, organization and time management skills
This is a rare opportunity… Be a part of a prestigious real estate team and offer yourself the enriched lifestyle that comes along with it!
  • Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
About Company

The Nancy Forlini Team is a leader in the Real Estate industry in Montreal.

We provide Real Estate services in Residential, Commercial, Industrial and Investment.

Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Competitive salary
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Receptionist Customer Service Representative
description:
Based in the Tilbury area in Delta, we are a manufacturing company of high quality bedding products looking for a qualified individual to work on a fulltime basis as a receptionist along with order entry and customer care duties.

The normal hours of operation for this position will be 7:00am to 3:30pm, Monday to Friday.

The ideal candidate will have qualifications, experience, and strengths in the following areas. Please note that for this position, our company is placing a premium on "the right attitude", and this essential element can compensate if and where experience is lacking.
  • minimum one year certificate from a college or technical school, with training relevant to this position
  • as our receptionist often represents the first face or voice that the public will encounter when they approach our company, an outgoing, positive, professional, and engaging personality and profile is necessary
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written), particularly on the telephone
  • Adequate computer/keyboard knowledge and skills
  • Experience operating a telephone switchboard
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong knowledge of customer service principles and practices
  • Customer service oriented
  • Experience in an office/inside sales environment
  • A "can do" attitude; willing to take on all challenges and requested tasks
The Position Comprises The Following Duties And Responsibilities
  • In the role of Receptionist, answering incoming telephone calls and e-mails, determining the purpose of calls, and forwarding calls and e-mails to appropriate personnel or department
  • When required, serving as a client liaison, providing product information, as well as addressing and resolving client issues with accuracy, efficiency, and professionalism
  • Processing client returns and/or any product complaints
  • Maintaining current records of all customer and potential customer interactions and information, from all relevant sources
  • Receiving, entering, and processing incoming orders
  • Assisting with a variety of administrative duties and other special projects, as requested
Northern Feather was originally founded in Denmark in 1901 and Northern Feather Canada has enjoyed over 40 years of sleep success.

Northern Feather Canada offers the best value and quality in Down and Man-Made fibre sleep products utilizing the highest and most technically advanced standards in manufacturing. It all translates into the most comfortable sleep and provides the ultimate in sleeping comfort at the highest level of quality. We are world renowned in the hospitality and retail industry from Canada to South America and Monaco to the Far East. We are able to supply our customers from our manufacturing facilities in Delta, British Columbia.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Are you someone reliable, who always has a positive attitude and can take initiative? Do you enjoy working with people, and being a great team player? Are you someone who is highly organized, and has a great eye for details? If so, we have an excellent opportunity for you in a communication and advisor firm as an office manager!

We are looking to hire a one-year contract office manager who can demonstrate a positive professional demeanor for a trusted communication firm.

Advantages
  • Big focus on mental health
  • Competitive salary
  • A chance to work in a supportive and positive environment
  • Hybrid role (WFH & in office)

Responsibilities
  • Support with office administrative tasks
  • Assist Senior VP and President with administrative tasks
  • Ensuring office space is maintained by ordering office supplies timely, keeping a tidy kitchen space, etc.
  • Supporting marketing and sales department
  • Package mail outs
  • Ad hoc duties as assigned

Qualifications
  • Ability to self manage, and fulfill deadlines
  • Possess strong organization skills and time management
  • Possesses professional demeanor
  • Able to utilize Microsoft Office proficiently
  • Experience with Salesforce is an asset

Summary

If you meet the above-listed criteria, register for a Randstad account online if you have not yet registered, and please apply directly online. We appreciate all applicants and those interested in this opportunity, however only those with relevant experience will be considered.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Receptionist
description:
The Village of Merrickville-Wolford requires a receptionist for a 10-month contract.

The successful candidate will have exceptional communication skills, attention to detail, general accounting knowledge, and a positive attitude. Previous experience in customer service and knowledge regarding municipal government would be considered an asset.

Deadline May 11, 2022

Applications should be clearly marked “Receptionist Position” and addressed in confidence to:

Kirsten Rahm, Treasurer

Village of Merrickville-Wolford

P.O. Box 340, 317 Brock St. W.

Merrickville, ON K0G 1N0

Email: finance@merrickville-wolford.ca

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant – Diocese of London

Reports to: Director of Human Resources


Overview: As a member of the Personnel Team, provides administrative support to the Director of Lay Ecclesial Ministry, the Director of Priest Personnel, the Coordinator of Catholic Pastoral Care in Health Care Institutions and on an as needed basis support to other diocesan offices. Collaborates with Human Resources and the Bishop’s Office.


Full-time role.


Duties and Responsibilities:


Communication:


• Effectively use systems including email and electronic documents to provide support to members of the personnel team in a virtual environment, due to off-site offices and significant amounts of travel

• Manage requests and inquiries in person, by telephone and by email from Diocesan Centre personnel, parish team members, external agencies (Service Ontario – Marriage Office, Ontario Health Insurance Office, Immigration Offices, other dioceses) and the public

• Schedule appointments and meetings for members of the personnel team, often coordinating with the bishops’ office when the bishop or auxiliary bishop is to attend

• Prepare announcements from personnel team members for release to Parish Briefings and/or other departments and parishes, including pastoral changes, new lay ecclesial ministers, prayer requests and death and funeral announcements for Priest Personnel

• Prepare correspondence and communications for the Director of Priest Personnel and the Director of Lay Ecclesial Ministry as required

• Assist the Director of Priest Personnel to support the active and retired priests of the diocese by responding to enquiries and following up on requests for instructions, information and documentation, and directing priests to other diocesan personnel when appropriate

• Maintain up-to-date email groups for distribution to priests, active priests, retired priests and lay ecclesial ministers


Administration:


• Ensure accurate maintenance of all records within the approved systems including personnel records, ministry related , immigration documentation (passport, visitor visa, visitor record), and appointment letters and faculties sheets approved and signed by the Bishop or his designate; Letters, Reports and Correspondence

• Prepare support letters for International Priests including visa applications, visitor record requests at port of entry, applications for SIN and OHIP, permanent resident 

• Wills and Powers of Attorney for Priests – maintain files and spreadsheet record of documentation on file

• Screening and Requests for Visiting Clergy to the Diocese

• Ongoing maintenance of all appropriate data bases and maintaining accurate and current data pertaining to clergy and lay ecclesial ministers in the diocese. 

• Police Vulnerable Sector Checks and Annual Offence Declarations

• Coordinate the timely and accurate completion of all reports within the Diocese and the Vatican.

• Participate and assist with projects and document revisions, policy manuals, procedures, etc.


Support to Committees:


• Record and transcribe minutes for meetings of the Priest Personnel Board, Priest Compensation Committee, Lay Ecclesial Advisory Board (when applicable), and other meetings as requested by members of the personnel team

• Prepare and distribute agendas and minutes for meetings


Qualifications and Experience:


• University degree or College diploma preferred

• Minimum of five (5) years’ experience supporting leadership in a professional organization

• Ability to exercise a high degree of initiative, confidentiality and judgement, particularly in personnel related matters

• Ability communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing to diverse audiences

• Excellent planning and organizational skills

• Ability to analyze information and problem-solve

• Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail in the presence of frequent interruptions

• Knowledge of policies and procedures, diocesan services, parish locations and staff teams 

• Ability to innovate and create process efficiencies

• Commitment to quality service in an approachable and supportive manner

• Ability to work in collaboration with others

• A faith-based understanding of the Catholic Church, its tenets and culture, and respect for its leadership and parish clergy is an asset

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

description:
We are looking for a creative administrative assistant, real estate to join our vibrant team at Reliable Developments in Concord, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time administrative assistant, real estate is an awesome opportunity to develop productive skills.

If you are strong in creativity, critical thinking and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of administrative assistant, real estate at Reliable Developments today!

Area Of Work Experience
  • Reports and records
  • Invoices
  • Correspondence
  • Contracts
Business Equipment and Computer Applications
  • MS Excel

title: Office Administrator
description:
Craven SPORT services is actively recruiting a full-time office administrator to join our fast-paced, high-energy, and detail-oriented team! Our front desk environment is customer-oriented, friendly, and professional; An ideal candidate will thrive in this environment. This position is designed for an individual looking to further their career in office and medical administration, with strong preference given to those looking to grow long-term alongside CSS. Strong customer-service experience is a must. While not required, a background in office or medical administration, experience with ClinicMaster or another EMR program, or the ability to support clients in additional languages will give applicants a competitive advantage. Please note that this position will also include some elements of facility support.


 

Responsibilities

  • Supporting the daily administrative requirements of the Craven SPORT services 2nd Avenue clinic through client scheduling, payments, and booking supports
  • Completing faxing and scanning as needed
  • Managing confidential personal health information with the utmost professionalism through the use of the ClinicMaster EMR system
  • Handling many competing demands simultaneously, whether face-to-face, over the phone, or over email
  • Completing facility management tasks such as laundry and some general maintenance/cleaning
  • Completing any additional administrative tasks as assigned by the Manager of Clinic Administration


Qualifications

  • A proven background in a customer-service-oriented role
  • Added bonus: Background in medical or office administration
  • Added bonus: Experience with ClinicMaster or another EMR program
  • Added bonus: The ability to support clients in additional languages to English


Schedule

  • Full time hours
  • Monday - Friday, 11:15am - 7:15pm
  • Please note that schedule may be open to adjustment in the long term at the employee's request
  • The ideal candidate will join the CSS team and begin their training as soon as possible!


Compensation

  • Compensation is dependant on experience
  • Craven SPORT services is proud to offer competitive wages, benefits, and professional development opportunities

title: Resort Activities Guide (Casual)
description:
Fairmont Banff Springs is looking for an energetic individual to assist in the delivery of our Resort Activities Guiding program. Resort Activities Guides should have a wide variety of talents but above all should have excellent customer service skills and a willingness to learn.

Covid-19 Safety Policy: In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

What Is In It For You
  • Subsidized staff accommodation provided on-site for full time status
  • Duty meal in our newly renovated staff cafeteria
  • Employee Travel Program
  • Comprehensive Wellness Platform (LifeWorks)
  • Discounts on food & beverage/fitness centre/spa/golf
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within Fairmont Banff Springs and over 5,000 properties with Accor
What You Will Be Doing
  • Lead / Guide experiences not limited to guided wilderness, vehicle and bike tours, as well as walks and hikes.
  • Share the history and culture of Canadian Rockies enthusiastically
  • Assist in contacting guests before their hotel arrival to ensure smooth delivery of guided experiences
  • Selling, booking and updating guided experiences
  • Be responsible for a positive, safe and memorable experience for each and every guest
  • Maintain positive working relationships with Parks Canada and adhere to all Parks regulations
  • Assist in the set-up for all facilitated activities and execute clean-up duties upon completion of program, including cleaning and sanitizing of spaces and objects, before, during, and after the facilities open / activity ends
  • Contribute new activity ideas and assist in the future development of Resort Activities, as well as other programs
  • Carry out all other tasks as assigned by the Resort Activities Manager or Executive Team
  • Other duties as assigned
Your Experience And Skills Include
  • 40 hour Standard First Aid & CPR C level or greater is mandatory
  • Apprentice Interpretive Guide Certification from IGA or equivalent
  • Four Season Group Management Certification from IGA
  • Class 4 Drivers License and clean driving history
  • Minimum one years recent experience working in a high-volume, fast-paced recreational / guiding environment
  • Excellent work organization – ability to solve problems and respond to changing conditions or unexpected events
  • Positive, outgoing and professional attitude with a passion for National Parks and Town of Banff
  • Graduate or student of an Outdoor Recreation/ Ecotourism or Tourism program an asset
  • Must be physically fit and able to run all activities in any weather including walking, hiking, biking.
  • Must be able to lift and carry 40+ lbs and be on your feet for 8 hours a day
Your Team And Working Environment
  • Fast-paced, upscale, luxury hotel
  • Close proximity to multiple ski resorts
  • Hospitality employees worldwide making this a great place to develop lifelong connections
  • Close proximity to multiple ski resorts in winter and world-renowned hiking trails in summer
Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for AccorHotels?

We are much more than a world leader. We are more than 250,000 hoteliers with a purposeful and heartfelt mission: to make every guest Feel Welcome in our 4,500 addresses and on our digital platforms. We are committed to a culture and guided by our values that make our talent Feel Valued. We want them to express their passions every day and realize their full potential through exemplary professional development and growth opportunities, enjoying a life filled with unlimited experiences. To connect with us, please visit https://www.accorhotels.jobs/home.aspx

APPLY TODAY: For more information on working and living in Banff, please visit www.banffspringsjobs.com.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
If you're seeking your next exciting role, look no further! We at Affinity are a close-knit group of smart, hard-working, and caring people. We have a great mix of folks: parents, world travelers, homebodies, first-timers in the startup world and lots of foodies! It's a special group of people, so you'll fit in great if you have an always-be-learning philosophy balance with a great sense of humor.

We're hiring an Executive Assistant / Workplace Manager to support our San Francisco and Toronto hubs as well as our remote employees. We're a hybrid team, with some people who come into our hubs regularly and others who are fully remote or casual office users. As the EA/WM, you'll be the first point of contact for team members and guests and will be a central hub of information, so this is a great role if you're outgoing, proactive, and resourceful.

This role is your opportunity to get into a great company and make your mark. You'll report to the VP People.

What You'll Be Doing:

EA / Workplace:
  • Manage the co-CEOs' busy calendars
  • Support calendaring for other members of the leadership team
  • Assist with meeting preparation and logistics
  • Develop and manage workplace budget
  • Idea generate around innovative use of office space in a hybrid environment (huddle spaces, collaboration setup, etc)
  • Support remote team proactively to ensure they maintain a sense of community
  • Collaborate with HR and IT on the employee onboarding and offboarding process
  • Liaison with building management in hub offices
  • Manage cleaning service for safety and sanitation
  • Oversee relationships with food/beverage vendors
  • Manage office calendaring, conference rooms and onsite events
  • Manage office supplies and consumables
  • Develop environmentally sustainable policies and practices
  • Responsible for managing the upkeep of the office, ensuring the office space is tidy and clean. This includes upkeep and maintenance of the lunch and kitchen area, meeting rooms, etc.
  • Maintain an organized and systematic office supply storage system
  • Coordinate building maintenance or repair requests
  • Manage Envoy and Robin desk and visitor management platforms
  • Assist Recruiting team with ensuring candidates are welcomed warmly setup for their interviews
  • Manage IT deliveries and shipments

Qualifications

Required:
  • Minimum 4 years office management experience
  • 2+ years of Executive Assistant experience
  • Highly detail-oriented with the ability to multitask and switch gears quickly
  • Eager to think beyond the usual to create something unique in our new hybrid environment
  • Upbeat attitude and positive approach to work
  • Excel at providing the highest level of customer service to guests, fellow employees and vendors
  • Good working knowledge of Google Mail, Google Docs and Mac environments
  • Proficient computer skills (ex. Word, Excel, keen to learn new systems)
  • Proficiency with basic math and accounting skills

What You'll Enjoy At Affinity
  • We live our values as playmakers who are obsessed with learning, care personally about our colleagues and clients, are radically open-minded, and take pride in everything we do.
  • Health Care coverage and flexible personal & sick days. We want our team to be happy and healthy :)
  • We provide an annual budget for you to spend on education and offer a comprehensive L&D program – after all, one of our core values is that we're #obsessedwithlearning!
  • We support our employee's overall health and well-being and reimburse monthly for things such as; Transportation, Home Internet, Meals, and Wellness memberships/equipment.
  • Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is essential.

About Affinity

We are passionate about helping dealmakers in the world's biggest relationship-driven industries to find, manage, and close the most important deals. Our Relationship Intelligence platform uses the data exhaust of trillions of interactions between Investment Bankers, Venture Capitalists, Consultants, and other strategic dealmakers with their networks to deliver automated relationship insights that drive over 450,000 deals every month. We have raised over $120M and are backed by some of Silicon Valley's best firms. With over 1700 customers in 70 countries on our platform, a 4.8 Star Glassdoor rating and being ranked in the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies, we need more great people to help us scale even more.

The more diverse our team is, the more we'll be able to learn from each other, and the better our company and our product will be. Whatever your gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, veteran status, favorite Spotify playlist, or social, cultural, and economic background, we can't wait to welcome you to Affinity!

This includes upkeep and maintenance of the lunch and kitchen area, meeting rooms, etc.', '2+ years of Executive Assistant experience', 'Minimum 4 years office management experience', 'Develop environmentally sustainable policies and practices', 'Oversee relationships with food/beverage vendors', 'Virtual team building and socials. title: Part-Time Show Host- Today's Shopping Choice
description:
Come play a key role in building the future of Sports & Media! Everyone wants to be part of a transformational team – and that’s exactly what we’re building at Rogers Sports & Media. A team that innovates and a team that wins.

At Rogers Sports & Media we are committed to creating and growing teams that are digital-first, fast-moving and bold-thinking and are focused on delivering impact with everything they do. Our impressive collection of assets includes media properties, sports teams, sports events & production, venues, e-commerce platforms and a close connection with our Connected Home and Wireless team. Collectively, we touch the lives of 30 million Canadians every month!

Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and working in an environment that allows each of us to bring our best authentic selves to work. That starts with our firm commitment to a diverse, inclusive and safe workplace. We’re also dedicated to giving back by using our media megaphone to help Canadians who need it most. Our team is All IN on diversity and inclusion – find out more at www.allinforequity.ca.

Are you up for the challenge and the fun? If so, consider the following opportunity!

Todays Shopping Choice is a leading interactive, multi-channel retailer, offering a vast assortment of exclusive products and top brand names to its customers. As one of Canada's most innovative and diversified retailers, TSC incorporates entertainment, inspiration, personalities and industry leaders to provide a unique shopping experience, where customers find exceptional selections in Health & Beauty, Jewellery, Home/Lifestyle, Fashion/Accessories, and Electronics.

As the only live broadcast retailer in Canada, we operate within various channels of Broadcasting, Digital & Call Centers
  • Please be sure to upload demo videos as per instructions below**.
What You Will Bring

As an On-Air Show Host with TSC you will become the face of our brand. You will use your training, extensive product/market research, live television background and passion for the retail experience to build the stories that will engage our customers. Your ultimate goal is to drive demand sales, customer retention and new customer acquisition.

What You Will Do
  • Prepare for each and every hour using all available tools - script and given content, vendor and guest review, buyer review and pre-show meetings with On-Air Crews.
  • Present all product offers on-air and on social media in a thoughtful, compelling and exciting manner. Ensure to portray an accurate representation of the product by leveraging Key Selling Points and research. Present all corporate concepts as they are defined and scripted. All presentations must include a call to action.
  • Meet or exceed all demand and net sales targets. Report on reasons for variances on a post show feedback report.
  • You must always display an aspirational yet attainable persona as dictated by the Corporate Style Guide. You will participate in regular Style Review and Planning sessions.
  • Participate in all training activities as outlined by your Manager. These may include but aren't limited to In-house Product Training, Market Research, Industry Seminars and/or Accreditation, Vendor visits,Skills Review and Coaching. Please note that some of these activities may require travel.
  • Participate in Department meetings.
  • Take part in all internal and external social media and marketing activities as outlined
  • Be available to commit to set-out schedule as well as cover other shifts as required.
  • This position requires shift work outside of normal 9-5 business hours. All On-Air Show Hosts must be available to work hours as dictated by the schedule.
CASTING CALL

TSC, Canada’s only home shopping network, is looking for personable, enthusiastic On-Air Hosts that will further our customer’s fun and fantastic shopping experience.

Are you…
  • An excellent speaker and/or product expert who relays information naturally, intelligently and credibly?
  • A well rounded and upbeat person with life-experience and a passion for retail sales?
  • Highly motivated, reliable, flexible and open to feedback?
How To Apply
  • Provide us with a video showing us why you would be the perfect TSC Host. This should be recently shot and a maximum of 3 minutes. (Use the text box in the question below to post a link or use the "Add Attachments" section in the application)
Submissions will NOT be considered without a video clip.
  • Pick a product you love and tell us about it. Choose anything from jewelry, health and beauty, home products or electronics. Make your product shine!
ONLY SUBMISSIONS THAT FOLLOW THESE INSTRUCTIONS AND SUBMIT A PROPER DEMO WILL BE CONSIDERED

Audition Tips

Watch TSC and get to know our products, Hosts and Guest experts. Also, the more you know about the latest trends, current events and what’s happening in the world, the more you can relate to our customer (target demographic) - who is 35-55, has children and loves to shop! She’s the one you’re talking to!

Project a professional, confident, trustworthy image, but don't be afraid to have fun. Watch your body language. Don't slouch - smile and be positive. Be yourself and be comfortable. We are looking for real and relatable.

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Part time

Shift Variable

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 59 Ambassador Drive (097), Mississauga, ON

Travel Requirements Up to 10%

Posting Category/Function Broadcasting & On-Air Talent

Requisition ID 267823

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Venue Services Admin Assistant - Seasonal - Fast Hire
description:
We are looking for a motivated Venue Services Admin Assistant - Seasonal to join our awesome team at Calgary Stampede in Calgary, AB.

Growing your career as a Full Time Venue Services Admin Assistant - Seasonal is an incredible opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in teamwork, cooperation and have the right experience for the job, then apply for the position of Venue Services Admin Assistant - Seasonal at Calgary Stampede today!

About The Calgary Stampede

The Calgary Stampede celebrates the people, the animals, the land, the traditions and the values that make up the unique spirit of the west. The Calgary Stampede contributes to the quality of life in Calgary and southern Alberta through our world-renowned Stampede, year-round facilities, western events and several youth and agriculture programs. Exemplifying the theme We’re Greatest Together, we are a volunteer-supported, not-for-profit community organization that preserves and celebrates our western heritage, cultures and community spirit. All revenue is reinvested into Calgary Stampede programs and facilities.

Position Summary

The Venue Services Admin Assistant (Admin Assistant) is a member of the Venue Services, responsible to provide administrative support to the department.

We currently have 2 open roles.

These positions involves answering a multi-line telephone, handling walk in customers, data entry of time, prioritizing and following-up on communications, coordinating mail and providing exceptional customer service.

These are Seasonal positions.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:
  • Reception duties including greeting customers as they come in, answering multi line telephones and distribution of messages.
  • Provide exceptional customer service in person and on the telephone
  • Perform general administrative functions including typing and filing correspondence, reports, manuals and scheduling as required.
  • Assist with administrative and support duties as assigned.
  • Communicate progress, challenges and issues to supervisor.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate will be proactive, optimistic and have worked in a dynamic environment where they have experience delivering on multiple priorities and will hold the following qualifications:
  • High School Diploma
  • Working knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).
  • Accurate typing, strong attention to detail and data entry skills.
  • Ability to work towards a common goal and vision.
Benefits

The Calgary Stampede offers a unique and exciting work environment.

To Apply

To apply, please submit your resume.

All applicants are thanked in advance and advised that only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Competitive salary
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Office Manager/Receptionist
description:
Our company is looking to hire a Receptionist/Office Assistant to be responsible for the general operation of the office. We’re looking for an energetic professional who doesn’t mind wearing multiple hats.

Duties will involve greeting visitors, purchasing office supplies and taking proper inventory, and keeping the office clean and organized for Senior management.

You will also need to be proficient in Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel.

Responsibilities:

  • Reporting to VP HR.
  • Greet clients as soon as they arrive and directing them appropriately.
  • Liaison between the building and Connex, including learning the building policies and procedures.
  • Answer phone calls.
  • Coordinate meetings and organize catering and other meeting requirements.
  • Clean up the office and set it up for the next day before leaving.
  • Organizing travel by booking accommodations and reservations as required
  • Pick up mails at the mail room. Accept deliveries.
  • Reconcile petty cash and other credit card purchases.
  • Assist the HR team with recruitment process.
  • Provide general administrative and clerical support.
  • Maintain a professional and hazard free appearance for the office area.
  • Ensure office equipment is properly maintained and serviced.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements/Skills:

  • Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures
  • Knowledge of computers and relevant software applications
  • High level of discretion required when dealing with confidential matters.
  • Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular).
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work.
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Courteous.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, including setting priorities and working under pressure of high volume and constant interruptions.
  • Possesses the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent keyboarding, proof reading and data entry skills with emphasis on accuracy.
  • Customer service skills and good demeanor as a frontline liaison, in person, on phone and via email.
  • Work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Previous clerical experience in an office environment is an asset.
  • Bilingual an asset.

Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Passionate, high energy, happy, extremely positive, and most importantly eager to learn.
  • Confident managing multiple tasks in a detailed and organized manner.
  • Thrives under tight deadlines.

Our employees are the ambassadors of CONNEX with clients and business partners. Their skills, integrity and sense of responsibility are the keys to our success. Training for all employees, regardless of their function in our organization is considered a priority. In addition, our pay scale is competitive, and we offer a full range of benefits.

You are interested to enrich your work experience? We need people like you, passionate and committed. If you want to join our team, please send your resume to the following address.

description:

title: Administrative Assistant Scanning Medical Records
description:
***6-MONTHS CONTRACT ONLY***


One of large partner is hiring!


Reporting directly to the OHS Manager, the Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support to the OHS team and is responsible for the smooth functioning of the administrative duties involved In Digitization of paper medical files.


Major Responsibilities: Provide administrative Support to the Canada - OHS team (Manager, Team Leader, Coordinator, NCM and CMO)

  • Handles details of confidential nature and performs administrative support to ensure that OHS clinic operations are maintained in an effective and accurate manner.
  • Ability to scan and sort medical records for electronic medical system.
  • Accurate data entry in SAP OHS / Cority, related to regulatory all medical exams.
  • Prepare reports in advance of meetings related with medical scanning of records.

 

Skills/functional knowledge required to perform the job: 

  • Advanced computer skills, particularly in Microsoft Office tools and scanning programs
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, ability to work independently, establish priorities, meet deadlines
  • People-oriented, flexible and resourceful.
  • Excellent writing, spelling, grammar, editing and proofreading skills.
  • Detail-oriented, judgment, thinking things through, ability to maintain confidentiality
