title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Miles HR is seeking an experienced and energetic Administration Assistant to work with a small, but growing organization in Vancouver, BC. This is an opportunity for a self-directed, confident individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced setting and has excellent customer service and organizational skills. If you have at least two years of Administration experience and are a self-starter, this could be a great opportunity for you.

This position is based in-office in Vancouver, BC, following all current COVID-19 precautions.

About the Role:
  • Schedule and arrange client appointments by phone and email
  • Communicate directly with clients in regards to upcoming appointments including protocols and procedures
  • Identify client requests and offer adapted solutions to meet their needs
  • Prepare invoices for clients, and collect payments
  • Maintain the office environment including ordering all office and clinic supplies
  • Work closely with the Account Manager to support ongoing client activities
  • Manage social media platforms
  • Other duties as required

About You:
  • Minimum two years of experience in an Administrative or Clinic environment
  • Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, or equal number years of experience
  • Proactive and self-directed in identifying innovations and new solutions
  • Highly organized and can manage multiple priorities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and customer service skills
  • Tech-savvy with Word, Excel, Outlook, Adobe, and Microsoft Teams

If this sounds like you, then apply for the Administrative Assistant position today!

title: Vancouver Private School Recruit Executive Assistant (Canada/China) (Chaoyin International School)
description:
Chaoyin Education Group is pleased to announce the opening of Chaoyin International School in Richmond, British Columbia on September 2021. Chaoyin Education Group has been a leader in public K-12 education in China for the past 20 years with elementary, middle and high school schools in Qingdao, Shandong province. Chaoyin International School marks their first school abroad. The school will be the first of its kind in Richmond incorporating the best practices of Western and Chinese education teaching instruction. The school will open with classes ranging from kindergarten to grade 7. One of the school’s featured programs is an Early and Late Mandarin Language Program (the first of its kind in Richmond). The EMLP begins with entry in kindergarten and grade 1. It is an instruction program where students learn and study in the mandarin language.

The school is located in the central business area of Richmond at 10111 Bird Road, minutes away from Vancouver International Airport, Hwy 99, and the Knight street bridge.

Responsibilities

We are currently looking for dedicated and enthusiastic Full-Time EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT position to begin immediately. We are seeking someone with the following qualifications and abilities:
  • Assist the General Manager (GM) in arranging daily work, including scheduling, work arrangements, reception arrangements, document processing, resource and data management, etc.
  • Assist the GM in daily administrative work.
  • Support the GM in Human Resource Management work.
  • Accomplish other work assigned by the General Manager.
  • Available for business travel, where required, potentially in China.
  • Be interested in Chinese culture, Chinese schools, and International Education.
Qualifications
  • Deal effectively and diplomatically with people.
  • Be fluent in Chinese-Mandarin (reading, speaking, writing).
  • Have excellent command of the English language and able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Able to organize and prioritize a varying workload
  • Be highly computer literate
  • Be knowledge of specific software program requirements including, but not limited to: Microsoft Word, Publisher, Excel, Power Point, Adobe PDF documents, as well as the ability to learn other programs as the need arises.
  • Preference will be given to those who have experience or education in language translation, broadcasting, or university student unions.
Most importantly, this position requires a close working relationship with the General Manager of Chaoyin Education Group and stakeholder groups of the school, and therefore, the Executive Assistant must possess extraordinary people skills.

Salary and benefits are competitive and would be commensurate with experience.

Value

title: Administrative Assistant, Finance
description:
Goodmans LLP is internationally recognized as one of Canada’s leading and most innovative law firms, offering market leading expertise in M&A, corporate, securities and finance, private equity, real estate, tax, restructuring, litigation and other business-related specialties. We are a community of committed, talented, hardworking professionals who are motivated by exceeding our clients’ expectations, with a law firm culture that is second to none.


The Administrative Assistant, Finance is a pivotal member of the Finance team. The role is responsible for supporting the Senior Management Team in Finance.


Specific responsibilities include:

  • Drafting, preparing and facilitating all confidential communications to Partners;
  • Compiling and facilitating the distribution of financial reports to firm stakeholders;
  • Preparing daily agenda and communications to Goodmans Chair;
  • Monitoring and ensuring timely entry of billable hours (docketing);
  • Building relationships with assistants, lawyers and external service providers (bank, corporate credit card provider);
  • Coordinating firm insurance applications and credit applications;
  • Providing calendar and e-mail management to the Director, Finance & the Senior Managers, Finance;
  • Coordinating meetings, room bookings, catering, etc., for Finance;
  • Assisting with the administration of corporate credit cards; and
  • Completing special projects as requested, and other duties as assigned.


The ideal candidate possesses:

  • Post-secondary education in a related field.
  • Administrative assistant experience, preferably in a professional services environment.
  • Superior attention to detail with strong writing, proofreading and editing skills.
  • Aptitude for numbers, and a basic understanding of accounting.
  • Confident and effective results driven individual with strong problem-solving skills.
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, and Excel).
  • Positive and energetic attitude.


Goodmans LLP is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives. Goodmans LLP invites applications from all qualified candidates. For applicants with disabilities requiring accommodation at any point in the recruitment process, please contact HR@goodmans.ca.


Please note that in light of Goodmans LLP/Goodlaw Services Limited Partnership’s COVID-19 vaccination policy, applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment from the firm will be required to provide proof of being fully vaccinated with all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada. Individual requests for accommodation will be considered on the basis of medical grounds and/or because of creed/religion.

title: Executive Assistant, Office of the CEO
description:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future.


That includes YOU.


How would you like to be a part of a fun, high-performance culture that’s truly one of a kind – on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time?


If that sounds like your thing – and you’re an exceptional Executive Assistant – we’d like to hear from you.


We’re CAAT Pension Plan, and we’re growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what they’re getting every month – for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them.


We are looking for a self-motivated and professional Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our Chief Executive Officer & Plan Manager, and the broader Office of the CEO department.



We are looking for someone that has demonstrated skills in the following:


  • A self-starter that can juggle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Advanced computer literacy, MS Office Suite experience, skilled in developing presentation materials and digital tools experience including MS Teams, SharePoint etc.
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Superior customer service skills and professionalism when partnering with internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
  • Experience executing and assisting with projects and special assignments by establishing objectives, determining priorities, managing time, monitoring progress, problem-solving and adjusting plans
  • Proactively resolves issues in a professional and calm manner.
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently with minimal direction and proficiency in dealing with ambiguity
  • Detail oriented when writing and editing business documents, communications, and presentations
  • Ability to use discretion and judgment in dealing with sensitive and confidential materials and matters
  • Strong interpersonal, influential, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Drive to achieve results and continuously strive to deliver the highest performance
  • Resilient, resourceful, and flexible in adapting to changes to the leader’s priorities and able to devise contingency plans as needed
  • Experience in mentoring or supervising other administrative professionals is an asset
  • Flexible to work extra hours on occasion and sometimes on short notice


A University or College degree with seven (7) or more years of experience supporting a C-Suite Executive in an organization makes you an ideal candidate. You must also have a strong aptitude on task prioritization, the ability to adapt quickly to changing needs, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic organization that constantly evolves and adapts.



Responsibilities:



  • Provide a full range of confidential administrative services for a senior leader ensuring quality service and professionalism
  • Meeting management which includes scheduling, preparing agendas, taking minutes, and documenting action items at leadership team meetings, strategic sessions and applicable boards the leader is involved in
  • Prepare reports, leading edge presentations, communications, and documents relating to matters of sensitive nature on behalf of the leader by identifying required information, conducting research, and utilizing appropriate sources as required
  • Build strong relationships across the organization, including partnering with internal and external stakeholders
  • Manage, coordinate, and maintain a complex calendar with conflicting priorities
  • Coordinate extensive and sometimes complex domestic and international travel arrangements, hotels, and itineraries.
  • General office duties with may include ordering catering, greeting guests, etc.



What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us?



  • Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. That’s what drives our high-performance, fun culture – one that’s truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019 and 2020, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 and 2021, and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.
  • We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAAT’s defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programs
  • Everyone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT Academy
  • We are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.
  • We are working remotely at present due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and in the future will be offering a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.
  • You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca



DEFINITELY INTERESTED? Apply on LinkedIn or email your resume to careers@caatpension.ca on or before May 16, 2022, with Executive Assistant in the subject line.



We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest. Only those considered for an interview will be contacted.



CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future.


That includes YOU.


How would you like to be a part of a fun, high-performance culture that’s truly one of a kind – on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time?


If that sounds like your thing – and you’re an exceptional Executive Assistant – we’d like to hear from you.


We’re CAAT Pension Plan, and we’re growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what they’re getting every month – for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them.


We are looking for a self-motivated and professional Executive Assistant to provide direct support to our Chief Executive Officer & Plan Manager, and the broader Office of the CEO department.



We are looking for someone that has demonstrated skills in the following:


  • A self-starter that can juggle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Advanced computer literacy, MS Office Suite experience, skilled in developing presentation materials and digital tools experience including MS Teams, SharePoint etc.
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Superior customer service skills and professionalism when partnering with internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
  • Experience executing and assisting with projects and special assignments by establishing objectives, determining priorities, managing time, monitoring progress, problem-solving and adjusting plans
  • Proactively resolves issues in a professional and calm manner.
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently with minimal direction and proficiency in dealing with ambiguity
  • Detail oriented when writing and editing business documents, communications, and presentations
  • Ability to use discretion and judgment in dealing with sensitive and confidential materials and matters
  • Strong interpersonal, influential, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Drive to achieve results and continuously strive to deliver the highest performance
  • Resilient, resourceful, and flexible in adapting to changes to the leader’s priorities and able to devise contingency plans as needed
  • Experience in mentoring or supervising other administrative professionals is an asset
  • Flexible to work extra hours on occasion and sometimes on short notice


A University or College degree with seven (7) or more years of experience supporting a C-Suite Executive in an organization makes you an ideal candidate. You must also have a strong aptitude on task prioritization, the ability to adapt quickly to changing needs, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic organization that constantly evolves and adapts.



Responsibilities:



  • Provide a full range of confidential administrative services for a senior leader ensuring quality service and professionalism
  • Meeting management which includes scheduling, preparing agendas, taking minutes, and documenting action items at leadership team meetings, strategic sessions and applicable boards the leader is involved in
  • Prepare reports, leading edge presentations, communications, and documents relating to matters of sensitive nature on behalf of the leader by identifying required information, conducting research, and utilizing appropriate sources as required
  • Build strong relationships across the organization, including partnering with internal and external stakeholders
  • Manage, coordinate, and maintain a complex calendar with conflicting priorities
  • Coordinate extensive and sometimes complex domestic and international travel arrangements, hotels, and itineraries.
  • General office duties with may include ordering catering, greeting guests, etc.



What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us?



  • Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. That’s what drives our high-performance, fun culture – one that’s truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019 and 2020, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 and 2021, and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.
  • We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAAT’s defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programs
  • Everyone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT Academy
  • We are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.
  • We are working remotely at present due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and in the future will be offering a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.
  • You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca



DEFINITELY INTERESTED? Apply on LinkedIn or email your resume to careers@caatpension.ca on or before May 16, 2022, with Executive Assistant in the subject line.



We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest. Only those considered for an interview will be contacted.



CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Receptionist
description:
Position: Office Receptionist

Location: Toronto, ON

Tenure: Full-Time, Permanent

Position Overview

Our client is a private lending institution looking for an enthusiastic individual looking to further their administrative career as an Office Receptionist. Based out of their corporate office in Toronto, the successful hire will be responsible for being the main point of contact for the organization via phone and email and will bring with you 1-2 years of experience in maintaining professional office spaces.

Who You Are
  • Client service – believe strongly in providing optimal service to all clients
  • Handle multiple priorities – you’re able to multi-task and take on new priorities as they occur
  • Are empathetic and caring towards the needs of our team, our stakeholders, and our clients
  • Go above and beyond – settling for “good enough” is not part of who you are
  • Strong communication – you’re able to communicate with clients and stakeholders effectively and efficiently
  • Confidentiality and respect – you understand the need to be tactful about the personal information of clients that you may become privy to in this position
  • Are looking to join a growing organization within an exciting and expanding industry
What You’ll Be Doing
  • Greet and assist anyone entering the office space
  • Manage the office and/or building needs as appropriate, maintaining office supplies, and stationary management
  • Answer all incoming phone calls and correspondence (emails, letters, packages, etc)
  • Fill, scan, fax, and file documents as needed
  • Place orders with suppliers as needed
  • Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure day-to-day operations run smoothly
Must Haves
  • 1-2 years in a similar role
  • Ability to manage office needs and access when needed
  • Excellent listening, communication, and interpersonal skills and approachability
  • Customer focused with outstanding customer service abilities
  • Excellent organization and time management skills with ability to set priorities
  • Has a clear understanding of the ethics and values practiced in a corporate environment

title: 009 - Theatrical Tour Guide
description:
Company: Ghost Tours of Quebec

Job Title: Part-time Theatrical Tour Guide

Description

Indulge your theatrical side by purveying the darker side of Quebec history to adults and youth alike. Adorn a top hat and wield a lantern as you meander the cobblestone streets of Old Quebec at night while having a frighteningly fun time!

Candidates will be required to memorize a substantial script. Mastery of French is not required but helpful.

How To Apply

Please send your CV along with a cover letter to info@ghostfantome.com.

Potential candidates will be provided with a text to memorize for the audition.

title: Executive & Personal Assistant
description:
Executive & Personal Assistant

Location: Vancouver, BC. (Hybrid) 


About Us

Golden Pear Ventures is a boutique family office with portfolio investments in digital assets, blockchain companies, real estate, capital advisory projects, as well as a charitable family foundation. Various business entities span across Canada, US, Cayman Islands and Hong Kong.


Are You the One? 

We are looking for an Executive & Personal Assistant (EA/PA) working for two Principals of the Family Office. As our trusted and empowered EA/PA, you will not only work closely with ambitious leaders but also with and provide admin support to stakeholders within group companies in various jurisdictions, with a focus on Golden Pear and its associated funds. This is an exciting opportunity to assist this new Family Office and become a pivotal part of its' future.


Your Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

-Manage an extremely active calendar of appointments across different time zones;

-Arrange complex travel, logistics, itineraries, and agendas globally;

-Organize meetings, events, catering, and celebrations;

-Monitor inbox, address time-sensitive mails and handling calls;

-Draft correspondences and assist in preparing Powerpoint presentations;

-Liaise with external professionals and service providers: banking, payroll, IT, accountants, lawyers, medical, insurance, etc.

-Track expenses, costs and reimbursements;

-Assist in administration of staff and household employee: payroll, T4s, WorkSafeBC;

-Manage all admin-related duties for the family office entities;

-Assist in property portfolio maintenance; and

-Observe a code of strictest confidentiality at all times.


What You Bring:

You will thrive in an environment of creation, working alongside successful, global entrepreneurs and will play a key role in handling important administrative and personal matters which will empower the organization. You will be experienced in handling a wide range of tasks and will be able to work independently. You must be well-organized and have the ability to interact with staff (at all levels) in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible and agile, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism. 


Our Must Haves:

-Minimum 1-3 years of experience supporting at a senior management or executive level;

-Bachelor’s degree or equivalent;

-Excellent verbal and written English communication;

-Demonstrates a high level of autonomy, independence and initiative.

-Adaptability and versatility: able to respond to a constantly evolving set of needs and demands

-Strong commercial judgement;

-Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask;

-Demonstrate proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability;

-Experience arranging travel, meetings, catering, and general office organization;

-Proficient in MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, and Zoom; and

-Always discreet and confidential.


﻿Let’s go…!

If you’re feeling like the stars are aligned and this role is for you, please send your CV and cover letter to info@goldenpear.capital. We value your interest in joining us and while we would like to connect with each and every one of you, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Executive Assistant

Job Description

What is the Opportunity ?

Our Physical network Strategy team is seeking an energetic Executive Assistant who is a self-starter and enjoys working in a fun, dynamic and fast paced environment. In this role, you will provide outstanding level of administrative support to the Vice President, Physical Network Strategy and her team as required.

What will you do?
  • Calendar Management, including scheduling meetings, rooms and appointments
  • Booking travel arrangements including flights and hotel accommodations
  • Onboards new employees, ensuring timely set-up prior to start-date - includes ordering/transferring equipment, email/systems access, asset assignments, updating departmental admin databases, correspondence with new employee, etc.
  • Prepares various forms of communication; letters, agendas, emails, notes, and reports as required.
  • Gathers and prepares information and material required for presentations, meetings, quarterly diversity initiatives, audits, etc.
  • Organizes events, both internal and external.
  • Prepares expense claims and reconciles monthly corporate credit card expense statements in a timely manner.
  • Performs various and sundry administrative duties including photocopying, printing, scanning, filing, maintaining administrative data, etc, as well as premises related issues and ordering and maintaining office supplies, phone, and computer service.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:
  • Minimum 3 – 5 years of experience working as an Administrative Assistant in a large matrixed environment.
  • Excellent technical skills, including above average knowledge of Microsoft Office, including PowerPoint and Excel. Demonstrates the ability to prepare presentations
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and deal with change and continuously shifting requirements
  • Excellent interpersonal and time management skills in addition to strong attention to detail and proven ability to work collaboratively in real time
  • Welcomes challenges, but comfortable doing administrative/repetitive tasks

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients succeed. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2022-04-26-07:00

2022-05-08-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Arsenault Bros. Construction is seeking to hire an Administrative Assistant in Cornwall, PEI. Answering to one or more executives the Administrative Assistant will be responsible for a wide variety of administrative duties.

The successful candidate generally should have or be able to:

  • Perform their work in a professional, timely, safe, and ethical manner;
  • Have the ability to work independently, as well as in a team setting;
  • Ability to meet strict deadlines;
  • Ability to work well under pressure;
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize;
  • Have intermediate computer skills;
  • Remain focused on task, have excellent attention to detail;
  • Be a good communicator;
  • Be trustworthy;
  • Be a problem solver;
  • Be adaptable;
  • Be reliable;
  • Be professional;
  • Be proficient with the use of e-mail, text, and phone calls;
  • Communicate in a direct and professional manner;

Specific duties include:

  • Answering and transferring phone calls;
  • Greeting of clients/patrons;
  • Maintaining calendars and book meetings as directed;
  • Record keeping/filing;
  • Ordering and receiving office and general supplies;
  • Booking and coordination of travel and lodging;
  • Providing administrative assistance to the office staff as directed;
  • Filling out forms and preparing documents for signature;
  • Printing, copying, scanning;
  • Other general administrative duties;
  • Openness to potential expansion of roles and responsibilities;
  • Entering accounts payable invoices and reconciling monthly statements.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Grade 12 or GED equivalent;
  • Completion of an administrative or management post-secondary program strongly recommended;
  • Knowledge of products and services in the construction industry would be considered as asset, but is not required to apply;
  • Being familiar with the use of accounting software would be considered an asset, but is not required to apply.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary;
  • Health & dental benefits (after 6 month probationary period);
  • Excellent work atmosphere.

Start date: Immediately (to be negotiated).

Arsenault Bros. Construction is an equal opportunity employer. No preference will be given to any candidate based on race, gender, religion, orientation, age, or otherwise. Please be advised that only a select few candidates will be chosen for the interview process and unsuccessful applicants will not be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $14.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Office Administrator
description:
Are you an administrative professional who's looking for a new, dynamic role? We've got the perfect position for you!

Agilus is recruiting for a Office Administrator in the administrative industry in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Our wonderful client is looking for an administrative professional to join their team in Downtown Vancouver. You will be working with a close-knit group of uber professional women and helping with coordinating events, services and other activities for association members. This role also includes processing and tracking member applications. We are looking for someone who is friendly, professional and who isn’t afraid to put themselves out there. This is a great opportunity to gain valuable administrative experience.

Duties

Help with setting up educational and networking events for members

Make sure the overall office is functioning smoothly

Process, track and follow up with member applications and potential members

Openly communicate with members, various committees and reach out to prospective companies/individuals for memberships

Successful Candidates Will Have

Around 3 years of administrative experience

Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint)

Excellent communication skills

Friendly attitude

Event planning experience is an asset

What's In It For You

$49000.00 annually

Full benefits and vacation

Full time, Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm

Fantastic working environment

Interested?

Please apply directly online by email mdhaliwal@agilus.ca

Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.

We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Apollo Health & Beauty Care (Apollo) is a premium developer of private label and control label health & beauty care products and leverages unique expertise and experience in developing national brand-equivalent products designed to compete equivalently with the most popular national brands. The largest private label and control label personal care manufacturer in Canada, Apollo has formidable penetration and distribution in the North American marketplace and also services customers throughout Central and South Asia, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Building on our core values of Excellence and Commitment, Apollo has established itself as a market leader that attracts the industry's top talent. We are currently searching for an energetic, motivated Travel Coordinator and Administrative Assistant to join our Apollo Team! POSITION SCOPE:

The Travel Coordinator & Administration Assistant will be responsible for managing the air, hotel and ground transportation reservations for executive members travel requirements and assisting other administrative or HR support.

RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
  • Manage all national and international air, hotel, and ground transportation reservations for executive members.
  • Research and compare available flights/hotels/car rentals to identify the best available option for each travel need
  • Responsible for day to day operations, last minute changes, new bookings due to schedule changes/delays, cancellations.
  • Prepare travel itineraries and distribute travel arrangements and schedules to all appropriate executive member within a reasonable amount of time
  • Advise travelers of and assist with any need for specialized travel documents
  • Find COVID-19 testing sites and book tests for travelers, when needed
  • Prepare and submit per diem requests for all travel booked
  • Provide cost breakdown for flights, hotels, rentals, etc. for install travel booked
  • On call for travel emergencies after hours
  • Perform a variety of clerical duties such as writing memos, letters, filing, photocopying etc. as requested
  • Perform other duties as assigned

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
  • 1-2 years’ experience of booking corporate travel, with scheduling/logistics experience considered an asset
  • Knowledge and Experience: 1-3 years’ experience in a corporate environment required; post-secondary education preferred
  • Superior organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills, with the ability to juggle multiple large and small projects at a time
  • Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to assess multiple options and to identify the best choice to serve a specified goal
  • Ability to work well under pressure and remain calm in stressful situations
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with extra proficiency in Excel
  • Willingness and ability to keep up to date with evolving technology and travel regulations
  • Ability to keep personal information about employees and others confidential
  • Available for work weekends and/or after hours for emergency support for travelers

"Apollo Health & Beauty Care will ensure accommodations are available in consultation with candidates during all stages of the recruitment process"

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Duties outlined on this job description may not be all-inclusive and can be modified at any time if requested by management. Apollo is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process. Apollo will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those meeting the minimum qualifications will be interviewed.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

description:

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.

  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.

  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.

  • Canada residents only

  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.

This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Tour Leader / Adventure Guide
description:
MISSION 
 
Master of minutia, logistical guru, our tour leaders and guides will assume the following tasks: 

  • Lead small groups of 10-12 travelers  

  • Drive a 15 passenger van with a trailer in tow 

  • Provide local knowledge about the areas we visit 

  • Manage budgets  

  • Solve problems  

  • Plan and prepare gourmet outdoor meals  



Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS 

  • Be 21 years old or older 

  • Valid class 4 licence or equivalent  

  • Clean driver’s abstract 

  • Have a valid first aid certification (minimum of 16hrs or 40hrs according to the type of trip) 

  • Be an experience outdoor enthusiast and knowledgeable about Canada and/or the USA 

  • Leadership experience 



Additional Information

ATTRIBUTES 

  • Outdoor enthusiast 

  • Leadership 

  • Resourcefulness 

  • Great at planning and organizing 

  • Hard working and cool under pressure 

  • Speak English or French (both languages is an asset but not mandatory) 

 

We are also looking for candidate that speak German, Italian or Spanish.

title: Administrative Assistant - Hiring Fast
description:
We are looking to hire a brilliant Administrative Assistant to join our diverse team at City University of Seattle in Vancouver, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time Administrative Assistant is a fantastic opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in leadership, critical thinking and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Administrative Assistant at City University of Seattle today!

Canada: Administrative Assistant

Category

Canadian Positions

Department

Canadian Operations

Locations:

Vancouver, British Columbia

Posted

May 2, 2022

Closes

Open Until Filled

Type

Full-time

Ref. No.

150517

Position ID

147069

About City University Of Seattle

City University of Seattle (CityU) is a distinguished and comprehensive private nonprofit university and an affiliate of the National University System. CityU is regionally accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU). We are dedicated to providing accessible, achievable higher education to adult learners. As a pioneer in digital learning, we have been delivering online education for over 40 years. CityU is ranked by the U.S. News & World Report among the top for online bachelor's degree programs, and among the top online programs for veterans in the U.S. CityU prides itself on having a completion rate of twice the national average according to data from the Chronicle of Higher Education.

CityU has over 20 locations in the Northwest and worldwide. Many of our degree, certificate and endorsement programs are offered online, in-person, mixed-mode and in performance-based formats. Aside from its flagship campus and headquarters in Seattle, CityU offers programs in Canada, China, the Czech Republic, Mexico, Slovakia, Switzerland, and Vietnam.

Job Description

City University of Seattle in Canada is looking for a qualified Administrative Assistant to support our Master of Counseling Program Virtual Campus.

Job Summary

Provides general administrative support and customer service and coordinates office operations for the program or department under general supervision. Apply knowledge of supervisor's work commitments, including status of projects and nature of contacts in responding to inquiries, setting priorities, arranging meetings, etc.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Provide administrative support duties to maintain office operation, including but not limited to the following:
  • Track departmental expenditures. Create and process financial documents.
  • Screen and direct calls, greet visitors, and respond to inquiries.
  • Schedule meetings, interviews, and special events.
  • Prepare event arrangements, announcements, agendas, reports, minutes, department calendars, etc.
  • Prioritize and distribute electronic and standard mail.
  • Order supplies and equipment. Arrange for maintenance services when needed.
  • Make copies.
  • Coordinate office operations for assigned program or department. Establish priorities and follow deadlines. Create and maintain documentation regarding job and office activities. Make recommendations for streamlining or process improvement.
  • Ensure that operational documents are in order. Work with student or faculty involved and follow up to ensure that records are completed and all information is tracked and recorded.
  • Create, modify, maintain and archive physical files and electronic records using spreadsheet and database software such as PeopleSoft, BlackBoard, Point, and Curriculum Development System. Ensure that records are up-to-date, accurate and accessible. Maintain records in accordance with state, federal, provincial, and accreditation requirements. Assist users experiencing system problems.
  • Prepare and proofread a variety of documents such as correspondence, spreadsheet or database reports, meeting notices and agendas, manuscripts, schedules, student evaluations, etc.
Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Post-secondary degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 3 years of administrative experiences.
  • Able to work remotely if needed.
  • Excellent customer service skills and experience.
  • Advanced Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook Skills.
  • Exceptional organization, prioritization and multi-tasking skills.
  • Flexible and positive personality with a willingness to take on a variety of tasks.
  • Task-oriented and efficient at meeting deadlines.
  • Proven ability to work independently.
  • Competent in virtual meeting environments.
  • General understanding or interest in education field an asset.
Physical Demands

Additional Information:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, talk, hear and perform repetitive motions of the hand and/or wrists.
  • The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, grasp or handle, feel and reach.
  • The employee must frequently lift and/or carry up to 10 pounds, and occasionally lift, carry, push or pull up to 20 pounds.
Working Conditions

The working conditions described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Work is generally performed indoors in a typical office setting.
  • Must be able to work remotely if needed.
  • Work days are Monday to Friday.
Application Instructions

CityU of Seattle only accepts application materials through this online application process. Please submit a complete application to be considered for this position. A complete application includes:
  • Completed Electronic Application Form
  • Current Resume
Once you have created a profile, please remember to record your password. If you use the 'Help Desk' feature, responses will be sent to your Interview Exchange account. Candidates with qualifications and experience most aligned with current needs will be contacted by a hiring manager. Once the position is filled, you will see a status update in your account profile.

If you encounter technical problems while applying for a position, please use the 'Help Desk' feature in your Interview Exchange account to submit the issue to technical support. For non-technical issues or questions, please email ******** .

City University of Seattle is an equal opportunity employer and is continuously working to build a diverse faculty and staff. City University strongly encourages inquiries from all qualified individuals interested in becoming part of the CityU team, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you a polished administrative professional looking for a fast-paced, dynamic, and flexible environment where you can support the work of others? Do your organizational skills and attention to detail put others to shame? Do you build trust and lasting professional relationships everywhere you go? If so, NATIONAL wants to hear from you.


Simply put – we’re looking for a top-notch administrative whiz; someone who can keep the Managing Partner of our Toronto Office organized, manage their calendar with ease, and keep a wide variety of office initiatives moving.


The Ideal Candidate

Whether you come from the corporate world, consulting or somewhere else…we need people who are passionate about the work they do and are focused on our collective success. Our goal is simple: we hire great people who like to work hard, have fun and want to help our team succeed.

This is a part-time role (Monday-Friday 20 hours per week) in a hybrid work environment.


Qualifications

  • Previous executive or administrative assistant experience, preferably in a professional services or consulting environment
  • Highly accountable and organized with excellent time management skills
  • Strong working knowledge of the MS Office Suite, Teams, SharePoint and Zoho (or ERP)
  • Very comfortable with setting up technology for meetings (e.g., Zoom, Webex, Teams)
  • Strong calendar management skills
  • An ability to arrange and attend internal and external meetings in person and virtually, as required
  • Possesses strong time management skills; can prioritize work effectively and juggle multiple projects with minimal supervision
  • Strong writing skills, particularly for correspondence
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Flawless attention to detail
  • Professional attitude and demeanor
  • Ability to work with a sense of urgency


Responsibilities

  • Liaise with clients and their support staff as required
  • Conduct basic research to support mandates undertaken by the Managing Partner
  • Keep Managing Partner informed of work in progress
  • Keep Managing Partner organized and aware of important deadlines
  • Develop and share team communication materials
  • Handle a wide range of administrative duties in support of the Managing Partner and members of our Senior Leadership Team
  • Participate on internal committees and in planning of company initiatives
  • Work cooperatively with other NATIONAL offices as required
  • Assist with preparing accounts payable logs
  • Assist with maconomy entries, as needed


Interested?

Please submit a resume in confidence.


We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified candidates. Accessibility accommodations for candidates requiring them are available upon request.


Please note that we will only be reaching out to those candidates who are being considered for an interview. We appreciate your interest in working with NATIONAL Public Relations.

title: Part-Time Anchor-CityNews 1130 Vancouver
description:
Come play a key role in building the future of Sports & Media! Everyone wants to be part of a transformational team – and that’s exactly what we’re building at Rogers Sports & Media. A team that innovates and a team that wins.

At Rogers Sports & Media we are committed to creating and growing teams that are digital-first, fast-moving and bold-thinking and are focused on delivering impact with everything they do. Our impressive collection of assets includes media properties, sports teams, sports events & production, venues, e-commerce platforms and a close connection with our Connected Home and Wireless team. Collectively, we touch the lives of 30 million Canadians every month!

Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and working in an environment that allows each of us to bring our best authentic selves to work. That starts with our firm commitment to a diverse, inclusive and safe workplace. We’re also dedicated to giving back by using our media megaphone to help Canadians who need it most. Our team is All IN on diversity and inclusion – find out more at www.allinforequity.ca.

Are you up for the challenge and the fun? If so, consider the following opportunity!

We are looking for a part time Anchor!

Are you a budding storyteller, brimming with news ideas, and nowhere to put them? Does the idea of a fast-paced, 24/7 multi-platform newsroom seem like your ideal environment? Then CityNews 1130 is looking for you to join our on-air team!

What You Will Do…
  • Collaborate with a team of journalists to find the most compelling stories and work to tell them effectively on multiple platforms, with a special emphasis to on-air storytelling and writing
  • Contribute riveting and impactful story ideas that you may produce yourself
  • Support your teammates by helping with all areas of the editorial process, from pitch to publish
  • Focus on how to tell stories in linear and non-linear audio formats, while also considering web and TV
What You Will Bring…
  • A passion not just for speaking, but for storytelling
  • The developed sense of what kinds of stories people in Vancouver want and need to hear
  • Curiosity and a desire to push beyond the surface of news stories and challenge conceptions of the status quo
  • A willingness to put the team first, and be able to work in service of a larger goal
  • News moves fast! You must be able to multi-task and deliver for multiple, daily online and broadcast deadlines
  • Because news never stops – a willingness to work evenings and weekend
We’re Looking For Someone Who
  • Is passionate about storytelling
  • Is naturally curious and driven to win
  • Cares about people and the world around them
  • Has a digital-first mindset
  • Is a bold, strategic, creative thinker
  • Understands the challenges facing journalism today
  • Has the courage to change things
Here’s What You Can Expect In Return
  • A competitive salary and benefits that include 50% off Rogers services
  • A manager who deeply cares about your development and long-term career at Rogers
  • A newsroom environment where you will be heard and supported, and where you can bring your whole self to work
  • A team that trusts and wants to win together
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Part time

Shift Variable

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 2440 Ash St (094), Vancouver, BC

Travel Requirements None

Posting Category/Function Broadcasting & News

Requisition ID 266734

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes Rogers Sports & Media

title: Administrative Assistance/Data Entry (Amazon)
description:
Amazon Company seeks for a long term employee to fill Administrative Assistant position. Chosen candidate will train to replace the current assistant and will start on a part time basis, working into a full time position within three months of being hired. Qualified candidates should possess accounting experience working with Quickbooks, and excellent customer service and data entry skills, preferably in a construction office environment. Must type at least 30 words per minute. Application and interview process will include typing and other office skills tests. Must have reliable transportation for occasional office errands. Mileage is reimbursed. We are looking for someone extremely reliable who can run the office alone from time to time. Duties include answering phones, scheduling service calls, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll and job costing, filing and cleaning the office. Presently, we do not offer health insurance or retirement benefits. Vacation pay begins accruing upon hire and is available for use after six months. Hourly rate depends on experience.

These Benefits Include
  • Medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage.
  • 401(k) savings plan.
  • Paid time-off and Holiday overtime pay.
  • Resources to help improve your overall well-being.
  • Discounts on Amazon purchases.
Value

title: Service Receptionist - Start Immediately
description:
We are hiring a capable Service Receptionist to join our productive team at White Rock in Surrey, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time Service Receptionist is an awesome opportunity to develop relevant skills.

If you are strong in communication, decision-making and have the right mindset for the job, then apply for the position of Service Receptionist at White Rock today!

Looking for a great opportunity to work in Canada’s largest Automotive Group?

 White Rock Honda is currently looking to fill the position of Service Receptionist.

The primary function of the Service Receptionist is to administer to incoming walk in traffic & answering & properly directing inbound dealership calls through to the parts and service department.

Essential Duties
  • Greet customers upon their arrival at dealership.
  • Answer all incoming calls promptly, and direct call to appropriate individual.
  • Handle general inquiries from callers.
  • Communicate with all callers in a friendly, efficient and professional manner and attempt to minimize the amount of time they are placed on hold.
  • Refer messages to correct party in a timely manner.
  • Inform telephone company maintenance department of any switchboard malfunctions.
  • Collect payment from customers and issue receipts for goods and services.
  • Prepare invoices and record amounts received.
  • Provide cash refunds or issue credit memoranda to customers for returned goods, as authorized by manager.
  • Record/balance totals shown on cash register tapes or computer records; ensure invoice amounts and payment methods correspond; verify cash on hand to float.
  • Handle customer complaints with integrity and confidence and, if necessary, direct customers to Service Advisor or other appropriate individuals.
  • Process invoices.
  • Operate credit card machines; verify balances at end of day and advise manager immediately of any cash shortages.
  • Follow close out procedures and final balancing at end of shift
  • Ensure work area is neat and clean and exhibit an informed, professional approach with all customers.
  • Perform clerical duties such as arranging for couriers and proofreading, and assist other administrative departments as necessary.
  • Attend all department meetings.
  • Follow all company and manufacturer policies, directives and procedures.
  • Perform any other duties as required.
Dilawri Group of Companies is Canada’s largest automotive group with 72 franchised dealerships representing 30 automotive brands throughout Quebec, Ontario, Saskatchewan, Alberta, and British Columbia. Privately owned and operated by the Dilawri family since 1985, the company continues to expand its footprint in Canada, building on its history of excellence in the automotive industry. With more than 4,000 employees, Dilawri Group of Companies is proud to offer exceptional products and customer service in every dealership.

Dilawri Group of Companies is not only a leader in the automotive industry, it is also a leader in the communities it serves, having established The Dilawri Foundation in 2002. The Dilawri Foundation has contributed tens of millions of dollars throughout Canada supporting a variety of charitable causes.

Go to our website to see more about our company and the many reasons why you will want to work for us!

We do thank all applicants in advance, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Advantageous package

description:
We are seeking a high-performing Real Estate Administrative Assistant. If problem-solving and customer service are your forte, then this job posting is for you.

Here’s what we need you to be able to do:
  • Deliver internal projects on time, in scope, and within budget
  • Coordinate with clients, vendors, partners, and team members

title: Administrative Assistant / Front Desk
description:
The Company

Fast + Epp is an internationally recognized structural engineering firm with a team that prioritizes creativity and simplicity. We work with all materials but are well known for our mass timber and timber-hybrid projects. We love working on architecturally expressive structures, on every scale from single-family homes to large institutional buildings. We enjoy work with a high premium on structural expression. We strive to improve people’s lives through practical, holistic structural design.

Description

We are searching for a personable, reliable, proactive Front Desk Admin Assistant to work at our Vancouver office. You are an ideal candidate if you have excellent communication and customer service skills, and an understanding of administrative procedures. This is a great opportunity for someone with customer service experience looking to transition into an office environment.

This role is Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM in the office.

Responsibilities
  • Answer, screen and direct phone calls in a polite and friendly manner
  • Welcome and assist visitors
  • Respond to general information requests with accurate information
  • Oversee mail deliveries (including sorting and distribution), packages, and couriers
  • Update calendars and schedule meetings
  • Ensure reception, meeting rooms and other common areas are tidy and clean
  • General kitchen duties
  • Assist in organizing and maintaining Library
  • Keep internal distribution list current
  • Order office supplies and maintain inventory
  • Coordinate onsite visits and communicate with vendors
  • Scanning, archiving and data entry
  • Perform other clerical and administrative duties as required to the highest standard

Required Knowledge And Skills
  • Minimum 6 months’ work experience in a reception, front desk or customer service/hospitality role
  • Personable, professional and team oriented; enjoys meeting and connecting with people
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  • Ability to be resourceful and proactive when issues arise
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills
  • Experience managing competing tasks and deadlines

Why Work For Us?
  • Work for an industry leader; contribute to exciting and challenging projects!
  • We are committed to your professional development, with offered tuition assistance
  • Flexible working hours with the ability to utilize "Flex Time" for additional paid time off.
  • Annual company profitability and discretionary bonuses
  • Office closure between Christmas and New Years Day.
  • A positive working atmosphere
  • Social events and activities - we like to have fun too!
  • Customized to your liking extended health plan, Dental coverage, a health care spending account and RRSP matching
  • Located in a very transit friendly location, complete with a generous Transit subsidy

Powered by JazzHR

title: Academic Administrative Assistant
description:
Position Job Title: Academic Administrative Assistant


Location: Vancouver, BC


Reports To: Director, Academic Operations & Support Services


Primary Purpose


Reporting to the Director, Academic Operations & Support Services, the Academic Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support for all Academic Department related functions. This role will require liaising with Staff, Faculty, and Students.


Specific Responsibilities


The Academic Administrative Assistant is responsible for the following tasks as well as other related duties as assigned to support the business objectives and purpose of the University:


  • Providing administrative support to Academic Department by providing reception services, scheduling appointments, meetings, recording, and preparing correspondence, reports, and documents as requested or as needed.
  • Working collaboratively with other admin assistants and Academic team members to complete administrative tasks for the Academic Department.
  • Participating in on campus orientations and training for new and continuing faculty.
  • Troubleshooting classroom concerns for Faculty teaching on campus.
  • Providing administrative support to Faculty, Course Leads, and Department Chairs in their work associated with the course syllabus approval process.
  • Troubleshooting account issues with Faculty and supporting them with account set up.
  • Assisting students by providing initial responses to questions about classes, course registration, etc. using established guidelines and correspondence templates, and redirecting students to appropriate resources and departments.
  • Supporting the Academic Department operations team with external and internal resources such as Teams, Moodle, Examity, and Turnitin, and reaching out as necessary to internal IT support or external system help desks as needed.
  • Assisting with course content repository updates and loading LOAD course section content in the MyUCW portal.
  • Assisting with Moodle support for both the Academics team and the faculty.
  • Managing and tracking information sent to the department such as syllabi, final grades, and exam dates.
  • Redirecting any complaints, concerns, or issues that come to Academic Department to appropriate team members for follow-up and tracking of complaint records.
  • Assisting with tracking Faculty documents such as biographies, and other new-hire documents, ensuring that we receive the required documentation for faculty files.
  • Creating and compiling our digital and physical files for each of our faculty (including required documents as above).
  • Compiling reports and data as required.
  • Contributing to a work environment that encourages knowledge of, respect for, and development of skills to engage with those of other cultures or backgrounds.
  • Other projects/duties as assigned


Position Requirements


Competencies:


  • Able to provide respectful, tactful, fair, and efficient service to a culturally diverse group of clients including students, staff, faculty and other affiliates
  • General knowledge of academic operations and administrative support duties – experience working in an academic setting an asset
  • Efficient, effective, and dependable time management and organizational skills
  • Evidence of advanced English skills with written skills at a formal university level
  • Ability to positively engage with students, faculty and staff and constructively problem- solve or troubleshoot
  • Proven ability to work independently and in a team
  • Adaptability and change management skills
  • Advanced computer skills (MS office proficiency – must be proficient in using Microsoft Flow, Power Automate, and Excel)
  • Proven service-oriented focus
  • Attention to detail and accuracy


Education and Experience:

  • Minimum Bachelor’s Degree
  • Basic training in office practices, customer service, and communication
  • One-three three-years’ experience in education or related field in a fast-paced environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications

title: Administrative Assistant - Fast Hire
description:
We are hiring an ambitious Administrative Assistant to join our passionate team at First Onsite in Dartmouth, NS.

Growing your career as a Full Time Administrative Assistant is an awesome opportunity to develop competitive skills.

If you are strong in persuasion, teamwork and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of Administrative Assistant at First Onsite today!

First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Administrative Assistant to manage the life cycle of construction job files from initiation through to receipt of payment. Are you a get-it-done, can-do person? Are you so organized that you wish other people would let you organize their lives for them? If so, read on!

This Administrative Assistant position comes with a competitive salary and a typical schedule of Monday-Friday. We also offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the office position for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

As an Administrative Assistant, you are an organizational expert! You manage multiple job files at one time from initiation through to receipt of payment. You are responsible for the quality of each file in terms of accuracy and completeness combined with making sure that timelines are met. Following our standard operating procedures, you complete data entry, tracking, and updates. If any filing issues occur, you report them to the management lead and assist in providing a plan of action.

On a daily basis, you collaborate with Project Managers (PM) and Construction Managers (CM) regarding projects requiring attention and/or approaching deadlines to ensure no slippage in project planning. You continuously review projects to make sure that both the customers' and our standards/key performance indicators are being met. Following up with PMs, CMs, and other stakeholders, you ensure that all tasks and filing of documentation are completed.

You provide critical analysis of job performance including job costing, profitability, invoice accuracy, and application of customer standards. To achieve weekly billing goals, you ensure that all invoicing is completed. You enjoy your job as you are never bored and get to work in an exciting fast-paced office!

Qualifications
  • Intermediate computer skills including ClaimTrak, Word, Excel, Outlook, Xactimate, and XactAnalysis
  • Ability to type at least 50 WPM
  • Basic administrative/accounting math skills
Are you able to effectively prioritize and manage your time in a fast-paced environment? Do you have strong verbal and written communication skills? Are you attentive to detail with great administration and record-keeping abilities? If so, you may be perfect for this office position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR OFFICE TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this Administrative Assistant position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Advantageous package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Driving Instructor
description:
About Kruzee:

Learning to drive is hard enough. Finding a qualified instructor shouldn’t be. At Kruzee, we’re a team of driving instructors, marketers, and product specialists on a mission to shape the future of driver’s education in Canada. As an online-first driving school, our digital platform allows students to find, book, and complete in-car lessons with Canada’s best driving instructors. All of our instructors are equipped with a mobile app that allows them to seamlessly manage their schedule and students. We are looking for a dynamic instructor to join our team in the Greater Toronto Area and help build for this future.

If you’re a passionate driving instructor, customer-obsessed, and believe Canadian drivers deserve better, we’re excited to talk to you!


What we offer:

  • $30 / hour guaranteed, whether you get lessons or not 
  • We cover the cost of installing a dual brake (if you don’t have one) 
  • We provide a dynamic workplace with promotion opportunities and a flexible work schedule! 


What you will do:

  • Deliver in-car lessons and teach students how to drive using Kruzee’s educational standards
  • Give driving feedback to our students and help them become better drivers
  • Create a safe learning environment for our students
  • Participate in frequent training / upskilling
  • Share your knowledge with other Kruzee instructors


What we’d like to see in you:

  • Safe driving skills
  • Reliability and punctuality
  • Patience and teaching ability
  • Excellent customer service ability
  • Technological ability and willingness to learn - all of our instructors manage their schedules using the Kruzee app


What we’d like to see on your resume:

  • MTO driving instructor license (required)
  • 5+ years of driving experience
  • Existing driving school, Uber, taxi, or truck driving experience a significant asset
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • College / university diploma / degree is an asset


Meet the ministry standards for driving instruction:

  • Have a clean driving record (zero demerit points)
  • Able to produce a Vulnerable Sector Check and a Police Information Check
  • A vehicle with a valid safety certificate


Thank you for considering a career with Kruzee Driving School.
