title: Assistant(e) Administratif(ve)
description:
Opportunité d'emploi :Adjoint(e) administratif(ve)

Date de début d'emploi: À partir de la semaine du 2 mai

Heures requises : Poste à temps partiel, de 12 à 25 heures par semaine


Description de l'emploi : Les tâches comprennent les inscriptions des étudiants, la gestion des horaires, le service clientèle, les ventes de livres de musique et partitions, le traitement des transactions, le maintien de l'ordre dans l'école, fournir des informations en personne et par courrier électronique, ainsi que d'autres tâches administratives diverses.


Compétences recherchées : Le candidat doit avoir un comportement professionnel, doit être organisé, avoir de bonnes compétences en communication orale et écrite en français et en anglais, maîtrise de l’informatique, connaître Excel, les logiciels de point de vente, une expérience des ventes, une formation en musique et de la lecture de la musique, de l'expérience du commerce de détail ou autre secteur axé sur le service à la clientèle.


Veuillez envoyer un CV et une lettre de motivation et vos disponibilités à l'attention du directeur de l'école de musique M. Ron Harris: info@ecoledemusiquedumarche.com

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We’re a naan traditional company…


The Administrative Assistant is a self-starter, proactive, results-oriented individual with excellent organizational and communication skills who willprovideoutstanding support tothe T&DGroup Leader,reporting to the T&D Program Manager.

What FGF Offers:

  • FGF believes in Home Grown Talent, accelerated career growth with leadership training. Unleashing Your Potential
  • Competitive Compensation, Health Benefits, & a generous flexible medical / Health spending account
  • RRSP matching program
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Discount program that covers almost everything under the sun - Restaurants, gyms, shopping etc
  • Hybrid position , with 2-3 days in the office and flex to work from home.


Primary Responsibilities

  • Produce a variety of materials such as reports, spreadsheets, powerpoint presentations etc.
  • Assists with/helps prepare information for presentations
  • Verifying the accuracy of correspondence, documents, letters and memos
  • Organize and schedule internal and external meetings and ensures all details are managed
  • Create action plans to track progress and follow up to ensure timelines are met
  • Update databases/files (electronic & hard copies) maintaining current documentation (i.e. agreements, NDA’s, audits)
  • Reconciliation and preparation of receipts for expense reports
  • Other miscellaneous duties as required


Required Experience

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in an administrative support role
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Exceptional organizational skills: ability to speak to/work with all levels within an organization
  • Adapt and work extremely well with a diverse set of stakeholders
  • Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
  • Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding
  • High level of maturity, good judgement, and the ability to deal with confidential information
  • Familiarity in an environment requiring discretion, sensitivity to confidential matters
  • A talent for multi-tasking and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledge of Concur, ICIMS and Visio considered an asset
  • Finance, Accounting experience, considered an asset

What is the recipe for a great career at FGF?


Working at FGF Brands, there is never a dull moment! As a successful company that is continually growing there is always challenging yet rewarding work to be a part of. We have an entrepreneurial spirit which encourages all our team members to use their own creativity and out of the box thinking to come up with solutions and new ideas.

Disclaimer: The above describes the general responsibilities, required knowledge and skills. Please keep in mind that other duties may be added, or this description may be amended at any time.

description:

- Percevoir le coût de location

Poste à temps partiel principalement les soirs de semaine ainsi que de jour et de soir la fin de semaine.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Toronto, Canada

Mani Wonders Inc. is an emerging product design brand paving a niche in the fashion technology space. The tech-infused lifestyle products are designed in Toronto and are manufactured and distributed worldwide. At Mani Wonders Inc., we believe in making products that bring simplicity and inspiration to your everyday life.

We are seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our Toronto team on a full-time basis. The incumbent thrives in championing brands, building relationships, creating positive experiences and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations of the office.

Responsibilities
  • Maintain positive and professional staff and client relationships; welcome and greet clients and office guests
  • Support office staff and executives with general operational tasks; perform general accounting and bookkeeping duties
  • Plan and schedule meetings, presentations, and other office related events; send reminders regarding upcoming appointments
  • Answer phones in a professional manner and direct calls to appropriate persons or take detailed messages
  • Arrange social, corporate and team building events
  • Schedule travel arrangements
  • Manage communication of information in and out of the office; type out correspondence letters, emails, memos, etc. (paper and electronic); prepare outgoing mail and packages for executives
  • Assist in preparation of presentation materials
  • Monitor and maintain office equipment; repair or replace malfunctioning equipment and hire technicians when required
  • Monitor office supplies; order and re-stock as needed
  • Ensure office is kept clean and organized at all times
  • High level of discretion required in dealing with confidential matters
  • Typical of any start-up, the ability to navigate ambiguity and mitigate it with creativity is crucial. With ambiguity comes the opportunity to develop new process and establish strong infrastructure
Requirements
  • High school diploma or GED equivalent required
  • 2+ years experience as an administrative assistant
  • An individual who cares deeply about creating a unique brand experience
  • Fast, proficient, and accurate typist
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite, other administrative programs and current technologies
  • Outstanding communicator, both orally and written
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Self-starter who works well independently
  • Ability to prioritize workload and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Detail-oriented and exceptional organizational skills
  • Experience with complex file management
  • Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Can-do attitude, self-driven and proactive, with an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Positive friendly demeanour, interpersonal with exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Interested candidates are welcome to submit resume/CV to careers@maniwonders.com

title: Administrative Assistant - Onsite
description:
We are looking for a part-time Administrative Assistant to support various programs at our Back in Motion Newton location.

Work schedule: Mondays 11:30am to 7:30pm and Thursdays 7:45am to 11:30am. With additional shifts available to cover for vacation coverage.

You will be responsible for reception, answering and directing calls, processing referrals, file set up and management, sending reports, supporting an interdisciplinary clinical team with in person and telehealth service delivery, and providing exceptional customer experience to both external and internal customers. You may also support clinical accreditation procedures as well as the corporate Health & Safety program.

We invite candidates with 6 months to 1 year of similar experience, strong customer service and organizational skills, intermediate skills in MS Office, Zoom, Outlook, MS Teams, etc. If you enjoy helping people and being part of a collaborative team, bring your exceptional customer service and communication skills along with you ability to problem solve and organize multiple priorities. Interest or experience in supporting CARF accreditation process and Health & Safety programs are assets.

Hourly rate starts at $17/hour depending on experience.

title: Service Appointment Coordinator and Receptionist Full time
description:
Westminster Toyota is currently seeking a full time Service Appointment Coordinator and Receptionist to join our busy Service Department.

This role is responsible for answering customer phone calls and directing those calls to the correct Service team members.  This person will also book appointments over the phone for customers and respond and book appointments that come in as an email request.  The appointment coordinator is responsible for making outgoing reminder phone calls, running daily reports on the computer and working directly with the public.  We are looking for someone who is happy, outgoing and enjoys helping people.



Qualifications

You must possess the following qualifications:

  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excellent telephone manners
  • Experienced at working on a team
  • Strong computer skills (Reynolds and Reynolds experience an asset but not mandatory)
  • Self starter that is capable of working independently
  • Experienced at providing excellent customer service
  • Solutions oriented individual

Additional Information

This is a full time position.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM GLOBAL?

Become a part of AIM Global’s history.

We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades through our employees’ strength and our clients’ trust, thus establishing our international presence and diversifying our expertise. Take your place at AIM Global, an integrated chain comprised of five divisions who work in collaboration to revalorize resources such as metals, construction waste, end-of-life vehicles, and urban areas. We invest in our installations and employees to ensure a better future for all.

It’s simple; we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description

The Administrative Assistant will provide support to our Treasury and Tax departments, assisting in daily office needs and managing our company’s general administrative activities.
  • Corporate Treasury:
    • Main duty is to perform contact an email sender or trusted vendor (in person or by using a known telephone number) when we receive instructions to change bank account information to reduce the risk of fraud. (approx. 50% of time)
    • Support Corporate Treasury with bank account documentation (opening, closing, maintenance of the signing officer list and periodic update with banks, etc.);
  • Corporate Tax:
    • Responsible for managing the accesses to governmental online service portals for handling the company’s tax matters (filing, paying, view tax accounts)
    • Responsible of keeping the work-in-progress and notice of assessments trackers up to date
    • Assist Corporate Tax with tax documentation preparation e.g. filling-in of the general information section in tax forms
    • Perform follow-up calls with tax authorities
  • Carries out administrative duties such as filing, typing, copying, binding, scanning etc.
  • Exhibits polite and professional communication via phone and e-mail.
  • Supports team by performing tasks related to organization and strong communication.
  • Other tasks as needed.

Qualifications

We would like to meet you if you have...
  • Proven experience as an Administrative Assistant, or Office Admin Assistant.
  • High School degree.
  • Additional qualification as an Administrative assistant or Secretary (an asset)
  • Fluently bilingual English and French.
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task.
  • Efficient, diligent & resourceful a must.

Additional Information

Work schedule: 35 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

What we offer!
  • Dynamic and pleasant work environment.
  • Group insurance.
  • Group RRSP.
  • Free gym on site.
  • Subsidized meal program.
  • Social events (BBQ, taffy on snow, raffles, etc.)

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to all. The masculine is only used to lighten the text. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Admin
description:
Job Description:


A Calgary based Condominium Property Management Company is looking for a dynamic individual to join our team and grow with the company. With a high focus on customer service, we are looking for a team player that can work with us as we take this company to the next level. Start and grow with us now to be part of an exciting future!


Job Responsibilities/Skills:﻿

• Produce and distribute correspondence e-mails, memos, letters and forms

• Carry out administrative duties such as filing, typing, copying, binding, scanning, etc

• Assist Project Managers (PMs) with setting up appointments, changing addresses,

owner and tenant information, calling vendors about invoices, etc.

• Assist answering telephones and e-mails

• Provide general support to homeowners and tenants

• Develop and maintain a filing system

• Order office supplies

• Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner

• Answer telephone calls when staff is unavailable

• Assist with on-boarding of new buildings and data entry

• Assist with construction projects/contractor relations

• Serve as a liaison between tenants and owners

• Maintain/manage office calendar and important dates for PMs and Accounting

• Special Projects as Assigned


Job Skills:

• Construction experience would be an asset

• Property Management experience would be an asset

• 2+ years of hands on administrative support experience

• Must be proficient in MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook

• Specific knowledge in Condo Manager or other Property Management software an asset

• Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Strong organizational and planning skills

• Professional customer service skills

• Self-motivated, proactive, detail oriented, problem solver and a team player

title: Receptionist
description:
Company Description

This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening

The Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global creative studio with a single goal: to create experiences that move people. With decades of storytelling experience, we are perpetually pushing the limits of what is technologically and artistically possible to tell visually stunning stories.

MPC continues to lead in an ever-evolving industry, building authentic and long-lasting connections with audiences across all channels.

Job Description

The receptionist will be the first friendly face at the studio with dynamic administrative and reception responsibilities. The successful candidate will have excellent customer service and strong organizational skills. Daily tasks include:
  • Greeting visitors and Clients in a professional and efficient manner
  • Managing staff and guest access passes including new employee badges
  • Managing visitor NDAs
  • Ensuring the Covid-19 visitor management policy is adhered to
  • Ensure reception environment always reflects the highest standards in client care and presentation
  • Arrange private car or taxi transportation, as requested
  • Ensuring security of building is maintained during main business hours, including checking for entry passes and managing staff / visitor signing books
  • Immediately reporting any suspicious activity and/or breach in buildings security
  • Manage company inbox including forwarding correspondence and responding to emails in a timely and professional manner
  • Work with Orientation Coordinator to support with employee onboarding tasks and organization
  • Using the delivery management system, oversee the efficient management of couriers and deliveries, and communicate to recipients the arrival of packages; ensure deliveries are received in the AP system
  • Sending sick/late emails
  • Providing a first-class hospitality service for Client visits
  • Collaborate with the Office Manager to support guests throughout the duration of their visit.
Qualifications
  • Exceptional commitment to customer service and support
  • Organized and efficient
  • Strong communication skills, oral and written
  • Ability to work efficiently under tight deadlines and prioritize tasks
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
  • Bilingual (English and French), oral and written
Additional Information

Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.

TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Paquin Entertainment Group Inc. is one of Canada’s premier entertainment companies with a diverse portfolio including artist agency and management, ﬁlm and television, theatrical production, brand partnerships and touring exhibitions. With offices in Toronto, Winnipeg, and Vancouver, we pride ourselves on the ability to provide artists and clients a distinguished level of personal and professional services. Our vision is to foster a creative culture that seeks and develops the world’s premier artists and productions.


Currently, Paquin Entertainment is seeking a positive and proactive Executive Assistant to support the CEO and COO at our Head Office in Winnipeg. An Executive Assistant at Paquin Entertainment is reliable, collaborative, and versatile.


Core Responsibilities:

  • Provide administrative, technical, and organizational support to the CEO and COO
  • Act as the main point of contact for the CEO and COO
  • Maintain appointment schedule; plan and coordinate meetings and teleconferences
  • Oversee scheduling and travel accommodation arrangements for the CEO and develop travel memos; responsible for all travel grants
  • Liaison between the CEO & COO and internal/external stakeholders
  • Complete administrative tasks related to communication, PR and our exhibition division as instructed
  • Assist with adhoc personal assistant tasks
  • Assist with invoicing as needed; ensure invoices received are provided to accounting with accurate information and confirm payment terms are met
  • Research or procurement of items as needed
  • Other duties as assigned

 


Skills & Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in Administrative Assistance
  • Exemplary planning and time management skills with the adapt in a fast-paced work environment
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize daily workloads with diligent respect for deadlines and keen attention to detail 
  • Must be highly organized and able to effectively prioritize workflow
  • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Effective problem-solving skills with the ability to take direction and produce positive results
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office, virtual meeting software (Zoom, Teams, etc.)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience in Arts & Entertainment considered an asset
  • French speaking considered an asset

 


Who you are

 

A superb professional with a passion for arts & entertainment. Someone who is accessible, shows initiative and is a natural personal assistant. Someone prepared to be in office 5 days a week. Comfortable & keen on executing a variety of high level and low level tasks is paramount.


Paquin Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.

 


Please note that only those selected for interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Drive Muskoka is an Automotive Group in the heart of Huntsville, Muskoka with a goal to provide an exceptional experience to both our customers and our Employees. With a dedication to our community, the people we work with and the team members who make Drive Muskoka what it is today, our award-winning Canadian dealer group has been successful in expanding to include Huntsville Honda, Hyundai of Muskoka and Armstrong Dodge and will continues to grow over time.


We are looking for an organized and driven Administrative Assistant to join our team. As the Administrative Assistant, you will provide general administrative and organizational support to the Drive Muskoka Group and handle all correspondence in a timely and professional manner.


Roles and Responsibilities

  • Provide Administrative support to Dealership Principal, Management and wider staff
  • Interact with suppliers, internal and external customers regarding contracts, work orders, special projects
  • Manage branding, logos, sponsorships, as well as ordering and organizing stationary requirements
  • Prime contact for website providers/domains, I.T. /phone/voicemail requirements
  • Provide support, implement, and repair to software programs.
  • Prepare and/or edit internal and external letters, memos, and mass emails
  • Type and proofread correspondence, forms and other documents
  • Stationary, janitorial, and cleaning supply ordering inventory management
  • Maintains records, documentation, and files, particularly more complex or sensitive files such as employee files.
  • Develop, apply and assist with Company processes and dealership process maps
  • Retrieve, screen and distribute business mail and coordinates courier pickups
  • Organize, maintain, and coordinate company records and files in their proper locations
  • Manage Internal Employee Engagement events
  • Manage and maintain renewals of Memberships and Licenses
  • Occasional calendar management for Dealer Principal
  • Co-ordinate scheduling of meetings and some occasional travel
  • Special projects or other tasks as requested by Managers, General Manager and Dealer/Principal
  • Assist HR with onboarding and offboarding and other administrative duties as required
  • Assist with Marketing initiatives and communication as required
  • Provide lunch/break/vacation relief to Receptionists at all dealerships as required
  • Assist with Health & Safety/AODA initiatives as required
  • Other duties as required


Qualifications and Education Requirements

  • Confidentiality, professionalism, and discretion are a must in this position
  • Good attitude as part of a results-oriented team environment
  • Post-Secondary education of some description
  • Previous experience in a related position
  • Accurate and proficient use of MS Office products and as well as Apple iOS
  • Extremely detailed oriented
  • Proven ability to effectively prioritize work flow
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to exercise good judgment, show initiative and be proactive
  • Valid Driver's License


Job Specific Training

  • Orientation training
  • As much as required for the success of the position


All of the training below to be completed within 60 days of hire, yearly refresher thereafter:

  • PBS Training (Controller Module)
  • Power-Up
  • E-dealer
  • Newt Fibrenetix
  • Front App
  • HR4


In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), Drive Muskoka will also provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats and communication supports upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Client Care (Reception)
description:
About The Role:

Our ideal Client Care/Receptionist builds positive client relationships by displaying genuine care and compassion towards clients and their pets, being respectful in all interactions and providing exceptional customer service. This involves greeting and checking-in clients in a friendly and warm manner; receiving incoming calls from current and prospective clients utilizing a courteous and caring approach. This person will appropriately screen calls, book appointments, take detailed messages as well as provide knowledgeable non-medical information to clients. Responsibilities also include performing a variety of administrative office tasks, including mail (receiving, sorting, distributing, posting), drafting memos and other correspondence, completing reports and other ad-hoc document requests.

What We Offer:
  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Networking, Collaboration & Knowledge Exchange With Other Veterinarians Within Our Practices
  • Comprehensive Benefits Include: Medical, Dental & Life Insurance
  • Flexible Schedule
  • Vacation & Paid Time Off

title: Executive Assistant
description:
OVERVIEW:


We are currently seeking an Executive Assistant responsible for day-to-day administrative assistance and support of several executives.


THE BUSINESS:


Headquartered in Toronto, Mandrake is one of Canada's foremost executive search and consulting firms. As a strategic partner to some of the world's leading businesses, our primary goal is to enhance organizations by identifying and attracting outstanding leadership executives.


WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • Strive to deeply understand Mandrake’s strategic priorities, and work with the Executive to ensure that their time is organized accordingly.
  • Database management including entering and updating data such as resumes, candidate details, client and candidate interviews, document management, and other administrative tasks.
  • Manage the Executive’s calendar in Outlook, including organizing internal and external meetings across multiple time zones, locations and mediums (including but not limited to phone, email and other proprietary systems).
  • Project management – including, but not limited to, corporate initiatives, technology support, candidate and client best practices (references, profiles, invoice requests, client agreements).
  • Appropriate liaising and communication between candidates and clients.
  • Creation of recruiting briefs, company profiles and other documents to support new business and ongoing searches.
  • Initial industry and company research, including candidate location and identification.
  • Supporting other associates during vacation or increased workload.


WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

  • 7+ years’ experience in an administrative role supporting various level executives - ideally within the recruitment industry.
  • Research experience an asset
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Zoom and database data entry.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Bilingual communication in French/English is an asset.
  • Reliability, punctuality, and discretion.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Attention to detail.
  • Well organized and capable of making decisions and ability to work without supervision.
  • Exceptional multi-tasking abilities and prioritization skills.
  • Ability to adjust to changing demands and circumstances.
  • Post-secondary education an asset.


WHAT YOU SHOULD EXPECT:

  • A great environment to work and have fun! Our Yorkville location is well equipped with modern facilities for our colleagues, clients, and candidates.
  • This role will provide the successful candidate with a broad range of business experiences enabling them to develop an understanding of clients, markets, people, and functions, with special attention to client relations.
  • Flexible work arrangements in a hybrid model
  • Extended health and dental benefits


YOUR NEXT STEPS:


Mandrake promotes the highest standards of integrity and principles of quality, diversity, equity, and ethical practice. We thank all those who submit their résumés. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Reception Agent
description:
Resepsiyon Görevlisi

Bİlk izlenimler en önemli detaydır! Resepsiyon görevlisi olarak, konuklara geldikleri andan itibaren unutulmaz bir deneyim yaşamalarını sağlayarak onlara yardımcı olacaksınız.

Sizin için ne gibi faydalar var?
  • 3-4 nokta ile yan ödemelerle bizimle çalışmanın avantajlarını yakalayın.
  • Dünya çapında Accor'te indirimli fiyatlar sunun ve çalışanlara sağlanan karta sahip olun.
  • Akademilerimizin düzenlediği eğitim programlarıyla kendinizi geliştirme fırsatı kazanın.
Yeteneğinizi geliştirerek çalıştığınız otelde ve dünyada kendinizi geösterme şansına sahip olun.

Toplumda, kurumsal sosyal sorumluluk projelerimiz ile (Planet21 gibi) fark yaratabilme olanağınız olsun.

Ne Yapıcaksınız
  • Misafirlerin isteklerine anında cevap verin..
  • Kişiye özel bir deneyim için insiyatif alın.
  • Çalıştığınız yeri gururla temsil edin ve misafirlerin konaklama süresini arttırmak için fırsatlar arayın.
Tecrübeleriniz Ve Becerileriniz
  • Hizmet odaklı kişilik esastır.
  • Opera veya ilgili sistemlerde deneyim..
  • Akıcı İngilizce ve ayrıca bir yabancı dil.
Ekibiniz Ve Çalışma Ortamınız
  • 1-2 cümle ile: Ekibi, çalıştığınız yeri veya ofisinizi kültürü yansıtacak şekilde tanıtmaya özen gösterin.

Not: Çalışma izinleri gibi belirli yerel veya yasal gereklilikler için özelleştirme dahil edilebilir.

Çeşitliliğe ve Birlikteliğe olan bağlılığımız:

Herkesi kucaklayan bir şirket olarak hedefimiz farklı yeteneklerin bizimle çalışmasını sağlamak, işe almak ve tanıtmaktır.

Niçin Accor'da çalışmalıyız?

Biz bir dünya liderinden daha fazlasıyız. Sizi olduğunuz gibi kabul ediyoruz ve kişiliğinize uygun iş ve markada iş bulabileceğinizi taahhüt ediyoruz. Her gün gelişmeniz ve öğrenmeniz için sizi destekliyoruz, işinizin hayatınıza bir amaç getirdiğine inanıyoruz ve bu sayede bizimle olan seyahatinizde Accor'un limitsiz olanaklarını keşfetmeye devam edeceğinize inanıyoruz. Accor'a katılarak, hikayenizin her bir kısmını sizin yazmanıza olanak sağlıyoruz ve geleceğin hizmet anlayışını beraber hayal ediyoruz. Accor'da sizi bekleyen hayatı keşfetmek için, https://careers.accor.com/'u ziyaret edin.

Sevdiğiniz işi yapın dünyayı önemseyin ve statükoya meydan okuyun! #BELIMITLESS

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

Your skills may be required for a short period of time, or for a longer period (up to 12 months).

Your key responsibilities will vary depending on the assignment but you can expect to support teams in their daily activities, draft correspondence, prepare reports and presentations, collate data, liaise with various stakeholders, maintain registers and do data entry.

  • The willingness to work in our offices located either downtown Toronto or in Montreal (St-Laurent).

You must be legally authorized to work in Canada for the full duration of the assignment.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
Purpose/Objective:

 

We are looking for an Executive Assistant to join our dynamic team in the Canadian and Global ETF Market. This is an opportunity to join Canada’s most innovative ETF provider. 

 

The successful candidate will provide complete administrative support to the CEO while maintaining a high degree of discretion, professionalism, and maturity when handling confidential and sensitive information.

 

Responsibilities:

 

·        Manage all travel arrangements and accompanying material

·        Answer, screen, and direct phones calls, identify priorities, and respond appropriately

·        Provide administrative support to the CEO including e-mail correspondence, calendar management, and expense reporting; including travel and meeting arrangements, both internally and externally

·        Organizing documents and maintaining records

·        Prepares various forms of communication; letters, agendas, emails, notes, and reports as required

·        Prepare and organize Board of Directors meeting packages

·        Coordinate between departments when CEO approvals are required

·        Proactively anticipates the needs of the management team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

·        Assist other leaders with administrative support as needed

·        Planning, organizing, and implementing staff and client events as required

·        Perform other duties and special projects, as may be required

 

Skills & Experience:

 

·        High School Diploma or equivalent

·        3-5 years’ administrative experience

·        Completion of a relevant office administration or general business post-secondary education

·        Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy

·        Highly organized and ability to multitask and meet tight deadlines

·        Ability to provide support outside of normal working hours

·        Proven planning and organizational skills

·        Self-directed and able to complete projects with limited supervision

·        Advanced knowledge of MS Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe, Outlook

·        Knowledge of Concur software is an asset

 

 

To Apply: Click Apply or send your resume and cover letter in one file to careers@horizonsetfs.com

 

In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, we are currently working under a hybrid model.

*A successful candidate would be required to comply with Horizons ETFs vaccination policy prior to their start date.

 Horizons ETFs is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to providing a respectful, welcoming and accessible environment for all people. All employment decisions at Horizons ETFs are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to sexual orientation, gender identity, race, religion, colour, age, marital status or disabilities.

 

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. During the hiring process, for those job applicants selected for interviews, any required accommodation will be provided. If the successful candidate requires accommodations, an individual accommodation plan will be established and the proper adjustments will be made to support them.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.

Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Assistant, Playland (Pacific National Exhibition)
description:
Office Assistant, Playland

Full-time; Permanent

Wage: $24.86/hour + benefits

Date Posted: March 17, 2022

Who We Are…

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 110-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams: the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organization’s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution. With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to “Deliver Memorable Experiences” for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are looking for a passionate and enthusiastic Office Assistant that will join us in evolving the site’s guest experience to the next level. Our ideal candidate is an individual that has a passion for event operations and experience in executing guest experience training programs that lead to a high degree of continuity across multiple sites or venues. This role will work out of Playland Administration, with a focus on the PNE’s guest experience across all year-round events, inclusive of the Ride Operations team during the Playland season.

Why join our Team?
  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Staff discounts
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and relationships!
What will you do this year?

In your role as an Office Assistant, Playland, your primary accountabilities will be to:
  • Provide general administrative support for the Playland Maintenance and Ride
  • Operations department.
  • Provide administrative services to the department including word-processing,
  • spreadsheets, filing, record keeping and mail distribution.
  • Process information for payroll purposes, including time entry and Employee Information
  • Forms (EIRs).
  • Assist with the implementation and administration of an online shift scheduling system
  • for the Ride Operations department.
  • Assist with transferring documentation from paper-based to electronic, including
  • training verification records, ridership figures, and staff scheduling.
  • Provide general reception services such as answering inquiries by telephone.
  • Process incoming and outgoing mail, including faxes and emails.
  • Deal with confidential information pertaining to both employee and departmental
  • issues.
  • Ensure common areas are maintained including office equipment and supplies.
  • Maintains a safe and clean environment.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
What else?
  • Successful completion of Grade 12; or an equivalent combination of education and experience required. Post-secondary course work in office, computer and purchasing skills are considered an asset.
  • 2-3 years of work experience within an administrative capacity and/or reception and office services.
  • Strong knowledge and experience with computer applications including but not limited to MS Office Suite; with a minimum typing speed of 50 wpm.
  • Proficient with computer applications and programs, with the ability to administer new or changing software applications.
  • Excellent customer service skills and a pleasant manner for assisting clients on the phone and in person.
  • Previous experience with a time & attendance system is considered an asset.
  • Keen attention to detail with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Comfortable with autonomy and working under pressure, with ability to meet multiple service demands simultaneously.
  • Ability to deal with confidential matters and use discretion.
  • Available and willing to work five days/week with a start time as early as 7:00 am; and flexibility to work various shifts (evenings, weekends and holidays) depending on operational needs.
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check.
Who are you?
  • Skillful communicator
  • Committed
  • Methodical
  • Detail oriented
  • Organized
Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The PNE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at hr@pne.ca.

Value

title: Office Assistant
description:
Description

Start working as an office assistant today!

Robert Half has a contract opening for a highly-skilled and motivated office assistant / file clerk to provide support with various administrative duties. Are you a self-starter who loves handling multiple projects at once with a positive outlook? Then we have a position for you. This contract role is located in the Surrey, British Columbia area.

How You Will Make An Impact
  • Filing, copying, scanning, and faxing
  • Maintain office facility
  • Answer phones and direct to the correct department
  • Data entry
Requirements

What we're looking for:
  • Ability to multi-task efficiently and prioritize work
  • Complete tasks independently
  • An enthusiastic teammate who is willing to take on anything from small internal administrative tasks to high profile requests
  • Ability to operate basic office equipment, complete general office work and route incoming materials
  • SharePoint and Microsoft Office is preferred
If you have a winning team attitude approach and you are eager to grow your career to the next level, we want to hear from you! This position is perfect for you if you love thriving in a dynamic environment. Contact us now- this position will be gone by the end of the week!

To be considered for this contract role, click the “Apply Now!” link or by using the Robert Half mobile app. Download it on the App Store or get it on Google Play today!

Robert Half would like to thank all applicants for their expressed interest however, only those candidates identified for interview will be contacted.

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4154. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Sales Associate
description:
At Rogers, our retail team is the heart of our success. They don’t just embrace the latest technology and content—it's part of who they are. They're outgoing and approachable team members who want to share their knowledge and experience with others. They understand that our customers rely on technology to enhance and simplify their lives and they're excited to show customers how our latest products and services can help.

We’re growing our teams and are looking for retail representatives who are committed to innovating by sharing ideas that have real business impacts and creating a best-in-class customer experience for our communities and neighbours in our retail stores from coast-to-coast-to-coast.

Let’s help make your passion for the latest technology a career possible. Consider the following opportunity!

In Retail, we believe our people are the heart of our success. We don’t just embrace the latest technology and content - it’s part of who we are. We dive deep into how our products and services enhance our customer’s lives and we’re excited to show them how our technology can make more possible each and every day. We put our customers first in everything we do, and we’re committed to creating best-in-class customer experiences by connecting with our customers in our stores from coast-to-coast-to-coast. This is an opportunity for you to have a role that is both challenging and rewarding and helps build transferrable lifetime skills.

Life At Retail – What We Offer…

<>

We invest in our people to unleash their potential so we can win as a team! As part of the team, you will have access to a ton of amazing resources, discounts, and perks. To name a few
  • Competitive base pay plus commissions
  • Unlimited access to Headspace Premium for mindfulness training
  • Access to a virtual walk in clinic to connect with Healthcare Professionals from home
  • LIVX – Fitness Membership to attend classes virtually
  • Company matching contributions to charities you support
  • Paid time off for volunteering
  • Great benefits, pension plan, RRSP, TFSA and Wealth Accumulation Plan
  • Employee discounts that can offer up to 50% off our products and services
  • Leadership development, Mentorship and Coaching programs
We genuinely care about each other and we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace at Rogers so all of our team members can bring their whole selves to work. We have employee resource groups that build awareness and a culture of allyship for equity-seeking groups, including groups representing People of Colour, LGBTQ2S+, Indigenous Peoples, Persons with Disabilities and Women. We all bring something different, and we know what makes you different makes us great.

https//youtu.be/i8Cp-R42LtI

What We’re Looking For…

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about connecting with our customers and genuinely wants to help find the best product to meet their needs. Someone who has a deep passion to listen and genuinely want to help each person they connect with. This role is fast-paced, and the environment is ever changing. You will be challenged to ask the right questions to unlock the appropriate solutions. You will foster collaboration within your team and other departments in efforts to provide world class customer service.

What You’ll Do…

Our customers come first, and they inspire everything we do. As part of our team, your analytical expertise will be used showcase how our products and services can help make their possible everyday. You will have the opportunity to connect, develop relationships, and offer value-added solutions to customers in your local community. You will receive ongoing training and development to ensure you have all the necessary skills to navigate our systems and find the solutions and/or the products that best suit our customers. We are there when our customers need us so you will have the ability to work a flexible schedule.

Who You Are…
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Expert in communication and listening
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Skilled in delivering exceptional customer service and sales experience
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule (min 20 hours/week)
  • Navigate multiple computer systems and multitask
We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for our customers, we believe it starts with our retail team. At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your possible.

As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to complete an online assessment and provide consent for and successfully pass a criminal background check.

As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.

Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

Schedule Part time

Shift Variable

Length of Contract Not Applicable (Regular Position)

Work Location 1 Dundas St. W Unit Z010 (5434), Toronto, ON

Travel Requirements Up to 10%

Posting Category/Function Retail (In Store / Hourly) & Sales and Service

Requisition ID 266009

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work
  • Our people are at the heart of our success
  • Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
  • We do what’s right, each and every day
  • We believe in the power of new ideas
  • We work as one team, with one vision
  • We give back to our communities and protect our environment
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

Posting Notes Retail

title: Data Entry Clerk
description:
Join Livingston and grow your career in the constantly changing world of international trade. Livingston is a market leader offering customs brokerage, international trade consulting, compliance and freight forwarding services around the world. Livingston has over 3,000 employees at more than 90 key border crossings, sea ports, airports and other strategic locations in North America, Europe and Asia.

Our fast-paced and collaborative environment offers you the opportunity to work with leaders in the industry, receive recognition for achievements and develop your expertise in the complex and evolving world of trade. Learn how you can make an impact at Livingston.

Job Type: Full Time

Location: Offsite CBSA Dorval Quebec

Job Summary

The Data Entry Clerk receives and prcoesses data elements. In addition the clerk invoices transactions and provides customer service.

Key Duties & Responsibilities
  • Enter data into system or database
  • Scan documents
  • Generate invoices for transactions
  • Provide customer service
  • Perform other related duties as assigned by management.
  • Adhere to established policies and procedures.
Knowledge & Skills
  • Basic computer functions
  • Customer Service skills
  • Export process knowledge
Work Experience – Minimum Required

1 year of experience

EDUCATION

Required: High School/GED or equivalent

Certifications Description

COMPETENCIES

Accountability

Business Acumen and Straight Talk

Agility

Customer First Focus

Inclusion and Collaboration

Leading and Developing

Livingston is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

For Canada: Livingston is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity, respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. Accommodations are available for applicants and employees with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Our client, a leader in the banking industry is seeking an Administrative Assistant for their Technology and Operations team for a 6-month contract with the possibility to extend or move to a permanent position. This role will be onsite in their Toronto office. In this position you will be responsible for supporting the execution of payments, transactions, service requests, administrative activities and processes and fulfillment of business, stakeholder and/or external customer inquiries/requests within relevant service level agreements. The ideal candidate has a positive attitude and is passionate about providing great quality work.

Responsibilities
  • Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
  • Communicates and collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
  • Supports change management of varying scope and type; tasks typically focused on execution and sustainment activities.
  • May function as a problem-solving resource for more junior staff, referring non-routine issues to more senior team members and/or manager.
  • May perform quality control and training.
  • Organizes work information to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  • Executes routine tasks such as service requests, transactions, queries etc. within relevant service level agreements.
  • Provides accurate and timely processing of service requests, transactions, activities, etc. within relevant service level agreements and in accordance with established policies, processes and procedures.
  • Provides accurate, consistent, knowledgeable responses to stakeholder questions and requests.
  • Follows documented policies and procedures to execute day to day transactions, activities, processes and ensures all Service Level Agreements(SLAs) are met.
  • Checks and reconciles information and documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  • Identifies and resolves discrepancies in accordance with standard procedures. Escalates issues, where necessary, as per guidelines.
  • Communicates and collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
  • Collaborates in development/implementation of new processes/systems and changes/improvements to existing systems and processes.
  • Develops and maintains an understanding of the regulatory requirements and risks inherent in the operations and ensures appropriate actions are taken and operational integrity is maintained.
  • Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits.
  • Analyzes issues and determines next steps; escalates as required.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications
  • Typically between 1 - 2 years of relevant work experience and Post-secondary degree in related field of study desirable or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Knowledge and experience using relevant systems and technology.
  • Thorough knowledge and understanding of the business unit’s key products and services, processes and controls
  • Exceptional knowledge of the risk and regulatory requirements of the business
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills
  • Excellent collaboration and team skills
  • Ability to problem-solve and take initiative
At Prime Hires our mandate is simple - provide top-tier talent to our clients and unsurpassed career opportunities to our candidates while ensuring the best fit for both. We are perfectionists who excel at working to ensure we have a perfect match. With experience spanning almost 3 decades and offices across North America, we have built our reputation on the strong relationships and trust of our clients and candidates. Our expertise is in Temporary, Contract and Permanent placements in Finance, Accounting, Administrative & Clerical, Office Operations, Contact Centre, and Technology.

description:
Entry-level job - Remote Work At Home. Full or part-time placements available from home. With or without experience we motivate all candidates to apply.

We are looking for candidates interested in collaborating with companies who are employing staff members for remote at home positions. Both permanent as well as part-time opportunities are available in a selection of job fields consisting of but not limited to data entry, advertising and marketing, client service and support, clerical, as well as administrative. Candidates with experience in within sales, outside sales, as well as retail sales are also urged to apply on our website. If you can work on your very own from home and also are self-motivated you would certainly be an excellent fit. Ideal candidates ought to take pleasure in such job as email customer support, data access, social networks posting as well as assessing products. Data entry clerks originate from all different backgrounds including customer support, sales support, clerical, secretary, administrative assistant, receptionist, call center, part-time, retail areas & even more We are wanting to hear from you. Please apply on our website today!

Computer with internet access

Silent workplace away from distractions

Desire to take instructions

title: GM Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Responsibilities Include

The Administrative Assistant will support the General Manager and fulfillment center Operations team. The successful candidate will be organized, detail oriented, self-motivated, able to handle confidential information, as well as a demonstrated ability to respond to changing workloads and priorities. Must have the ability to communicate clearly and to manage multiple assignments and people simultaneously. Other responsibilities will include:
  • Manage and complete expense reports for General Manager, Senior Leader(s) if applicable, and yourself as needed.
  • Maintaining schedules, planning events, coordinating meetings, and conferences for the Fulfillment Center Staff
  • Own and manage conference room coordination and room calendar management
  • Conduct clerical duties, including filing, full office management, responding to emails, preparing documents and presentations using graphics, graphs, and internal information and platforms
  • Typing meeting notes, creating conference agendas and minor content curriculum creation
  • Scheduling cost effective travel arrangements which include: airfare/hotel/ground transportation for General Manager, and Senior Leader(s) as needed
  • Assist with internal communications for associates and leadership among multiple platforms, interfaces, and programs
  • Work with outside vendors to coordinate upkeep, and maintenance of the Fulfillment Center
  • Run work-related errands as needed
  • Think and plan ahead, delegate responsibilities appropriately and manage time effectively
  • Compile team goals, track and help drive completion of key deliverables and follow up on outstanding items.
  • Management of complex calendars and scheduling with diplomacy and discretion
  • Coordinate closely with Workforce Management, Recruiting, Maintenance, Human Resources, and other teams within the FC
  • Serve as representative on department team-building activities and peer recognition

Basic Qualifications
  • Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint)
  • 2+ years administrative support experience at an executive level
  • Ability to create graphs in MS Office products
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule (Monday-Friday) and overtime as needed
Preferred Qualifications
  • Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to learn organizational structure and the objectives of the team
  • Strong organizational and communication skills and problem solving skills
  • Prioritize and handle multiple assignments at any given time while maintaining commitment to deadlines
  • Ability to communicate with a variety of constituent groups such as senior management, peers, and outside contacts

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Working with the Administrative group, you will be involved in the daily operations of the Finance/Accounting team.

You will be responsible for:
  • Process all staff expense reports and attending to employees’ inquiry/ies in a professional and timely manner
  • Prepare and reconcile weekly and monthly backlog reports and submit to managements
  • Provide administrative support to the Accounting department
  • Other accounting duties as required
  • Compliance with all Evertz Policies and Procedures

The successful candidate will posses the following:
  • Recent grad with a diploma in accounting/business administrative program
  • Previous experience in a similar position is an asset
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
  • Ability to work the late shift every other Friday and month-ends
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem solving ability, time management skills and interpersonal skills

What we Offer:
  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-Life Balance
  • Employee assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career Progression
  • Casual Work Environment
  • Social Events and Sports Teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery. Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers. With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Avis Budget Group is an action-packed, high-energy workplace where things move forward every day. We are a global leader in the travel services industry operating two of the most recognized brands in the vehicle rental business. We are a customer-led, service-driven organization that offers an enthusiastic, family-friendly and collaborative work environment where you can expect to be developed, recognized and rewarded for a job well done. If you want to GO somewhere in your career, Avis Budget Group is the place to be.

As a City Administrative Assistant, you provide support to the City Manager and other key management team members. To be successful in this demanding role you will have strong communication skills and be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and able to make a positive impact on key responsibilities, some of which will include the following:
  • Completes a broad variety of administrative tasks for the City Manager, HR Partner, and adhoc support other Managers as needed.
  • Assist with operational support for customer recovery
  • Plans, coordinates and ensures the City Manager’s schedule is followed and respected. Provides "gatekeeper" and "gateway" role, creating win-win situations for employees.
  • Researches, prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature.
  • Assists in managing special projects. Project management skills necessary.
  • Produces information by formatting, inputting, editing, retrieving, copying and transmitting text, data and graphics. Microsoft Excel skills necessary.
  • Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
  • Assist in preserving and maintaining files
  • Provides a variety of reports to location managers.
  • Assist in other roles/activities as assigned
  • Ensuring that vendor accounts are paid and kept up to date;
  • Handling employee related transitions including new hire paperwork and other routine changes;
  • Approving payroll for the corporate employees in the City;
  • Maintaining and updating closed contracts for the districts operators;
  • Assisting management in scheduling and running organizational meetings;
  • Providing confidential administrative and clerical support to the locations City Manager.

Required Experience
  • High school diploma.
  • Minimum of three years of general office experience.
  • Microsoft Office skills are required
  • Must have strong administrative skills

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Must be able to communicate clearly, accurately, and effectively both orally and in writing.
  • Must be able to interact professionally with all levels of management.
  • Payroll and other administrative or secretarial education/experience a plus.
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment.
  • Self motivated, requiring little direct supervision.
  • Solid PC skills including Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point and Excel).
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new tasks and responsibilities.

We offer a wide range of exciting benefits for full time employees, including:
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Employee discounts
  • Opportunities for training and advancement

If you're motivated and dependable with a proven track record of success in a customer care environment, then we can put your career on the map.

IT'S EXCITING being on the fast track to career success. Get your GO on!

Avis Budget is an EO employer.

Avis Budget Group is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify the Recruiter when contacted for an interview.

The information listed in this advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. Your response to this ad may result in your being considered for employment with an affiliated company of Avis Budget Group, the publicly traded parent company of Avis Budget Car Rental, LLC and its subsidiaries.

This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment.

Who We Are: Glad you asked! Avis Budget Group is a leading provider of mobility options, with brands including Avis, Budget & Budget Truck, and Zipcar. With more than 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries, we are shaping the future of our industry and want you to join us in our mission. Apply today to get connected to an exciting career, a supportive family of employees, and a world of opportunities.

Etobicoke

Ontario

Canada

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Who we are.

We’re an operational consultancy that’s been around for over 15 years. We’ve worked hard to build a reputation for solving the most challenging front-line operational and financial problems that some of today’s most important industries face. Loving your Monday to Friday is important to us. We’ve been recognized as one of the top 10 Best Places to Work in Canada for the past 3 consecutive years, which we know has something to do with our culture of rewarding great work with great experiences, fostering rapid career growth, and sharing the success of the business with the whole team.


We are looking for an experienced Executive Assistant to support two of our senior leaders.


This role will support:

  • Calendar management & coordination
  • Email management & communication
  • Liaise with partners & actively manage their ‘to-do’ list
  • General administrative support
  • Executive Project/initiative Support
  • Event planning support
  • General administrative support


Who you are.

  • Attention to detail – You’re naturally driven to get the details right - all the time, every time.
  • A people person – You have strong interpersonal skills and enjoy interacting with people
  • Multi-tasker – You can manage a diverse range of responsibilities and prioritize each task with allotted timelines to complete them effectively and on-time
  • Trustworthy – You have a ton of integrity and feel confident in your ability to manage sensitive information
  • Team Player – You love working in a collaborative environment and building strong working relationships with business leaders and peers
  • Organized – You’re always one step ahead and are able to prioritize your work to meet all required deadlines
  • You’re a doer – When given a task, you are able to run with it and complete it effectively and on-time
  • You’re tech-savvy – You know your way around commonly used computer software and applications and are a fast learner
  • A great communicator – You have excellent verbal and written communication skills – you bring energy and professionalism into interactions with internal and external stakeholders
  • Independently motivated – You embody the ability and drive to take on tasks without immediate direction
  • Strong project manager – You ask the right questions to understand the vision, involve the appropriate stakeholders, and can manage a task list that leads to the most efficient and effective outcome
  • Confident – You’re not afraid to set expectations with multiple stakeholders including the leaders you’re supporting to drive the right processes and priorities
  • Experienced – you have 1-3 years’ experience managing 2 or more executives and have proven ability to improve processes that maximize the effectiveness of the role

What You’ll Do.

  • Manage intake of meeting requests from internal and external stakeholders and prioritize appointments
  • Set-up internal and external meetings that involve the executives you’re supporting
  • Create a process that protects your executives time by efficiently managing calendar requests while ensuring all business, employee, and client needs are met
  • Manage the inboxes of your respective executives by tracking to all emails and ensuring a response within a timely manner, through an email triage process
  • Facilitate regular status updates with each of your executives to align on priorities for the week and flag emails or tasks that require their attention
  • Effectively use judgement to understand shifting priorities for the executives you’re supporting
  • Book all travel for your executives including flights, hotels, drivers when needed
  • Manage administrative tasks on behalf of your executives including monthly expenses, time tracking, and CRM management
  • Support in the coordination and execution of events being hosted by your executives – booking the venue, ordering food and beverage, and creating a positive experience for all in attendance
  • Support in project management for special initiatives being led by your executives
  • Identify opportunities to improve support and implement additional best practices into the EA process

Why work for us?

  • You’ll receive a competitive salary
  • 5 weeks-vacation for everyone at the company
  • You’ll be a part of an incredible team that does meaningful work that has a massively positive impact on the world!
  • You’ll work with amazing people who genuinely love to spend time together
  • You’ll have great work-life balance – no working on weekends allowed
  • You’ll receive a comprehensive benefits package 100% covered by us
  • You’ll receive a generous annual wellness allowance
  • You’ll participate in company sponsored events and activities
  • We’ve been recognized as being one of the top 10 Great Places to Work in Canada for companies under 100 people for the past 3 consecutive years
