title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Administrative Assistant

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The RBC Dominion Securities branch located in Coquitlam BC is looking for an Administrative Assistant to provide administrative support to a successful Advisory Team.

You will provide quality client service and help deepen relationships with existing clients through ongoing, efficient support to both clients and the Advisor Team.

What will you do?
  • Coordinate and prepare meetings for Advisors with their clients/prospects.
  • Provide proactive client service with a focus on problem resolution and attention to details. Liaise with various departments for execution, where necessary.
  • Respond to client inquiries (account transactions, requests account documentation, account reporting, etc.).
  • Assist the Advisor team with client onboarding.
  • Help manage incoming communications from clients, Advisors and other internal and external partners.
  • Maintain existing client accounts and identify opportunities to contact clients: manage timelines and key dates for accounts
  • Ensure accurate and timely updates of all necessary documentation in compliance with internal controls and industry regulatory requirements. Maintain complete and up-to-date client files within appropriate systems.
  • Help update team’s communication channels: websites, LinkedIn, Facebook, brochures, newsletters.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
  • Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills
  • High level of time management and organization skills
  • Demonstrated skills in providing world-class client service that will come across as professional, warm, and friendly to our clients
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication in English

Nice-to-have
  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Conduct & Practices Handbook (CPH)
  • Knowledge of RBC Dominion Securities’ systems and procedures
  • Experience in the securities industry is an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

Address:

COQUITLAM, British Columbia, Canada

City:

CAN-BC-COQUITLAM

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-04-29-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-05-20-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Recepcionista
description:
As primeiras impressões são tudo! Como Recepcionista, você cuidará dos clientes desde o momento da chegada até a partida, garantindo que eles tenham uma experiência memorável conosco.

O Que Há Para Você
  • Em 3- 4 pontos, mostre os benefícios e as vantagens de trabalhar no hotel/na sua área
  • Cartão de benefícios do colaborador oferecendo tarifas com desconto na Accor em todo o mundo
  • Programas de aprendizagem através de nossas Academias
  • Oportunidade de desenvolver seu talento e crescer dentro de seu hotel e em todo o mundo!
  • Capacidade de fazer a diferença na comunidade local através de nossas atividades de Responsabilidade Social Corporativa, como o Planet 21
O Que Você Irá Fazer
  • Cumprimente, faça o check-in, responda a solicitações prestando um serviço excepcional.
  • Tome niciativa para realizar uma experiência personalizada
  • Orgulhosamente, promova as instalações do hotel, procurando oportunidades para melhorar a estadia do hóspede por meio da venda.
Sua Experiência e Habilidades Incluem
  • Personalização e foco no serviço é essencial; experiência na área é um diferencial
  • Experiência anterior com o sistema Opera ou um sistema relacionado
  • Fluência em inglês; idiomas adicionais são um plus
Sua Equipe e Ambiente De Trabalho
  • Em 1 a 2 frases, introduza o ambiente de equipe, hotel ou escritório de uma forma que reflita a cultura

Observação: a personalização pode ser incluída para quaisquer requisitos locais ou legislativos específicos, como permissões de trabalho

Nosso Compromisso Com a Diversidade & Inclusão

Somos uma empresa inclusiva e nossa ambição é atrair, recrutar e promover talentos diversos.

Por que trabalhar para a Accor?

Somos muito mais do que um líder mundial. Sejam bem-vindos como você é e você poderá encontrar um trabalho e uma marca que correspondam à sua personalidade.

Apoiamos você a crescer e aprender todos os dias, garantindo que o trabalho traga um propósito à sua vida, para que, durante sua jornada conosco, você possa continuar a explorar as possibilidades ilimitadas da Accor.

Ao ingressar na Accor, cada capítulo de sua história é sua para escrever e juntos podemos imaginar a hospitalidade de amanhã. Descubra a vida que espera por você na Accor, visite https://careers.accor.com/

Faça o que você ama, cuide do mundo, ouse desafiar o status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: Administrative Assistant, Communications - Hiring Fast
description:
We are looking to hire an energetic Administrative Assistant, Communications to join our high calibre team at APEGA in Edmonton, AB.

Growing your career as a Full Time Administrative Assistant, Communications is an awesome opportunity to develop exceptional skills.

If you are strong in creativity, planning and have the right mindset for the job, then apply for the position of Administrative Assistant, Communications at APEGA today!

APEGA Career Opportunity

Administrative Assistant, Communications

 Full-time, Permanent

Location: Edmonton

Competition #22-20

Want to be part of a team that makes a difference? Come be part of the change.

Since 1920, APEGA has been regulating the practices of engineering and geoscience to serve the public interest in Alberta.

We are looking for energetic individuals who thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and challenging environment. You need to be committed to serving the community with integrity, accountability, and innovation, and have a desire to deliver exceptional service. If you reflect these values, have the knowledge, skills, and abilities to make a difference through your work, and are passionate about acting in the best interest of public safety – then come be a part of our diverse team!

Together we can help shape the present and future practices of professional engineers and geoscientists of Alberta.

Position Summary

Reporting to the Director, Member Engagement & Communications, the Administrative Assistant will write content for the staff intranet, track sponsorship requests, update budget spreadsheets, and oversee the director’s calendar and inbox.

Responsibilities
  • Manage the Director, Member Engagement & Communications’ inbox, on a daily basis, to prioritize requests and tasks, and to respond on behalf of the Director, when appropriate.
  • Manage the Director, Member Engagement & Communications’ meeting requests and calendar.
  • Support the Director, Member Engagement & Communications to oversee the department budget, including invoicing and credit cards, quarterly forecasts, and annual planning.
  • Coordinate department meetings, including organizing room bookings, meeting location logistics, creating meeting agendas and meeting packages, and taking meeting minutes.
  • Gather information, update documents, compile reports and and/or documents.
  • Communicating with other APEGA departments and stakeholders to maintain open lines of communication.
  • Informing department staff of any administrative protocol or policy changes.
  • Responding to department inquiries from APEGA staff and members, escalating as needed.
  • Planning travel arrangements and completing expense invoices, claims, and reimbursements, if requested by department staff.
  • Write intranet (OWL) stories to inform and educate staff and contractors on activities driven by the Communications Department.
  • Be the key Communications contact for OWL and be part of the OWL Governance Committee.
  • Attend key meetings and events across divisions and departments to gather information to write clear, concise copy to share on OWL, such as the Social Committee, Corporate Challenge, and the United Way.
  • Work with the Director, Member Engagement & Communications and the Marketing & Communications Manager to manage sponsorship requests and activations, including correspondence, budget review, staffing booths, and distributing event tickets.
Competencies, Skills & Attributes
  • Competencies: exemplifying integrity, fostering communication, results orientation, service excellence, and teamwork.
  • Functional Competencies: adaptability, attention to detail, digital literacy, initiative and problem solving.
  • Knowledge of communication best practices with experience writing internal communications.
  • Proficient writing and editing skills.
  • Demonstrated high proficiency of computer applications and databases including the use of Microsoft Office Applications.
  • Excellent organization, prioritization, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational, time management and attention to detail skills.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proven ability to work independently as well as in a team setting.
  • Meeting management, minute taking and records management skills.
  • Ability to function with high degree of independence and confidentiality.
Qualifications
  • Post-secondary diploma in related field.
  • 2-3 years’ experience within an administrative role.
  • Communications background is considered an asset.
  • Proficiency in SharePoint considered an asset.
  • This position will work a flexible model that includes 50% of the time in office and 50% from their home office. Employees are required to have a designated confidential workspace at home with quality internet. This flexible work model will be reviewed periodically and updated as needed.
How To Apply

 Closing Date: Until successful candidate is found.

APEGA’s Vaccination policy and protocol is currently suspended requiring agency contractors and staff to be fully vaccinated and required to show proof of vaccination. This policy and protocol may be reinstated at any time in alignment with public health measures.

If you are interested in this position, please submit your cover letter and resume, including your salary expectations, as one pdf document (file name: LastName_FirstName.pdf) to the People Experience Team at peopleexperience@apega.ca.

Please note, each submission needs to clearly indicate the competition number of the position you are applying for. If you are submitting a resume for multiple positions, please ensure you send a separate submission for each competition.

We acknowledge all candidates working in their area of expertise may build their knowledge, skills, and competencies in several ways. We welcome candidates from a breadth of backgrounds, who may have equivalent skills and competencies to the ones listed above. There may be APEGA positions posted that have specific regulatory requirements, and in keeping with those requirements, APEGA will follow the guidelines that we are bound by. All candidates are considered with the objective to enhance APEGA's people and culture.

Thank you for your interest in APEGA.

Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Competitive salary
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Front Desk Clerk - Urgent Position
description:
We are searching for an expert Front Desk Clerk to join our amazing team at KSAN SOCIETY in Terrace, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time Front Desk Clerk is an amazing opportunity to develop competitive skills.

If you are strong in creativity, persuasion and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Front Desk Clerk at KSAN SOCIETY today!

KSAN SOCIETY

Job Title Front Desk Clerk, Supportive Housing Program

Job Summary Provides a variety of reception and general clerical assistance in an office.

Maintains various records, files and related filing systems.

Effective Date September 2018

Last Updated

Reports to Manager, Supportive Housing Program

Classification/Grid/ Administrative Assistant 1, Grid 5, BCGEU

Union
  • Greets clients/suppliers/visitors to the building in a professional and friendly
Key Duties and manner.

Responsibilities
  • Answers phone and/or in person inquiries and routes to appropriate staff
members as required. Responds to routine queries with regard to the

organization and services provided.
  • Assists with client intake by obtaining basic information, assisting in completing
forms, and booking appointments with staff in accordance with established

guidelines.
  • Sorts and distributes incoming mail and processed outgoing mail/deliveries.
  • Distributes and posts printed information for clients, families, staff and others.
  • Prepares, updates, and prints program brochures. Ensures supplies of up-to-date
handouts and resource materials are available.
  • Maintains filing systems, including referrals, as well other records. Performs
general data entry functions such as inputting client information into

computerized systems. Backs up electronic files and assists other staff to back

up computers as per established guidelines.
  • Performs general word processing and typing from rough draft or general
instruction, including correspondence, reports, forms, and documents. Drafts

routine correspondence such as thank you letters, client appointment letters

and internal memoranda.
  • Ensures confidentiality of all client related information and Ksan business.
  • Operates a variety of office equipment such as computers, printers, & copiers
and coordinates maintenance of same.
  • Monitors, orders, and receives office supplies and janitorial supplies with
approval.
  • Ensures that front desk, general office area, photocopy room, meeting room,
front foyer, kitchen, and other areas are maintained in a clean and tidy manner.

Keeps aisles and fire exits clear of clutter.
  • Assists volunteers with general office questions and refers to appropriate staff
when needed.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
Ksan Society | Front Desk Clerk, Supportive Housing Program, Job Description 1

Qualifications Grade 12, and six (6) months recent related experience.

Or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Clear Criminal record is required.

Skills and Abilities
  • Ability to produce professional written documents and handle correspondence.
  • Ability to work effectively as a team player.
  • Good organizational, time, and general management skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal behaviour, communication, and computer skills.
Ksan Society | Front Desk Clerk, Supportive Housing Program, Job Description 2

Company Benefits
  • Company offers great benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Competitive salary

description:

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.

If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

title: Operations Assistant
description:
• Hours of Work: Fulltime Hourly 8:00AM – 4:30PM Mon-Fri

• Wage: Competitive market rate based on experience

• Benefits: Health, Dental, Company matching RRSP after 3 month probation

• Immediate start available

• Reporting to Plant Manager and Customer Service Manager


The role of the Operations Support includes, but are not limited to:

• Receive documents from warehouse and enter to spreadsheets with accuracy; scan and email to customer

• Enter physical inventories weekly

• Scan order, receiving, and inspection documents to file

• Assist in creation of purchase requisitions

• From email or phone, create orders and batch tickets

• Print orders, batch tickets, labels, and SDSs and send to warehouse

• Review shipped orders and scan to file for invoicing.

• Answer phones

• Maybe required to assist in yard or warehouse so must be comfortable using personal protective equipment


Experience and Qualifications:

• High school diploma

• Intermediate proficiency in Excel, Word, and PDF suites

• Excellent attention to detail; demonstrated ability for accuracy, timeliness, and completeness in information processing

• Ability to manage high volumes during peak times

• Excellent communication skills both oral and written

• Customer Service experience preferred

• Experience navigating Chempax or ERP systems considered an asset

title: Administrative Specialist
description:
Miipe is a dynamic organization that fosters creativity and growth. We offer opportunities to learn and challenge yourself in a fast paced software consulting firm, working alongside large Fortune 500 clients in a myriad of industries, such as banking, telecommunications, insurance, utilities and technology.

 

As a leader in our field, we are rapidly growing and looking for bright and talented individuals to join our team. In addition to working with great people in a supportive work culture, we offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, and a company culture that values each member and encourages professional growth and development.

 

If you are interested in working for an innovative and dynamic organization, then Miipe is the right place for you!

 

We are currently seeking for an Administrative Coordinator to join our team.


Job Responsibilities:


·        Support Sr. Administrator

·        Perform general office duties including, but not limited to: typing and formatting correspondence and meeting minutes, use of company templates and ability to customize if needed, maintaining electronic logs, organizing/maintaining office files, scanning and copying, processing and preparing mail and packages for shipment

·        Book travel arrangements for all company travelers

·        Proactively coordinate company events

·        Draft and review emails, presentations, and marketing material in support of the leadership team

·        Onboarding new contracted resources including overseeing proper documentation receipt

·        Preparing contracts

·        Tracking expiries, changes and updates to insurance and contracts and pursue renewals

·        Oversee equipment return

·        Equipment Inventory tracking

·        Manage company’s subscriptions

·        Ensure office is clean, stocked, and tidy

·        Managing and purchasing snacks, and other purchases as needed

·        Health and Safety – prepare documentation, schedule and participate in meetings

·        Perform additional duties as needed

·        General administration duties involving the preparation of documents, spreadsheets and forms

·        Schedule and plan meetings and appointments

·        Monitor level of supplies and handle shortages

·        And other ad hoc projects or tasks as assigned

Qualifications:

·        Bachelor degree in administration

·        3- 5 years of experience required

·        Intermediate Excel knowledge is a must

·        Some knowledge of sourcing techniques

·        Excellent verbal and written communication skills

·        Valid Driver's License

·        Must be able to multi-task

·        Excellent attention to details

·        Excellent time managements skills

  • Must live in GTA area

 

 How to Apply:

 

Please send your resume in confidence through LinkedIn.

 

Due to high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Applications will not be acknowledged in writing.

 

Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, initial interviews will be conducted via video conferencing.

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Miipe strives to ensure that all recruiting processes are non-discriminatory and barrier-free. If you require any accommodation, please advise the Recruiter in advance of attending the interview.

At Miipe, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Miipe is committed to having accessible recruitment practices for all of our job candidates. Miipe is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. If you require accommodation at any stage throughout the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Take recycling to a global scale.

Join us in our mission to recycle more than 3 000 000 tons of metal every year across the globe. At AIM Recycling, we recycle metals to the maximum of their capacity. For more than 80 years, we have been uniting our strengths to make a positive difference. Join our team to contribute to our company’s growth and to support our recycling activities in North America.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description

Reporting to the Vice President of Operations, the Executive Assistant role at AIM provides administrative support to key leaders, manages travel and entertainment resources, and performs other office managerial functions as required.

Administrative support to key leaders
  • Prepares correspondence, memos, and takes meeting notes as required
  • Manages calendars for key leaders, including scheduling meetings with clients and other visitors
  • Distributes mail, and answers and phone calls
  • May be required to conduct research on certain managerial items

Travel and entertainment resource management
  • Makes travel and accommodation arrangements for management team
  • Completes and submits management team expense reports
  • Plans entertainment for clients
  • Plans and manages the use of business assets (condos, fishing camps, etc.)
  • May plan and schedule employee activities and events

Office Management
  • Keeps offices organized (e.g., archiving, filing, etc.)
  • Manages office supplies, ensuring sufficient quantity is on hand
  • Maintains files
  • May oversee other office staff

Other Duties As Required

Qualifications
  • College Diploma, or High School Diploma with relevant experience
  • Minimum of five (3) years of relevant experience in a similar role
  • Professional level communication skills
  • Excellent computer skills with an in-depth knowledge of all Microsoft 365 programs (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint)

Dedicated/hardworking: able to treat work as a top priority; oriented towards execution and solution finding

Customer service oriented: able to anticipate and react to customer needs; eager to provide unparalleled service with a positive attitude

Organized: able to keep multiple projects running at the same time; able to meet deadlines

Autonomous: able to operate with minimal steering

Trustworthy: can anticipate risks and ensure their management; actively seek solutions to potential problems

Professional/Discreet: understands the importance of maintaining confidentiality and limiting information to only those people who need to know it

Courageous/Resilient: Able to tolerate stress and ambiguity; ability to ask questions and participate in decisions

Flexible: available to work outside normal working hours as needed

Additional Information
  • Additional Information
  • Group benefits like insurance and RRSP
  • Competitive salaries commensurate with experience and qualifications
  • Additional training and uniform
  • Great working environment
  • Overtime opportunities
  • HEALTH AND SAFETY
  • Must work in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulation and follow in accordance with AIM’s Health and Safety policies and procedures
  • Responsible for reporting all accidents, illnesses, or ‘near miss’ incidents to management
  • HOURS OF WORK
  • Permanent and full-time position
  • Able to work extended hours/weekends when deemed necessary

title: Administrative Assistant (Amazon)
description:
We are looking for a responsible Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Duties of the Administrative Assistant include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs and managing our company’s general administrative activities. Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The ideal candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment. If you have previous experience as a Secretary or Executive administrative assistant and familiarity within our industry, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, a successful Admin Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of our office.

These Benefits Include
  • Medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage.
  • 401(k) savings plan.
  • Paid time-off and Holiday overtime pay.
  • Resources to help improve your overall well-being.
  • Discounts on Amazon purchases.

title: Temp Office Admin
description:
Golin is looking for an Administrative assistant to assist in managing our day-to-day support and finance requirements.

If you haven’t met Golin, we’re a global PR and digital agency reinventing our industry. Every. Single. Day. Yet we still make time to create award-winning client work and have fun while we’re doing it. Our CEO describes us as, “nice guys who kick @$$” and we’re happy to have earned that reputation thanks to a dynamic team, strong clients and an obsession with shaking up the status quo

Our expertise ranges from brand-building and cutting-edge digital content, to corporate reputation, wellness and healthcare advocacy and measurement. Golin aligns earned-first, data-driven creative with the customer journey through our collaborative G4 Model to deliver maximum impact for clients. Our roster includes many of the largest CPG, retail, food, healthcare technology and consumer service companies in the world.

Recently named PR Week's 2021 Global Agency of the Year and winner of a 2019 Gold Cannes Lion, we tend to Go All In, in everything we do. We’re especially committed to going all in for our people by offering our LifeTime benefits program. LifeTime offers unlimited time off, enhanced family care, generous health and wellness benefits, the ability to work remotely and a monthly LifeTime stipend for the gym or hobbies. Our culture is built around happy people who are the best at what we do!

Sound like you want to “Go All In” with us? Here are the details:

Reliability, detail, excellent organizational skills and accuracy are important qualifications for this position, as well as good customer relations and the ability to communicate clearly.

The ideal candidate for this position is a skilled multi-tasker and committed to consistently meeting deadlines.

Responsibilities
  • Balance and maintain accurate ledgers working with our finance team
  • Track vendor invoices and liaise with finance department on the creation and management of Purchase Orders to ensure timely vendor payments
  • Managing vendor agreements, onboarding new vendors and managing vendor relationships
  • Coordinate legal review and approval of contracts, NDAs, permission forms
  • Manage agency reservation system (hot-desk work arrangements)
  • Provide administrative support to senior leadership such as expenses, coordinating appointments and staff functions, working with workplace suppliers (Aramark, Staples)
  • Ordering and managing office supplies
  • Completing documents and forms
  • Monitoring and managing all office expenses
  • Organizing client meetings including travel, catering and printing

Please disclose any additional skill sets such as copywriting and editing, graphic design, social media management, bilingual (French/ English), experience working with general ledger systems as these will be considered assets.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule
  • 37.5 to 44 hours per week (OT pay provided for anything over and above)
  • Monday to Friday, 9AM to 5PM (EST)
  • Some work outside of these hours may be required from time to time

Education
  • Secondary School (required)

Experience
  • administrative assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • receptionist: 1 year (preferred)

Hybrid Work
  • Part-time hybrid; some in-person workplace responsibilities will commence

Perks of Working at Golin
  • ‘Unlimited vacation’ and a ‘work from anywhere’ policy
  • Full benefits package (health, drugs, vision and dental)
  • Health and Wellbeing allowance per month - we actively encourage you to seek experiences that will enhance your creative spirit and mind
  • Monthly technology allowance
  • Professional development services to support you on your career journey at Golin
  • Convenient King Street East location (Globe and Mail Centre) with regular shuttle from Union Station
  • Opportunity to work with a growing and entrepreneurial company
  • Progressive, positive and inclusive culture connected to a vibrant global network

Golin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. DeVries recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.

We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com . This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Office Coordinator, Toronto ON, Full Time

This role is an in-office role with Covid Safety Protocol in place.

Simply Group’s Office Administrator is the first point of contact for all our employees, vendors, customers and everyone who walks through Simply’s doors. They are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the office, and for creating the desired office culture built on our core values. The office coordinator brings a level of energy and at the same time order to the office environment, and pitches in wherever they can. They own their role and are the go-to resource for all office related matters. They are proud of and accountable for the office’s efficient function and the experience had by all who spend time with us.

What’s In It For You?:
  • Competitive Compensation Structure.
  • Full time hours, flexible shifts.
  • A rewarding role with rapid growth and leadership opportunities.
  • Opportunities to give back to our community through Simply Cares charitable foundation. Our charitable partners include, but are not limited to:
    • Georgetown Bread Basket
    • Covenant House
    • United Way (Halton and Hamilton)
    • Support and Housing (Halton Hills)
Reception Duties:
  • Responsible for timely and efficient incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail, packages and other items requiring shipping and receiving. Ensure mail is routed to appropriate internal departments.
  • Greet and direct walk-in customers, partners, couriers, and vendors in alignment with Simply’s customer service standards. Ensure proper security and confidentiality measures are taken when working with external stakeholders.
  • Leverage the reception area and role as a vehicle to impart Simply’s culture, including maintaining cleanliness standards, fostering an appropriate atmosphere, maintaining materials and information, and connecting with our team.

Office Management:
  • Be the go-to resource for all office related matters and own the resolution and outcome of any changes, issues, or conflicts.
  • Establish, communicate, and enforce appropriate office policy and procedure, including operations, process, health and safety, cleanliness, usage and cultural drivers.
  • Act as first point of contact for employee requests and resolve within required timeframe, and direct employees as appropriate.
  • Own and successfully relationship with building and parking management and any other office related partner.
  • Ensure efficient use and operation of shared spaces, including kitchen, boardrooms, copy rooms, storage rooms. This includes appropriate configuration and layout, maintenance of equipment, supplies and cleanliness.
  • Mediate any conflict around shared space usage and occupancy, problem solve for solutions.
  • Own and maintain relationships with vendors as required including marketing material suppliers, office supply providers, equipment/maintenance providers.

HR Responsibilities:
  • Support planning and execution of office culture touch points, like team building activities, team lunches, special events and special projects.
  • Support onboarding new employees into the office through scheduling and being first point of contact.
  • Provide support to admin team by backing up HR Coordinator or executive assistant, and support on special projects as required.

Required Experience:
  • A minimum of 1 year experience as an Office Coordinator is required.
  • A minimum of 1 year receptionist experience is required.
  • Post-Secondary education business administration or equivalent field of study is required.

Skills Required:
  • Exceptional attention to detail skills, with the passion to put in the work in to ensure satisfaction and efficiency.
  • Proven written and oral communication skills, including one on one, in a group and at all levels of an organization.
  • Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate difficult situations.
  • Drive to go above and beyond the call of duty to see success in all tasks.
  • Eager to take on all challenges and see assigned tasks as an opportunity to succeed.
  • Excellent organizational skills to be able to multi-task and ensure nothing is missed.

Simply Group is a family of companies sharing common values, interests, and practices to deliver energy-efficient residential and commercial solutions, so Canadians never have to sacrifice comfort or quality for essential services. With steady year-over-year growth and over $1.45 billion in rental assets, Simply Group is one of Canada's leaders in whole-home comfort. Our team of more than 400 employees takes an innovative approach to offer a comprehensive source of solutions that improve the status quo for ourselves, our communities, and our clients. We are committed to making things better for everyone and advancing the careers of all our employees.

Simply Group serves customers across Canada through multiple brands. Our companies are divided into five categories: home comfort, lending, lighting, new construction, and green living. We are proud to be Great Place to Work-Certified for six straight years and winner of the 2019 Best Business of the Year award from the National CanadianSME Business Awards. Join us on our path to success!

All candidates will be considered, however only qualified candidates will be contacted. Simply Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Simply Group is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Team will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process.

SGNonSales

title: Remote Data Entry Clerk Work From Home
description:
Position: Data Entry Clerk Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Data entry clerk experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are a data entry clerk or someone just looking for a flexible part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Receptionist Administrative Assistant
description:
Administration Duties Include
  • Following up with clients
  • Filing, scanning and data input
  • Addressing client inquiries regarding their application
  • Various reception duties
  • Customer service
Requirements
  • Perfect English is a must
  • Ability to communicate professionally via email and over the telephone
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (specifically Outlook, Excel and Work) Intermediate level
  • Good time management skills

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Miles HR has an opportunity for an Administrative Assistant to join a downtown Vancouver financial institution for a 6 month contract. This position is be suited to the candidate who has experience working in a banking or credit union setting verifying transactions and all associated paperwork.

About the Role:
  • Verify transactions and all associated paperwork
  • Physical receipt and delivery of certificates
  • Processing and new issue of private placements
  • Stock transfers
  • Control of safe deposit boxes
  • Obtain documentation to negotiate securities, messenger duties and reports
  • Processing securities for deposit
  • Assisting clients at the securities counter

About You:
  • Bachelor Degree or Diploma with a focus on Accounting or Finance an asset
  • Minimum 6 months administrative experience in a bank or credit union
  • Proven ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines
  • Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
  • Strong ability to operate in a fast paced, multi-tasking environment
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Self-motivated team player

If you are interested in the 6 month contract Administrative Assistant role please apply here now! This position starts immediately.

title: Reception Agent
description:
Resepsiyon Görevlisi

Bİlk izlenimler en önemli detaydır! Resepsiyon görevlisi olarak, konuklara geldikleri andan itibaren unutulmaz bir deneyim yaşamalarını sağlayarak onlara yardımcı olacaksınız.

Sizin için ne gibi faydalar var?
  • 3-4 nokta ile yan ödemelerle bizimle çalışmanın avantajlarını yakalayın.
  • Dünya çapında Accor'te indirimli fiyatlar sunun ve çalışanlara sağlanan karta sahip olun.
  • Akademilerimizin düzenlediği eğitim programlarıyla kendinizi geliştirme fırsatı kazanın.
Yeteneğinizi geliştirerek çalıştığınız otelde ve dünyada kendinizi geösterme şansına sahip olun.

Toplumda, kurumsal sosyal sorumluluk projelerimiz ile (Planet21 gibi) fark yaratabilme olanağınız olsun.

Ne Yapıcaksınız
  • Misafirlerin isteklerine anında cevap verin..
  • Kişiye özel bir deneyim için insiyatif alın.
  • Çalıştığınız yeri gururla temsil edin ve misafirlerin konaklama süresini arttırmak için fırsatlar arayın.
Tecrübeleriniz Ve Becerileriniz
  • Hizmet odaklı kişilik esastır.
  • Opera veya ilgili sistemlerde deneyim..
  • Akıcı İngilizce ve ayrıca bir yabancı dil.
Ekibiniz Ve Çalışma Ortamınız
  • 1-2 cümle ile: Ekibi, çalıştığınız yeri veya ofisinizi kültürü yansıtacak şekilde tanıtmaya özen gösterin.

Not: Çalışma izinleri gibi belirli yerel veya yasal gereklilikler için özelleştirme dahil edilebilir.

Çeşitliliğe ve Birlikteliğe olan bağlılığımız:

Herkesi kucaklayan bir şirket olarak hedefimiz farklı yeteneklerin bizimle çalışmasını sağlamak, işe almak ve tanıtmaktır.

Niçin Accor'da çalışmalıyız?

Biz bir dünya liderinden daha fazlasıyız. Sizi olduğunuz gibi kabul ediyoruz ve kişiliğinize uygun iş ve markada iş bulabileceğinizi taahhüt ediyoruz. Her gün gelişmeniz ve öğrenmeniz için sizi destekliyoruz, işinizin hayatınıza bir amaç getirdiğine inanıyoruz ve bu sayede bizimle olan seyahatinizde Accor'un limitsiz olanaklarını keşfetmeye devam edeceğinize inanıyoruz. Accor'a katılarak, hikayenizin her bir kısmını sizin yazmanıza olanak sağlıyoruz ve geleceğin hizmet anlayışını beraber hayal ediyoruz. Accor'da sizi bekleyen hayatı keşfetmek için, https://careers.accor.com/'u ziyaret edin.

Sevdiğiniz işi yapın dünyayı önemseyin ve statükoya meydan okuyun! #BELIMITLESS

22010170

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant

To the Chief Administrative Officer & Council


The Job

The Town of Edson is seeking an experienced, professional, and competent individual for the Executive Assistant position.


Under the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO), the Executive Assistant is responsible for providing administrative support to the CAO, Mayor, and Council. Organizational skills, conscientiousness, political sensitivity, and professionalism are fundamental in delivering exceptional service to internal and external stakeholders.


The Candidate

This person must possess a high degree of personal initiative, organizational skills, integrity, professionalism, and political sensitivity. They must thrive in a fast-paced environment characterized by unexpected pivots that require a person to think on their feet. They must be skilled, courteous, meticulously organized, and highly resilient.


In addition to the above, the right candidate will possess:

- A post-secondary certificate in office administration, public administration, or related field, and

- Three to five years of related experience, preferably in a municipal setting.


Compensation

The wage range for this position currently sits at $60,000-$72,500 per year. Candidate placement within the range during the first six months on the job is dependent on experience, available budget, and internal equity.


How do you apply?

Please send us a resume and a cover letter not exceeding one page in length by 4:00 pm, May 20, 2022. Please tell us who you are, what you value, and why you think this position is a good fit for you in that cover letter. If you plan to relocate for this position, please clearly indicate this.


Please send your cover letter and resume to:

Email: humanresources@edson.ca

Be sure to quote Competition Number: EDSOM-202207

Closing Date: May 20, 2022

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)

  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only

  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.

This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Bilingual Administrative and Records Clerk
description:
Position: Bilingual Administrative and Records Clerk

Location: Toronto

Salary: $50,000 per year

Job Type: Permanent

Shift: Day


A prestigious company located in downtown Toronto is currently seeking a highly motivated Bilingual (French) Administrative and Records Clerk. You will assist the Director of Human Resources and Office Services with a wide variety of clerical, data entry, and document scanning tasks. They offer excellent benefits, including pension and 4 weeks of vacation to start.


Responsibilities:


- Operate photocopier, collate, and bind audit reports

- Operate and effectively control audit files by logging all files and storage boxes on the computer and transferring (retrieving) files

- Process incoming mail and faxes, including sorting into delivery locations or other predetermined categories, log registered mail, route mail, and faxes to sections within the office

- Process outgoing mail, including, sort, weigh, meter, bag for delivery to the other ministries, facilities, and Canada Post

- Maintain inventory controls of items such as audit bags, calculators, binder, and stationery, ensuring that adequate stock of stationery and supplies is maintained

- Purchase all office stationery and supplies on authorization of the Supervisor and receiving shipments thereof, matching invoices to merchandise

- Act as primary backup for Receptionist, open up reception in the morning, and provide relief for breaks and lunch

- Provide other support such as arranging coffee and or catering requests for office meetings


What you will need to qualify in this role:

- Post-secondary education in Office Administration is mandatory

- 3 to 5 years of demonstrated years of experience in an office support role

- Bilingualism in English and French is a must

- Advanced knowledge of all Microsoft Office Suite programs, in particular Excel and Word

- Excellent oral and written communication skills, with outstanding customer service and interpersonal skills

- Ability to be flexible and work under pressure in a fast-paced setting and have very good time management abilities

- Demonstrative ability to take initiative, prioritize, and be highly detailed-oriented


Don't wait! Please apply immediately by emailing your resume in Word format to Chandra DuQuesnay at cduquesnay@quantum.ca.

Please apply immediately by emailing your resume in Word format to Chandra DuQuesnay at cduquesnay@quantum.ca.", '- Operate and effectively control audit files by logging all files and storage boxes on the computer and transferring (retrieving) files', '- Provide other support such as arranging coffee and or catering requests for office meetings', 'A prestigious company located in downtown Toronto is currently seeking a highly motivated Bilingual (French) Administrative and Records Clerk. They offer excellent benefits, including pension and 4 weeks of vacation to start.']

title: Office Assistant
description:
For more than 20 years Global Relay has set the standard and trends in compliant communications with our multi-award winning unified communications, data capture, and data analysis platform. We securely capture and manage the world’s communications data and give its owners greater control and visibility to drive value and ensure compliance with the regulatory requirements of a large variety of industries and authorities.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other typical things you expect, but we are not your typical company. Global Relay is a career-making company. It is a place for big ideas, new challenges, and cutting-edge innovation. It is a place where you can make an impact.

Your Role:

We’re looking for an energetic, detail-oriented individual with superb customer service skills to join our growing administration team. As an Office Assistant you will provide comprehensive administrative support to the daily processes and business operations of our fast-paced organization.

The role requires a resourceful individual who is energetic, adaptable, logical, tech-savvy, and works well independently but thrives in a team environment; someone who enjoys learning, building relationships, and possesses good business acumen.

The role may require you to work on statutory holidays.

Are you up for the challenge?

Your Job:

  • Ensure that visitors/clients are greeted and directed appropriately upon arrival, and adhere to office security procedures upon check-in
  • Maintain office appearance and cleanliness; provide assistance and support for Global Relay team members in daily operations including the cleaning and organizing of meeting rooms, supply stations, the lounge and cafeteria
  • Liaise with office janitorial and building maintenance for facility cleaning and repair
  • Manage office supplies and equipment, including supplies inventory, ordering and distribution; invoice reconciliation
  • Order and set up catering for client meetings
  • Perform office tasks such as handling a high volume telephone switchboard, calendar management, data entry, filing, generate reports and presentations and mail distribution
  • Perform administrative duties in Salesforce CRM software and other software systems such as data entry, client file updates, and ensuring data accuracy
  • Compose external correspondence to Global Relay customers and Partners
  • Support various departments in coordinating meeting and training schedules, circulating agendas and training materials
  • Various job-related duties as projects arise, such as event management

About You:

  • Diploma/certificate in Office Administration, or relevant work experience
  • Ability to speak and write English fluently and possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills with excellent telephone etiquette
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint & Outlook)
  • Exceptional time-management, organizational, and prioritizing skills with great attention to detail
  • Strong work ethic with a willingness to multi-task and be flexible to take on varied responsibilities
  • Ability and maturity to exercise tact and discretion, and can be entrusted with confidential information
  • Good judgment to proactively and independently solve problems and make sound decisions
  • Goal oriented self-starter who can work independently and reliably with minimal supervision and has an appetite for continuous learning
  • Comfortable working under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven ability to handle challenging situations with integrity, empathy and sincerity
  • A friendly, “can-do” attitude and customer focused approach

Please note: Submitting a cover letter in addition to your resume is highly encouraged for this role.

About Us:

At Global Relay there is no ceiling. This is the land of opportunity for the energetic, intelligent, and driven people that make this company great. The combination of the right people in the right positions and a rapidly growing company means unlimited career potential.

You will receive the mentoring, coaching, and support that you need to reach your personal and career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that promotes and rewards hard work and creativity and will grow into the new opportunities that are available to you.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Administrative Assistant (Amazon)
description:
We are looking for a responsible Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. Duties of the Administrative Assistant include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs and managing our company’s general administrative activities. Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The ideal candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment. If you have previous experience as a Secretary or Executive administrative assistant and familiarity within our industry, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, a successful Admin Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of our office.

These Benefits Include
  • Medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage.
  • 401(k) savings plan.
  • Paid time-off and Holiday overtime pay.
  • Resources to help improve your overall well-being.
  • Discounts on Amazon purchases.

title: Intervenant(e)
description: En tant qu’intervenant(e), tu travailleras en interventions de groupes et individuelles, tu participeras à la concertation clinique et tu représenteras l’organisme sur le territoire de la Mauricie et du Centre-du-Québec. Tu seras amené à travailler sur différents projets en lien avec l’intervention auprès de la clientèle masculine, plus précisément sur les agressions sexuelles vécues par celle-ci. Tu participeras au développement d’Emphase sur le territoire, plus précisément au Centre-du-Québec.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

title: Medical Office Assistant
description:
Medical Office Assistant


This position guarantees 20 hrs/week. Salary starts at $18 per hr and increases depending on individual skills, experience and qualifications. There is the possibility of transition to full-time hours.

Our clinic is driven by advanced knowledge of Medicine and exceptional service. We love what we do and are excited about the positive impact we can have on peoples lives. We are looking for someone who is motivated, friendly and has a positive personality. Someone who enjoys working independently and in a team-based environment. Professionalism, confidentiality, and a high degree of customer service is required. Growth, knowledge, and ongoing learning will be expected and encouraged.


Responsibilities


Open the office daily and start up computer systems. Secure office at the end of the day.

Answer phones in a pleasant and courteous manner.

Greet and register patients on arrival, review their demographic info and health card info

Room patients 

Work with EMR system (will provide training).

Administrative duties such as filing, data entry, relaying messages, scanning, copying, faxing

Perform simple qualitative clinical test eg. Preg tests, strep tests, light cleaning duties

Measure and record weights, heights, Blood Pressure, temperatures 

Maintain organization of the wait room, exam rooms and reception areas

Perform regular inventory of clinic supplies

Regularly clear voicemail and update outgoing voicemail message recording

Schedule and manage patient’s appointments

Provide support to other members of staff as needed

Answer emails, voice mails and text messages as needed

Able to create and update Word documents/ spreadsheets

Ensure organization and efficiency of day-to-day functioning of the clinic

Flexible availability including some evenings and weekends


Required Qualities 

o Excellent communication, computer and people skills

o Detail-oriented, efficient, organised, professional.

o Able to multi-task and keep calm under pressure

o Positive, friendly, outgoing personality

o Candidate should be willing to learn, good at problem-solving and thinking quickly

o Requires excellent reading, and speaking skills in English


Education

o Secondary school education a must

o MOA diploma is preferred but not mandatory 

o Medical office/ Medical Admin/ Medical Billing/ Medical terminology Certificate Courses would be useful and considered in negotiating pay


Experience

o 1 year medical office experience a benefit. Familiarity and comfort with Telus PS EMR preferred

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Located in the absolute centre of downtown in the vibrant Halifax Waterfront, in the heart of the new Queen’s Marque district, Muir offers elevated hospitality inspired by the spirit, culture and natural beauty of Nova Scotia. In each of our departments, our team shares a common goal – providing an exceptional customer experience in a clean, comfortable environment. If you are passionate about a career in hospitality and want to join a team that shares this common goal, the Muir is presently seeking an Administrative Assistant.


This is a Full-Time, Temporary (3 month) position.


Reporting to the General Manager, the Administrative Assistant will provide a vital support role to the hotel leadership team with a strong focus on supporting the Sales Team in achieving revenue and sales activity goals.


The Administrative Assistant will exhibit high standards, excellent communication skills, and have an ability to take initiative, and prioritize daily tasks. A strong ability to take charge and meet tight deadlines will ensure your success in this multi-faceted role.


As the ideal candidate you have experience in a professional setting supporting multiple team members, preferably in the hospitality industry. Your experience is complemented by your excellent communication and customer service skills, and exemplary attention to detail. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with minimum supervision as a self-starter. Advanced skills in the Microsoft Office suite is considered an asset, as is experience with Marriott’s CI/TY sales system.


The opportunity to join Halifax’s first five-star hotel at its very beginning is an exciting one as you will be introducing the local market to an entirely new luxury experience. You will be rewarded every day by the respect of your peers, achievements of your team and satisfaction of Muir’s clients and guests.


If you are looking for an opportunity to showcase your talents and be part of something truly exceptional, please submit your cover letter and resume.

Only those candidates with existing authorization to work in Canada will be considered.

Muir is an equal opportunity employer. While we thank all applicants only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant, Full-Time (32hrs)


The Program

WJS contracts with governments across Canada to provide community-based services to children and families, persons with developmental disabilities, and young offenders. The continuum of services offered by WJS is designed to foster positive life changes and increase self-esteem and confidence.


WJS is one of the only private, national social service agencies in Canada. With approximately 125 services delivered across British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario through more than 90 government contracts. Its 600+ dedicated staff, serve approximately 1,300 persons across Canada every day, offering individualized programs through a balance of education, training, life skills and culturally appropriate recreation and leisure activities with structured cognitive-behavioural interventions and a high degree of family and community involvement.


The Position

Working in a busy central administrative office in Maple Ridge, the Administrative Assistant performs administrative support duties for various departments including Human Resources and Accounting, requiring a range of skills and knowledge of organizational policies and procedures. Deadlines may be stressful at times.


Weekly Scheduling:

• One (1) permanent full-time position of 32 hours per week*

• Weekly schedule of Monday through Friday days (i.e. 0830-1630 Mon-Thur or Tues-Fri); schedule to be confirmed at time of interview/hire.

• Collaboration / coordination of this position's tasks/duties/scheduling will be required, as this position works hand-in-hand with one other individual in the same role.

• This is NOT a work from home (WFH) position; it is office based in Maple Ridge, BC.


*Potential for weekly hours to increase, based upon the needs of the business, to a maximum of 40 hours per week.


Hourly wage subject to discussion, based upon skills and related experience to the position.


***Interviews may be conducted via web-based/online resources.***


In Your Role You Will

• Prepare, compose, edit and proofread documents, correspondence, reports and proposals from notes, verbal direction, or knowledge of established policies.

• Greet visitors, ascertain the nature of business and direct visitors to the appropriate person.

• Record and prepare minutes of meetings; by transcribing, composing, typing, editing, and distributing agendas and/or minutes of meetings.

• Relay and resolve administrative problems, telephone and/or walk-up enquiries.

• Schedule/coordinate meetings, events, interviews, appointments, travel and lodging arrangements, etc. for management.

• Prepare or assist with the preparation of scheduled and/or ad hoc statistical and narrative reports.

• Perform basic information gathering and analysis and/or forecasting, as specifically directed.

• Develop/maintain data, and perform routine analyses and calculations for recurring internal reports.

• Assist in problem-solving, project planning, and development and execution of stated goals and objectives.

• Establish, maintain, and update files, databases, records, and/or other documents.

• Order supplies, printing, maintenance, and other services, as required.

• Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.


Criminal Record Check/Ministry Check Statement

*** Prior to confirmation of employment all applicants must provide a current (dated within 6 months of hiring date) Criminal Record Check and Ministry Check. These checks can take up to 6 weeks to obtain, please ensure you prepare accordingly.


As An Ideal Candidate You Possess

• Minimum high school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED) with a specialized admin support program.

• Minimum of 3 years of experience directly related to the specified duties and responsibilities.


Other Requirements / Competencies:

• Skilled in the use of computers and related applications, including using Office 365 and SharePoint to create complicated documents and reports; willing to learn and adapt to new software.

• Familiar with computer-based group conference processes (ie. Zoom, Teams)

• Ability to re-prioritize and adjust to interruptions and changing requirements.

• Ability to comprehend information and communication effectively both orally and in writing, including business communications.

• Ability to understand and follow specific instructions and procedures and use a problem-solving approach.

• Knowledge of supplies, equipment, and/or services ordering and inventory control.

• Ability to gather data, compile information, and prepare reports.

• Ability to gather and analyze statistical data and generate reports.

• Records maintenance and database management skills.

• Ability to analyze and solve problems.

• Ability to make administrative/procedural decisions and judgments.

• Ability to create, compose, and edit written materials.

• Organizing and coordinating skills.

• Ability to record and transcribe meeting minutes.


What WJS Canada does

WJS Canada's mission is 'We serve individuals and families with high quality, personalized, and culturally responsive support'. The support we provide for families, emphasizes building relationships to enhance the family's strengths and achieve goals that address their needs for support in areas of struggle. Services are individualized and based on the family's belief that their own internal resources can be strengthened and that other helpful skills can be developed. For more information on WJS, services and career opportunities, visit www.wjscanada.com


While WJS serves individuals in many communities across Canada, this opportunity will be based in Maple Ridge BC. Situated on the southern coast of British Columbia, Maple Ridge offers outstanding scenery, amazing diversity and extensive culture; all within a mild climate. It is an area rich with eco-adventures and personality. Amenities include international cuisine, boutique shopping, community festivals, a variety of eco-tourism, along with the natural beauty of the area, suitable for individuals of every age.


Our Employees Enjoy

At WJS Canada, trust, strong connections, innovation and results are the pillars of our mandate. We manage by developing our core strength: our people. We give employees the tools to do the job, developing their competence and their confidence, by conducting training programs to ensure professional development and build skills, employee morale, employee safety, health, loyalty and satisfaction. Developing people includes respecting employees work-life balance through flexible hours, locations and duties. We support our staff with assistance and benefit packages, innovative wellness programs and compassion for the life challenges they face.


Website reference

For more information on WJS Canada visit our website: www.wjscanada.com


Closing Statement

We recognize that equity diversity and inclusion (EDI) is an important element in our work and in our day to day lives.


  • No telephone calls please. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be notified.

title: 009 - Theatrical Tour Guide
description:
Company: Ghost Tours of Quebec

Job Title: Part-time Theatrical Tour Guide

Description

Indulge your theatrical side by purveying the darker side of Quebec history to adults and youth alike. Adorn a top hat and wield a lantern as you meander the cobblestone streets of Old Quebec at night while having a frighteningly fun time!

Candidates will be required to memorize a substantial script. Mastery of French is not required but helpful.

How To Apply

Please send your CV along with a cover letter to info@ghostfantome.com.

Potential candidates will be provided with a text to memorize for the audition.

title: administrative assistant - Urgent Position
description:
We are hiring a brilliant administrative assistant to join our dynamic team at KBS Painting Ltd. in Surrey, BC.

Growing your career as a Full Time administrative assistant is a terrific opportunity to develop useful skills.

If you are strong in cooperation, planning and have the right drive for the job, then apply for the position of administrative assistant at KBS Painting Ltd. today!

Specific Skills
  • Type and proofread correspondence, forms and other documents
  • Schedule and confirm appointments
  • Greet people and direct them to contacts or service areas
  • Determine and establish office procedures and routines
  • Arrange and co-ordinate seminars, conferences, etc.
  • Answer telephone and relay telephone calls and messages
  • Answer electronic enquiries
  • Compile data, statistics and other information
  • Order office supplies and maintain inventory
  • Record and prepare minutes of meetings, seminars and conferences
  • Arrange travel, related itineraries and make reservations
  • Open and distribute regular and electronic incoming mail and other material and co-ordinate the flow of information
Work Conditions And Physical Capabilities
  • Attention to detail
  • Tight deadlines
Company Benefits
  • Excellent benefits
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Attractive package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs
