title: Executive Assistant
description:
Nestlé is the world’s largest food and beverage company. We have over 2000 brands ranging from global icons to local favourites and are present in 190 countries worldwide. In Canada, excelling means sharing our passion for our purpose of enhancing quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. It also means living up to our exemplary values which are rooted in respect for ourselves, others, diversity, and the future. We will support your personal growth with a people-focused culture and a flexible and diverse working environment. Join our team to support our purpose of unlocking the power of food to enhance quality of life for everyone, today and for generations to come.

Position Snapshot

Business areas: Nestlé Canada

Job title: Executive Assistant

Location: North York

Position Grade: 13

Position Summary

We are looking for an Executive Assistant based at our North York location reporting jointly to the SVP, Corporate Affairs/NHW and SVP, Human Resources/Legal. The primary purpose of this role is to provide executive level, administrative and coordination support to the Executives and their teams.

A day in the life of an Executive Assistant:

As an Executive Assistant you will coordinate key events, meetings, and activities. You will be working daily with the SVPs of HR/Legal and Corporate Affairs/NHW, as well as their teams with autonomy and support to really thrive. You will also:
  • Provide executive level administrative assistance to the SVP, HR/Legal and SVP, Corporate Affairs/NHW and provide administrative support to the broader CA/NHW and HR teams as well.
  • Support the teams in coordination and planning of meetings and internal/external events, which includes developing and editing presentations, product ordering and other event details.
  • Proactively coordinate HR communications, both within the HR function and to the entire organization.
  • Drive connections within the HR function by planning and delivering informal team-building and focused development sessions.
  • Manage SVPs' calendars, providing rapid response to meeting requests and highlighting urgent issues.
  • Manage meeting calendars for teams by booking the functional weekly/monthly/yearly meetings and building agendas. Where possible, anticipate room booking requirements ahead of time and using strong network connections negotiate room switches as required.
  • Collaborate with Coordinators and Executive Assistants to facilitate meetings requests and coordination of key events.
  • Support SVPs with external industry and stakeholder meetings.
  • Basic budget management including managing Purchase Orders, manage supplier billings and cross billing to other businesses.
  • Completion of expense reports and travel bookings.
  • Manage office supply budget keeping a tight rein on spending.
  • Respond to general external inquiries to Corporate Affairs Inbox, respond to donation and community requests, process monetary donations and arrange product donation orders and details.
  • For Corporate Affairs, maintain updated crisis lists, policy documents, department contacts, etc. Manage external stakeholder lists including all government contacts and distribute regular communications to stakeholders per direction.
  • Maintain the current filing and data sharing systems (example, SharePoint) and look for ways to improve current systems.
  • Update respective HR, Legal and Corporate Affairs intranet sites including me@nestlé.
  • Build strong contact network within Nestlé to ensure superior response to team requirements.
  • Support onboarding and set up for new team members (hardware, meetings, orientation schedule).
  • Time administrator to the team keeping track of all team absences.
  • Assistance with other projects as required.

What Will Make You Successful

As the successful candidate, you will need to be passionate, tenacious, results focused and really enjoy working in a highly energetic and exciting environment. You will already be highly organised and pro-active, where enthusiasm is essential, as is your ability to understand and work within our competitive market.  You will also have:
  • Approximately 5+ years at Executive Assistant/Coordinator level in a busy commercial environment.
  • University Degree or completion of a College Diploma.
  • Excellent computer skills, specifically PowerPoint and Excel, and Outlook. SAP would be a distinct advantage.
  • Positive can-do attitude, strong initiative and ability to work independently.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage well under deadlines and multi-task effectively including prioritizing workload, balance requests from team and daily tasks, find solutions, and identify issues and opportunities.
  • Sound judgement and critical thinking skills.
  • Strong project management skills and the ability to follow through to completion.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills required to work with cross functional teams and to communicate internally with employees at all levels and within all functions.
  • Outstanding organizational skills.
  • An interest in learning and understanding the business issues in order to maximize personal effectiveness.
We have a friendly, supportive team with a coaching and mentoring environment. There are real opportunities for future development and progression – this really could be a move towards other exciting opportunities within HR, Corporate Affairs/NHW or other areas of the organization.

What you need to know

What can we offer in return? Great benefits you’d expect from a business the size of Nestle including a comprehensive total rewards benefits package including Health and Dental benefits that start on day one as well as a Company matched retirement savings plan, Excellent training and development programs as well as opportunities to grow within the company.

The closing date for applications is May 13, 2022. We will be considering applicants as they apply, so please don’t delay in submitting your application.

Please note: Education Verification, Reference Checks and Criminal Background Checks will be administered on suitably qualified candidates.

We thank you for your interest in this opportunity; however only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Nestlé is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. Nestlé will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process.

#NestléCAHiring

title: Business Coaches, Educators, Consultants and Entrepreneurs
description:
Company: ActionCOACH Canada


Locations: Multiple locations / Self Employed / Work Remotely


Seeking: Business Coaches, Educators, Consultants and Entrepreneurs


Now has never been a better time to pivot into the second fasted growing industry in the World!


ActionCOACH Canada is rapidly expanding and looking for those that seek self-employment within a framework that has been proven over 27yrs across 85 countries.


This framework has allowed our coaches in Canada to revenue an average of $240,919 in 2020. We are seeking strong candidates that understand having access to such a robust platform, education and training comes with an initial investment (multiple options available).


Who is ActionCOACH Canada?


ActionCOACH is recognized as the global leader in business coaching. ActionCOACH implements advisory services with Guaranteed Results and provides their clients with an average of 6.42x ROI by leveraging our proprietary coaching methodology built over the last 27years, with a framework of more than 3,500 business tools and solutions. ActionCOACH offers the broadest array of best-in-class business coaching products and services to business owners across all sectors of the economy.


What will you be doing?


As a Business Coach you will be:


  • Providing advice and support, advisory services, and motivating entrepreneurs to grow their business.
  • Creating business planning material with your team and clients to assist them in becoming accountable to the goals of their organization.
  • Guiding entrepreneurs from all walks of life with functions of sales, marketing, financial management, systems development, leadership, exit and liquidation strategies, and more using ActionCOACH’s intellectual property.
  • Assisting business owners and a team to increase profits, obtain mastery over time management, and to ultimately be more successful so they can spend their time doing what matters most to them.


What qualifies you?


Quality Management, Self-Development, Professionalism, Entrepreneurial Spirit, Business Knowledge, Vision, Trustworthy, Integrity, Team player and likes to have fun.


ActionCOACH Canada is the largest and most reputable business coaching firm in Canada, where business coaching happens to be the second-fastest growing industry only behind information technology.


ActionCOACH Canada’s client retention is on average up to 63 months and is backed by over 27 years of growth and innovation. ActionCOACH Canada anticipates playing a huge role in the new Canadian economy, post-pandemic, while providing immense levels of value to Canadian businesses.


Take this opportunity to apply and work with a group of high-performing, dynamic, driven, and fun individuals as they bring best practices and innovative ideas to business owners across Canada.


Work Remotely

  • Yes


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Commission, Permanent


Salary: Up to $240,000.00 per year


COVID-19 considerations:

Zoom interview process

title: Data Entry Clerk - Remote Part Time or Full (OnCall Centre)
description:
Data Entry Clerk - Become a Focus Group Panelist now - Remote Part-Time or Full-Time Work At Home Position.

Are you an administrative assistant or data entry clerk looking for ways to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Market Research assignments.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 mins before the discussion starts time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • A complete written survey was provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss PRIOR to the meeting date.
Value

title: Executive Personal Assistant
description:
1-2 self-motivated & experienced personal/executive assistant (client core coordinator) and digital marketing assistant openings are available in Rebecca Action Star Team.

Prefer Individual who speaks English, Mandarin & Cantonese and with relevant experience. Please inquire within.


You will be responsible for administration, marketing, social media, as well as but not limited to, other duties as described herein. Real Estate administration experience is highly preferred.

 

Candidate MUST be fluent in both English and Mandarin, preferably Cantonese.

 

Location: Markham.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

●                   Managing personal calendar and all appointments

●                   Following-up on emails and phone calls

●                   Answer/filter listing related calls from showing agents/prospective clients

●                   Prepare and load showing and access instructions to Broker Bay

●                   Broker loading - uploading and updating listings on MLS

●                   Offers -- preparation of offers, amendments, waivers and other related forms/ documents

●                   Coordinating or assisting with the preparation and delivery of marketing materials and presentations

●                   Arrange marketing for listings (i.e. photography, measurements, MLS descriptions, floor plans, staging, minor renovations, etc.)

●                   Booking of open houses, preparing feature sheets

●                   Pre-listing, listing and post-sale activities

●                   Coordinate with inspectors, mortgage specialists, lawyers, etc.

●                   Organizing mailings and target mailing

●                   Coordinating or installing/ removing signs and lockboxes

●                   Prepare & Submit Trade Record Sheets

●                   Managing Emails, Social Media Sites, Websites, etc.

●                   Manage client relationship tasks such as follow up and ensuring all required documents are collected and correctly completed

●                   Assist as required with personal functions such as, getting car washed, filling up car with gas, buying gifts, greeting service providers, picking up dry-cleaning, etc.


Qualifications and Skills:

●                   Must be proficient in English and Mandarin and preferably in Cantonese

●                   Superior customer service skills, including excellent telephone and interpersonal manner.

●                   Detail-oriented, high level of initiative and the ability to multitask

●                   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

●                   Outstanding communication skills (written and verbal)

●                   Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

●                   Strong time management capabilities.

●                   Strong data entry and reporting skills

●                   Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel), email and internet

●                   Minimum 1 to 2 years working experience in general office administration, ideally in the real estate industry.

●                   Must have own vehicle and valid G license

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Office Assistant
description:
Compensation

We're looking for a professional, friendly administrative assistant. Your primary job will be to serve as the first point of contact with all clients, providing excellent customer service. Additional administrative duties include increasing productivity by creating and following office protocols, scheduling important appointments and/or travel arrangements, purchasing office supplies as needed, and assisting in marketing our brand online and at events. Job seekers should have superb organizational skills and love talking to people. Ready to join the team. Send in your application today.

$30,000 - $50,000 yearly

Responsibilities
  • Facilitate communication between our customers and team to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Purchase office equipment when appropriate
  • Help build online marketing, brochures, email campaigns, etc. that highlight our services
  • Produce progress reports and present to the team on a regular basis
  • Work to create marketing opportunities and plan events for our customer base in the community to improve company reputation and visibility
Qualifications
  • Shows ability to quickly finish very detailed work
  • Customer service experience in our industry is preferred
  • Shows great interpersonal skills and excellent written communication
  • Navigates computer programs with ease to provide a quick front-desk experience for customers
  • Associate's degree preferred but not required to apply
About Company

Austin, Texas-based Keller Williams, the world’s largest real estate franchise by agent count, has more than 930 offices and 177,000 associates. The franchise is No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States. In 2018, Training magazine inducted Keller Williams into its Hall of Fame of top training organizations across all industries in the world.

Since 1983, Keller Williams has grown exponentially and continues to cultivate an agent-centric, education-based, technology-driven culture that rewards agents as stakeholders. The company also provides specialized agents in luxury homes, commercial, and farm and ranch properties.

http//kwlegacies.ca/

title: Grade 3-4 combined class teacher
description: Newbridge Academy is BC’s first bilingual Mandarin- English university preparatory school. We are a small and growing school using the BC curriculum in addition to 45 minutes a day of Mandarin. We are celebrating our 5 year anniversary. We are located in an area walking distance to parks, public library and many other amenities. This position is a home room position teaching all core subjects and should be BC certified or able to get the certification. Mandarin and Art are taught by a specialist teacher. All students speak English and reading is strongly encouraged. Class sizes are approximately 10 students, and the facility is small but quaint. The Board has decided to grow into a K-12 school thus looking to expand in the future. For further information, please contact Steve Olah at admin@newbridge-academy.ca

title: Distribution Centre - Office Assistant
description:
The Distribution Center Office Assistant provides support to the IPEX office team (managers and shippers), responsible for accurately and quickly serving a very demanding client base, with various office duties. The Office Assistant will spend most of his/her time in the office, working typical tasks assigned from DCM/DCC/Shippers in the office. He/She will be responsible for assisting in the process of office documentation, customer orders, transfers and occasional communication to the warehouse team.

40 hour work week – 8 hour shifts - Monday-Friday (Contract 6 months)

Requirements
  • Completion of a high-school diploma or equivalent.
  • Proficient with computers, Microsoft Office, and Process Documentation
  • Experience with Info-flow and RF scanner considered an asset
  • Ability to meet daily deadlines and to work in an environment where assignments and work priorities are reviewed several times a day.
  • Able to read and write in proficient English.
  • Previous experience working in a warehouse preferred
  • Ability to work well as a team but be self-motivated and independent at time
  • Good communication skills
  • Diligent and Punctual.
  • Successful candidate must complete a criminal background check

RESPONSIBILTIES:
  • Execute work in the prescribed sequence so deliver-by-date is met.
  • Answering customers calls effectively and efficiently
  • Monitoring and processing of the paperwork for all orders that relate to Courier/LTL
  • Scheduling pick-ups for LTL and designated Courier carriers
  • Advise Distribution Centre Manager and/or other shippers on any issues pertaining to any warehouse or pickup paperwork
  • Communicate stock errors and discrepancies clearly and effectively with team members
  • Maintain a strict housekeeping standard in accordance with 5S protocols.
  • Any other duties assigned

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact our HR department.

title: Receptionist - with Growth Opportunities
description:
We are looking for a focused Receptionist to join our vibrant team at CEP Forensic in Ottawa, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Receptionist is an incredible opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in creativity, planning and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Receptionist at CEP Forensic today!

We are looking for a full-time receptionist (37.5 h/week) from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. This person will play an important role in everyday operations and the smooth functioning of the Ottawa office as the first line of contact between the clients and the business.

Under supervision of the regional director, this person will work hand in hand with different professional teams and offer timely administrative support for routine activities and special events, as needed.

Responsabilities

Reception
  • Act as the first point of contact for clients and visitors.
  • Prepare and update employees and suppliers contact information.
  • Acknowledge receipt and adequately answer client emails and other correspondences, then follow-up as needed.
  • Complete general office tasks, such as photocopying, faxing, scanning documents, and filling in forms.
  • Coordinate sending and receiving emails, packages, and shipments.
  • Manage office supplies, including safety equipment and supplies used in the kitchen and the washrooms.
  • Oversee proper maintenance and cleaning.
  • Collaborate with service suppliers concerning building management and installation contracts (document shredding, garbage collection, office cleaning, etc.).
Administration
  • Open new mandates on the company’s systems, including Salesforce, and create both a physical and a virtual file on the server.
  • Manage the entirety of the files billing process.
  • Manage storage of exhibits for inactive files.
  • Contact clients to obtain missing information on a file and update said file as needed.
  • Buy, replace, and make technical supplies available in the laboratory and workshop when they break.
  • Manage the storage of samples and exhibits so that they are easily retrievable and update the inventory.
  • Label equipment and tools.
  • Book flights and accommodations as needed.
  • Perform any other related task entrusted by management.
Requirements :
  • Administrative or secretarial studies.
  • Two years of relevant experience in a similar capacity.
  • Bilingualism – verbal and written mastery of both French and English.
  • Proven ability to work with sensitive information and use common sense in various situations.
  • Resourcefulness, teamwork as well as competency in interpersonal relations, communication, planning, organization, coordination, and time management.
  • Exceptional writing, transcription, and report revising skills.
  • Excellent customer service skills and attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of cross-functional workflows and processes.
  • Positive and upbeat attitude, resilience, and adaptability.
Benefits :
  • Be part of a collaborative team.
  • Group insurance plan and RRSP/DPSP.
  • A day off on your birthday.
  • Telemedicine.
  • And more…
Company Benefits
  • Excellent benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Attractive package

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
We are looking for a focused Receptionist to join our vibrant team at CEP Forensic in Ottawa, ON.

Growing your career as a Full Time Receptionist is an incredible opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in creativity, planning and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Receptionist at CEP Forensic today!

We are looking for a full-time receptionist (37.5 h/week) from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. This person will play an important role in everyday operations and the smooth functioning of the Ottawa office as the first line of contact between the clients and the business.

Under supervision of the regional director, this person will work hand in hand with different professional teams and offer timely administrative support for routine activities and special events, as needed.

Responsabilities

Reception
  • Act as the first point of contact for clients and visitors.
  • Prepare and update employees and suppliers contact information.
  • Acknowledge receipt and adequately answer client emails and other correspondences, then follow-up as needed.
  • Complete general office tasks, such as photocopying, faxing, scanning documents, and filling in forms.
  • Coordinate sending and receiving emails, packages, and shipments.
  • Manage office supplies, including safety equipment and supplies used in the kitchen and the washrooms.
  • Oversee proper maintenance and cleaning.
  • Collaborate with service suppliers concerning building management and installation contracts (document shredding, garbage collection, office cleaning, etc.).
Administration
  • Open new mandates on the company’s systems, including Salesforce, and create both a physical and a virtual file on the server.
  • Manage the entirety of the files billing process.
  • Manage storage of exhibits for inactive files.
  • Contact clients to obtain missing information on a file and update said file as needed.
  • Buy, replace, and make technical supplies available in the laboratory and workshop when they break.
  • Manage the storage of samples and exhibits so that they are easily retrievable and update the inventory.
  • Label equipment and tools.
  • Book flights and accommodations as needed.
  • Perform any other related task entrusted by management.

  • Proven ability to work with sensitive information and use common sense in various situations.

  • Exceptional writing, transcription, and report revising skills.
  • Excellent customer service skills and attention to detail.
  • Knowledge of cross-functional workflows and processes.
  • Positive and upbeat attitude, resilience, and adaptability.
Benefits :
  • Be part of a collaborative team.
  • Group insurance plan and RRSP/DPSP.
  • A day off on your birthday.
  • Telemedicine.
  • And more…

  • Excellent benefits
  • Company offers career progression opportunities
  • Attractive package

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Receptionist
description:
Description

Would you describe yourself as a motivated self-starter who can handle multiple projects at once with a smile? Robert Half is reviewing potential Receptionists to join a growing firm. Candidate must be experienced and able to communicate eloquently. Regularly ranked as a great company to work for, the job is an amazing opportunity to develop new skills while advancing your career trajectory. This short-term contract / temporary to hire Receptionist position is a terrific opportunity and is based in the Vaughan, Ontario area.

Responsibilities
  • Help out other administrative staff with support overflow work, including word processing, data entry and Internet research tasks
  • Maintain various office files and provide general office filing support
  • Wield strong prioritization skills and a sense of urgency
  • Receive, review, and distribute incoming mail according to specified procedures
  • Maintain various office files and provide general office filing support
  • Submit orders for office and kitchen supplies
  • Greeting visitors
  • Handle and route all incoming phone calls
Requirements
  • Customer service and office administrative skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills (verbal, written, and listening)
  • Strong organization skills
  • Excellent phone etiquette and ability to establish rapport with diverse clientele
  • Attention to detail and proven ability to follow standard procedures is a requirement
  • Energetic, intelligent, resourceful, solution-oriented, and tech-savvy
  • Command of Administrative Assistance
  • Deep understanding of Microsoft Office
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Receptionist Duties
This position is offered exclusively through Robert Half. This is an outstanding career opportunity for a Receptionist that is driven to grow their career and advance their skill set. This position may fill up fast so don't delay in contacting us!

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4154. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Summary

 

The Administrative Assistant directly supports the leadership team while assisting with other office administrative responsibilities, as needed. The Administrative Assistant will include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs and managing general administrative activities. The Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The person in this role possesses excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment.

 

Duties may include, but are not limited to:

·       The Administrative Assistant is a proficient expert in sound operational processes to ensure superior administrative support to leadership and the entire team.

·       Provides routine administrative support to include calendar management, composing and typing documents, answer direct lines for executives being supported, create spreadsheets, send emails, filing, faxing, etc.

·       Coordinate meetings, meals, conference calls, travel, etc. for leadership which entail such things as organizing attendees and picking up food.

·       Manage and reconcile expense reports.

·       Complete special projects on an as-needed basis

·       Ordering supplies, generating requisitions for funds, coordination with vendors

·       Office maintenance – liaising with building management, printer/network maintenance/issues

·       Mail/Courier management

·       Maintain office roster

·       Manage and maintain parking tags and badging

·       Other administrative duties, as assigned



Qualifications

Requirements:

·       High School Diploma or equivalent. 

·       2 or 4 year college degree preferred.

·       Minimum one year of administrative experience, to include typing skills of at least 40 wpm.

·       Proficient in Microsoft Office products, including Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook

·       Excellent verbal / written communication skills.

·       Must be highly-organized and detail-oriented

·       Ability to multi-task and interact effectively in a team environment.

·       Consistently displays high character and a strong work ethic

·       Criminal background check required



Additional Information

As a workplace, we focus on relationships – with each other, our clients and our candidates - in fact serving others is one of our core values. We support open communication and recognize that giving constructive criticism can be even harder than receiving it. We appreciate the fearless and the passionate, who force us to be better. Everything we do sits on a pillar of diversity - diverse perspectives, backgrounds and ideas drive innovation and make us successful.

See what it’s like to work at AGS by searching #LifeAtAGS on any social network.

 

AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to disability, please call 844-604-7059

title: Branch Operations Assistant
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Branch Operations Assistant

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The RBC Dominion Securities Management team located in Coquitlam BC is looking for a Branch Operations Assistant to join their team! You will provide superior service along with administrative and operational support to clients and employees.

What will you do?

Help manage incoming communications from clients, Advisors and other internal and external partners.
  • Provide attentive and accurate service to clients and respond to their needs
  • Complete administrative tasks to help the Management team: manage office stationery orders, boardroom scheduling, and provide support to the Branch Operations Manager when needed.
  • Complete administrative and operational tasks to support Advisor teams: process incoming and outgoing funds, process account opening and maintenance documentation, etc.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
  • Meticulous attention to detail and excellent time management skills
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills
  • A professional approach to all situations to create a positive working environment
  • Ability to complete duties independently seeking out own answers and solutions

Nice-to-have
  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Conduct & Practices Handbook (CPH) is an asset
  • Knowledge of RBC Dominion Securities’ systems and procedures, an asset
  • Experience in the securities industry is an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

Address:

COQUITLAM, British Columbia, Canada

City:

CAN-BC-COQUITLAM

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-04-25-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-05-16-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description

 Administrative Assistant

About SYSTRA Canada

SYSTRA Canada is part of the SYSTRA group, an international consulting and engineering group, a world leader in the design of transport infrastructures. SYSTRA Canada is an engineering and consulting firm who is dedicated to transportation solutions, whether for passengers or goods.

Imagining and implementing the safest, most efficient, and economical tailor-made transport solutions: this is what guides us daily. Thanks to the know-how of our 7500 experts, we are involved in all phases of transport projects: Preliminary and design studies, construction phases, test and commissioning, operation, and maintenance.

Our engineers work with passion to provide people around the world with the opportunity to move freely every day. They are men and women who put all their business expertise and human qualities to work to transform the world through innovative means of transport. Join them and let's invent tomorrow's public transport together.

SYSTRA's ambition is to be the benchmark for transport solutions and an opinion leader in mobility.

Role And Responsibilities
  • Secretariat: printing, scanning and formatting of various documents
  • Receiving and distributing mail, attendance at reception, event registration
  • Support to the HR department: letters, calls, filing, data entry
  • Support to the accounting department: archives, banking, invoices
In More Detail, You Will Have The Following Tasks
  • Greet guests as they arrive at the office
  • Direct visitors to the appropriate person and office
  • Answer, screen and transfer incoming phone calls
  • Organize courier pick ups and deliveries
  • Ensure that the reception area is neat and presentable, with all necessary stationery and materials (e.g., pens, forms, and brochures)
  • Ensure that the kitchen area is neat, clean, and stocked with necessary supplies such as coffee, sugar, etc.
  • Provide basic and accurate information in person and by phone/email
  • Maintain office security by following security procedures and controlling access via the front desk (monitor logs, issue visitor badges)
  • Maintain emergency contact list
  • Order office supplies, coffee and maintain inventory
  • Update calendars and schedule meetings
  • Arrange travel and accommodations and prepare visa requests (occasionally)
  • Perform other receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, transcribing and faxing
  • Any other related duties
Qualifications

Education: A DEP or DEC in secretarial or office management;

Years of experience: At least 2 years of experience as a receptionist, secretary or other related field

Technical Competencies
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
Personal & Soft Skills
  • Hands-on experience with office equipment (e.g. fax machines and printers)
  • Professional attitude and appearance
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to be resourceful and proactive when problems arise
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Multi-tasking and time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks
  • Customer service attitude
Employment terms and conditions

Contract nature: Permanent – Full Time

Location: Montreal - Canada

Division: Support

Reports to: Assistant to the President

Remuneration: Based on profile

Note : do we indicate this is a hybrid model?

This job description is intended to provide an indication of the nature and levels of work, knowledge, skills, abilities, and other essential functions to be carried out as part of fulfilling the role mentioned in the job title. Various other duties will apply as required.

In this description, the masculine gender is used for easy reading purposes and includes the feminine.

SYSTRA Canada is committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that values applications from all and offers employment equity based on the merits and abilities of candidates and personnel.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
NMR Family Office


Executive Assistant

Job Summary:

The Executive Assistant is responsible for providing senior executive level administrative support to the Chairman, the President, and the VP Finance of the Family Office (the “Executives”)

Accountabilities

  • Provide personal assistance, administrative clerical support and bookkeeping assistance to the Executives
  • Gain understanding of the business of the family office and add value to management of activities through organization, filing, use of technology
  • Maintain daily filing and record keeping for several entities, including the administration of the Family Office Portal (Boardvantage)
  • Complete accounting entries, cheque preparation, and bank account reconciliations using QuickBooks
  • Assist in the development and preparation of financial reports and other reports to the Trustees
  • Organize meetings, including preparing agendas, logistics, scheduling, arranging catering, record and distribute meeting minutes
  • Meeting preparation, minute taking and presentation arrangements.
  • Manage Executives’ calendars, schedule personal and business appointments
  • Track insurance policies and diarize renewal dates
  • Drafting, editing, and proofreading internal and external correspondence such as emails,memos, and presentations
  • Maintain contacts and personal information database
  • Manage and distribute incoming mail, prepare, and send outgoing mail
  • Conducting research or assisting with special projects
  • Coordinate travel arrangements for both personal and business-related purposes as required
  • Other administrative duties as assigned by the Executives

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Confidentiality and discretion is of the utmost importance
  • Exhibit professionalism in all matters of accountabilities
  • Minimum 5 years of administrative experience reporting directly to senior management
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Experience with QuickBooks Software required
  • Exemplary planning and time management skills
  • Up to date with advancements in office tools and applications
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize daily workload
  • High level verbal and written communications skills
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and professional demeanor
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
  • Forward thinking, proactive, “can do” approach

Travel Requirements: Minimal, locally within the GTA, as required

Reports to: VP Finance with dotted line responsibilities to the Chairman and President

THIS ROLE WILL START AT 3 DAYS PER WEEK AND PROGRESS FROM THERE.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Administrative Assistant (MIRO)
description:
Once hired for either of the available roles, you will generally be responsible for:
  • Handling office tasks, such as filing, generating reports and presentations, setting up for meetings, and reordering supplies.
  • Providing real-time scheduling support by booking appointments and preventing conflicts.
  • Making travel arrangements, such as booking flights, cars, and making hotel and restaurant reservations.
  • Screening phone calls and routing callers to the appropriate party.
  • Using computers to generate reports, transcribe minutes from meetings, create presentations, and conduct research.
  • Maintain polite and professional communication via phone, e-mail, and mail.
  • Anticipate the needs of others in order to ensure their seamless and positive experience.
I assume you can handle all of these duties effectively if you get hired and trained?

title: Administrator
description:
Executive Assistant/Communications Guru
Responsibilities:
· Drafting and/or coordinating the writing of communications materials, for shul membership.
· IT support/super administrator for ShulCloud, Microsoft Suite, Google Suite, GoDaddy, Adobe DC, programs and devices in Office, and backup support for services.
· Marketing and promotion of shul programs and events.
· Setting up Zoom links and meetings.
· Computer software management (anti-viral, programs, updates, and domain Management).
· Take meeting minutes.
· Creation of templates for communications, yahrzeit notices, registrations, Letterheads, Mailing, Labels.
· Editing the leadership’s communication materials and updating website.
· Proficiency with all forms of social media.
· Answering phones and routing calls to the correct person or taking messages.
· Managing the office calendar.
· Assisting senior management as requested.
· Strong interpersonal skills and team player but also works well independently.
· Video editing and graphic design is considered an asset.
· Highly organized and able to keep others organized
Requirements:
· Proven experience as an executive assistant or other relevant administrative support experience.
· Ability to organize others and keep the processes moving forward
· Attention to detail
· In-depth understanding of entire MS Office suite.
· High school diploma.
· Ability to organize a daily workload by priorities.
· Must be able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced quickly changing environment.
· A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills.
· Professional level verbal and written communications skills.

title: Finance and Administrative Assistant
description:
FTXT Canada is committed to developing world class hydrogen fuel cell products. FTXT has a global multicultural team with R&D centers in Shanghai, Baoding, Germany and Canada. This position is in Vancouver BC at FTXT’s fuel cell stack center of excellence. FTXT offers a highly competitive salary and benefits package with a culture of innovation. FTXT has an immediate and exciting opportunity for a full-time Finance and Administrative Assistant. The successful candidate will report to the Managing Director and perform a variety of key roles within a 30-person team in 2022 growing to 50-100 people in the next 5 years.


Responsibilities:

  • Assistant to the Financial Controller and Managing Director coordinating schedules and meetings;
  • Review and process incoming invoices, including approvals, payment and filing;
  • Supports all Canadian staff on using the Great Wall Motors internal administrative system in simplified Chinese;
  • Acts as the floor reception, greeting guests and directs them to meetings;
  • Adheres to standards of the Great Wall Motors Purchasing Policy as well as manage the office and lab supplies and ordering of goods in accordance with the Purchasing process;
  • Supports FTXT-Canada purchasing process, account receivable process, logistic activities, assets tagging, monthly bookkeeping, employee attendant calendar, and timesheet process;
  • Maintains accurate and up-to-date tracking lists as needed;
  • Arranges travel and training for FTXT-Canada employees.
  • Organize internal and external company events;
  • Receives and sends mail and packages from/to other companies;
  • Other business and administrative duties as required for the FTXT Canada team.


Qualifications:

  • Degree in Business Administration or equivalent with at least 2 years in administration experience, including basic accounting knowledge and experience in bookkeeping;
  • Must be fluent in spoken Mandarin, proficient in reading and writing simplified Chinese.
  • Must also be fluent in English.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines;
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills, and multi-tasking.
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office;
  • Proactive, able to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Proven ability to document work (e.g. reports, presentations etc.);
  • Experience in team environment, and able to collaborate with cross-functional departments.


Benefits include flexible hours, free on-site parking, casual dress, disability insurance, life insurance, vision care, dental care, travel insurance, and annual bonus.


FTXT is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.

description:

If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Summary

Job Description:

This position obtains customs clearance information on shipments via phone. Candidate processes inbound shipments and maintains verbal contact with the public. This position identifies sales prospects and strategically probes customers for volume expectations.

Responsibilities
  • Obtains broker information on shipment so shipments can be accurately assessed for duties and taxes by the designated broker.

  • Sales experience - Preferred
  • Previous telephone experience
  • Bilingual (French) preferred

title: Reception Administrative Assistant - Hiring Fast
description:
We are hiring an experienced Reception Administrative Assistant to join our stellar team at Roska DBO in Whitecourt, AB.

Growing your career as a Full Time Reception Administrative Assistant is an awesome opportunity to develop excellent skills.

If you are strong in decision-making, adaptability and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Reception Administrative Assistant at Roska DBO today!

Roska DBO Inc. is currently seeking a Reception Administrative Assistant for our busy client located in Whitecourt, AB. The shift for this role will be 6 hours a day, from 9am - 3pm, for 5 days per week with the possibility of becoming full time in the future. Must reside in the Whitecourt area.

If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on providing exceptional customer service, completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience within a growing and dynamic industry, then we want to hear from you!

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Inventory management
  • Asset Integrity data support
  • Regulatory administrative tasks
  • Courteously receive and screen in-bound calls, emails and visitors, while always maintaining a professional image and demeanor
  • Book meeting rooms and arrange for catering
  • Photocopying, scanning and binding of various documents
  • Ensure that all incoming mail is sorted and distributed
  • Prepares all outgoing mail
  • Make travel arrangements for staff
  • Provide administrative support to the West operations team
  • Order kitchen and office supplies and ensures all work areas are stocked appropriately
  • Perform light housekeeping (dishwashers, counters, etc.)
  • Typing of various correspondence as required (Word/Excel/PowerPoint)
  • Take accurate minutes at company meetings and distribute accordingly
  • Establish and maintain an effective filing system
  • Production validation for various fields
  • Maintain excellent rapport with field staff and vendors
  • Open invoice coding and processing
  • Assist with planning and organization of company social functions and events
Successful Candidates Will Have The Following
  • Highschool Diploma / Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree
  • 2-3 years of previous office administration work experience
  • Basic knowledge of the oil and gas industry
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Motivated and enthusiastic team player
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral
  • Effective time management and organizational skills with ability to prioritize and multi-task
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in Roska DBO Inc., only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Roska DBO Inc. is a customer-focused operations company with a 25 year track record offering expertise in production and equipment solutions on well sites and facilities. Based in Grande Prairie, Alberta, with a network of locations, Roska serves all of western and northern Canada, plus selected U.S. and international markets, with a primary focus on the Alberta/ B.C. region.

In addition to fulfilling the contract operating needs of oil and gas producing, midstream and pipeline companies, Roska Designs, Builds and Operates well-site facilities, rents equipment and provides Production Testing and flowback services using a company-owned well testing fleet. When you join the Roska Team, the sky is the limit!

Company Benefits
  • Learning opportunities
  • Opportunities to grow
  • Attractive package
Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Receptionist / Administrative Assistant (Hunter Litigation Chambers)
description:
Founded in 2006, Hunter Litigation Chambers (HLC) has become one of the premier firms in BC. HLC is a 21-lawyer litigation boutique in downtown Vancouver. The practice of the firm is restricted to dispute resolution, focusing on commercial litigation, arbitration and administrative law.

We offer a collegial and respectful working environment that inspires team and social interaction between staff and lawyers. At HLC we encourage staff to make a positive contribution to the work environment.

We are currently recruiting for a Receptionist/Administrative Assistant with two or more years experience to deliver high-quality support to ensure excellent service to firm members and to our clients. We are looking for a team player who is detail-oriented, self-motivated, proactive, and able to handle a busy workload. For candidates who are early in their career, this is a great place to learn and grow. This position is cross-trained with the Office Services Clerk and the two employees work as a team every day and are able to step into each other shoes on breaks, lunch, sick days and vacation.

This position is on-site Monday thru Friday. The hours are 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Responsibilities
  • Primary responsibilities for greeting guests on the phone and in person;
  • Arranging boardroom bookings, set-ups and food and beverage service;
  • Helping assistants with conference and video call arrangements, including technical support to assist with video call setup;
  • Perform library updates, maintaining library database and re-shelve books;
  • Managing incoming and outgoing mail and couriers;
  • Primary contact with telephone consultants for support and maintenance;
  • Maintains internal directories, lists and floor plans;
  • General office duties filling printers, and maintaining supplies and kitchens;
  • Tidying reception area;
  • Performing COVID cleaning several times per day;
  • Other general and administrative tasks as required.
Qualifications
  • A client-focused approach and commitment to providing professional service to internal and external clients;
  • Ability to work well under pressure and to manage high volumes of work;
  • Strong administration and organization skills with exceptional attention to detail.
  • Excellent English (oral and written) communication skills;
  • Ability to take initiative and be pro-active;
  • Flexibility to perform occasional overtime on short notice is required.
  • Knowledge of MSOffice Word, Outlook and Excel.
Please forward cover letters and resumes to Leslie Green, Director of Administration, at lgreen@litigationchambers.com.

We thank all candidates for their interest in Hunter Litigation Chambers, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administration & Accounting Assistant
description:
Location: 150 King Street West, Suite 305, Toronto ON, M5H 1J9


The role is currently a “work from home” position but will be required to go into the office on an average one day per week.


About DGA Careers Inc.

DGA Careers, a leading recruiting and executive search firm for the Canadian insurance industry, has a career opportunity for a highly organized, energetic, and personable individual. Founded in 1986, DGA Careers, specializes in providing insurance recruiting services to major insurers, insurance brokerage firms and independent adjusting firms.


Position Summary

The Administrative & Accounting Assistant is responsible for supporting DGA Careers and its sister companies in their everyday administrative and accounting activities.


The successful candidate will have proficiency in Microsoft Office and Business Management Software, will be eager to learn, and will consistently be able to meet deadlines while producing highly accurate results.


This position includes a competitive salary and an opportunity to gain experience in administrative, financial, and accounting practices.



Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The duties and responsibilities outlined below are representative but not all-inclusive:

  • Organizing and Managing source documents
  • Accurate calculation of profit share (commission)
  • Daily Cash Deposit
  • Customer Care
  • Daily Revenue Reconciliations
  • Accounts Receivable responsibilities
  • Accounts Payable responsibilities
  • Managing Petty Cash and Employee Reimbursements
  • Payroll Responsibilities as assigned
  • Bank and Credit Card Reconciliations
  • Revenue and Expense Reconciliations
  • Managing Business Information and daily reports
  • Ongoing projects that facilitate the continued growth of the company



Requirements


Education & Experience

  • Education related to business accounting.
  • 1+ years of experience in a similar role



Key Attributes: What you’ll need:

  • Personable, friendly, outgoing, positive attitude and strong work ethic
  • Word processing and data entry skills; preferably in Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Takes on initiative and has a ‘can-do’ attitude
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Knowledge of basic accounting principles.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
  • Flexibility and accountability in daily responsibilities



Benefits and Opportunities:

  • Company benefits plan upon completion of probation period
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Development of skills learned in school through experience
  • Flexible work from home module.



Schedule:

DGA Careers office hours are from 8:30am - 5:00pm

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

description:
Position: Data Entry Clerk Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Data entry clerk experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are a data entry clerk or someone just looking for a flexible part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Receptionist/Boardroom Booking Assistant
description:
Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP (Blakes), one of Canada’s largest and most successful law firms, has an immediate opening for a Receptionist/Boardroom Booking Assistant to join the Boardroom Services team in the Toronto office. The required hours of work for this position are 11:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Eastern Time (EST).


Reporting to the Manager of Catering and Boardroom Services, this position will be responsible for assisting visitors of the Firm by greeting, welcoming, and directing them to the appropriate boardrooms, notifying Firm personnel of visitors’ arrival, and maintaining security and the telecommunications system. The Receptionist/Boardroom Booking Assistant will also operate telephone switchboards and consoles to connect, hold and transfer telephone calls, and provide information to clients or refer them to appropriate contacts within the Firm.


Receptionist Major Duties and Responsibilities:

 

·        Welcoming visitors by greeting them, notifying lawyers and/or assistants of client arrivals, answering or referring inquiries, providing boardroom location instructions, and passing on client requests to the technical assistants, etc.

·        Maintaining security by administering passcard procedures (i.e. issuing temporary passcards; retrieving forgotten, lost or damaged cards, etc.); recording visitors in the visitors log software and following Blakes security procedures

·        Assisting with clerical/administrative duties where required by clients (i.e. photocopying, scanning, etc.)

·        Answering internal and external phone calls, directing calls to the appropriate people and answering any inquiries or redirecting questions to the appropriate individuals

·        Communicating issues relating to the Boardroom Services operations to the appropriate people

·        Providing support to the Boardroom Services team by assisting with bookings, emails and/or phone calls and switchboard where needed and detailed below


Switchboard Operator Major Duties and Responsibilities:


·        Maintaining external and internal communications and inquiries by answering internal and external phone calls, directing calls to the appropriate people, and answering any inquiries or redirecting questions to the appropriate individuals

·        Accurately and efficiently handle all cold calls received by taking down information and passing it on to the appropriate department

 

Qualifications


﻿Education/Experience:


·        High school education is preferred

·        Minimum of one year of experience in a receptionist and/or switchboard operator function is preferred

·        Legal or professional services experience is considered an asset


Skills/Abilities:

            

·        Strong attention to detail

·        Proven verbal communication skills

·        Professional demeanour and strong customer-service skills

·        Ability to complete often competing tasks to ensure clients expectations are met and exceeded


How to Apply:


To apply for this position, please submit your application and include your cover letter and résumé directly to our application portal by visiting: https://www.blakes.com/join-blakes/careers/administrative-staff/receptionist-boardroom-booking-assistant


Blakes wishes to thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Who We Are


At Blakes, we care about our people. We are committed to providing exceptional experiences for not only our clients, but also our employees by fostering an open and inclusive workplace culture. As a winner of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers and Greater Toronto’s Top Employers awards, we understand the importance of fostering an environment that brings out the best in each person. Our success as a firm starts with the hiring, development and retention of top talent.


Blakes welcomes applications from all qualified applicants. The Firm is committed to maintaining an inclusive work environment composed of people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, identities and cultures.


The Firm provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities and in respect of other protected grounds during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Receptionist
description:
Putting people first, every day

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.

Your opportunity

Our Rimbey office is looking for a Receptionist to join the Office Administration team and own the following responsibilities:

  • Attending to all customer inquiries; whether by phone or walk-in, in a timely and professional manner
  • Receiving and routing calls, providing directory assistance and directing inquiries to proper departments or individuals
  • Providing administrative support to multiple partners and staff within the office and coordinating and scheduling meetings with clients and for office functions
  • Handling various administrative tasks, including but not limited to coordinating client invoicing, letters, calendar management, meeting and travel coordination, various office duties, etc
  • Drafting of Facilities Communications i.e. Fire Testing Alarms, general building maintenance
  • Input database and processes i.e. Invoices
  • Receiving and processing payments
  • Maintaining the front desk and reception area in an organized and professional manner
  • Booking meeting and training rooms as requested
  • Sort and deliver incoming mail, cheques and courier packages, post outgoing mail
  • Assist in all Covid related protocol and procedures
  • Assisting in set up of meeting rooms for training and various events
  • Maintain appearance and cleanliness of kitchen and meeting rooms
  • Ensure reception is opened/closer appropriately, ensure security requirements set each night and holidays
  • Providing administrative support where needed to team
  • Various other duties as required

How do we define success for your role?

  • You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
  • You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; clients describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
  • You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
  • You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
  • You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
  • You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.

Your experience and education

  • Minimum 1 year of experience in a professional reception role with a multi-line digital system and general administrative duties
  • Diploma/Degree in a relevant field is preferred but not required
  • Ability to support high level management demands and with a strong attention to detail
  • Deadline and detail-oriented, with the ability to work independently
  • Exceptional time management, organization and prioritization skills
  • Ability to work with and maintain confidentiality with sensitive information
  • Professional demeanor
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work extra hours as required

Why BDO?

Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canada’s Top 100 Employers for 2022 . This recognition is a milestone we’re thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:

  • We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.
  • We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.
  • We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.

Giving back adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market-leading personal time off policy. We’re committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed without barriers. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion, Equity and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, equity, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us .

Hybrid new normal: As a hybrid workplace, all BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client site, and remotely unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place. To protect the health and safety of our people, clients, and communities, we require all partners and employees to be COVID-19 fully vaccinated in order to enter a BDO office. Individuals that cannot be fully vaccinated with a Health Canada approved vaccine due to medical reasons or another protected ground under Human Rights legislation may request an accommodation.

Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page .

#LI- JW1
