title: Executive Assistant
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to leverage your personality and administrative expertise to join a company fighting for food security and equality?

Trendi is hiring an Executive Assistant and wants to hear from YOU!

Who Are You?
  • An exceptionally organized Executive Assistant with a keen eye for detail AND exceptional listening skills?
  • A rebellious, self-aware, and compassionate thinker ready to drive real change in technology?
  • An innovative contributor who manifests ideas into actionable strategies and procedures?
  • A great delegator and communicator that leads with kindness and humor?
  • A growth-seeker that thrives in a chaotic and tight-knit work environment?

A Day in the Life
  • As the right-hand to the Executive team, capture and embrace the craziest of ideas into actionable meeting minutes and strategies that spur your Trendi team into action.
  • Initiate daily touch point meetings with executives so that you’re always clear on daily priorities, assignments, timelines (and roadblocks!) and deliverables.
  • Champion communications with the executive team by capturing post-meeting action items, deliverables, and discussions to circulate relevant information to the wider team.
  • Grab the executive’s chaotic and fast-paced company life by the horns and own their email, calls, meetings, and travel with your task manager and vigor to get ish done.
  • Open your Pinterest and your colour-coding system to invent creative streamlining and filing processes that get the executive’s files, documents, and Google Drive into shape.
  • Embrace relationships with our clients and stakeholders to make them feel like they’re part of the family with your upbeat spirit!
  • Equip yourself and the team with the office supplies needed and the equipment required to tackle their workday at Trendi and crush all the obstacles that threaten our mission.

What You Bring To The Table
  • 3+ years of experience passionately embracing and owning your previous Executive Assistant roles in a fast-paced and growing company.
  • 3+ years of experience supporting internal team communications and delegating to execute projects.
  • You have exceptional listening skills that foster innovation through your unique ability to follow an Executive’s train of thought AND action, action, action!
  • You’re a pro at navigating Microsoft Office Suite, Calendly, Monday, and Todoist, and you have outstanding organizational and time management skills.
  • You’re enthusiastic about technology and addressing barriers to efficiency by connecting your team with solutions.

Bonus Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in a field of study that you are passionate about!
  • Experience in a start-up environment.
  • Experience coordinating events.

Why Trendi?

Here, at Trendi, we value and actively work to ensure all employees are equipped with tools necessary to become the best, healthiest, and most passionate version of themselves. Here’s a bit about how you can expect us to support you:
  • Competitive Compensation & Generous Benefits – Your passion, drive, and contributions are the reason Trendi is successful. We offer a competitive base salary, a generous bonus program (that’s actually attainable), and comprehensive benefits to care for you and your family.
  • Vacations, Time Off & Remote Work – You’re human, which means you need to pursue your passions, enjoy time with people you love, and prioritize work-life balance.
  • Personal & Professional Development – When you learn, grow, and achieve your goals we all win. From articles and webinars to mentorship, events, and continued education, we’ve never found a growth opportunity we didn’t love! We’re small, and we recognize that means your growth may outpace ours. In fact, we consider that a win! We love and celebrate our alum!

About Trendi

We’ve all thrown out a bag of rotten fruit before. None of us are perfect. Especially on the Trendi team, where we each have a unique story, a quirky personality, and many flaws. Our focus is undoubtedly on eliminating the food waste crisis, particularly in Canada where we waste 58% of the food we produce. With that said, we’re not tree-hugging sustainability gurus; we’re just regular people like you.

But regular people can make a big difference. You can help us work towards rescuing the 1.3 billion tonnes of unused food before it’s wasted every year, upcycle it, and make it accessible to 800 million people that go hungry daily.

We do it all with robotics, AI, automation, delicious food, and most importantly our quirky team of misfits. Our team doesn’t work here because they just need a job. They do it because this mission propels them and gives them an opportunity to personally grow and become a kick-a$$ change maker.

If this is something you can get behind, we want to hear from you. Just like the misfit food we rescue, tell us how you’re a misfit.

Trendi is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know from experience that a diverse team that reflects our planet, partners and community stakeholders is central to ensuring varied perspectives and better ideas to solve the complex problem of food waste. Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion are unwavering and the core of how we build our team, cultivate leaders and create our impact. We do not discriminate, and we are open to anyone, whoever you are, wherever you’re from, however you identify and whatever your story. If you’re qualified for the job and can get on board with our mission and community, we’re ready to talk.

Does this sound like the opportunity you have been waiting for?

Apply today with your resume!

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Apollo Health & Beauty Care (Apollo) is a premium developer of private label and control label health & beauty care products and leverages unique expertise and experience in developing national brand-equivalent products designed to compete equivalently with the most popular national brands. The largest private label and control label personal care manufacturer in Canada, Apollo has formidable penetration and distribution in the North American marketplace and also services customers throughout Central and South Asia, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Building on our core values of Excellence and Commitment, Apollo has established itself as a market leader that attracts the industry's top talent. We are currently searching for an energetic, motivated Travel Coordinator and Administrative Assistant to join our Apollo Team! POSITION SCOPE:

The Support Office Assistant will be responsible for managing and assisting Executive Assistant to Senior Management and other administrative support.

RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:
  • Performing duties like doing errands, preparing and arranging coffee , catering etc. for meetings and for executive team
  • Perform a variety of clerical duties such as writing memos, letters, filing, photocopying etc. as requested- Support to Executive Assistant to Management.
  • Perform other duties as assigned

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
  • 1-2 years’ experience of booking corporate travel, with scheduling/logistics experience considered an asset
  • Knowledge and Experience: 1-2 years’ experience in a corporate environment required; post-secondary education preferred
  • Superior organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills, with the ability to juggle multiple large and small projects at a time
  • Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to assess multiple options and to identify the best choice to serve a specified goal
  • Ability to work well under pressure and remain calm in stressful situations
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with extra proficiency in Excel
  • Willingness and ability to keep up to date with evolving technology
  • Ability to keep personal information about employees and others confidential
  • Available for work weekends and/or after hours for emergency support Perks:- Benefit Cover effective after 3 months of hiring. - 2 weeks vacation in a year- Company Gym - Free Car Parking

"Apollo Health & Beauty Care will ensure accommodations are available in consultation with candidates during all stages of the recruitment process"

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Duties outlined on this job description may not be all-inclusive and can be modified at any time if requested by management. Apollo is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process. Apollo will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those meeting the minimum qualifications will be interviewed.

title: English Transcribers
description:
Job description


We are looking for English Transcribers/Language Data Analyst with native speaker fluency in English to join us on a new innovative and interesting job to improve Artificial Intelligence (i.e. as speech or text recognition, input methods, keyboard/swipe technology or other areas of human-machine interaction related to languages).

As an English Transcribers/Language Data Analyst for the AI Division, you will perform some or all of the following tasks:

  • Transcription (create written copies of live speech or dictated audio)
  • Data labeling (identify and label the purpose of what you transcribe)
  • Data classification (categorize the data provided considering different criteria)

This job requires a high level of independence, adaptation, and accuracy. Love of attention to detail helps succeed in this role!


TransPerfect Is More Than Just a Job…

Our greatest asset is our people, and nothing is more important to us than ensuring that everyone knows that. Each of our 90+ offices has its own individual identity, and each also has its own unique rewards.


Job requirements

  • Native Speaker fluency in English
  • Are of legal age (18+)
  • Great reading and comprehension skills in English. All the training material and guidelines provided are available in English only!
  • Ability to meet daily KPI's
  • Excellent time management
  • Ability to work independently
  • Flexibility, ability to adapt and react to changing priorities quickly and efficiently
  • Ability to track, analyze, and report issues
  • Full-time availability (9AM-6PM)
  • Availability to work from our Vancouver office
  • Ability to understand and implement feedback
  • Find comfort in detail-oriented work

title: Awesome Administrative Assistant - Exhibition and LBE - 19 Month Contract
description:
Job Description

Are you a "Problem Solver", a "Fixer", and "Organizer" and a "Doer" who enjoys a fast paced environment, offering Administrative Support to part of the Cineplex Executive Team, than this contract role (19 Months) is for you!

The National Operations department at our Home Office in Toronto is currently seeking an Administrative Assistant Exhibition & LBE, reporting directly to the Executive Vice President Exhibition & Location Based Entertainment

What The Role Is:
  • Provide administrative support to the Executive VP Exhibition & LBE, Senior VP National Operations, and two VPs National Operations
  • Manage and maintain Outlook Calendars, coordinate travel, and complete expense reports
  • Coordinate onsite/offsite meetings and activities including Agendas, materials, AV, logistics, and catering
  • Oversee logistics and planning of an annual large-scale 3-day conference, including organizing events, venue coordination, managing budget and invoices, and connecting with Executive VP Exhibition & LBE and Senior VP National Operations, planning committee, and regional teams
  • Assist in coordinating schedule and logistics for annual Road Show and theatre visits throughout the year
  • Ensure Exhibition and Location Based Entertainment teams function cohesively and efficiently
  • Prepare expenditure documents, code invoices, and maintain related tracking
  • Handle time sensitive projects and confidential files, monitor and maintain timelines for projects and internal processes
  • Monitor departmental out of office/vacation schedules
  • Prepare correspondence, reports, and PowerPoint presentations
  • Manage mail/couriers and maintain files

Qualifications

What You Offer:
  • Five + years of experience as an Administrative Assistant with at least two years assisting at the Executive level
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic accounting skills
  • Intermediate knowledge of expense reporting and accounting systems

What Sets You Apart:
  • Be a self-starter with the ability to take initiative and work effectively in a team or independently
  • Have a demonstrated ability to manage effective communication and working relationships with head office, multiple remote offices and theatres throughout Canada
  • Be detail oriented, have excellent oral and written communication skills, and have demonstrated ability to manage conflicting priorities
  • Possess a strong guest service focus and have effective interpersonal and time management skills
  • Use discretion and judgment necessary to treat confidential items and assignments appropriately
  • Background in theatre management, retail or hospitality environments is an asset
  • Bilingual in French and English is an asset

Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

Life at Cineplex:

Cineplex is synonymous with entertainment. Known as Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, we’re so much more than movies - operating The Rec Room, Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ and Playdium, specially designed for teens and families.

At Cineplex, change and disruption are nothing new. Infusing innovation into everything we do has fueled our evolution as a fully-integrated, diversified and growing organization with exciting career opportunities in our locations and corporate functions. Grow with us, and explore roles in operations, food services, hospitality, digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), digital (Cineplex Digital Media) and cinema media (Cineplex Media), consumer loyalty (SCENE), finance, human resources, technology, amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group), and more.

Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we rally behind our values of Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence.

We are creative, curious and love thinking big. The next evolution of Cineplex starts here, with you.

Learn more about our businesses through the links below.

Cineplex | Cineplex Digital Media | | Cineplex Media | Cineplex Store | Player One Amusement Group | Playdium | The Rec Room | SCENE

No Agency Calls Please

title: Kindergarten Teacher
company: Manitoba-Saskatchewan Conference of the Seventh-day Adventist Church
description:
Riverside Christian School will have an opening for a half-time Kindergarten teacher at the beginning of the 2022-2023 school year.

Eligible candidates demonstrate the energy, dedication, and understanding to teach Kindergarten students in their first year of school and inspire them to choose Christ as their Savior and Lord. Candidates should be strong in teaching the early grades and have proficiency with technology, experience with working with people from a wide range of ethnic diversities, and the flexibility and collaboration skills needed as a team player - willing to support and assist faculty and administration alike.

Riverside Christian School (RSCS) is located in Saskatoon, the largest city in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan with the majestic South Saskatchewan River running through the center of this “Paris of the Prairies” as it is sometimes called.

RSCS is a provincially-funded school and is supported by 4 constituent churches and boasts of supportive working conditions.

Qualifications for Employment:
+ Is an active member of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, modeling Christianity, and upholding the faith and values of the Seventh-day Adventist Church
+ A current favorable criminal police check & vulnerable sector check
+ Has a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Education and/or Early Childhood Education
+ Has current SDA Denominational Certification and/or qualifies in obtaining one.
+ Is in possession of a Saskatchewan Provincial Teacher Certification and/or qualifies in obtaining one.
+ Documented ability to work legally in a school in Canada - A Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or has a Current Work Permit valid for a minimum of 3 or more years
+ Models excellence in teaching through innovation (STEM, STEAM, Research-Based, multigrade, etc.)
+ Exemplifies the attributes of Adventist Education
+ Experience teaching Kindergarten students
+ Is proficient in using typical classroom technology and software
+ Well organized, working collaboratively with students, faculty, administration, school board, and conference.
+ Communicates effectively and has strong people skills that enable the candidate to interact with diverse ethnic groups
+ Is an independent thinker, who has a strong desire for teaching, and a love for students.
+ Is committed to providing a rigorous academic program while still meeting the individual needs of students.


Send a Cover Letter, Updated Resume, at least three references, letter from your Pastor, and any relevant Documentation via E-mail to:

Corinne Lindberg – Director of Education
Manitoba-Saskatchewan Conference
1004 Victoria Avenue
Saskatoon, SK S7N 0Z8

306.244.9700 Ext. 215
clindberg@mansaskadventist.ca

title: Administrative Assistant
company: Working for a Member of Parliament | Travailler pour un(e) député(e)
description:
The office of Kevin Vuong, Independent Member of Parliament for Spadina—Fort York (Toronto) is currently seeking an Administrative Assistant who can provide high quality support. Could you be the perfect fit?


We are a team of motivated professionals committed to the well-being and interests of the constituents of Spadina-Fort York. The ideal candidate will be the first line of contact for the Parliament Hill office.


Duties include:

  • Take lead on creating and facilitating delivery of constituency communication materials (Householders, 10%ers).
  • Schedule and track meetings, events, requests for the Member; prepare event and meeting materials; ensure Member has up to date schedules/calendar and is informed of all bookings in advance.
  • Triage and track emails and mail sent to the Member.
  • Work with the Member’s Director of Parliamentary Affairs to track and respond to correspondence, conduct research, liaising with stakeholders, advocacy letters, administrative requests, etc.
  • Assist constituency-based team as requested, including drafting written outputs and with constituency casework when required.
  • Support legislative duties where necessary.
  • Coordinate and book all travel between riding and Ottawa.
  • Complete various administrative tasks related to House of Commons administration requirements and office needs, such as submitting forms, purchasing supplies, Etc.
  • Answer phone calls to the Hill office.
  • Ensure that all Ottawa-based Member expenses and travel claims are submitted to the House of Commons Financial Department.



It is strongly preferred that the successful candidate possess the following experiences/capacities:

  • Previous experience working on Parliament Hill.
  • Ability to create MP Householders, 10%er Constituency Mailings, communication materials.
  • Experience providing administrative support in an office that offers a wide range of services: responding to correspondence, drafting of documents, preparation of briefing documents, formatting of documents, meeting planning, event organization, filing, client service, appointment scheduling and managing emails.


The ideal candidate would have the following:

  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize.
  • Excellent communication, writing, and editing skills.
  • Ability to work independently and unsupervised and also be part of a helpful team.
  • Ability to work under pressure, while managing competing priorities.
  • Comfortable using MS Office suite, Skype, Zoom, TEAMS, Etc.
  • Strong research skills and ability to find information effectively to answer enquiries.
  • Bilingual (English-French) or (English-Mandarin) would be a definite plus but is not mandatory.



To apply:

Interested candidates are requested to forward their resume and cover letter clearly outlining how they meet the prerequisites to: glenn.bradbury.501@parl.gc.ca by 5 p.m., May 6, 2022.


Please Note: Candidates will be selected for further evaluations and assessments based on their submitted resume and cover letter, and the ability to demonstrate how they meet the prerequisites noted in this posting.


While all interested individuals will be considered, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


Essential Information:

  • **Effective November 22, 2021, all individuals entering the Parliamentary Precinct are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID 19, unless accommodated based on a medical contraindication. Individuals are considered to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 fourteen (14) days after they have received the recommended doses of one vaccine or combination of vaccines approved by Health Canada.
  • **As part of the application process, candidates will be asked to identify their vaccination status. The successful candidate must show proof of vaccination, or medical contraindication.
  • **In the event that a candidate is selected to be assessed on-site, proof that they are fully vaccinated will be required along with government issued ID at that time.


Additional information

Job title: Administrative Assistant

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Online Data Entry Clerk Job - Online Typing Stay At Home - Remote Part Time or Full Time Work At Home Position

Are you looking for an opportunity to make extra income remotely from home?

Our company is seeking motivated individuals to take part in nationwide & local paid Focus Groups and Clinical Trials.

With most of our focus group studies, you have the option to participate online or in-person. This is a great way to earn extra income from the comfort of your home.

If the thought of participating in group discussions and voicing your opinion about new consumer products, while being compensated to do so, gets you excited...we'd love to have you apply while spots are still available.

Responsibilities
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
Requirements
  • Must have either a smart phone with working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to a reliable internet connection
  • Desire to fully participate in one or several of the given topics
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in-person.
  • No commute needed if you choose to work from home.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
Click the Apply button to apply for this position now. This position is anyone looking for temporary, part-time or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is required.

If you are looking for a flexible part time remote work from home job, this is a great position for earning a good side income.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Early Years Educator
description:
Are you an Early Childhood Educator with a specialty in Infant Toddler Education? If you answered yes, then we want to hear from you!

ProducKIDvity is Kelowna's first childcare academy and co-working centre located in the heart of downtown. Our centre serves 50 students ranging from 0-5 years. We are looking for an Infant Toddler Educator who:

- Has completed their post-secondary education in Early Childhood Education, including their IT certification (note: ECEs in the process of obtaining their IT will also be considered)
- Is passionate about early childhood education and looking to contribute to curriculum development
- Is a team player who excels working alongside other educators
- Is intentional in their approach to early childhood education
- Is willing to learn and grow within our organization (this is our first location, but not our last!)

Qualifications

- Early Childhood Education (ECE) Certificate Licence
- Valid Infant Toddler Certificate or currently completing Infant Toddler Certificate
- Childcare: 2 years (preferred)
- First Aid/CPR Certificate
- Familiar with current BC Licensing Regulations
- Knowledge of the Montessori and Reggio Emilia methodology as well as Active Play curriculum
- Ability to prioritize and to exercise time management

ProducKIDvity Perks include:

- Above average salaries. Our Infant Toddler Educators start at $27 per hour, not including the wage enhancement!
- Health and wellness benefits
- 3 weeks paid vacation
- Monthly personal days
- Transportation allowance
- On-site gym

And much more!

title: Department Secretary/Administrative Assistant
description:
LCBO

Number of Openings:

1

Pay

$38,946.00 - $61,613.00

Job Posting Description:

Administrative Assistant

We are seeking a dynamic Administrative Assistant to support the Asset Management Department in the Store Development and Real Estate Division. The Administrative Assistant will provide support to the Sr. Director and the Facilities and Property Management team overseeing the real estate operations of the LCBO network. The role ensures and undertakes the ongoing centralization of data and documents, tracking of facilities programs, creation of work orders and subsequent invoicing while further departmental needs are met through preparation of budgets, meeting co-ordination, travel arrangements and creation of presentations.

The self-motivated Assistant will demonstrate professionalism, integrity and the ability to balance competing priorities. Having the ability to see the bigger picture and anticipate needs, you are an agile, high performing individual that is able to interact with stakeholders from all levels within an organization with confidence. You take an innovative approach to problem solving and are self-motivated. You will use your strong initiative, creative thinking and problem-solving skills to support a collaborative team in a constantly changing environment to prioritize and meet business objectives. If you possess superior organization and analytical skills and are passionate about anticipating the needs of the team and preparing them for success, then this is the role for you.

About the role:

  • Maintaining databases of information and preparing reports
  • Creation of vendor work orders and processing invoices
  • Assist with PowerPoint presentations, Work documents, Excel spreadsheets, proof-reading and formatting of all correspondence
  • Process internal and external correspondence on brief instruction or own initiative researching responses as required.
  • Assist with calendar management and meeting coordination with internal and external partners
  • Administer the departmental budgets
  • Process invoices, review and track expenses
  • Plan, facilitate and attend departmental meetings to transcribe meeting minutes
  • Coordinate all travel arrangements and approvals, including the provision of meals, transportation and accommodation

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience providing senior administrative support in a multi departmental and highly fast paced environment.
  • Ability to problem solve and operate with a high degree of independence.
  • Excellent experience with Excel and experience remainder of the Microsoft Office suite including Word and PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of Accelion and Oracle is an asset.
  • A working knowledge of budget preparation and monitoring is also an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, tact, diplomacy and discretion
  • Well organized and able to prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Understanding the role of facilities management is also beneficial

There is a world of opportunities at the LCBO…

Join an organization where you can be challenged while achieving your true potential. A place where you can make a positive impact supporting Ontario business and communities. Discover a safe, healthy, diverse, inclusive, and accountable workplace where your wellbeing is our top priority. At the LCBO, your contributions are respected and valued. Be part of our journey as we invest in people and technology to transform an organization. There really is a world of opportunities at the LCBO.

We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging, so everyone feels valued, respected, and heard. The LCBO is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an interview or employment opportunity, please advise if you require an accommodation.

Duration:

Work Hours:

36.25

Union / Non-Union:

Non-Union

Job Posting End Date:

May 20, 2022

The LCBO is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

description:
Would you like working for a company that promotes innovation?

Are you known for your excellent receptionist skills?

Since 1989, this company has been working hard to promote a collaborative innovation environment in order to find solutions that benefit the transportation industry in Québec. We invite you to advance our team by bidding your application and join their team as a receptionist.

Normal working hours will be from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm, Monday to Friday.

Advantages

Salary: $42,500

Face-to-face

3 weeks of vacation

Benefits paid 100% per employer

Permanent positionYou will be eligible for the company's profit program.

Answer calls;

Receive and distribute mail;

Prepare outgoing mail;

Assist sales representatives when required;

Keep the lobby clean and welcome guests

Separate invoices, send customer account statements;

Carry out communication between TTY and AUQ;

All other related tasks

Bilingual

Your membership in all the conditions of the Action Utility Québec Inc. Prevention Program is mandatory.

Mastery of the office suite

Office experience (an asset)

Summary

Are you looking for a receptionist position?

Looking for work in Lachine?

Apply now and send your CV to our recruitment manager:

jessica.macchiagodena@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Executive Assistant to CEO, Automattic
description:
About Us

At Automattic, we have the power to create opportunities for people in every corner of the earth. We offer people flexible and fulfilling careers with true impact and scale. It's an exciting time to join Automattic. We are growing and expanding into new creative frontiers. Automattic is remote-first, and we embrace Distributed work - you could be on the outskirts of a jungle, living a nomadic life out of a van, in a major city or a small town that doesn’t have a central business district—as long as you have an active Wi-Fi connection, you can be an Automattician.


We support our Automatticians with phenomenal benefits including opportunities for professional growth, an open vacation policy, flexible parental leaves, wellness support, sabbaticals, and more.


The Role

Our Executive Office team is at the forefront of all things Automattic, and at the heart of the operations that keep things humming. Our mission is to enable our CEO to do their best work, supporting a system that not only meets but exceeds expectations. We strive to be a standout team.


The ideal candidate is located in a UTC -8 to UTC -10 timezone (UTC -8 e.g. Canada, UTC -9 e.g. Alaska, UTC -10 e.g. Hawaii) and is energized by the prospect of tackling projects and solving problems both big and small. If you are super organized, appreciate the details, thrive under pressure, are independent, reliable, and believe that communication is oxygen, then this is the role for you!


Reporting directly to the Director, Executive Operations, the Executive Assistant provides administrative and project support, partnering with our Lead Executive Assistant. Our goal for this role is to fill the gaps and provide 24/5 coverage by adding additional EA support.


The right candidate will be creative and enjoy working in an active and dynamic environment. You exercise good judgment in a variety of situations and possess strong written and verbal communication skills. You have a deep administrative skill set and are highly organized. You maintain a realistic balance among multiple priorities. You take initiative and are able to work independently on projects overseeing a wide variety of activities and demands while maintaining discretion when dealing with confidential and sensitive matters. You take pride in being nimble and enjoy rising to take on a challenge.


The Role:

  • Partners with the Executive Office team to advise the CEO of pertinent issues, correspondence, internal and external messages requiring attention, and assists in the delegation and prioritization of tasks.
  • Tracks, reviews, and drafts email correspondence as required.
  • Coordinates travel arrangements and travel schedule working alongside our travel agent.
  • Assists the CEO with the preparation of the materials and briefings for all meetings, events, and press engagements.
  • Provides backup support for the Executive Office Team to cover PTO.
  • Maintains all aspects of the CEO’s busy schedule.
  • Communicates regularly with the CEO to consult on work in process and upcoming priorities.
  • Monitors and maintains the CEO's various tracking systems, keeping these up to date daily. Active project management engagement is key.
  • Proactively endeavors to keep informed of activities, projects, and initiatives in order to maximize information flow to the CEO.
  • Provides suggestions to the other members of the Executive Office team for planning, efficiency, and workflow.
  • Provides leadership by example to other administrative colleagues by upholding corporate procedures, and provides training and direction on technologies when effective and appropriate.
  • Puts customer service as the guiding principle in all duties and interactions. Creates a professional, customer service environment for the CEO's team.
  • Works closely with the Executive Office Team and other teams within the company, to coordinate and prepare for all-employee meetings, events, and other activities.
  • Takes on additional administrative duties as required for the efficient, smooth, and timely flow of work.


Qualifications:

  • Preference given to candidates living within UTC -8 to UTC -10 timezones.
  • Minimum of 5 years experience supporting executive-level management in an administrative capacity.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills, with experience in the creation and management of executive-level communications.
  • Unflappable and demonstrates emotional acuity.
  • Skilled in communicating effectively and concisely, internally and externally, with senior executives, their assistants, and employees across teams.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills including the ability to draft correspondence and other communications with minimal direction.
  • Listening skills; ability to understand assignments and complete them with little to no follow up.
  • Collaborative and aims for "yes."
  • Able to handle multiple tasks concurrently and use their own time to save time for others.
  • Calm, friendly, and professional demeanor always; able to be diplomatic when saying no.
  • Organized but flexible, anticipates change responding efficiently and quickly.
  • High level of integrity; ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
  • Technical proficiency is critical along with the ability to pick up on new tools quickly.
  • Act on multiple and changing priorities effectively.
  • A personal commitment to a high degree of quality in work.
  • Is both a self-starter and a standout teammate.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple email inboxes and calendars across workflows.

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
description:
Position: Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify

Compensation
  • $75-$150 (per 1 hour session)
  • $300-$850 (multi-session studies)
Job Requirements
  • Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.
  • Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.
  • Complete written survey provided for each panel.
  • MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.
Qualifications
  • Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.
  • Must have access to high-speed internet
  • Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary
  • Canada residents only
Job Benefits
  • Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.
  • No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.
  • No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.
  • You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.
This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Administrative Assistant

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The RBC Dominion Securities branch located in Vaughan, ON is looking for an Administrative Assistant to provide administrative support to a high performing Advisory Team.

You will provide quality client service and help deepen relationships with existing clients through ongoing, efficient support to both clients and the Advisor Team.

What will you do?
  • Coordinate and prepare meetings for Advisors with their clients/prospects.
  • Provide proactive client service with a focus on problem resolution and attention to details. Liaise with various departments for execution, where necessary.
  • Respond to client inquiries (account transactions, requests account documentation, account reporting, etc.).
  • Assist the Advisor team with client onboarding.
  • Help manage incoming communications from clients, Advisors and other internal and external partners.
  • Maintain existing client accounts and identify opportunities to contact clients: manage timelines and key dates for accounts
  • Ensure accurate and timely updates of all necessary documentation in compliance with internal controls and industry regulatory requirements. Maintain complete and up-to-date client files within appropriate systems.
  • Help update team’s communication channels: websites, LinkedIn, Facebook, brochures, newsletters.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
  • Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills
  • High level of time management and organization skills
  • Demonstrated skills in providing world-class client service that will come across as professional, warm, and friendly to our clients

Nice-to-have
  • Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Conduct & Practices Handbook (CPH)
  • Knowledge of RBC Dominion Securities’ systems and procedures
  • Experience in the securities industry is an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Job Summary

Address:

VAUGHAN, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-VAUGHAN

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-04-28-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-05-17-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Miles HR has a fantastic 25 hours a week temp to hire opportunity for an Office Administrator with a unionized Non Profit, located on Vancouver’s West Side. Experience in documentation control, preparing for board meetings, data entry, a strong understanding of MS Office programs and Indesign or similar for quarterly newsletters is an expectation. A pleasant clear telephone manner, and ability to work independently, as well as with others is essential.

Duties include:
  • Perform office administrative duties
  • Prepare documentation packages for board meetings
  • Editing minutes of meetings
  • Database management
  • Book travel and accommodations for Executive board members and others as directed
  • Maintain inventory of office supplies
  • Provide clerical support to Executive board members
  • Compile articles for publications and produce quarterly newsletter using Indesign
  • Update and maintain website, social media and other forms of digital information
  • Reception
  • Other duties as required
  • Convenient West Side Vancouver location
  • 25 hours a week, Monday to Friday, 9-2 or 10-3, this is not a work from home opportunity

Skills:
  • Minimum 4 years recent administrative experience
  • Office experience, minimum 55 words per minute typing
  • Proficiency with MS Office, Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint
  • Experience with indesign or similar for newsletter production
  • Excellent ability to prioritize tasks
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and calm working under pressure
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Exceptional organizational skills with high attention to detail
  • Dependable and professional
  • Required to maintain confidentiality
  • Work co-operatively and respectfully with others
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Take initiative

If you have the skills, experience, energy and passion we are looking for, we look forward to hearing from you. Please apply today!
